As it warmed roasted marshmallows started to take shape as did dried strawberries and earthy tones. Sweet with an earthy burnt finish and burnt fruit lingered. Quite smooth and full-bodied. Great stout.
Roasted chocolate nose. Dark, dark pour, no lights getting through there. Lots of choclate and coffe flavors. Very heavy palate, yet good. Very good stout

Pours a dark black color, decent retentive head. The nose is roasty with a bit of lactose and smoke, not overly assertive with some astringency and fruity cherry notes. The flavor is creamy and balanced with a good amount of roast and very little hop essence. Not too bad, a bit of licorice and coffee flavors in the finish. I’ve had this when it was great and when it was aweful. Perhaps it’s my palate, but this time it was real.
Taster at the brewery. Medium amber, thin head, sheets of lacing. Fruity, hoppy aroma. Taste brings in the hops in a big way. Dank and bitter. Tastes like old times.

Tap at the brewery-pours bright deep orange with a small white head and lite lacing. hmmm, seems a bold odd-lots of herbal and tobbaco hop qualities here. flavors are leafy, almost british in style. big malt sweetness doesnt do much for me. dry herbal hop finish lingering with the malt sweetness. hmmm didnt care for this one.

Draft at the brewpub. A red-tinged amber hue with a sudsy head. The aroma is surprisingly sweet. This carries to the flavor ... The hops surface as an odd sweet aspect, neither citric nor acidic. There’s also a soapy, or maybe odd smoky, kick to it too, but only the immediately initial touch of the tongue. It goes quickly, but I had trouble getting past that initially off-putting impression. Got better the more I drank. (#4679, 7/7/2012)
Had at MBBF in Idaho Falls Copper with a medium sized white head. Aroma of tropical fruit and mild caramel. Taste is citrus, piney and bready. A nice IPA.
Draft. Aroma of tropical fruit. Taste is fruit and white bread. Not too aggressive. Decent enough.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear copper color with a medium white head. The aroma is a huge citrus and pine hop. The flavor is a very good IPA; smooth balanced flavors, citrus, bitter hops, caramel toasted malts. Very good.

SLC to OLY 877 Miles – Table Rock Brewing - Boise, ID Aroma – Lots of hops in the nose nice malt backing. Floral and fruit aromas. Appearance – Amber in color, Clear, with a thin head. Flavor – Big floral flavor with the roasty malt. The hops gave off the floral and light fruit flavors. Big grapefruit flavors. Palate – Dry finish with a Nice Mouthfeel. Overall – Very tasty Big IPA.
on tap-pours an off white head and amber color. Aroma is pine/resin, secondary medium malt-caramel. Taste is pine/resin, secondary medium malt-caramel. OK/soft carbonation.

Tasted on tap at the brewpub 10/25/2008. This IPA pours a medium orange gold color from the tap. Small sized white foamy head. The aroma is caramel and sweet. A medium bodied IPA. The malts are fruity and sweet. The hops are grapefruit and floral. Kind of mild bitterness for a “PNW” style IPA, a touch too sweet with not enough hops to balance. Good carbonation. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is very slightly bitter, most of that at the very end.
The name lied to me. Sure it is a hoppier IPA than most, but nothing comparatively. Reminds me of a more full bodied TG.
Can. Pours golden orange with a white head. Plain and wheaty, with low sweetness, low bitterness, and a relatively clean finish. An easy drinker.
12 oz can poured into a pint glass. Gift from a neighbor. Thanks neighbor. Not much of a wheat beer drinker. However, this very tasty ale. Perfect session beer on a hot afternoon. Highly recommended.
Sample at the brewery during RBSG 2017. In my glass orange with a white head. Nose of citrus and wheat. Medium plus body Flavor is light hops and the finish shows fruit. Drinks fine .
Draft sample at the source. The beer is a hazed gold with a white head of foam. Spice and earthy grain. Wheaty. Light body and moderate carbonation.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazed orange with a thin white head. Soft orange, a touch of citrus, musk, wheat, a touch of yeast. Medium bodied, soft musk, wheat, yeast. Gentle wheat into the finish, soft and fruity, yeast.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazy orange gold with medium white head that lasts. The aroma is honey and toasted malt. Medium body, bread, wheat, honey, light finish, good.
Pretty run of the mill boring arse wheat beer. Nothing "bad" about it cept it puts you to sleep. Uninspired

On tap at Sockeye Pub & Grill, pours a hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma brings out light wheaty notes, not much else. Flavour is very mellow, with soft wheat and biscuity notes. Not much to speak of here. Meh.
One of the better wheat ales, nice slick and slippery body. Toss the orange slice of orange, not needed here. Dark golden with small creamy head. Aroma and taste is pure wheat, but subdued.
Super duper average, pale pour, body and beer defined by creamy wheatyness.
I had some of this same batch. Just a murky off color in appearance. Terrible sour taste, that just made you wince everytime you took a sip.

Batch: 11/21/02 (1.042 Abs. Grav) - Sweet mild and developed smell. Almost clear, slightly hazy. Unimpressive head. Tasted very bad, some flavor that was very unappealing in taste and on the palate. Very musky wet finish, really weird. Couldn't finish this beer. Even the employees didn't care for this one much.
Big caramel, booze and lighter roast. Initial aroma is good but elements mismatch a little. Boozy sweet and blackish pour with OK head and lacing. Tap at Seattle Taphouse grill.

Poured into a snifter, the appearance was a dark brown almost brown color with a nice looking foamy creamy colored head. Nice foamy stringy lace. The aroma had some sweet milk chocolate, gentle roast and some toast. The flavor took all of those previously mentioned aromas to blend very nice. Quick dry ruggedly sweet aftertaste roaming into the finish in a semi-creamy sort of way. On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a nice sipping quality about it. Low carbonation assisting a nice creamy smooth feel along my tongue. ABV felt spot on. Overall, nicely done imperial stout, but I didn’t get a whole lot of oatmeal, if any. Still, I’d have this again.
Full of chocolate, roasted malts, light burnt malt. Creamy smooth body that has a lightly dry finish. A well made Imperial.

Keg at Beer Zen backyard party. In my red cup its looks jet black. Strong milk chocolate and oat aroma, rich malt, hint of booze. The flavour surprises with rich dark cherry and plum I didn’t really get in the aroma. Very nice. Some lingering alcohol warmth, reasonably smooth and creamy.

Traditional imperial stout. Good pour, great aroma, & big taste. This is a solid imperial but not enough to differentiate from its counterparts. It’s s very good beer, but just lacking that standout trait!

20 July 2015, tap at Boundary Bay. black. nose is burnt toast. med body and moderately fizzy, a tad creamy. slightly sharp acidic bite, licorice, burnt malt, molasses, no noticeable alcohol. very god.

22 oz bottle pours dark and thick brownish black with a solid tan head. Aroma is sweet and malty. Rich roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate and oak flavors. Very sweet. Chewy mouth feel and a smooth finish. Very tasty!
Sweet, roast espresso aroma. Pours dark near black with minimal oily head and good lacing. Nice flavor profile and hop presence. This is a good beer.

Draught into a growler. Pours an extremely dark brown color with very little head on it. Nose is roasty with some heavy chocolate elements and quite a bit of oatmeal in there as well. Taste is fairly sweet and roasty, and just a tad overly sweet for me. Still good, though. Would go great with oatmeal cookies.
Tap at Devil Craft Hamamatsucho. Liquorice, fruity porter like aroma. Taste has bit of coke, touch of smoke, little bit of sweetness. Can’t get the oatmeal. Pretty boozy. Cherry.
on tap-pours a white head and yellow color. Aroma is some banana. Taste is some citrus-lemon, banana, wheat/grain.

On draught at the brewpub! - Pours golden with a short white head that stayed pretty well and laced some on thes ides of the glass. Aroma is mild yeast, a touch of lemon, and a bit of bubblegum. Flavor is very similar. Palate is light and carbonated just enough to make this very drinkable. Nothing offensive, nothing outstanding. Average.

Draft at brewpub. Clear amber with an average white head that diminished slowly. Moderate sweet hoppy aroma. Light to medium body. Moderate sweet wheaty citrus flavor with a short finish. Drinkable but not my style.
Mild malt and fermented fruit aroma. Clear gold. Mildly tart, medium hopping, lightly sweet. An inoffensive beer, but no real wheat qualities. Crackery finish, good CO2.

The worst from CBC. Color is a pale yellow, almost green haze. No foam with a low yeast aroma of spice and grain. Flavor contains no malts, no hops, no wheat. Just blah with a mild lingering bitterness.

On draught at CBC and served with a lemon. I am pretty sure this is a seasonal so it must not be a seasonal given the fact that I tried it in November. Pours a hazy yellow color with a thin white head. Very thin lacing. Light-bodied and effervescent with a hoppy and wheaty flavor. The finish the lightly hopped with a hint of fruitiness. This is not as wheaty as a lot of Wheat beers, and is light and easy to drink.

I had this on tap at the Port Columbus Airport's Columbus Brewing Company's outlet. Sort of cloudy yellow with a thin white head. Strong hop flavor like an APA but it had enough smoothness in it for me to buy that it was a wheat. Refreshing beer but looses points for style vagueness.

column1: Carolina Brewery Old North State Stout
column2: Chapel Hill, North Carolina, United States
column5: Keg at the brewpub. Clear dark red, large creamy tan head. Good retention. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, ashy notes, coffee. The taste is chocolate, roasted malt, dark fruits, mild coffee and caramel. Thin-medium bodied, mild lingering bitterness, high carbonation.

column1: Carolina Brewery Old North State Stout
column2: Chapel Hill, North Carolina, United States
column5: Draft at brewpub. Pours black with a thin khaki head. Sort of thin Mouthfeel. Nice roasted malt and chocolate nose on the nose. Lots of cocoa on the tongue. Finishes clean and tight. Just a lovely beer.

column1: Carolina Brewery Old North State Stout
column2: Chapel Hill, North Carolina, United States
column5: Tap at the brewery - pours cola with a tan head. Aroma is roasty and woody. Taste is dry sweetness, finishes dry. Overall, solid, but a bit boring.

column1: Carolina Brewery Old North State Stout
column2: Chapel Hill, North Carolina, United States
column5: Black pour with tan head and lace. Light coffee aroma and toasted maltiness a hint of hops as well. Nice burnt coffee and a medium bitter followed by good carbonation and med/full palate make this a real good beer for me.

column1: Carolina Brewery Old North State Stout
column2: Chapel Hill, North Carolina, United States
column5: At the brewery. Dark brown/black pour with a thin tan head. The aroma is light chocolate, grainy, coffee. Subdued nose and flavor. grainy, weird upfront taste, a little bitter, chocolatey. Mediocre palate. Maybe i’ll try it again.

column1: Carolina Brewery Old North State Stout
column2: Chapel Hill, North Carolina, United States
column5: Very stouty with caramel malts... Full flavored with a rich creamy palate. The appearance is dark brown with a very small head that does not last long. Decent aroma. Not a great beer but good for a local place.

column1: Carolina Brewery Old North State Stout
column2: Chapel Hill, North Carolina, United States
column5: on tap-pours a tan head and black color. Aroma is sour, dark malt-molasses, oatmeal. Taste is sour, dark malt-roasty/molasses/chocolate, oatmeal, secondary flat hops. Occasional. OK carbonation.

column1: Carolina Brewery Old North State Stout
column2: Chapel Hill, North Carolina, United States
column5: Draught at the brewpub. Pours dark brown with beige head. The aroma is cold coffee, cola, and brazil nuts. The flavor reminds me of Coke Blak (that Coca-Cola and coffee mixture stuff), but not as carbonated. Grainy sweetness throughout, slightly metallic finish.

column1: Carolina Brewery Old North State Stout
column2: Chapel Hill, North Carolina, United States
column5: The one looked good and smelled good. But then dissapointed a bit with the mouthfeel (a bit weak and watery). Same earthiness/peatiness that I have noticed in other brews by this brewery. still overall a pretty good dry stout.

column1: Carolina Brewery Old North State Stout
column2: Chapel Hill, North Carolina, United States
column5: Pint@ brewpub. Good aroma. Very dry viney chocolately. Blackish brown color, small head, that lasted a bit. Good lace. Bitter flavor. Again a grapey, vineous,chocolately. Medium body, smooth watery mouthfeel, bitter fruity finish. Nice easy to drink stout. Could sip all day. Really was liking the grape I was getting as it warmed.

2011 vintage bottle shared by alexsdad06 pour dark copper with lots of floaters, thin tan head. Nose caramel, red fruit, light musty. Taste a little thin, caramel, green apple, but oxidized. Some mineral.
Pours deep amber with white head. Aroma of sauna stones, slight hoppy, molasses, slight lirocice, chokolate, some good toffee, tannic, slight bitter. Good
Bottle at Orla tasting. Aroma of toasted malt, melasse, dried fruit, tannins, port and bourbon notes. Heavy sweet with some alcoholic warmth. Full and sticky. Great
Bottle @ Mr Orla Going Barley, Ratebeer Odense. Hazy chestnut with a lasting off-white head. Aroma of toffee, caramel and milk chocolate. Sweet malty flavour with fruity and chocolate notes

Bottle from Bottle Barn. Mahogany pour, fluffy head fades to tiny ring. Woody, toffee aroma, hint of booziness to come. Taste is sweet malts, molasses, barrel notes. Smooth, sweet and boozy. Wonderful.

2017 bottle thanks to Klimaet. Aroma of malt, caramel, oak, port like, vanilla, dark dried fruit, slight bourbon. Reddish brown with white head. Taste is moderate sweet, malty, oak, slight tannic, honey, bourbon, dark fried fruit. Full body, sticky feel and sweet malt finish.

Bottle shared. Pours hazy dark brown with a small offwhite head. Aromas of dark fruits, toffee, malt, bread, vanilla. Taste has lots of caramel, dark fruits, toffee, bready malts, vanilla, oak, tannins, light bitterness. Delicious life

Oxford tasting; vintage 2014, 3 years old, 13.4% ABV Dark amber color with no head. Aroma of alcohol, bourbon, some malt. Good malt flavor, sweet, but the body is not too thick because the alcohol is very strong; very strong bourbon character, touch of nuts and toffee, hints of leather. Good, extreme, a bit too extreme indeed.

22 oz. Acquired at Hopsy on Solano in Albany, CA. Pours a translucent blood caramel. Limited head; just enough. Smells sweet and strong. Notes of toffee, licorice, oak, and aaalcohol. Silky, yet sharp mouthfeel, As the suds fizzle on your tongue, the boozy bite welcomes itself into your palate with a firm handshake to each tastebud. Lovley after al pastor tacos.

Really nice. Coke color. Very few bubbles. Creamy molasses-porter stout taste. Warming like whiskey when it goes down. Smooth long lasting finish. Nice lingering taste. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Alaskan Pilot Series: Barley Wine Ale
column5: Acero scuro versare con la testa bianca. Il naso è leggermente ossidato con caramello, caramello e malti.

column1: Alaskan Pilot Series: Barley Wine Ale
column5: Botttle at Extreme Beer Fest, Ralston Arena. 2010 Vintage. Poured amber with an off white head. Aroma of caramel, raisin, fig, alcohol. Taste was mild bittersweet, mild alcohol, caramel malt, earthy, raisin, fruit.

column1: Alaskan Pilot Series: Barley Wine Ale
column5: 650ml bottle from Elizabeth Station bought on 5th Anniversary event, shared with Jamey and Brad. Vintage 2011. Pours a hazy brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet with dried fruits and caramel. Taste is pretty much the same with lots of sweetness, caramel, and toffee. Some hoppy bitterness on the back. Good barleywine. I can only imagine how good this would be barrel aged.

column1: Alaskan Pilot Series: Barley Wine Ale
column5: Originally rated on 1/26/09. This barleywine was a bit of a let down, the alcohol was too overbearing in the flavor department, overshadowing the faint floral hops. Mouthfeel was nice and creamy, and it had a decent finish. Overall it was o.k. and i wouldnt mind trying it again.

column1: Alaskan Pilot Series: Barley Wine Ale
column5: Bottle sample @ ABR 2016. Dark reddish pour with a small head. Nose is fairly nutty. Stewed grain and pastry. A hint of smoked wood. Flavor has some earthy roasted grain. Hot and nutty. Chewy malt abounds. Mellow plum and caramel. Full body, a real sipper. Nice.

column1: Alaskan Pilot Series: Barley Wine Ale
column5: 2013 Bottle, thanks luttonm! Ruby color with small tan ring. Aroma is slightly oxidized, orange juice toffee, caramel malts, figs and raisins, a bit oxidized. Taste is again, orange juice, toffee, again a bit oxidized. Sirupy mouthfeel, low carbonation. Slightly oxidized finish. Nice stuff.

column1: Alaskan Pilot Series: Barley Wine Ale
column5: Bottle in Seattle. 2013 bottle. Found at Costco last year. Dark malty red body, thin ring of white foam. Rich malty body, spicy American barleywine character. Deep, cherry fruit character starting with the aroma. Rich body, alcohol spice. Sweet, mild body for the alcohol weight. Smooth vanilla, velvety body. A touch of bitterness at finish. Nice beer, impressive.

column1: Alaskan Pilot Series: Barley Wine Ale
column5: Bomber, 2013 vintage. Boozy aroma with rich dark fruit, caramel, a bit of nuttiness and some hoppiness. Pours dark caramel colored with a thin tan head that has some retention and good lacing. Starts with sweet dark fruit and caramel malt flavors with a rich body. Finishes dry with a bit of nuttiness as well as some hops and warming booziness. Nice American barleywine.

column1: Alaskan Pilot Series: Barley Wine Ale
column5: (2007 bottle) Deep umber, mahogany colored liquid. Small head of light tan bubbles. Mild dark fruit, toasted malt, caramel, oak, and hearty sherry aromas. Fully, lightly oily feel. Roasted pecans and almonds drenched in a fresh caramel glaze. Hints of dried fruit. Simple, yet it still makes you step back and think about it. A really nice sipping winter brew. I think this bottle may take me a good hour or two to finish. 5/10

column1: Alaskan Pilot Series: Barley Wine Ale
column5: 2011 bottle thanks to Tom. Pours a hazy brown with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is candy sugar, caramel, toffee. Medium mouth, similar flavors to nose, boozy finish, very nice.
Tap. Pours a clear dark red with great head and lacing. Sweet malt/brown sugar and cookie dough in the nose. Smooth malty flavor. Slightly creamy with a touch of roastiness and a smooth finish.
Dark brown. Heavy malts, raisin, smokiness, improved as it warmed up.......

A - pours golden with white head, off white head head, some lacing. S - Aromas of tropical fruit, peaches and pineapple, followed by grassy piney hops. M - light body no carb. T - Citrus piney hops on the nose. Sweet grassy/clover malt ending. O - Overall a well balanced IPA. Grassy hops and light alfalfa/green leaf malts. 6+

Tap at the brewpub. The body was deep hazy bronze with a light khaki head. The aroma was oranges with some peanuts. Malty. The taste was oranges with some old caramel. Hints of leather and apples. An earthy finish, this was malty for the style.
Tap at brewpub. Quite dark for an IPA, this one poured a deep brown with no head. Aroma was lots of pine, earthy, alcohol, and slight citrus. Bitter on th palate. Fairly well done IPA.

Draught at the brewpubHazy dark amber. The aroma leans towards foresty hops and malts like multigrain bread. Kind of underhopped for the style, but bringing that whole grain bread maltiness and hints of crystal overtop the foresty hop. Evenly balanced and well-made, just be prepared that thsi is not your standard Cali hop juice IPA.
Tap @ brewpub. Cloudy golden orange color. Good hop and malt balance. The best beer on tap that I had here.

50 cl. plastic bottle. with a screw cork, guess its called a pacific bottle. Low fluffy lasting white head. Clear yellow golden body. Weak straw cardboard aroma and flavor. Little hops bitterness, slightly sour, wonder if somethinLog was wrong with it, Low carbonation, Short finish. Boring.
Altes Rating, gibt es die Marke überhaupt noch, jetzt wo es Plus nicht mehr gibt? Einfaches, dumpf schmeckendes Pils, hat man nichts verpasst.
Pours a pale piss yellow with a off white head. Nose is corn/maize. Cheap malts. Grainy and watery.
cereal, spruce, caramel, smoke, raisin, golden, hazy, minimal head, light sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter,

330mL bottle. Pours clear pale gold with a small white head that thins out. Grassy, slightly fruity aroma. Very little flavour, faintly malty with a slight grassy bitterness and some fruit, forced fermentation? Light bodied, average carbonation, short finish.

Bottle 5%ABV (Aldi). Orange with a white head. Cheap corny aroma with some earth and grass. Taste has sweet grain with a touch of metal, a little sourness and indistinct bitterness. Very cold it’s just about drinkable if you don’t pay attention. Cheap supermarket beer is cheap.
Pours a nice golden yellow. Aromas of corn, malts, hops. Crisp hop bitterness and dry finish. Kind of skunky.

500 ml brown PET-bottle, a gift from Germany. Now called "(Traditional) Schloss Premium Pils". It is "Gebraut und abgefüllt in Deutschland" -"Exclusively for Plus" (a German supermarket chain?), "By: HGI Hanseatische Getränke-Industrie GmbH, 22755 Hamburg". ABV is 4.9%. Pale golden colour, large head. Sweetish fruity aroma, not bad. The flavour is rather moderately hopped for a German pils, there is a very moderate sweetness in the background. Not a great pils by any means, but not repulsive either. At least it is "Reinheitsgebot" ... I guess this is pretty much what you can expect from German contract brewed supermarket discount pilseners.

Canned, brewed by Frankenthal Brauhaus. Pale golden, brief airy head. Aroma of carboard, metal and blood. Sweet, raw and mellow. Light-medium body, no hop flavour. Some late harsh resin finishes it off. Utter crap!
23 May 2006 - Light sweet hop aroma. Clear light amber colour, poor head and low lacing. Simple hop malt flavour. Thin, tangy bitter hop finish.
Dose - Altes Rating, sicher vor 10 Jahren getrunken. Sehr süßes, sehr bananiges Weizen mit viel Co2.
Sweet banana milkshake. Very creamy stuff, lot of banana. But hardly any beer taste.
Plastic bottle. Citrus/banana aroma. Unclear orange colour. Stable white head. Flavour is a little watery, but OK wheaty. Yeasty aftertaste. Slightly slimy mouthfeel.

Damn, not too bad for a plastic bottle hefe! Imagine if kmart or walmart sold a hefeweizen, this is produced for plus, a discount chain. Its one of, if not the best beer that oettinger makes. Not too bad.
plastic bottled. not too bad for such a cheap plus bier. cloudy orange. banana aroma. somehow manages to be light-bodied and sticky. some cheesecake flavour in there. trinkbar

A very fruity aroma - orange, peach, banana. Light tan color but not as cloudy as most Hefes. Taste is much subtler mostly of orange and banana without much spiciness. Bought this in a plastic bottle - possibly the best Weizen you can buy in a plastic bottle.

Fruity, fresh aroma. Yellow coloured, good head. Typical weizen taste, yeasty, citruslike. Bit watery though. Refreshing palate. Rerate, original rated 3.1. This beer is mainly a banana bomb. Because of that rating got down.
Can. Orange and pineapple aroma. Yoghurty, yeasty flavor with orange. Slightly metallic aftertaste.

Brewed with cocoa and pink pepper. Cloudy amber, beautiful creamy head, persistent. Delicate aroma, with some malt and cocoa. Smooth, a delicate background of cocoa (no vanilla, no artificial flavors!); caramel. Ordinary palate. Original; successful experiment. It's my 3rd Chocolate beer, after Young's Double Chocolate Stout and Florisgaarden Chocolat, and the only one I would try again with pleasure.
Buon sapore di luppolo, con malto fine pure. Equilibrio molto equilibrato, anche se un buon luppolo.

Pours a clear golden color, topped with a medium white head, frothy which slowly dissapears almost completely. Grainy malt aroma with some sourish grassy feel to it. Starts slightly sweet and malty, grassy with some soury feel and very mild bitterness in the finish. Light and a bit watery. Standard average lager.
Bottle, 5.2%. Citric, lagery aroma. Clear golden colour. Stable white head. The flavour is mildly malty with some sewery notes. Slightly rough hoppiness in the finish. A mediocre pale lager.

Bottle in Vienna, 2006. Slightly darkish golden color. Good, fine head. Very malty aroma, a touch sweet, with cookies. Good hop flavor, with fine malt as well. Very evenly balanced, though good hops. Slight cardboard taste. Finish is hoppy. Good balance and nice taste. Not very special or interesting, but a good drinking beer.

06/01 0.5 l bottle from a Merkur in Graz. Poured pale yellow body with smaller white head. Not really strong aroma of some flowery malts, with somewhat sourish touch. Flavor sourish probably from the hops and sweetish malty, let’s say pleasant but very light bodied. Finish is short, reflecting the sweetness of the flavor. Not so bad but far too light.

0.5l courtesy of and shared with heavy who brought it from Austria (thanks!) Poured a pale yellow-golden colour, small creamy white head that went away fast, lazy carbonation. The nose turned out to be quite weak, just some weak and unimpressive notes of malt and honey showed themselves. The taste isn’t any stronger... some weak weak sweet maltiness, which was supposed to be balanced by some herbal hopiness near the end, which turned out to be flat and unimpressive, if quite noticable and somewhat lasting... the two tastes don’t complement each other all that well. Just a touch eggy. Ok I guess, but bland. Shame.
bottled, 0.5l. it is said to be made from glacier water. very clear overfiltered color, and taste. a bit too light but drinkable

(Bottle BBE 01/07) Hoppy and slightly malty aroma. Golden colour, bright, slightly sparkling and small, white, fully diminishing head. Malty and slightly bitter flavour. Lively carbonated and light to medium-bodied palate. Drinkable brew but nothing special. 13/08/06
Grainy aroma, golden color. First very grainy flavor, then sweetness and a strange flavor of lemonade. Salty and sourly in the end and a light bitter, dry finish. Unbalanced and unpleasant grainy.
Bottled(500ml). –my was 5.2%ABV, pale golden coloured, little white airy head, malty and slightly hop aroma, bitter finish with not so pleasant aftertaste, boring and uninteresting beer

From tap at Plutzer. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is distinct hops fruity and slight grassy. Mild citrusy and crisp hoppy flavoured. Bitter and citrusy into a nice lingering finish. Ends citrusy and medium dry.

Tap at Wiener Bier Fest. This radler can be described as having too much of a bad industrial beer in the mix. If there was more lemon syrup and water it would probable be drinkable. Metallic off-flavour laden beer that is.
Tap at Wiener bier fest. Golden color with medium white head. Ugly chemical aroma. Sweet chemical fruity taste with malt. Bad
Heller, muffig süß-hellmalziger Antrunk. Geringe Würzigkeit, monoton, süffig. Mittellanger Nachhall. Unspektakulär. 8/8/9/8/5/8
Vielen Dank an Erzengel! Fast klare goldgelbe Farbe, mittelgroße weiße schaumkrone. Geruch mild hopfig, süß getreidig malzig, etwas wässrig. Geschmack ist getreidig süß malzig, wässrig, langweilig.
Many thanks to Sascha and Sandra bringing this from Austria! Grainy neutral nose. The beer starts grainy neutral, interesting mild with a dry grainy bitter aroma in the aftertaste. Normal Helles.
duft: krdlig trist normalt pilsner duft smag: mejs malt cornflaks lidt citrus til slut en svag kant af humle
330 ml bottle won in a raffle. Practically a working definition of holiday beer, brewed as if afraid to offend anyone. Cold and wet. A dull 10 minutes, but for the scenery.
Bottle. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Light bitter flavor. Average ight bitter finish. Oily palate.
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are sweet malt, little grass, straw and hops.
The body is gold, the head not robust. It is a easy Lager, just brewed to drink it and have party or something like this. Boring but drinkable Lager 8/7/7/7/11/8

Bottled 330ml. -First rate of this Schladminger. Totally different label than this one on picture. Golden coloured, medium sized white head that went away slowly, grassy caramellish nose. Malty, grassy and some caramel with dusty honey notes. Pretty short finish with trace of salt. Average beer.

Bottle from Camping Stein, Nr Bad Endorf on Lake Simssee, Bavaria 28th June 2019. Pours hazy orange gold with a white head, a little bit of yeastiness on the nose, some wheat and a little banana. A little fizz on the tongue, a touch of spice. I like this, okay it's a little bit sweet but it is a nice simple 'does what it says on the tin' type of beer.

Barwa piwa złota, dość mętna. Piana mega obfita długo utrzymująca się. W aromacie jak na pszenicę przystało: banan, goździk. W smaku początkowo wysycenie średnie, fajna goryczka połączona z goździkiem, banan, nutka ziołowa, drożdże. Schłodzny świetnia pijalny w upalny dzień.

Auerbräu Rosenheimer Hefe Weissbier Weissbier - Hefeweizen 546411 Lukt: Høy, hvete, svak røyk. Utseende: Gulbrun. Skum/kullsyre: Tykt dekkende skum, heng. Smak: Høy, hvete. Hvor: Tasting kveld hos Bryne. Medium: Flaske@500ml, ABV@5,5%, Når@21.04.2019.
Bottle. Pours hazy yella good head. Aroma is strong bananas and clove, sweet. Sof water, good tart, bananas, spices. Soft mineral water, yeast remains. Good refreshing weizen.

Flasche 0,5l: Bernstein, kräftige Trübung, kräftiger stabiler feinporiger Schaum; frische + leicht fruchtige Nase, malzige Süße, kräftige Hefearomen, leichte Zitrusnoten, Malz, Karamell, reife Bananen, etwas helle Schokolade; frischer + leicht fruchtiger Körper, fruchtige Süße, kräftige Hefearomen, dezente Hopfennoten, grüne Früchte, grüne Bananen, Malz, Getreide, Karamell, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure; angenehmer fruchtig-trockener Nachgang

Hazy, orange colour poured from the bottle. Yeast and wheat malt on the nose. Big banana flavours on the palate with a hint of spice. Medium carbonation. Strange lingering aftertaste that I can’t exactly put my finger on.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma is yeasts, flour, slight fruits and freshly baked madeleines. Taste is smooth sourness and malty sweetness, that is somehow watery and also has something of dish washing water, which sounds worse than it actually is. Full body, no texture. Alright.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange color with big white head. Looks nice. Durability of head is amazing. In nose aromas of banana with some sour and pepper notes. Flavor is mostly banan with some caramel notes. Body is not so full as you would expect, especially for hw. But I like that. Sweet. Somewhat of empty finish. Overall: Expected less.

On tap @ Hotel zur Post - Opaque golden/orange colour with beautiful, long lasting foamy white head. Nice spicy aroma of wheat, banana, apple and cloves. Sweet wheaty taste with banana, tropical fruits and a very light noble hops. Medium body, chewy texture, high carbonation, smooth finish with a little sour aftertaste. A quite good hefeweizen with banana, spicy notes.
igazándiból csak maradványaiban helles inkább valami száraz pils-re hajaz ez nekem.

Bottle from Camping Stein, Nr Bad Endorf on Lake Simssee, Bavaria 28th June 2019. Pours very pale gold, crystal clear, with a large clean frothy white head atop. A little light lemon, perhaps a touch sweet and lacking depth. It's fine, okay it's a little bit safe and lacking in character but I like it.
Super bright and pale yellow. Very thin head. Aroma is quite grainy. Taste is oat and cereal. Moderately bitter. Smooth finish.
Flasche hat neues trendiges Design bekommen. Klassisches hell, gut trinkbar, für ein Helles recht kräftiges Aroma, leicht malzig im Abgang. Angenehm.
0,5l Flasche. Gelbes klares Bier, weisser Schaum. Nasses Gras, etwas Zitrone. Würziger Getreideantrunk, etwas Säure. Zitrone, Gras. Muss ich nicht nochmal haben.
Pale color white head. Taste of straw and mikd grains, light body carbonated dry finish. Cardboard on the leftover. A bit disappointing.

0,5 l bottle from a regional bottle shop chain. Retro label art. Clear pale golden in the glass with a nearly three finger head. Smells low grassy. Taste starts also low grassy but get surprisingly increasing malty. Citrus in the background, pale grain. High drinkability.
Bottle from Kiosk Wohlwillstr HH - golden color, white head. easy Helles, bit grainy, medium sweetness. nice new retro label.
Sampled the brew resturant. Big nobel hop aroma. Fresh malty taste. Low bitterness and big drinkabillity.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (mitgebracht von der Grünen Woche). Klares Gold mit viel Schaum. Sauber gehopft. Fast mit Pilscharakter.
On tap in Zlý Časy (Prague Nusle) , neutral malt aroma, clear, golden, creamy foam, medium sweet, medium bitter, full body, bitter finish,

Bottled. Golden colour with mediumsized white fluffy/creamy white head. Aroma is strongly malty with some fruity and yeasty notes coming in. Flavour is is the same, but has a big grassy/wooden hoppy kick in it. A wellbalanced and pleasant Bohemian pilsener.

bottle from Pivní Galrie, Praha. Clear golden colour, very very large and creamy head, very persistent. Really unusually large for a 14° speciál. Full-bodied, st first very malty and sweet with a touch of fruit, then with an intensive hoppy bitterness. The contrast of the sweet and bitter flavours make this beer very interesting. Lovely!
[Draught] Golden coloured. Apple notes in the aroma. Sweet and fruity flavour with an alcoholic touch.

The aroma is lightly flowery with notes of hops and malt. The color is golden and it has a fine lasting head. The flavor is a good pilsener flavor; pretty sweet and rather bitter though the hops used is not a kind I like - it makes it rather sour in the end.

for some reason there is a lovec entered but it is definitely lorec. this started pretty normally with a sweet malt aroma and turned weird with plum brandy and cough syrup sweetness. made an instant impression in my gut
Bottle @ ZZT X, small sample, thanks all for sharing! Slight hazy golden color, short head. Aroma of grainy malt, bit flowery hop, spicy yeast. Bit sweet. Mediocre. Wouldnt have put it as a pilsener.

Bottle @ ZZT X, courtesey of DutchDrebus. Pours a clear golden beer with a thin white head on top. Aroma is very skunky and old malts. Flavor is medium bitter, very lagerish and not very special. Not too bad, but not interesting either.
Bottle shared at ZZT 10. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, grain and some light fruit. Flavor is over light sweet and bitter. Light bodied with moderate carbonation.

Bottle @ ZZT X shared by Dutchdrebus. Clear golden color, small white head. Smell malts, sweet malts. Taste malts, slightly sweet, lightly grainy, decent bitterness, a hint of yeast. Decent body and carbonation.
Bottle @ ZZT 10 shared by me. Clear golden yellow colour with a small white head. Smells malts, herbs, spices. Tastes malty, sweetish, herbs, spices. Medium body, medium carbo.
Bottle @zzt10 shared by dutchdrebus. Clear golden color with a small white head. Smells and tastes and tastes belgian yeast, malts, iron.
Bottle at chrisOs... Golden yellow... Thin white lacing... Soft grassy hay nose... Soft fruits.. Soft grassy lemon.. Dull fruits
30cl bottle at home. Clear golden with a medium white head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Medium (metallic) sweet- and bitterness.A very watery tasteless brew.
Regular blond beer, not very exciting. Brewed with pils malt, which makes the beer flat.

Bottle. A strong aroma of bread, very sweet, some corn and malt. The head is small, white and fizzy, it disappears very fast. The taste is malty, light sweet with some citrus in the finish. The body is lively with a lively carbonation, it is rather light.
Pours could copper, strong aroma of dusty cardboard, aroma of ripe banana peel, brown yeast. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a cloudy copper color.Fruity flavor with wheat, banana, clove, and bubblegum flavors.

Bottled, from Biershop Bayern. Cloudy orange/brown, rich creamy head. Fruity nose with ripe banana and bandaid. Mid sweet with light-medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Toffee and banana. Low bitterness.
Medium dark brown color with a beige head, frothy and lasting. Malted wheat and caramel aromas. Kind of sweet and caramel flavors with no bitterness. Balanced carbonation.

500 ml bottle. Pours a dark murky brown colour with a small head. Aroma of wheat, banana and some clove. Flavour is very yeasty with banana esthers, caramel, some dough and earth. Medium bodied and thin mouthfeel. Feels like a sahti, though the only thing missing here is juniper.

50 cl bottle @ Timo A. Pours murky brown color with a small head. Very stuffy on the nose, some caramel, lots of yeast, wheat and mild ripe fruit notes. Fruity flavor, wheat, faint spice notes, some wooden notes also. Quite Sahti-like. Decent. 4334
Bottle. Brown-orange colour with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, citrus, malt. Flavour is caramel, citrus, malt, yeast. Medium body. Boring beer.

Bottle 500ml. @ [ The pre Fastelavn Smagning - Carnival Tasting, Ulfborg ]. [ As Martinsbräu Weizen Hefe Dunkel ]. Unclear medium brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, wheat, caramel, moderate yeasty, fruity, banana, leather - clove notes. Flavour is moderate sweet with a long duration, caramel, yeast, phenol, fruity. Body is medium, texture is watery - creamy, carbonation is soft. [20140228]

0.5 l bottle, thanks Timo A! Hazy chestnut brown color. Aromas of nuts, clove, ripe banana and burnt rubber. Sweetish taste with clove, ripe banana, nuts and burnt rubber. Aroma and taste of burnt rubber is disturbing (BB JUL 2014).

500ml bottle. Hazy mahogany colour with huge, frothy, beige head. Malty and yeasty aroma with a lemon touch, bready, minimally roasty, a touch of stored apple. Taste is dry, bready malty, minimally fruity, minimally spicy yeasty. Average.

330ml bottle. Clear, yellow-ish, pale golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Strawy and metallic, hoppy aroma, a touch of limescale. Taste is minimally sweet pale malty, strawy, plain bitter hoppy.
50 cl. bottle. A clear yellow coloured beer with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, straw and with a bitter finish.

Bottle @ holiday. Super clear golden color, medium sized white head. Aroma is malts, grassy, hayish. Flavor is malts, lightly grassy / hayish hops, bitter hops, moderately bitter. Decent body, decent carbonation. Pleasant. 7-3-7-3-15.

Sampled from 0.5 l bottle from local 'trinkgut', best before April 2019. Clear, golden with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, white head. Sweetish, slightly grassy-spicy and a bit musty aroma of grains and some straw. Slightly sweet, moderately bitter, gently grassy-spicy and a bit watery taste of grains and straw, followed by a short, moderately bitter, slightly grassy-spicy and a bit metallic finish. Thin body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Poor.
Fles 50cl thuis. Wat zoetig, bitters, wat würzig. Redelijk lange nadronk. (4-2014).
Einfaches Bier mit leicht herbem aber nicht bitterem Touch. Ziemlich dünn aber trinkbar.. Erinnert an Plastikbecherbier vom Imbiss.

Wenig Schaumentwicklung, satte goldgelbe Farbe. Geruch unauffällig, leicht grasig, hintenraus etwas herb. Geschmacklich sehr mild, kaum Geschmack, etwas lieblose Herbe hintenraus erkennbar. Absolut unspektakulär.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein klares goldgelbes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig, getreidig, grasig. Geschmack hopfig, grasig, lang anhaltende Bitterkeit.
Herber, wenig süßer Antrunk. Leicht getreidig, herber werdend. Ebenfalls leicht hopfig, einfach. Trinkbar. 10/8/8/7/6/7
Dünn, wässrig, leicht bitter und schlapp. Ohne große Aromen kommt diesen Pilsner daher und dient beinahe nur zum Kippen. Trinkbar, mehr aber auch nicht.
04-05-19 // can shared with the crew. Thanks Maggie! Nutty caramel some bread. Very malt forward.
Can. Pours clear amber with a light beige head. Toasted malt, caramel, brown bread, nuts, hints of coffee. Pretty good.

Amber pour with small beige head on tap at Tap That Growlers in La Grande. Nose is big on roasty malt with a subtle hoppiness. Flavor is smooth roast malt, slight floral, nutty, earthy. Light to medium body. Light bitter finish. Very drinkable.

On tap. Pours a clear copper with a medium, frothy, long lasting, beige head that leaves curtains of lace. Sweet aroma of bready malt and caramel. Sweet flavour of toasted malt, biscuit and caramel with a dry, hoppy finish. Light body with a watery texture and soft carbonation. Pretty tasty for an Amber.

Sampled at the brewery during the RBSG but tour. In my glass copper orange with an off-white head. Nose is malty and there are floral hops. Light body. Flavor is lightly roasted malts and there is dry, earthy, and bitter finish. As ambers go this one is pretty good
Draft sample at the source. The beer is a clear copper with a beige head of foam. Citrus and tropical fruit notes. Some doughy character. Medium body and light carbonation.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a fairly clear orange amber with a medium sized white head. Soft toast, a bit of sweetness, a bit of malt. Medium bodied, soft toast, a bit of malt, crisp and clean, but a touch empty. Slow malt and toast into the finish.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a cloudy amber with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is toasted malt and earth. Light body, malty, cocoa, earth, light bitter finish, good.

On tap in Boise. Berry dark for style, worth a fine looking, clear, red-brown body and a decent head. Lightly sweet up front worth a mildly bitter, relatively hoppy finish. Smooth medium+ body with light carbonation.
Dark Amber pour. Heaven in every sip? Not here. An average Amber in every aspect - light toast, caramel and hops. Thin to medium body. Standard fare.

Clear golden color with some white foam. Aroma has grains, malt and wet cardboard. Taste has sweet malt, damp grains with a very light hop bitterness on the finish. Light to medium body with medium carbonation. Not really my kind of lager.

500 ml bottle from Interspar Vöcklabruck, bb 08/2016. Golden, clear body, with a big, unstable, frothy, moderately lacing, off-white head. Aroma of grains, grass, flowers, bread, some berbs, some honey. Taste follows this, with subtle citrus. Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation. Finishes moderate bitter, floral, grassy, a bit herbal, a bit bready. Nothing special overall, but easy and clean, with some nice floral notes. Not the best style examples I’ve had, while still a solid one.

Bottle, 5.3%. Refreshing hop aroma. Clear golden colour. Nice stable chalk white head. The flavour is mildly malty, slightly sweet. Medium bitterness. Hint of sewer in the finish, but overall quite nice.

bottle, Interspar Linz. Clear golden yellow, large white head. Full-bodied, intensively malty with a nice but shy hoppy touch in the finish. Shy fruity hints, as well as a very shy touch of marzipane.
Bottled(500ml). –on my label is only Gold, strong herbal and somehow metalic aroma, malty flavor, dry finish, usual brew

Yellow colored, big white head. Sweet and malty aroma. Malty flavored in start, turns out to have mildly grassy ending. Ends with pretty biting hops and dry mouthfeel, that’s nice. Basic start with medium body ends with fine ending, nice brew overall.
Hoppy, herbal aroma, pale golden. Light malty with more hop notes. Some strong alcohol notes. Quite overall, all in all.
FAint, although herbal aroma. Pale gold, crystal clear, with a big, dense white head. Flavor is good malt, with a hop background. Somewhat light on the malt character for a helles
clear golden colour, nice head and lace, strong herbal aroma, full-bodied, slightly tart with a very long dry hoppy finish
Aus der Flasche im 2014-11 getrunken. Schönes Stout was nicht kalt getrunken werden darf, da sonst die tollen Aromen vollkommen untergehen. Schön süffig.
On bottle. Pours dark brown, with small to no foam. Scent: Chocolate, coffee, liqourice. Taste: Chocolate, Coffee. Texture: Watery.
Couleur noire, légère mousse beige. Nez café torréfié avec crème chocolat. Gout café un peu grillé et fève cacao, note caramel. Corps assez aqueux. Fin sur le torréfié
Bottle 50cl, a dark beer with good head. Nose is on roasted caramel, roasted coffee. Aroma on roasted caramel and ashes, mostly dry, quite classic, correct.

0,5 l bottle. Pours out - black. Two finger beige head. More milk choco than coffee smell. Taste starts the same, also some hints of smoke. Thins a little bit out in the middle. Hopy elements in the aftertaste. Nice.
Flot sort stout. Meget fyldig øl. God smag af chokolade og malt og fin eftersmag.

Tap (HBF2017) (5:3:5:3:11=2.7) MInerally watery aroma, some roast. Dark, tight beige head. Palate also a bit watery. Some roast but a kinda dull beer. Rerate: Tap (Copenhagen, Helsinki) (6:4:6-:3:11=3.0-) Dark treacly aroma. Wateryish palate. Mashy, roasty, rawish dark malts. A touch harsh bitterness, dark ashy roasty barley.
Tap@kitts. Black. Roasty dark bredy, some chocolate on nose. Med full bodied, dark bready, bit dryish malty. Clean smooth though. Ok. -- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Tap @HBF 2017. Pitch black color. Medium size, brown head, stays. Malty, roast, fruity, sweet in aroma. Roast, malty, coffee, citrus, fruity, sweet in taste. Medium carbonation. Nice combination of roast and citrusy hops in aftertaste. Mellow mouthfeel. Very solid brew and highly drinkable.
Tap at HBF 2017, Helsinki. Colour s clear dark brown with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Cold coffee, burnt malts and roasted malts. Not good.
Im Antrunk muffig-malzig. Leicht süßlich. Im Hauptteil flach-süßlich, im Nachgeschmack ebenso flach-süßlich, dabei leicht herb. 7/10/7/7

Bottle 50 cl from Bier-Bienne (CH). Nice amber with an average white head and cool crackling. Malted aromas, floral, caramel and grassy hops. The taste is soft, very malted, sugar-honey, bun and lightness. Semi fluid and quenching beer, notes of toffy and slight bitter. Pleasant and a good example.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, getreidig, leicht herb. Geschmack malzig würzig, getreidig, minimale Bitterkeit.

Bottle. Golden, small to average and mostly diminishing head. Light to moderate malty and sweetish aroma, some caramel and faint grassy hoppyness. Body is light to medium, malty and sweetish flavor, some caramel and light bread, faint grassy hoppyness and faint caramel. Finish is short to average, malty and lightly sweetish, some caramel and light metal with faint hoppyness. Sweetish helles with caramel. Nothing wrong – nothing special.
Bottle from Stirchley Wines, Brum. Orange coloured lager. Tastes very chocolatey - almost like a chocolate milkshake. Bizarre. Drinkable. Bizarre.
Flasche 50cl. Helles mit sanften rötlichen Kupfertönen, relativ geringe Schaumkrone. Im Antrunk deutlich Röstmalz erkennbar, wenig Hopfen. Alles in Allem ein recht süffiges Landbier ohne Schnörkel.

#525 Goldige Farbe, etwas orange, manche würden bernstein sagen. Das Aroma ist malzig, aromatisch nach Hopfen. Der Antrunk ist zwar etwas dünn, was aber durch eine leicht-süßliche Malznote mit einem aromatisch-herben, leicht hopfigen Abgang egalisiert wird. Läßt sich schnörkellos angenehm trinken. Das Etikett der Bügelflasche mit Ihrer Majestät Graf Bray ist allerdings geradezu peinlich geraten, Ihre Hochwohlgeboren verzeihen! Insgesamt ein schmackhaftes Lager, der Probe unbedingt wert! Test vom 14.10.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 10,10,11,9,8,10 - 9,90
Pours clear and golden yellow with a huge white head. Aroma is slight grassy and crisp hoppy. Sweet and malty flavoured.

Bottle, bought @ Bierspezi Hoheluft, Hamburg. Clear golden with a small, frothy, white film head. Aroma is sweet, caramel malts, grass, light hay. Medium to low carbonation, grainy and fairly light mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet, sugary, hay, soft grainy. Not a fantastic beer.
Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Light bitter flavor. Average light bitter finish. Oily palate. Boring.
# 341; 6/2016. Nevyvážený, velmi sladký ležák bez výraznějšího chmelení se špatnou pitelností.

Had it from the bottle so there's nothing much to say about its appearance. Unfortunately, it was also a bit past its prime so I can't really say much about the taste either... Anyway, malt side took over. Strong caramel and honey notes combined with herbal and unpleasantly bitter background. A bit cloying, really. I'll leave a generic rating and re-rate when (if) I hopefully get ahold of a fresh sample.
On tap at Cafe Scherz Pours clear gold with white head. Bit dull. Tastes malty, low on to medium bitterness. Malty and lacks on hops. Okay.

500ml bottle from Zsolt as a gift. He's got it from Brno. Pours a clear deep golden colour with a small white head that reduces into a thin film. Cheesy popcorn aroma with some bread notes. Taste matches the aroma with some light citrus notes. Very flavourful for a pilsner. I like it.
Golden color with white head. Aroma is malty, herbal and floral. Taste is malty with light to medium bitterness. Overall it's good beer.
Bottle. Golden colour, nice frothy head that stays for a while. Aroma is much butter, also malt, a bit of grassy hops. Light bitterness. Decent.
Klasický český pivko. Takových už jsem měl, že psát stále to samé dokola se mi už nechce. Prostě klasika, kterou zná každý český pivař..

500 ml bottle from Edea, drunk at home on a warm spring afternoon. Pours clear with a brief frothy head that settled to a thin collar of lacing, a little visible rising carbonation. Mid straw in colour. Aroma driven by malts, with cereal, bread and biscuit. In the mouth, bitterness from the first sip, some biscuit and bread flavours, thin texture, slight sweetness and alcohol presence. Overall, not terrible, but just another dull, bitter, malty lager with no interesting flavours.
Prakticky tady přidávám tento komentář, jen aby tady něco bylo, protože zpětně dopisuji 900 piv z mého seznamu a asi bych se musel u toho zbláznit.
Botella. Clear golden like, medium white head. Aroma: Malty grainy hoppy grassy. Flavour: Malty grainy grassy, fair medium bitterness.

Draught @ Klub Malých Pivovarů, Pilsen. Pours clear pale golden with airy white head. Clear aroma of yeast and malt, with mild hoppy notes. Bitter, hoppy flavour with sweetish notes of yeast and malt. Estery and acidic aftertaste with hoppy notes and some metallic hints. Not bad for the style and quite tefreshing as such. Still, a bit watery, and I do not quite fancy the metallic notes.

(bottle 0,5l from brewery) Overall: Below average. Aroma: Light malty, light grainy. Appearance: Clear golden. Medium, white head. Taste: Light sweet, light malty. Palate: Light-medium body. Light bitter finish.

Bottled. Clear pale yellow colour, medium short-life white head. A bit watery and metallic aromas with some grains and grassy hops. Taste is malty sweetness, grains, floral and spicy hops, honey. Light body, lively carbonation, watery texture, dry and moderate hoppy finish. Good thirst quencher, but nothing remarkable.
Bottle, kindly shared by friend. Golden color with medium white head. Malty aroma with bitter hops. Malty taste with bitter hops in finish. Medium long hoppy bitter finish.
Can, bought in Dublin city centre. Pale gold with a light carbonation, its head disappears. Ordinary lager with a light texture.
On tap. Pours yellow color with white head. Aroma of banana, wheat, malt. Tastes sweet, banana, lemon.
Draught. Clear yellow colour, medium sized white head. Grainy nose and aroma escorted by honey and some hay. Grassy hoppy, citric finish.
I’ve had this bottled and on tap.Pours clear golden with a white head.Sweet,grainy aroma with notes of grassy hops,butterscotch,sweet malt and citrus.
On tap. Golden, little hazy, white head, lots of carbonation. Hoppy and sweet taste. Not too.bad. Refreshing at an outdoor market, but won’t change one’s life.
bottle from chody. Clear golden yellow, mid-sized white head. Slightly grainy malt flavours dominate, increasing hoppiness towards the finish. Smooth palate, highly drinkable. Good desítka.
21.07.19 AR: Malz, Getreide, Kräuter, Karamell, Tabak, Brot AP: trübes bernstein TA: Malz, Getreide, Kräuter, Karamell, Tabak, Brot
Feines sehr bekömmliches Zwickl, schöne Farbe. Schaum hält lange an. Malziger antrunk, lang anhaltender Geschmack. Sehr Süffig.

Bottle at home. Pours cloudy brown with a large, frothy off-white head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is lightly sweet grain and meal malt, faint honey/caramel malt notes, light-medium earthy and spicy hops with light toasted cereal malt notes late alongside a fleeting apple character. Flavor is crisp, lightly sweet bread and cereal malt, light caramel/honey notes, faint apple fruitiness, light spicy hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body, moderate mouth filling carbonation and low alcohol warmth.

Pours dark orange in colour, hazy with solid head. One more lager from this brewery with fruity and little bit weizen like notes, malty base. The beer is medium sweet with light bitterness and light sour in the finish. Really strange but easy to drink.
0,5l Flasche. Braunes Bier mit hellem Schaum.,leicht malziger Duft. Geschmack Malz, Getreide, Roggenbrot. Etwas flach und belanglos.
Unfiltrierte 5.2c°. Couleur ambrée, légère mousse beige. Nez malté caramel, notes acidulées. Gout malté caramel, noisettes, orge, note houblonnée épicée. Bonne amertume un peu épicée.
Draft tap at 37degree bar, Lindau 06/02/15. Poured a copper colour, hazed, with a thick white fizzy head. Notes of malt, light fruit tang, and a sniff of hops. Refreshing finish.
Flasche 50cl. Recht dunkles, hefetrübes Bier mit flacher Schaumkrone. Würzig, süffig, etwas dumpfer Nachgeschmack. Im Nachtrunk breit brotig-hefig. OK.
malty and fruity aroma with shades of lollipop... rough malty taste with notes of apple, kvass, toffee and some spices... hopping is rather noticeable... bitter and, a little bit, sweet aftertaste...
Leicht trübes orangegelbes Bier mit wenig Schaum. Geruch malzig, getreidig, grasig. Geschmack malzig, getreidig, leicht würzig.
0.5 l bottle. Dark brown color beer with almodt no head. Roasted, slightly caramel aroma. Taste of roasted malt, coffee an chocolate.
Mikołaj Rutkowski is drinking a Černá Hora Granát by Pivovar Černá Hora Całkiem spoko
Aromat palony, lekko karmelowy. W smaku przyjemnie palony słód, trochę kawy zbożowej. Całkiem wytrawne, jest ok.
Bevuta alla spina a Praga. Aroma poco intenso. Scura con schiuma persistente.

500 ml bottle. Overlaid black and brown beige foam. Aroma: toasted bread, distantly coffee and light sweetness. The body is fairly light, carbonation is above average. Taste: toasted bread tones, light notes of dark caramel, quiet bitterness. Aftertaste: light, with toasted notes.

Очень и очень недурный темный лагер. В аромате трава,кофе,немного хмеля. Во вкусе сбалансированная жженка,темный шоколад,тот же кофейный привкус и очень приятная маслянистость. Однозначно стоит попробовать. Питкое освежающие пиво,в жаркий день посмаковать самое то
Dark color, middle foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style.

Draft sample at the Prague Beer museum. The beer is a clear dark brown with a beige head of lasting foam. Toasted caramel and marshmallow with a bit of vanilla and espresso powder. Complex flavor profile. Sweet throughout. Medium body and medium carbonation.

0,5 bottle. Szép kávébarna szín, a hab kitöltéskor cabpuccinó színű, tömör, közepesen tartós. Illata picit alkoholos, karamell malátás, eléggé kerek, kicsit csokis. Közepesen szénsavas, jól iható. Aszalt gyümölcsös lecsengés, karamelles, kávés de mégsem igazán édes, komlózás is érződik. Remek cseh alap-barna.
Piana ładna długo się trzyma kolor czarny lekko przebijający. W smaku jest lekka paloność i nic więcej goryczka słaba. piwo pije się przyjemnie nic nie przeszkadza ale tez nie zachwyca zwykle piwo.
Bottle. White head. Clear golden body. Corn aroma. Flavor: I don’t know but I certainly don’t like it.
pretty dull in a well-made but uninspiring way. mulberry tartness comes as a relief
Clear golden colour, white foam. Light sweet, malty with medium bitter finish. Easy drinkable. Ok Pils.

"Rhaner Pils", Fläschlein von Edeka Buchbauer, Chamerau. - Goldgelb, blank. - In der Nase feinster, gediegener Aromahopfen, Kräuter, Gras, ein wenig Zitronenschale. - Antrunk schlank und zart hellmalzig mit zarter Honigsüße und schönen, klassischen Hopfenaromen: Kräuter, Gras. Milder rezent, nicht ganz so schlank, sehr weich. Im Abgang milde aber aromatische Herbe, ein wenig Zitronenschale. - Sehr rundes, saftiges Pilsener mit feiner aber gediegener Hopfung. Ein wenig runder als das gleichzeitig verkostete Viechtacher Bergkristall.

On tap. Dorato limpido e con un cappello di schiuma bianca molto fine dall lunga tenuta. Al naso lieve erbaceo, crosta di pane e soprattutto mais. Al palato è dolciastra e solo sul finale è leggermente amara. Corpo medio-leggero, carbonazione fine che che si esaurisce ben presto. Più una cream ale che non una pils.
0,33l Flasche. Klares gelbes Bier, heller fester Schaum. Getreide und erwas Zitrone in der Nase. Leicht süsslicher Antrunk. Mir zu wenig herb. Aber als Bier ok.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (Kauf bei Rewe in Bodenmais). Relativ mild und weich im Antrunk. Hopfenenwürze kommt etwas später.
Würziger, herb-getreidiger Beginn. Die Herbe als prägendes Aroma wird intensiver, milder angenehmer Hopfen. Geringe konstante Bitterkeit, deutlich erdig. Nett! 9/10/10/9/9/9
Bottled, from Biershop Bayern. Grassy, spicy nose. Sweet with light-medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Sugar and bread, some spice and grass. Long bitter finish. Too sweet to be refreshing.

Golden and clear beer with a white medium head that disappears quickly. Aroma is malty, with straw and grain. Flavor is predominantly sweet combined with a medium bitterness that drives to a long end with grain and grass notes. Body is slightly watery and carbonation is low.
Bottle at home. Pale yellow pour, thin white head. Aroma of grainy malts, soapy, some lime. Flavor is a bit bitter, a bit watery and with some crispy hops. Simple but drinkable pilsener.
Bottle 0.5l at home. Originally rated 24092011. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, sweetness and malts.

column2: Toms River, New Jersey, United States
column5: (4/98) This beer was nearly forced on my in an ice coated mug that was so cold the beer started to freeze. Even the arctic chilled mug could not force a head onto this (I'm sorry) bile colored "amber." Who's idea was it to cram a so-called brewery into a Ground Round? Smells a bit like dishwater, that's probably the overpowering aroma of melting dishwater/ice. This stuff tastes like Karo and water and pennies and cornbread. Not refreshing, even though it was served at -25 degrees. This was the second beer I gave back to the bartender. Sadly, not the worst beer I've ever had.

column4: The Cider House / Domaine de Grand Pré
column5: 341 ml bottle from Domaine de Grand Pré winery. Pours a clear pale yellow gold with tiny apple specs and small quickly disappering white head. Mild nose of tart apples. Flavour starts off sweet, moving to tart apple. Lingering finish, lively carbonation. Drinkable but nothing too special.

column4: The Cider House / Domaine de Grand Pré
column5: Thanks to HogTownHarry. Appearance: almost transparent yellow. No head. No visible carbonation. Aroma: mild ripe apple, some pear. Flavour: nice ripe apple, lovely carbonation with an almost peach like finish. Not bad at all

column4: The Cider House / Domaine de Grand Pré
column5: Forgot who I got this from, sorry, but thank you to the kind soul who provided it. Neither good nor bad, strictly speaking, but instead pretty similar to every other bottled hard cider I have ever had. Too sweet, almost artificial in the aroma, but taste is much milder apple and tart flavors and a chalky, peely aftertaste. Light mouthfeel and effervescent carbonation. Know what I would like? A cider that’s sweet like an ice wine. Guess I’d better pony up for one of those Quebec ice ciders.

column4: The Cider House / Domaine de Grand Pré
column5: (Bottle) Obtained through a trade with OKBeer. Pours a clear, light yellow body with a very active carbonation. Nose of sweet apples, milky white wine and a slight yeastiness. Very well presented and nicely sweetened. Good apple presentation with a mid-palate that delivers a tart dryness into the finish. I really don’t understand the poor reviews for this unless it very susceptible to temperature changes during transportation? This trade took place in November which may have kept the goodness preserved. Similar to Jodoin Temptation. Very refreshing!

column4: The Cider House / Domaine de Grand Pré
column5: clear yellow apple juice viz carb. Smells like rotten apples and booze. Carbonated water palate. Tastes like rotten apples & maybe a nice warm glass of piss.

column4: The Cider House / Domaine de Grand Pré
column5: Thanks jerc. Pours to an ultra-watery yellow body that is glowing. The aroma is strange apples, lemons, lightly rotting apples. The flavor is lightly rotten apples, lemons, weird. The palate is lightly sweet syrup, medium bodied.

column4: The Cider House / Domaine de Grand Pré
column5: Clear yellow-flourescent yellow body, kind of flat. Somewhat fermemted sharp macintosh aroma. Chemically sweet apples with a tart start. Musty finish. Not as offensive as some might think but it’s also not at all good.

column4: The Cider House / Domaine de Grand Pré
column5: Pale golden yellow. No head. Aroma is apple pie... nothing much too it. Some stale watery grain with yeast maybe. Taste is odd apple staleness. Not too good. Reminds me of going to the dentist for some reason...

column4: The Cider House / Domaine de Grand Pré
column5: Very pale yellow, no head. Crisp apple aroma. Tart apple flavour with glimpses of alcohol. Relatively sweet finish. Lingering apple juice in the aftertaste. Average palate, fairly effervescent. Pleasant but simplistic.

column4: The Cider House / Domaine de Grand Pré
column5: Bottle shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow, jerc & tupalev -- courtesy of jerc. Pours a pale yellow with no head. Decent aroma of mildly sour apples. Flavour is sweet and finishes tart. A little too watery. It’s not bad.
On draft at the brewpub in Princeton. Pours a clear deep cola with a tan head. Flavors of cocoa and roasted grain. Bitter roast finish.
Nitro, light aroma. Black with a nice head. Great rich body. Nice roasty body. Sweet. A bit too smooth.
Draft - Roast malts and some fruity notes. Deep jet black with a rich brown head. Light sweet roast malts, dark fruit and some sweetness. Pretty mellow and boring for the style.

On nitro tap at Triumph Philly. Appearance: Pitch black body with a huge creamy khaki nitro head. Aroma: Super mild aroma with creamer and milk chocolate, but it’s way weak. Taste: Sweet malts with big chocolate and mild roasted malts. Subtle yeasty esters on the finish top this off nicely. The finish lingers of bitter dark chocolate. Palate: Soft and thick. Overall: Despite the mild aroma, this is a great imperial stout with bold flavor.

Location: Draft at the Brewpub - Princeton, 4/21/13 Aroma: It has a chocolaty nose, fairly sweet, with some lighter roast notes as well Appearance: This one pours a dark brown color with a heavy tan head and coating lace Flavor: The taste is medium sweet and chocolaty, balanced by some light bitterness Palate: The body is medium, it has a fairly creamy feel, and it comes off as rather easy to drink Overall Impression: I thought this was a pretty good one. It’s a solid example of the style, and a nice beer. I certainly didn’t have any complaints.
Draft wrong new hope. Black pour with head. Butterscotch aroma. Tastes sweet, not so Roasty. Finishes thin.
Part of the draft sampler @ the Princeton location. Opaque black body with a small beige head. Aroma roasty and sweet. Flavor of roasted coffee and chocolate with little alcohol. Bitter finish.

I had this on tap at the Princeton location. It was served in a snifter, which was nice to see. The color is a completely opague black with a tan head. Lacing lasts a long time. Hay fever had my sinuses a bit stuffed up, so I wasn’t able to get as much aroma as I should but what I got was predominatly roasted malt. Flavor was also chocolatey roasted barley. It was served a pretty cold, but even as it warmed the alcohol stayed well in the background. All in all a very good Imperial Stout.

Root beer brew with browned creme top. Exceptionally hoppy nose for an imperial stout, but otherwise, the malting seems subdued, or even flat. Pleasant chocolate roast barley flavors wind through the palate, with the hop flavor more balanced than the aroma would indicate. Well crafted to conceal the potency.

On tap at brewpub. Pours deep opaque black with a thick tan head. Aroma of chocolate, and chalky roasted malt. Flavor of sweet rich malt, chocolate, coffee and alcohol. A medium mouthfeel, that is crisp and smooth. A nice well balanced easy drinking stout.

Tap at Triumph Philly, 30/11/13. Lightly hazed chestnut brown with a good sized beige head. Good lacing follows on this one. Nose is toffee, biscuit malt, light spice, toffee apple, brown bread. Taste comprises bready malt, earthy tones, biscuit base, bready malts, light sugar. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry finale with a little grass laden bitterness. So so Scottish tosh - at least it didn’t have a stupid kilt/caber/och aye name attached to it !
@Princeton-on nitro-rich tan-copper. A-roasty/caramel-med malt. T-roasty/caramel/some peat-med malt, hint of spice hops.
Pours a brown amber color with an off white foam head. Taste of sweet english bitters. Very mellow, silky.
Pours amber. Aroma is malty with a hint of grass. Taste is caramel and some roastyness.
Draft @ Triumph Princeton. Ruby mahogany pour with tan head. Light on flavor, texture and carbonation, slight malt and fruit flavors.

In short: Bland cereals and bland tea-like hops. Well brewed but rather bland How: Tap at brewpub, Princeton location The look: Clear amber body topped by a medium beige head In long: Unexpected tea-like nose, the type of generic tea-bag aroma served in cheap diners. Taste of bland breakfast healthy brown cereals and whole-wheat bread. Not much in the way of caramel, toffee or other sweet flavours. Very soft with a airy body. Finish has a little dry grass and the generic tea that I got in the nose, unusual but bland tea-like hopping here. Yet another Scottish Ale that I find totally boring. I really need to avoid that style but I didn’t have access to ratebeer at the pub so how could I know what style the beer was just by its name.

Triump Brewery- Princeton, NJ- 12 Draft. Deep reddish brown coloring, aroma of very sweet and nice malt flavoring. Medium-thick bodied with around an inch of thick head. Pretty enjoyable, was nicely surprised.
Cask at New Hope location. Pours copper with a beige head. Aroma of caramel malts, roast, and coffee. Flavor is roast, caramel, coffee, sweetness. Good body, decent brew.

Handpull at Triumph New Hope. Deep copper body with a cream-colored head. Aroma of well-caramelized malt and light roast. Flavor has a distinct sea water quality. Briny oysters come to mind. Very earthy. Smooth, medium-light body. Interesting character overall.

Cask in Princeton. Nice amber color with a thick tan head. Too much foam in my opinion. Smell had caramel, toffee, chocolate and vanilla. Interesting buttery flavor. I found this overly bitter because the temperature was too warm. This was above average but not memorable.

Drought. Hazy orange-yellow with small white foamy head, weak citrus aroma, bitter-sour citrusy taste, low carbonation, medium bitter finish. Lower alcohol abv than recorde here (7.4%). Nothing special but not annoying either.

This poured a hazy whitish yellow color with a white head. Aroma was lots and lots of corn starch, fruit, and yeast. Flavor was very sweet but not malty, just tasted like a bunch of table sugar was dumped in the beer, some light begiany fruity notes and some yeasty banan notes too. Hard to get over the sweetness and the blandness of this one.

The aroma is cereal grains, wheat, caramel. The appearance is somewhat clear yellow, white head. The flavor is like a wheat ale, usually for the normally oversweet wheat wine style. The alcohol is undetectable. Thin/medium in body, a disapointment for this style. The finish is wheat, cereal grainy, no real hops (!?!). Not great, but I didn’t vomit.

On tap. Odd beer. Crystal clear golden hue with a small white ring of foam. Aromas are of orange, tangerine, alcohol, estery and grainy. Flavors are of vanilla, grainy, butterscotch, floral and medium earthy notes. Alcohol. Marmalade, sweet. Strange off-flavor that I can’t quite pinpoint. Some bubblegum too. Thick bodied, warming.
Murky blond pour. Not too familiar with Barley Wines, this one at least seems similar to a Saison.

Plastic cup at the brewery, 17/12/11- this version 8.4%. Buttered sherry aroma. Raisiny, fizzy. Chew of dried fruits over a solid biscuity backdrop. Light lemon curd notes; almond, nougat. Honeyed with no esters or hops to lift it. Dull.

On tap at the Pony Bar, NYC. Bright pour, a gleaming light amber with moderate carbonation and nice sticky legs. Toasted coconut, mild citrus, and sweet toffee in the nose. Body was lively, with a slightly too sticky feel in places (a common enough feature for the style). Flavors were quite floral to start, and - after a sweet, malt-heavy center - led to a bitter finish. More complexity than in some wheatwines I’ve had and I found it pretty good.

On tap at Pony Bar. Pours a clear golden amber with a gray head that dissipated completely. Aroma was full of sweet grains and caramel with a bit of an underlying toffee note. Flavor was similar with a good amount of caramel and toffee with a hint of backing light fruit.

Growler filled at Big Z and consumed later the same day. Poured a slightly hazed gold with a moderate linen white head that lasted though the first two sips and left light lace. Pleasant aroma of malt, lightly sweet, with some fruity notes. The flavor is malt with a some mild wheat and again some fruit. No hint of the alcohol. Mild-moderate bitterness at the finish. Solid.

Draft. Pours a crimson body with a white head and light retention. Nice fruity body with punch and fruit notes, a bit punch y with apricots apples and marmalade. Hints of pineapple and star-burst candies. Nice offering.

column1: Chelsea The Tsars Revenge Imperial Stout
column5: Draft. Pours near black with a beige head. Roasted malts, light sweet dark fruits, faint smoked malts, and light earthy notes. Fine.

column1: Chelsea The Tsars Revenge Imperial Stout
column5: Drought. Dark brown with reddish tint, disappointing small beige foamy head, strong coffee aroma, high carbonation, burnt malt taste, long finish. Good bite at the end but felt more like a porter tan stout.

column1: Chelsea The Tsars Revenge Imperial Stout
column5: Draught @ Barcade NYC. This is a decent impy but nothing super special. Would take Rasputin over this any day.

column1: Chelsea The Tsars Revenge Imperial Stout
column5: Cloudy brown body with a small offwhite head. Aroma is caramel, butter, alcohol, chocolate. Flavor is fruit, caramel, light bitter.

column1: Chelsea The Tsars Revenge Imperial Stout
column5: Clear dark black brown colour with a average to large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white to light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, light tart malt, light to moderate yeasty. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet, light light acidic and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, tart malt, roasted, chocolate, dark fruit, yeasty. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130111]

column1: Chelsea The Tsars Revenge Imperial Stout
column5: Nice head with good duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are roast malt, caramel, fruits, wood and hops.

column1: Chelsea The Tsars Revenge Imperial Stout
column5: Black with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 110113

column1: Chelsea The Tsars Revenge Imperial Stout
column5: Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, dark fruits and yeast. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, yeast, little acid, berries, hop, little sweet and a little bitter.

column1: Chelsea The Tsars Revenge Imperial Stout
column5: Pours black with a bubbly white head. Tart and dusty. Roast, charcoal and dark fruit. Smooth and full bodied. Spicy roasted end.

column1: Chelsea The Tsars Revenge Imperial Stout
column5: just a wonderful flavor of chocolate with spices (imagine for yourself as they are not overly apparant) a in a fresh malty base that brings visions of a perfect roasted malt....that is chocolatey. sprite soda finish on the tongue with a dash of root. dark brew, smooth and silky with substantial but not too thick substance to it. perhaps sweet,perhaps hoppy. a very enjoyable 20 ounce portion served perfectly at gingerman NYC.
Drought. Dark red-brown with beige creamy head, faint coffee and liquor aroma, slightly bitter but strangely flat taste, low carbonatio, medium finish with bitter aftertaste. Could be better.

On tap at the brewpub on 43rd Street. Pours dark amber with creamy, white, long lasting head. Aroma is of caramel malt and ripe fruit. Body is medium and smooth. Taste is herbal, earthy hops and caramel malt, hint of coffee. Finish is long and bitter. Average brew.

Hazy dark red/brown with a one-finger off white head and decent lace. Toasted malt aromas with hints of caramel and brown sugar. Flavors are similar, and include gentle bittering hops and some gentle herbal tea. Medium-bodied, creamy mouthfeel, moderate carbonation, and a dry finish.
Draft. Pours amber orange with a creamy off white head. Light sweet caramel malt aroma. The aroma have caramel/toffee sweetness, vanilla, cream, and light notes of milk chocolate. Not bad.

Nice attractive appearance, dark red, almost brown, creamy white head. The aroma is not so good, caramel, stale, mettalic. The flavor was malts, caramel, brown sugar, slight booze. The finish was a mix of piney hops and a sour malty flavor. Not horrendous, but not good.
hmm, plain, plain, plain...semi cream, red rosy brown, not the greatest, i dont understand how it received a 51...

On tap at Union Square- appearance is clear and red- just like any other irish ale, aroma is of caramel but is subtle and flat. Flavor is sweet with a bit of bitterness toward the end of the taste. Palate is average. No real body to this one- not much different than Killians or any other of the genre.

Location: On tap at the 51st and 6th location of the brew pub Aroma: Nose is sweet, toffee caramel Appearance: Creamy red color, looks a lot like the rooster... Flavor: Lots of sweetness, with almost no balance Palate: Ok mouthfeel, medium body, sticky but creamy Overall Impression: Not a lot of raters of this one... It was a half-decent Irish red I guess, not much else to say about this one...

On draft at the Radio City location. Color was amber-brown/copper, decent head when served, yet it subsided and became average. Aroma was coffee and west coast type hops (pine?). The caramel and toffee notes came out, but it finished dry and with a firm hop finish. snore. Caramel and some toffee, moderately dry, firm hop presence. Mouthfeel was average for the style. Snore.

Tap at the Union Square location. Deep amber red colour. Thick white nitro head. Aroma is very sweet and candyish, sweet toffee, caramel, and brown sugar. Flavour matches with wave after wave of increasingly cloying sweetness. Caramel turns to butterscotch and I turn to order something else. A completely unnecessary brew.
Draft. Pours cloudy yellow with white head. Nose/taste of toasted grain and lemon. Lighter bodied.
Draft at the source. Crystal clear yellow color, white head. Aroma of white pepper and straw. Taste is light lager.

Tap at the brewery. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, short retention with good lacing. Aroma is Pils and corn malt with light hops. Flavor is malt dominant, light hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.
On tap at the brewery. Nice and light classic American blonde ale. Very drinkable and smooth. Would be great in the summer.
Strawyellow pour with light creamy white head and lace. Lemon, malt, and light paper, almost no hops. Light malt light corn aftertaste. Fizzy and watery. Very refreshing, light and easy to drink.

Very light beer. Tastes sort of like a miller lite or coors light. Pours very light yellow with very very small white head that does not last. The palate is much like Kool-Aid. This is my least favorite that I have had at this brewpub, but my wife likes it. IMO Its meant for the non-beer drinking audience.

sampled at the brewpub. clear straw color. Aroma is lightly grainy with faint hints of floral hops. Taste is very light, with some grainyness and light notes of malt and hops. Didn’t taste any major flaws, an ok light beer.
Wasn’t too bad, but by the time I got to it I was already full of beer that it was a little tough to drink down. Will have to try another time.

I would call this an introductory beer for those not familiar with craft brew. Very light bodied with an unassuming grainy malt character and very light flowery hop aroma. Finish is slightly tart and flavor is grassy throughout. Much too light for me, but I can see it as an entryway beer.

Sample at Metuchen, NJ location. Color pours sparkling golden with white head. Pale malt aroma. Light malty and biscuit like flavor. Mild hoppy finish. Obviously designed to as a crossover for the BMC drinker. Not bad, but not exciting either. But I’d drink this over BMC any day.

column1: Pizzeria Uno Station House Red Ale
column5: Draft. Pours reddish amber with white head. Nose/taste of malt and fruits. Medium body.

column1: Pizzeria Uno Station House Red Ale
column5: Draft at the source. Clear amber color, tan edge head. Aroma of black pepper and caramel. Taste is toasted caramel.

column1: Pizzeria Uno Station House Red Ale
