Flavor brings out more weed/bark/pine hops with a grainy-caramel touch of sweetness (which is really just barely sweet). Very sessionable... ok.
pretty much a strait forward amber beer, malty, a bit of carmel sugars, okay start and finish. not bad, not great.

Bottle. Pours a toffee amber with an average off-white head. Aroma is very toasty. Flavour is toasty toffee with an interesting fruity acidity in the finish. Mildly bitter. Simple but solid, a nice amber.

12oz bottle pours clear copper – gold with thin white head. Does the “mountain” part of this amber prevent it from attaining an amber color? This is the goldest amber I’ve ever seen. The aroma is sweet malts mixing with caramel malts and a touch of biscuit and toffee. The taste has some modest yet vague to maybe pine hoppy notes blending with caramel malts, sweet sugary malts and a touch of roastiness. I think I get a sense of citrus into the finish. Interesting interpretation.
Draft. Pours an amber body with an off white head. Malty body with caramel and dry earth tones. A mild malt sweetness with a mild bitter earth finish, pretty average.

Dark brown, translucent (not AMBER in any way); nose of caramel, strong enough to get a good whiff in a smoky post-Superbowl bar, but little beyond the sweetness. Flavor starts out sweet but develops a strong roastiness towards the end; becomes rather woody; medium body. OK, but not really much better than the A-B product of the same name.

31st July 2018, 0.3 litre tall glass at the brewery, sat in the afternoon sun on their patio. Pours a clear, deep amber, the head a lasting off-white crown. Malty from the start to finish, my sweet tooth really enjoying the caramel like aroma and flavour.

(Tap) Es hat eine hellbraune Farbe mit einem leichten roten Einstich. Es ist filtriert mit einer leicht bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist süßlich, malzig und ein bisschen nach Honig. Der Geschmack ist eher schlank, leicht malzig, etwas röstig und mit einer blumigen Note im Abgang.

Tap at the brewery. A clear amber, burnt orange coloured pour with a lasting greyish head. Aroma is semi sweet, brown sugars, bready, cakey malts, and some jammy fruits. Flavour is composed of semi sweet nutty malts, toffee, brown sugars, cakey, jammy red berries,. Palate is semi sweet, grainy, moderate carbonation. Good.
On tap at the brewpub. A clear amber beer with a small most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of reddish malt, biscuit, caramel. Taste of caramelish malt nutty hops, mild citrusy hops.
Draught at the brewery. Clear reddish. Aroma medium malty (caramel, roasted) and hoppy. Flavor medium sweet and bitter. Medium body.
Form the tap at the brewpub. Dark hazlenut colored with off white head. Aroma of rosted malts and nuts. Some Brown shugar and liqurice. Taste is roast and hazlenut. Some decenthops in the finish.

On tap at the brewpub. Malty-dark beginning. Intense roasted, nice hopped, fresh. Malty smooth. Caramel, nice smooth malt. Dark, sweetish but not sticky. The bitterness helps to create a good balance. Intense malty on the tongue with a great bitter-sweet balance. Nice.

At the brewpub, pours a deep copper color with a thick white head. The smell is, bread, toasted malt, brown sugar. The taste is toasted malt, bread, hint of caramel ending dry. The body is light+ with pleasant fine carbonation. Nice...
Draught @ Brewpub. Pours amber with a creamy white head. Caramel, fruit and bread. Chewy and clean. Really nice.

Eigener Antrunk, dominiert von einem dumpfen Hopfenton. Im Mittelteil grasiger, der Hopfen wird aromatischer und bleibt dies auch. Vollmundig aber eher unsüffig scheint das Bier hier zu sein, hintergründig mit einer Vielzahl von Aromen. Auch das Malz befindet sich hier noch im Hintergrund und kommt erst im Abgang zur Geltung. Immerhin setzt es hier direkt intensiv ein, hat aber gegen die Hopfigkeit keine Chance und muss sich mit Platz 2 zufireden geben. Untypisches und voluminös hopfiges Dunkel. Test vom 14.8.2008, Gebinde: Fass Noten: 11,13,12,12,-,12 - 12,05

Es sieht aus wie ein typ. Alt, kupferrot-braun mit cremigen Schaum. Ein schwach nussiges Aroma samt Metallnote. Wässriger Antrunk, etwas nach gebrannter Mandel im Geschmack und dann wirds metallisch herb. Selten so ein aromenarmes, ja schlechtes Alt getrunken.

Das Alt startet mild und wenig aromenreich, ein herber Ton regiert, die Malzigkeit erscheint etwas plump. Ab dem Mittelteil macht sich ein unangenehmer bitterer Ton breit, der den Nachgeschmack deutlich regiert. Zurück bleibt nur ein trockener Mund. Test vom 4.9.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 8,4,3,1,4,2 - 3,00
Blindtasting of 10 altbiers. This turned out one of the worst. It was kinda thin, a little metallic. Roasted, bitter. Didn’t call for another sip.

Bottle:Amber coloured, thin fluffy, off-white head, quickly diminishing; malty aroma, traces of cardboard; faint sweetish-bitter flavour; slightly malty and bitter finish with a metallic tinge, fizzy mouthfeel. A real "cheap" Alt, no pleasure at all.................

(bottle) Clear and dark amber colour with a fluffy tanned head. Sweet toasted malty aroma with caramel and shy notes of fruits. Light bodied, medium bitter flavour and taste, dry toastmalty. Bitter and slightly hopped aftertaste with a light metallic tone.
Bottled: Quite o.k. aroma, some maltiness and sweetness. Light grainy note, light sweetness and maltiness. Quit blend with a bitter, light hoppy finish.
Bottled. Clear ruby red colour. Big, off-white, foamy head. Slightly roastmalty aroma with sweet biscuity notes. A rather dry alt; hoppy, bitter and with tiny hints of caramel. Quite okay.

Light, woody nose. Clear amber brown color and a tall tan head with a nice lace. Lightly hopped and slightly buttery in the middle. Sulfuty aftertaste that is rough and gritty. Thinish, but very well balanced.
Malt and cereal nose. Medium head, amber color with hints of red. Malt and cereal taste, hints of nuts - leaving in a light nutty aftertaste. Ok.
Dark copper with an off-white head. Sweet malty aftertaste, distant caramel. A decent bitterness to balance it. Good.
Hoppy for a German beer, lots of malt and hay and lighter grain flavors. Some sugar, fruit like citrus.

Sampled on tap at Industry, pours a reddish brown with a beige top and nice lace. Notes are plum, smoke, dark fruit, light hops, fig, and other caramel malts. Medium to fuller bodied. Rich and layered. Enjoyable for the style.

Bottle. Color: Dark copper, off-white head. Aroma: Malt, subtle caramel. Taste: Malty and hoppy, subtle caramel, lightly herbal. Moderate to medium sweet, moderate bitterness. Notes of grass, hay, bread, subtle dried dark fruit. Orange peel hints. A lot more of different flavours than an original Alt beer. Medium body, just below average carbonation. Pretty smooth and dense mouthfeel. Bittery finish. Nice.

Dieses Bier habe ich ebenfalls wie einige hier gemeinsam mit dem Doppelsticke vor ca 2 Jahren gekauft. Zu wahren Begeisterungsstürmen vermochte mich das Bier nicht hinzureißen. Dafür war es zu eigen. Es warrecht dunkel und klebrig-süß. Jedem anderen Bier hätte ich dies negativ ausgelegt, aber hier passt es doch ganz gut. Die Malzig-pickigen Aromen werden schön von einer leichten Hopfenbittere unterstrichen, die sich zwar vornehm zurückhält, aber nicht ganz verschwindet. Es wird wohl nicht mein Lieblingsbier werden, aber hie und da kann man es schon trinken.
33cl bottle thanks to @rauchbierlover. Pours murky brown with beige head. Aroma is malty, hay and apple cores. Malty taste and bitter finish.
$4.80 can, Wine Warehouse. Pours murky brown with a small beige head. Aroma is musty basement, earth, hay, brown grass. Flavor is hose water, dust, brown grass, grain, mineral water. Interesting.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.

02.03.2015, 0,33l bottle @ home: Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, caramel malts, raisins, grass, butterscotch, nuts, minerals, hay, alcohol. Taste is slightly dry, weeds, alcohol, minerals, grass, caramel malts, minerals, weeds, nuts. Longlasting bitterness, slightly harsh boozy mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Bottle at Holy Craft Beer Bar, Düsseldorf. Thick caramel malt aroma with a touch of tobacco, a hint of figs, more dried fruits, and toffee. Medium sweet and mildly bitter flavour. Body is medium. Pretty rich, beautiful malt.

Cloudy gold body with a medium head. Light clovy aroma. Flavor is quite yeasty unidimensional and standard, as light as the aroma. Weird aftertaste which I cannot define. Medium-low carbonated keeps mouth fresh. An under-average german weisse.
Clove, slight shit and soap aroma. Pale, greyish clouds, small head. Yeast and clove notes. Lightbodied. If it wasn't for the strange aroma this would be a ok cheap weisses.
pleasant lemon sherbet aroma but otherwise Röhrly dull. i need to enter more characters before this review is accepted but i have absolutely nothing else to say about this beer

Hofmark Original Pils--2002 11.2 oz. Bottle. 5.10% ABV. (4.25 / 5.0) World Beer Direct Beer of the Month Club Selection. Clear bright light golden color. Mild lace tight head. Rich sweet floral Saaz hop front. Crisp tart creamy sweet butter caramel tangy Pils malt body. Smooth mild hop citrus spice end. Tasty. Sampled 7/24/2003.

Slight vanilla aroma. Medium to full bodied. Very malty pilsener. Hoppy and flowery with vanilla. Maybe a bit too flowery for my taste, but indeed a well hopped and well brewed pilsener. Thanks for the bottle, Dortmunder.
Bottle: Hazy, pale golden colour, medium-sized, fluffy head, lacing; fresh herbal-hoppy nose, some resin; light bitter flavour and finish; quite light bodied and a bit watery.......

Slightly cloudy, pale golden colour. Lacey medium head. Hoppy aroma. Very refreshing hop-bitter taste with flowery notes, and a very light sweetness. Very nice and balanced, as flowery notes in a Pilsener are often accompanied by a too strong sweetness and staleness. Not in this one. Very good Pilsner of the drier variety.

drank this in cham and it nearly made me do just that in my pants. i guess this is just for the local market. very bitter and dry. not quite as buttery and rich as the other hofmarks but still with plenty of the hay aroma and very fresh
Draught at the brewpub. Hazy golden with a small head. Weak, flowery aroma. Flowery flavour with a fine, late bitterness.
Draught at the brewpub. Hazy light amber. Flowery aroma, very nicely hopped. Rounded, flowery flavour with a nice bitterness.
Barnyard and horseblanket aroma. Dark amber color, cloudy, white head, good lace. Sweet, well hopped, full. Long lasting, bitter and a little dry finish.

Bottled: Malty, sweet, light grainy aroma,. Quite light aroma. Dark chestnut color, poor, light brown foamy head. Quickly diminishing. Light sweet, cardboard, some malt with roasty notes. Dry, metallic bitterness. Light bodied.

(Bottle 50 cl) Light brown, clear beer with a rather handsome and dense off-white head. Aroma of bread and roasted malt. Flavour of caramel and roasted malt with a rather dry, short bitterness. Actually this is rather unusual - I’d expected something sweeter. 300805

Bottle: Light amber coloured, off-white lacing head; cardboard, metal and some malts in the aroma; soapy, very shy malty taste, in the almost non existing aftertaste some metallic notes; empty mouthfeel, sticky texture, extremely bland.....The beer of torture!
Bottle Light roasted, honeyish, slightly herbal aroma. Dark chestnut low creamy head. Sweet malt body, with a weird flowery and herbal play on top. Lightbodied, sweet aftertaste.

a weird one i picked up at ambrosetti biermarkt in berlin. disturbing, swimming pool full of schoolkids aroma. rich amber colour, darker than other german lagers. tasted mainly of sugar - it is some kind of weird saxony regional specialty, maybe i just didn't get it

Keg at Marcus Brau, Berlin in 2016. Lightly hazy dark brown with an offwhite head. Aroma of toffee, lightly roasted malt and leafy hops. Mildly spicy flavour, with some cinnamon in amongst big grainy, malty flavours and dried fruit sweetness.
Tap in Brewpub. Dark brown color. Soft roasty caramelly yeasty flavor. Indifferent aroma. Cabbage in the aftertaste. Not really good.
Niceish dark beer. Doesn’t stand out for any reason though. Not super cleanly brewed either. Just okay. Marcus brewery berlin
Gezapft im Brewpub. Dunkles Braun, wenig Schaum, Aroma: Röstaromen, Kaffee, Karamell, Malz. Geschmack: Süßlich, Malz, etwas Karamell. Wenig Bitter, dünn.

On tap at the brewpub. A hazy dark brown beer with a mid-sized most good lasting beige head. Aroma of soft roasted malt, caramel, spices, some metallic hops. Taste of caramelish mild sweet dark malt, bread, nuts, okay.
Mild röstiger Antrunk. Dunkle, eher wässrige Noten, geringe Bitterkeit. Trocken, monoton, dennoch gut. 9/10/9/10//10
Tab at Brewpub - Dark beer with a small head. Taste is coffee, syrup, dark malts. Carbonation is quite high. Sweet finish. Okay.
5 ltr tappetårn på Marcus-Brau. Farge mørk brun uklar med offwhite skum. Lukt malt, hvetemalt. Smak rund fin maltsmak, hvetemalt, litt banan. Fin dunkel
From tap at the brewpub. Clear brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, caramel, fruit, hops and ester.
Clear brown body, light brown head. Aroma has much berries over malt. Sweet and buttery, some nuts in taste. Dull and grainy aftertaste.

Rather a curious ale. Very deep mahogany colour. Extremely pungent whisky malt aroma and flavour. A bit harsh. Quite interesting but lacks the sufficient balancing bite to make this a really satisfying beer. Cask (gravity), Battersea beer Festival.

[Cask ale at Charlie's Bar, Copenhagen] Very dark brown, almost black, with a small but creamy off-white head. The flavour is rather dry and mild with lots of malty notes. The carbonation is low. It is a bit like a watered down version of Guiness.

It’s unclear golden with a creamy, white head. The aroma has fairly mild notes of yeast, fruit and wheat. The sweet flavor is fairly mild too, and overall a bit too sweet even for a weisse. The notes are the same as the aroma. The finish is sliiiihgtly spicy.

Bottle (purchasased at the brasserie): Golden, hazy, huge creamy white head, visible carbonation; yeasty and orangey-zesty nose; moderate sweet-bitter and sourish flavour; sweetish-fruity and yeasty finish with an increasing acidity towards the end and a faint illusion of a Gueuze (?). Refreshing.......

Bottle, thanks pivnizub. Light spicy green orangepeel aroma. Pale cloudy yellow, big head. Fairly dry citric notes. Light body, mellow mouthfeel. Quick lemony finish. A good quencher in the summer no doubt, but feels a bit too much like it is for the kids to me.

(bottle) Hazy, golden colour with a big and stable foamy white head. Sweet and moderately yeasty wheat-malty nose with strong notes of banana and soft clovy spice in the background. Slightly sweet and sour flavour, light to medium bodied, fresh mouthfeel, just a bit fizzy on the tongue. Moderately wheaty and citrus-fruity taste with banana; yeasty and sourish fruity finish with traces of cloves. Nice and refreshing Weizen.

It’s mahogany red and the head is creamy. The aroma has notes of caramel, roasted malt, a touch of nuts and fruit. The flavor has a medium sweetness and notes of caramel, roasted malt, fruit and nuts, and the finish is dry.

Säuerlicher Antrunk mit nur leichtem Malzeinschlag, der von der gleichzeitig auftretenden Herbe in den Hintergrund gestellt wird. Im Mittelteil wirkt das Bier etwas unorientiert, es kommt kein klares Aromen zustande, stattdessen sind säuerliche, herbe und bedingt malzige Töne mal stärker und mal weniger stark präsent. Im Abgang sind die Aromen alle auf ein Minimum zurückgeschraubt und hinterlassen einen wässrigen Grundton. Extrem unspektakuläres Dunkles, das sich geschmacklich höchstens in einem Experimentier-Status befindet. Test vom 27.12.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 11,5,5,3,8,4 - 5,05

Bottle, thanks pivnizub. Beautifull red golden, off-white cappucino head. Roasted and unfortunately fairly diacetyl ladden aroma, which still is present in the mouth but hidden behind roasted, caramelly notes and some soy sauce. Ok hop balance, quick finish. Solid body, sparkly mouthfeel.

Bottle (purchased at the brasserie): Deep reddish-amber coloured, small, but quite stable off-white layer, caramel and a discreet (yeasty?) fruitiness in the nose, which is dominated by aromas of milk-coffeee; stronger sweetish flavour with a light acidity, light bodied and a bit sticky; short sweet-malty, milk-coffeeish finish. Unusual, not very convincing...........

(bottle) Clear, mahogany colour with a mid-sized beige foamy head. Sweet and roast-malty nose with molasses, almost Bock-like with notes of caramel, cacao powder and a subtle fruity touch. Sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with a moderate carbonation. Moderately roasted malty taste with molasses, a soft touch of caramel and milk chocolate; slightly roasted malty, sweet-bitter finish that reminds me of sugar beet syrup. A tad too sweet Dunkel.
Caramelly brown sugar aroma. Sweet flavor, thinnish. Sugary with caramel. Just a bit buttery. Too sweet to make a real impression.

It’s dark golden with a creamy, white head. The aroma has notes of bread, flower, malt and light fruit. The flavor has a light sweetness and notes of bread, grain, flowers, light straw, and the finish is floral and slightly dry.

Getreidiger Antrunk wobei das Getreide, dass den Hauptteil einnimmt, nur kurz alleine ist und dann Gesellschaft von einem leich würzigen und honigartig süßlichem Ton bekommt. Deutlich hopfiger werdend, dieses Aroma zieht eine deutliche Bitterkeit mit sich, die aber durch eine grasig-süßliche Note abgemildert wird. Das Bier wird nun noch etwas würziger und verharrt einige Zeit auf diesem Punkt bevor der eher bitter geprägte Abgang beginnt, der sich im Nachgeschmack noch steigern kann. Angenehmes und nicht zu schwaches Helles! Test vom 27.12.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 5,11,10,11,7,10 - 9,65

Bottle 50cl. Clear medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good, mostly diminishing, white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, grain, toasted, sour malt, vinegar, sour apple, cardboard. Flavor is moderate sweet, light sour and some vinegar notes with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20081128]
Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Pours a clear yellow with a small, rough, white head. Subdued aroma - perhaps a wee whiff of malt. Medium body, malt and almost perfumy flower notes. 281108

50 cL bottle, courtesy of fonefan. Pours clear and golden yellow to orange with a diminished white head. Sweet malty aroma with a vague acidic note. Sweet initially in the flavour, slowly going from malty to light cornish and dry bitter into the finish.
Bottle, 4.8%. Clear yellow colour. Very small white head. Good malty flavour. Also has some paper, vegetable, and a little citrus. Good mouthfeel.
Bottled. A light golden beer with a thin off-white head. The aroma is sweet malty combined with notes of straw. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of straw, leading to a dry bitter finish.
Bottle, thanks Urhell. Sour straw nose. Golden, low head. Unclean straw malt base with some herbal hop play. Light body. Sticky mouthfeel.

Bottle (purchased at the Brauerei): Sweet-grainy nose backed by hops and buttery aromas (diacetyl?), clear, golden coloured with a smaller white foam; moderate bitter-sweet flavours, light to medium bodied; sweet-grainy finish with a bitter aftertaste. A decent "Bohemian Helles".......

(bottle) Clear, pale golden colour with a small foamy white head. Malty and slightly buttery nose with a lot of sugary, residual sweetness and light herbal hoppy notes. Sweet and slightly bitter flavour, light to medium bodied with a not perfectly matured, slightly fizzy carbonation. Malty, subtle fruity taste with a balancing herbal hoppy blend; sweet and slightly bitter and herbal finish. Unspectacular.
Very ordinary, run-of-the-mill German Pilsener. No aroma eveident. On the plus side, Oddbins sell it for £0.89 for a 500ml bottle, which is very cheap.
Had on tap a while ago. virtually no aroma. appeared a clear black with little grey head. leaves a bit to be desired the the palate, empty tasting.
give me a rolling rock black please! i love this stuff especially from rolling rock.(tap.)

Supposedly, this is a beer available in draft only. It is a dark lager that tastes similar to Regular Rolling Rock. It pours a rich brown color with a thick tan head that dissipates quickly. The aroma is only a hint of roasted malt. The taste is rather light, with a hint of malt sweetness and some roastiness on the finish. Hops are unnoticable, just like Regular Rolling Rock. The finish is fairly clean, with a touch of roastiness in the aftertaste.

Much like an attractive blond, it looked great but was kinda dull and empty. Had this one on tap, great creamy brown head that lasted a long time, with lacing, and a nice dark brown body. And then the flavor sucked. End of story.

Bottle 50cl. @home poured into a lager glass. Clear pale amber, tall frothy off-white head, good retention, fair lacing; aroma toasted malts, light caramel, grass; smooth taste, medium sweet and light bitter, malty, caramel, spicy notes; sweetbitter aftertaste; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation; nice clean Märzen.
Clear deep golden colour with a big foamy white head. Lot of maltiness, some sweetness, pencil, woody dryness and a hint of fruitiness.

courtesy of Philipp and Thomas - clear and bright golden beer with a modest head retention; herbal aroma with light metallic notes; a good malt backbone, a bit oily palate; decently bitter and quite long spicy aftertaste

Bright golden color with a lasting white thick head. Aroma is grainy and malty with some straw notes. Flavor is roughly sweet with a sticky bitterness at the end. Strong body with an average carbonation.

Bottled (from BierZwerg). Deep golden colour, not much head. Aroma is mild floral notes, some grains, a bit herbs and some strange sweet notes as well. Flavour is fruity, floral, some sweet malts, mild starch and grains as well as a slight bit of honeylike sweetness. Quite messy. Also it’s rare, but this one made a good effort on the reaction test when removing the cap...

Bottle 500ml (BZ, BB 04/2015) Clear deep golden color, small white head. Sweet malty, even a bit metallic aroma. Medium-bodied. Malty, light bitterness in the finish with some metallic notes. Quite dry malty festbier, usually these are sweetier and as such this is perhaps closer to Helles style. Despite of metallic notes, it is a clean beer to have with XMas food. For sessions a bit lame.

Pours clear amber with a small head. Sweet and malty aroma. Taste is sweet too with notes of malts, fruits and even some caramel. Finishes with a hint of bitterish hoppy notes. Soft co2. A good one for a Märzen -type of beer. (0,5l bottle, bb 21.04.15)
Überschäumende 0,5 l Flasche BB 21.04.2015 golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, bread, hay, cereal, herbs, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, soft carbonation,
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel-goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig würzig, Geschmack angenehm malzig würzig mit ganz minimaler Bitterkeit.
Mild herber Beginn mit ebenso milden Malznoten. Brotig-trocken, weich, unspektakulär. Herb-würziger Schluss. Trinkbares Bier, das man schnell wieder vergessen hat. 10/8/9/8/8/8
Golden. Aroma is herbal, a little chalky, dried grass. Taste is light caramel with herbal tart hops. Tart and quite drinkable. Good.
Bottle. Clear brown color with white head. Aroma is chocolate, herbal, nicely rustic. Taste is chocolate, a bit herbal, a touch soy. Oily mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Quite nice!
Crystal clear brown, very pretty. Grainy sweet nose. Vegetal and sweet, a bit strange with some V8 character (parsnip or celery?). Massive caramel, not too bitter.
Bottle. Clear brown, creamy tan head. Meaty toast nose. `medium body, chewy, light berry and honey toast, Marmorkuchen, good balance, fruit cake finish. Solid, not exiting though.
Bottled, thanks oh6gdx! Clear nut brown. Raisiny nose with some caramel. Sweet with full body and oily, dense mouthfeel. Raisiny with dark bread and notes of treacle. Warming finish.

Bottled (from BierZwerg). Very deep ambery brown colour, small slightly off-white head. Aroma is sweet malts, mild ripe fruits, some toffee and mild sugary notes. Flavour is rather similar, but has a quite strong alcoholic sweetness to it. Quite nice, although the alcohol is a bit disturbing if taking bigger sips of it. As for a "small slow sipper" this is a good doppelbock though.

Bottle 500ml (from BZ) Clear deep ruby color, small off-white head. Bready, caramalt, some raisins in the aroma. Medium-bodied. Caramalt, raisins, alcohol and light earthy notes in the flavor. Robust and quite sweet and as such not a kind of doppelbock I’d love.
Pours a very dark brown with a moderate head. Nose is fairly malty, which previews a somewhat fruity taste.

Bottle. Amber, small and fully diminishing head. Moderate to full, malty and sweetish aroma, caramel and light bread, light dark fruits and alcohol. Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, some caramel and light bread with faint dark fruits, light alcohol. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish, some caramel and faint bread, some alcohol. Sweetish doppelbock with caramel. 7,8% makes the finish bit drier. Finish has too much alcohol considering the body.

500ml Flasche. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmmalzig, schokoladig, fruchtig. Geschmack röstmalzig süß mit leichter Fruchtigkeit, leicht schokoladig.

500ml bottle. Clear, orange, pale golden colour with small to average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Cautious, mellow malty aroma with cautious grainy and straw touch. Taste is minimally sweet malty, slightly bitter and minimally fruity hoppy, hints of yellow apple, a touch of pound cake.

An einem Currywurststand in Gerolzhofen, im Krug serviert. - In der Nase herb-fruchtiger, leicht säuerlicher Hopfen. - Antrunk zart hellmalzig-süßlich mit mild herber, pilstypisch schlanker Hopfung: etwas Gras, ein wenig Zitrone. Schlank, durchschnittlich rezent, an der Grenze zum Dünnen. Leicht trockener Abgang mit nicht besonders kräftiger aber runder Herbe. - Zart hellmalziges, mild aber aromatisch gehopftes Pilsner: anfangs sehr einnehmend, wirkt es zum Ende hin doch etwas anspruchslos.
Bottle. Pale golden, low white head.Grassy hop nose, Medium body, slightly sweet malt background, grassy noble hop finish. Decent.
Clear yellow, white foam head. This beer has all the right stuff to be a nice pilsener, typical in aroma and taste, just a fine beer. (Velp 201609)

Ein absolut "pilsiges" Pils klassischer Natur, das zu erfreuen weiß. Hopfen und Bitterkeit stehen hier klar im Spiel, doch werden sie dezent eingesetzt, so dass eine wunderbare Griffigkeit (selbst im Nachklang) entstehet. Was ein süffiges und erfrischendes Pilsner ! Überraschend gut.

Bottle shared with MichaelAwesome. Pours clear golden with airy white head. Clear aroma of malt and yeast, with mild hoppy touches. Bitter, hoppy flavour with notes of yeast and some malty touches. Bitter aftertaste with estery notes. Mild but not that bad.
Tap @ Würzburg markt @ Lebensfreunde aus der Region. Pours a bright yellow with a good, white head. Aroma is very grassy, somewhat grainy. Taste is grass, grain. A very good pils.

Bottle shared at the 2015 edition of the chriso Pre-GBBF tasting - London. Cheers! Pours clear, very pale yellow with a slight, foamy white head. The nose holds cereal and dry paper. Sweet and simple, with dry pale bread, light bitter hay. Light bodied with average carbonation. Finishes with notes of dried cereal, more simple bread, faint lemon rind. Just OK.

Bottle at Chris and Ruth’s Shindig 2015. Clear pale golden beer with a nice lasting off white head. Malty caramel aroma, grassy, bready, some grainy notes. Malty papery flavor, grassy, hay, floral notes, some grassy hops. Ok beer.

Bottled, from Biershop Bayern. Clear pale golden, small head. Mild grassy hop aroma. Mid dry with light-medium body and soft mouthfeel. Creamy, bready malt, mild but distinct grassy hops. Balanced bitter finish. Exceptionally moreish and relaxed toned down pilsener.

500ml bottle. Hazy, yellow-ish, pale golden colour with small to average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Wheaty, slightly fruity and minimally spicy yeasty aroma, hints of dried banana, a lemon dash. Taste is slightly dry, wheaty, fruity, subtle sweetness, diluted hints of banana, dried banana, some lemon, a touch of orange; light, minimally watery. Quite refreshing, some Belgian Wit resemblance.
Pleasant fruity flavor. Small foam, little carbonation.The color is almost like a pilsner. Taste is very fruity too ( citrus, banana,leaves). Aftertaste is sweet and a little bit herbs. Average beer.

500 ml bottle. Pours a very veiled light orange pale yellow with a short lived white head. Aroma is cloves, unripe fruit, clementine, banana. Flavor is fruits (clementine, apricot, pineapple, banana). Finish is pepper, spice, some herbs (lightly so). Lingering fruit. Light to medium body, sticky mouthfeel and average carbonation.

Bottled, from Biershop Bayern. Cloudy straw colour, rich creamy head. Phenolic nose with banana and bandaid. Mid dry with light-medium body and soft, somewhat spritzy mouthfeel. Mild cushiony doughy malt, ripe banana and notes of herbal spices. Low bitterness. A harmonious well made hefeweizen.
Hazy yellow color beer with a white head that slowly disappears. Banana and citric aroma notes. Sweek flavor with a crispy finish.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig, würzig. Geschmack hefig fruchtig, reife Bananen, leicht würzig.

500ml bottle picked up at the brewery. Pours a cloudy, yellow-gold colored body with an inch thick, dense and foamy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a good amount of lacing. Aroma is lightly sweetened wheat malts, banana, a light clove note, and a bit of a sour lemon note. Flavor is similar. A touch sour up front before a lightly sweetened wheat malt backing comes in. A bit grainy towards the end with a good amount of banana and a light clove spice. Finishes pretty clean with no real bitterness before leaving a medium length aftertaste. Light body and a fairly active carbonation. Overall, a decent hefe. A touch sour initially, but not overly distracting. Nothing special, but not bad.
Hazy light brown color with a frothy white head. Aroma of ripe banana and yeast. Sweet banana flavor with some sourness.
bottle from Bierzwerg. Cloudy pale yellow, large white head, quite foamy with bibbles. Wheaty and yeasty with a shy fruitiness in the background.Medium to high carbonation.

500 ml bottle. From bierzwerg.de. Hazy yellow brown colour with average to big white head. Wheat, yeast, tart citrus, lemon and clove in aroma. Flavour is yeast, wheat, mild banana, mild citrus, some tartness and clove. Quite fizzy. Some sweetness in aftertaste. Banana and caramel. I like this one.

Bottle (purchasaed at the brewery): Pale golden, quickly collapsing white loose head; pale-malty nose with a very distinctive grassy hoppy touch; very light bodied - that is understood -, light to moderate dryish bitter-sweet flavour; dusty, lingering bitter-sweet finish. A quite tasty and well crafted Low Alcohol.......

(bottle) Clear, pale golden colour with a loose foamy white head, quickly diminishing. A bit dusty, light sweet and sour doughy malty nose with shy herbal hops in the background. Faint bitter flavour, watery texture, crispy mouthfeel. Slim malty base with notes of sour dough; dry and slim finish with a noticeable herbal, slightly grassy and metallic hops character. Not that bad for a light beer, but definitely no highlight (23.05.08).

500ml bottle. Clear, orangey golden to pale amber colour with small, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Sweet-ish, minimally biscuity, malty aroma, a touch of caramel and dried banana. Taste is sweet caramel malty, a touch of toffee, speculoos, a fruity touch of dried banana.

Clear golden coloured beer with a medium-sized, quite short-lasting head. Quite pilsener-like, hay, dust, malt, caramel, grassy hops, honey. Taste is sweet malty and hoppy with a bit of cardboard in finish. Light to medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Solid.

Bottled, from Biershop Bayern. Clear deep golden, mid sized head. Fruity nose with hay-like hops. Mid sweet with voluptious body and soft mouthfeel. Bready and fruity, with hay and Earl Grey tea, perhaps some saccharine. Long but mild bitterness. Very harmonious. Uncomplicated but really good.

Very golden with a fast disappearing head. The aroma is hoppy and fruity like a Bock. It starts sweet, malty, hoppy, very grassy and again sweet like caramel and bread. There is a dominating taste of hops and herbals. Medium and oily body. Soft carbonation. Sweet finish. Drinkable, but due to that unusual herbal note not my favourite.
Golden colored pour with a decent sized head. Malty aroma with a nice sweet caramely flavor.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig würzig, Geschmack angenehm malzig würzig mit ganz minimaler Bitterkeit.

Bottle. Golden, no head. Light to moderate, malty - lightly grainy and sweetish, light caramel and light bread, faint hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and sweetish flavor, light caramel and faint hoppyness. Finish is average, malty - lightly grainy and lightly sweetish, light caramel and light bread with faint hoppyness. Sweetish märzen with no head - that’s it.

Bottled (from bierzwerg.de). Golden colour, not much head. Aroma is sweet malts, some mild grass and some slight herbal notes as well. Flavour is wooden, big time sweet malts, some herbs and mild notes of caramel. Wellbalanced.

Bottle 500ml. Clear medium yellow colour with a average to large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, fully to mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, hay, grain, toasted, light vegetables. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration, sweet malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110819]
Botella,. Clear golden colour, white head. Flavour has some fruity like hops with malt. Good mouthfeel. Flavour is fruity hoppish with malt, light to medium bitterness.

500ml bottle. Clear, yellow-ish, very pale golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Artificial lemon aroma, hints of artificial sweetener, minimally strawy, malty and hoppy background. Taste is sweet and tart, hints of lemon juice, artificial sweetener; dry aspartam finish.
Pours a clear golden color. Lemony, shy hops in the background, quite beery and not too sweet.
Cask Handpump at the Dog Inn, Over Peover 27/07/2003 Golden coloured and slightly bitter on the palate. Nutty malt finish.
Cask Conditioned at a Wetherspoons. Orange brown beer with bubbly head. Malty, fruity though thin beer, dry tobacco ash finish.
Sampled cask conditioned at Akkurat, Stockholm, Sweden. Amber coloured. Vague flowery aroma. Fruity and rather sweet with nice, fresh, chewy maltiness. Ashy with mild, fruity finish.

First tasted this in the Hogshead, Paisley in May 2000. Clear pale mahogany in colour with a thin creamy white head. Malty in the nose with sweet raisin fruit present. Thin but creamy mouthfeel and good lacing throughout. Pale malt gives a moist maltloaf base with syrupy raisins, sultanas, dates and maple syrup full in the mouth. Slight prickle of dusty hop resins gives a brief metallic aftertaste. Finish is robust and malty with slight rum and chocolate notes coming through. An excellent ESB and one of my favourites from the extensive portfolio.

Cask at various locations over the last 20-odd years... One of Oak’s original beers and very much out of step with their newer, more bitter, products. Dark amber with medium white head. Rich fruity aroma with flowery hop overtones. Full malt taste with the sweetness just winning out over the bitterness in the finish. Excellent beer.
Cask (Head of Steam, London) Big bitter. Sweet malts, fleshy fruits, aromatic hops. Decent finish. I didn’t mind the sweetness at all.
Cask Handpump at the Helter Skelter, Frodsham 25/05/2001 A dry and hoppy premium bitter. Sweet on the palate in the finish.

A rich, sweet bitter beer. Intense flavours of hops and toffee malt and a rich fruity (apricots/peaches) and quite bitter finish. Might be a bit sweet for some people. (Cask in Queen’s Arms, Manchester)

Copper colour. Rather faint fresh hop aroma with hints of yeast and vinous undertones. The flavour is quite winey and woody with some dry green hops, falling away in the middle, but the hops return strongly on the finish, which is bittersweet. Overall, a bit soft and sweetish, but comes off somehow. Cask (handpump), Head of Steam, Euston, London.

Rare Breeds Fest. Dark amber premium bitter. Wow! This is absolutely gorgeous. Not as sharply hopped as other Pheonix beers, this is a malt and hop moment of pure pleasure and balance. Flavours and aromas and bouquets swarm all over the place - lilly, honeysuckle, strawberry, melon, rhubarb and custard, cedar wood, etc, finishing with a gentle hint of chocolate. Smooth and silky. Absolutely awesome - thank god this was in good condition!

Sampled cask conditioned at Oliver Twist, Stockholm, Sweden. Amber coloured. Grapefruity hop aroma. Sweet and rather malty. Domintaed by it's citrusy fruitiness. The mouthfeel is sharpish and thus the bitterness becomes unbalanced and harsh.
Cask Handpump at the Friar Penketh, Warrington (JDW) 16/02/2003 Amber golden coloured with some sour fruit flavour. Lasting malt finish.
A good standard bitter. This has toffee/caramel sweet malts allied to a hoppy, dry finish. Well balanced and quite complex - this is recommended.

(on tap at Brauhaus Lemke) Pours a hazy, lightly amber body with little, white head. Limited nose with malty hits. Hits the palate with a medium-bodied flavour, thin texture and soft carbonation. Sweet flavours with a distinct bitterness from the hops. Not a bad beer.
Draught. Red ( obviously) with a short lasting head. Fruity aroma, autumn berries. Quite sweet taste with a smooth sweet aftertaste.

Draught at the brewpub. Clear red, average head. Roasty and lightly flowery . Medium dry with some soapy hops. Rather straghtforward, but with a surprising touch of ash (in a positive way) in a finish with medium bitterness. A brewpub amber may not be breaking news in the US, but in Germany it’s quite unique.
(On tap @ Lemke) Aroma of fruity malts and hops. Clear amber-red coloured with an off-white, lasting head. Taste is sweet, slightly bitter. Fruity and hoppy. Nice brew.
Pine aroma. Red color, white creamy head, fair lace. Light sweet, fruity, nice hops, well balanced. Long lasting finish. Nice surprise after all the Helles and Schwarz in Berlin.
Draught. Murky brown with a cream head. Aroma is musky malt. Flavour is not very schwarz, toasted nuts and roasted, a little smoke but lacks the burn.
Draft at the brewpub. Black beer with off-white head. Sourish pumpernickel aroma with light roast and low bitterness. It’s OK, but a bit light in the ass.

Biggish offwhite head. Hazy deep dark red body. Fruity roasty oily aroma. Dry-sweetish watery fruity roasty taste with faint vinegary notes. Soft mild mouthfeel. Dry roasty peppery aftertaste. Quite nice. (0.1l taster at brewpub.)
On draught at the brewpub, Berlin 2004: Dark color, red tones, little, fast diminshing, head, leaving laces. Mocca Nose also malt nose. Smoked taste, with a caramel candy finish.
Light roasted aroma. Black, light brown creamy head, very beautiful lace. Smooth, light roasted, light sweet, medium body. Long lasting finish with a nice sweetness and coffee.
Roasted, coffee and barnyard aroma. Cloudy, brown color, brown head, good lace. Very roasted coffee flavor, bitter but maltsweet, full. Long lasting coffee finish. But 1 litre was too much.

Draught at the brewpub. Quite malty aroma, sweet and syrupy with a hint of cream. Clear very dark brown colour, red shine. Big stable light brown head. The flavour is syrupy and caramelly with some spicy hops. Creamy aftertaste.

The Dunkel Bock is basically a supped up version of this breweries dunkel, quite malty with less diacetyl it seems, and the hop balance leans more towards the malt than even the dunkel does. It is a bit darker more towards a brown, with notes of deep red.

The aroma is barnyard, roasted and caramel. Dark brown color, light brown head, good lace. Too sweet, tastes like a stronger version of their dunkel and nothing more, caramel, light roasted malts. Long, sweet finish.
Süßlicher, dann schokoladig malziger Beginn. Leicht röstig, spritzig, würzig. Süßlich bleibend leicht steigende Malzigkeit. Mittellanger, malzig bitterer Nachgeschmack. 10/10/10/9//10

2L growler DØE Randers. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Dark amber colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. moderate bitter nice chocolate flaor. Average moderate bitter finish. oily palate.
Draught. Cloudy reddish brown with a large tan head. Aroma is heavy caramel. Flavour is orange caramel, medium roast chocolate with a nutty roast dry finish.

Draught @ Gasthaus Spreewälder, Dorfstraße 53, Schlepzig, Brandenburg, Germany 15910. Unclear matt medium to dark amber colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, nutty, caramel, licorice notes. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, chocolate malt, nutty. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110919]
Draught at the brewpub. Muddy brown colour. Stable tan head. The flavour is mostly malty, but also slightly roasted.

The dunkel seems to use the same yeast (a standard house yeast which is taken from the Radeberger Brewery) as the pils. The first time I was there it was a dark red color, which was a brilliant garnet when held up to a candle. Again, it also displayed a malty sweetness with a bit of diacetyl, but without the assertive hop bitterness of the pils. At other times it can be not quite as clear but the flavor is much the same if not just a bit sharper.
Light caramel aroma. Brown, little hazy, white almost creamy head, good lace. Sweet, caramel, roasted malts, medium body. Hint of coffee in the finish.

Draft pour at the brewery. Pours black with a tan foam head. Spicy roasted malt aroma. Flavor is a nice blend of spice, roasted coffee, and some dark chocolate. Very light in body, which was a bit unexpected. Coffee comes back late and lingers. Not bad.

"Thin in body, but with a very nice and pronounced roasted and chocolate aroma and flavor. Not much different than a standard porter, just done a little better. If the body was more robust I’d have been really impressed."

Date: September 12, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: clear dark brown with amber edges, fine beige head, drippy lace Aroma: sweet dark chocolate aroma, caramel sweetness, touch of roasted Body: body is a little watery Flavor: rich malt flavor, dark chocolate, caramel sweetness, light roasted Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 4/10; Overall: 9/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Drinkability: 6/10 Score: ** /4

Aroma of coffee with an underlying light sweetness. Pours dark brown almost black with pretty much no head. The flavor is roasted malt, coffee, and light chocolate. I enjoyed this one, and my only complaint is that it might have been a little too watery. It did have a nice coffee flavor however.

Draft at the brewpub. Black, still, headless, laceless. Looks two days old sitting there in the glass. Not a great presentation, especially for a porter. Neutral--and I do mean neutral--nose. Watery light body. Stale licorice on the mid-palate, followed by a mild milk chocolate finish. Yawn.

On tap at Engine House #9 in Tacoma, WA--Poured a dingy dark brown with a small off-white head. Acidic, nutty, gnarley nose. Molasses, toffee, and bold coffee, but not to the degree it should have been. This beer is not super terrible. That should tell you right there what I thought of this brewery.
Draught @ Brew Pub Tacoma. Dark brown pour. Lots coffee and residual sweetness. Over done with the coffee in my opinion. Decent though.
on tap-pours a retaining tan head and black color. Aroma is dark malt-coffee/molasses, some sharpness/acidic. Taste is dark malt-coffee/molasses, some sharpness/acidic-hops. Mild carbonation.
Not as much aroma as you’d expect. Flavor is very strong of coffee. Roasted, but with a sweet finish. Too much coffee for me.

Enjoyed this one on draught at the brewpub in Tacoma, WA. Pours to a deep brown to black color, with a creamy, tan head, and a moderate carbonation. The nose on this beer is excellent, with lots of good dark chocolate, coffee, and roasty notes. The palate is firm, with good dark chocolate, and malty flavors, paired with just a touch of estery fruit, and a very nice coffee/roasty flavor. This beer finishes with more good dark chocolate, and coffee up front, then ends dry and roasty, with good roasty flavor that lingers. Excellent robust porter, with really good dry, roasty, coffee aromas, and flavors. I really enjoyed this one. It would make an excellent match with the pub grub, or deserts on the brewpub’s menu.
Lemony with earth and yeast. Crisp and refreshing. Medium to light bodied. Not bad.
Engine House No. 9, Tacoma. Pale yellow, creamy foam. Pale beer. Soft, but finishes with some spice. A bit malty-flabby. Not terrible at finish.

On tap at Engine House # 9 in Tacoma-USA. Pale gold semi-clear color, minimal lacing. Nose: yeast and bread, some spices. Mouth: frizzy carbo, session character, clean spicy thrill. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft pour pint at Beer Authority. Clear pale golden with an active fizz head. A ton of orange peel through. Intense aroma. Spice heavy aroma and flavor. Orange peel finish. Not bad, but really one sided.

On tap at Engine House No 9, pours a cloudy blonde with a small white head. Aroma brings out fuzzy wheaty notes. Flavour is soft, with lots of coriander upfront and pillowy wheat in back. Solid stuff for what it is.

Keg at the brewpub ’Tickoma’ with Fergus, 07/11/14. Hazed pale golden with moderate off white edgeing. Nose is floral, citric rinds, lemon, clove, sweet notes. Taste comprises honeysuckle, vanilla, floral notes, light spice, citric rinds, straw. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. Ok for style.
Draft - Sweet wheat grains and some citrus. Hazy yellow gold with a decent white head. Lots of coriander, light orange and sweet wheat. Perfume and citrus dominate, sweet and easy drinking.
"Very reminiscent of a Great White. Very citrus/tangerine forward wit. Very light on the spices but they’re there. Light in color and body with a clean, dry finish."
Pours hazy banana, white head Smell sweet gum, banana, clove, sugar Taste light, spicy, gum and sweet fruity Light body Nice
Draft at the source. Served with a lemon, not a good sign. Lightly spiced. Pretty plain.
A bottle 0.33L tasted at One Pint Pub. Pale beige head. Brown reddish colour. Slightly metallic nose. Malty taste. Mild hoppiness.

330ml bottle (One Pint, Helsinki, Oktoberfest 2008)
Amazingly grainy sweet aroma - just like an LA. Sweet body, but also thin. Taste very simple, seems to have several degrees of fermentation still pending. Not a schwarz, just a lager made dark. The late finish is reasonably hoppy, but you need to wait for the sweet malts to subside before you get that. Disappointing. The label being in English should have been a warning sign.
light body, watery, dark (Coulor malt), no roasted malt aroma and no pleasent bitterness

There is nothing much to say about this one, it is very typical of this style and more so of the NW style. Black and dense, with a dark tan head. Nose is roasted and full of coffee, flavor matches the nose, with hints of chocolate, cherries and just a hint ever so slightly of oatmeal and coconut.
Black, creamy tan head.Nice roasted nose. Good roasted taste throughout,hints of chocolate
Almost black. Chocolatey, slightly coffeeish aroma. Soft palate. Hints of chocolate and coffee. Mild. Nitro.

The best party was the creamy head, agreed. Not too much else going on. Could have been a lot more full bodied and richer for this style of stout. It almost seems like they're going for a dry stout taste. Interesting brewpub, I'll have to go back.

Great big creamy head on this one (...I hope that doesn't sound like the opening line to some graphic novel...) after sampling the wonderful Roasted Porter I was stoked to try this, but was a bit disappointed. The Oatmeal stout was rather thin with hints of coffee and some bitter hops, but alltogether not a robust beer by any means, especially for being an Oatmeal Stout. I congratulated myself for having not purchased a full pint of this and continued drinking the Porter.
12 oz glass at brewpub. Only a 5.3 abv- really?? LOL Sharp bourbon and vanilla flavors. Well aged, authentic. Would not buy a case of this- but a wonderful tasting beer. They got this right.

On nitro tap at the brewpub in Media, PA. Pours with a red-brown body that has good clarity and highlights. Creamy tan head and a full coat of sticky lacing. Lots of bourbon an BBL flavor, partially masking the underlying porter (consumed immediate before the special version). Very good bitter-sweet balance. No sour or other off notes. Compared to the original, this i slightly more sweet, has some vanilla notes, and there is less smoke in the finish and aftertaste. Medium body and soft carbonation. Much smoother than the original.

Nitro at NWIH. Color unknown but dense nitro head. Nose is vanilla and alcohol, and malt sweetness. Flavor is very abrupt and strong. Sweet with hints of Bourbon and cocoa with alcohol burn. Flavor is all back if the tongue here.
Is a nice brew with a good bourbon aroma. Taste is a strong bourbon with a bit if vanilla and coconut. Not really my thing, but i can appreciate what they wanted.

pours dark brown with a medium tan head. aroma has notable bourbon but not boozy at all...some woody smoke and caramel. flavor has vanilla and lots of bourbon but again...not boozy...mild roast and woody notes. mouthfeel is light and creamy with a bourbon/woody/earthy finish. somewhat odd but interesting...lots of elements that ever so slightly clash but not so aggressively as to be offputting.
On draft at Media Iron Hill. Dark brown pour with thin kahki head. Aroma is coffee, cocoa and vanilla. Flavor of cocoa, coffee, and light bourbon

On tap at the Iron Hill Barrel event in Maple Shade. Aroma is dark coffee, slight cocoa and a strong vanilla presence. Pours black with a large beige head. Tastes big and roasty with plenty of chocolate, cherry and malts. Has a sweet lingering roast that is perfect. Strong. Brought home a growler.

Nitro draft at Phoenixville. Pours black with thick creamy nitro head. Nose is huge milk chocolate. First sip is malty sweetness with bourbonn, oakk and dark chocolate. Finish is sweet with hints of vanilla.

Draft at 2012 Barrels Bugs & Bourbon event. Poured a thinner looking dark brown center with lighter orange/brown edges and a foamy small beige head. Aroma is great with chocolate pudding skins, bourbon, vanilla, toast. Thinner body with average to stronger carbonation with a medium dose of heat. Flavor isn’t as good as the aroma with strong alcohol notes at first, followed by chocolate and bourbon. Okay but flavor doesn’t hold up to the aroma.

Draft. Dark brown in color with a small tan head. Bourbon dominates the aroma, with vanilla, oak, roast, and chocolate behind it. The flavor is also extremely bourbony. Oak and vanilla are secondary, and after that chocolatey and roasty porter flavors. Medium-bodied and boozy despite the ABV, or maybe that’s just the bourbon flavor confusing me. Sorry guys, there’s just too much bourbon in this one. I’d like to see the base beer shine through more. Good flavors in it still though.
Pours a jet black with a foamy tan head. Aroma is chocolate, roast, and earth. Flavor is sweet chocolate, caramel, toffee, roast, and earth. Good carbonation. Very good.

One of the best dang RimpyStouts I've ever had. Silky and rich, with tons of chocolate, a bit of coffee, star anise, vanilla, and umami--just what you want in the style. Draft at the source (Hershey), and so good I took a 4-pack to go. What a wonderful surprise.

Poured from bottle thanks Tim Golden oily black with a rich tan head. Aroma is roasted malt chocolate coffee light vanilla notes. Taste is creamy balanced notes of brownie batter chocolate coffee caramel. Very nice.

Nose - dark, high end bitter chocolate and a hint of dark roast coffee. Appearance - poured from a corked bottle into a Guinness pint glass; heavy cloud of a head; prominent Black and Tan look. Nice lacing, too. Taste - no booze taste at 9.5%, which illustrates the craft in this award winning brew. Phenomenal roasted malts that mingle coffee and chocolate flavors. Best stout ever! Spoiled to have it my backyard of Media, PA. Palate - thick like a chocolate milkshake!

Can from the Maple Shade brewpub. Pours opaque dark brown with large spongy tan head, faint mocha aroma with a hint of alcohol, medium carbonation, bitter mocha taste, alcohol undertones, smooth body. long finish. Potent and tasty.

Sampled from a 750 ml corked brown bottle this beer poured a black color with faint orange highlights and an enormous foamy brown head that lingered and left excellent lacing. The aroma was dryish and woody with anise, a hint of cocoa and floral hops. The flavor was dry, bitter and roasty with notes of wood, cola, floral hops, anise and a touch of smoke. Long finish. Medium body but noticeably thin for the style. Decent but disappointing for a style I tend to love.

Draft. Disappointing. Aroma and initial flavors are solid coffee and dark malt, but these quickly disintegrate into distinct disparate sugary and bitter elements. It’s almost as if this brew was stirred together and the components hadn’t had enough time to adequately mix. It’s akin to sugar coated ginseng candy - you can taste the sugar and the bitter root at the same time. Too sugary overall.
on tap at Maple Shade - super dark in color. Slight coffee aroma and flavor. Very good.
roasted malts, chocolate and coffee aromas. pitch black in color with decent head. full body, strong roasted malts, coffee, chocolate flavors, finishes smooth

16oz can via trade extra. Pours a black with a small tan head. Aroma of chocolate milkshake and some coffee. Taste is malt bitter, low hop presence. Flavors of chocolate candy bar (AZ style sweet/dry stout), light coffee. Good and thick like my black dildo. Alcohol kept in check. This beer is pretty good.
On tap at the brewery. Amber and clear with an off-white head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, sweet malts, earthy hops and light smoke. Similar flavor, sweet with minimal bitterness and an average body.

Pour on tap at the brewery, dark red pour with thin white head, aroma brought notes of caramel, toffee, hints of dark fruit and a slight burnt quality with some nice rich almost smoky notes. Taste is a nice mix of spicy and caramel notes, hint of biscuit, some dark fruit and a slight roasted note, finishing fairly smooth. Interesting for sure.

Clear dark burnt amber with a thin spotty head. Aroma not unlike a winter warmer. Dark malts, sweet nutmeg, and some sort of raisin-like dark fruitiness in the nose. Flavor is dark malty sweet with just a touch of peat smokiness, a light touch of chocolate, faint notes of winter-warmer mulling spice, with a smooth dark malt/peat finish and whispers of dark fruity tones.
Tap @ brewpub. Deep red, almost brown appearance with a light head. Sweet amber malty nose. Somewhat bitter amber malty Scottish ale. Pretty smooth and drinkable but not all that exciting.
amber color, not much carbnation. Malty aroma. Flavor is very sweet, took me by surprise. Lots of peaty flavors and a hint of roastiness. A good beer, but a little too sweet to dink a lot of.
On Tap at Bull & Bush Pub & Brewery, Glendale 14/09/2010 Malt aroma. Amber coloured strong in alcohol a little sweet on the palate and malty. A hint of earthiness and bitterness in the finish.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear mahogany colored body with a thin, creamy, tannish head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is muted with some flowery malts and fruits. Some earthy peat too, but not a whole lot going on. Flavor is better, but a bit jumbled. Caramel, toffee, smoke, earthy peat, and dark fruits before a semi-dry, smoky finish that lasts for a moderate duration. Light to medium body and smooth with a soft carbonation. Overall, not terrible, but somewhat thin and boring. Eh...

draft @ table 6 in denver. clear rust body with an off-white head. skunky peat and old/mold/fermented vegetables in the nose and up front. flabby body, disjointed carbonation. really a poor choice for a local draft to have on at probably my favorite denver restaurant right now.

Fairly light for the style, but straightforward and satisfying nonetheless - quite earthy and peaty, with light hints of smoke, very reminiscent of scotch, which shouldn’t surprise me, considering the staggering array of single malts available at the brewpub - outside of this, there is not much going on in this beer, but what is going on is pretty good - would I like more complexity? - yes - but I would order this again.

On tap at Wynkoop poured a clear amber with a lingering ring of ivory foam. Aromas of peat smoke, carmel, toffee, light fruittiness and light brown sugar. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of peat smoke, carmel, brown sugar and fruittiness with a smooth lingering peaty finish.

column1: Bull & Bush Tank Town Brown Ale
column5: Pours deep brown with a tan head. Rich malty body with a slight booze edge. Roasty woody aroma. Notes: on tap at the pub from old Denver visit

column1: Bull & Bush Tank Town Brown Ale
column5: At Bull & Bush with Stephen. Pours brown ruby red. Aroma is pungent figs, big malt, cardboard. Taste is card lard, big nice sweet figs, burnt sugar.

column1: Bull & Bush Tank Town Brown Ale
column5: (From old 2010 notes.) This has a really fine, off-white/light brown, soapy head with a dark brown colored body. It’s pretty solid and deep. The aroma... whoah... like whiskey/bourbon, alcohol, wood, and sweetness. Man, it has a great aroma. Wow. It smells too good to drink. Especially since the flavor isn’t as good as the aroma lets on. It has some sort of a cherry/liquor finish with an alcohol and roasted malt flavor hitting you plainly in the face. Overall, although it’s a great beer, my advice: just inhale this beer and leave your taste buds out of it.

column1: Bull & Bush Tank Town Brown Ale
column5: Apparently this was a 2010 vintage aged in a 23 year Pappy Van Winkle barrel, too bad its not bottled, the geeks would have a field day. Dark brown color and served in a goblet. Smells like bourbon but not overdone, very nice. Flavor was bourbon, wood, delicious brown ale, vanilla, good stuff. Serving type: on-tap Reviewed on: 06-01-2011 02:57:13

column1: Bull & Bush Tank Town Brown Ale
column5: Pour on tap at Avery Strong Ale, dark brownish/hazy pour with thin white head, aroma brought notes of bourbon, vanilla, oak and some slight caramel, hints of earth and spice notes but pretty one dimensional. Taste is pretty nice but not much to it, some bourbon, vanilla notes go into some oak and caramel notes, finishing fairly sweet.

column1: Bull & Bush Tank Town Brown Ale
column5: Tap @ Avery, doing the 10th Annual Boulder Strong Ale Festival. Pours dark brown with a offwhite head. Aroma of roasted malt, bourbon, oak, tartness. Taste is malts, caramel, bourbon, oak, molasses, coffee. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, slight alcoholic finish. 090312

column1: Bull & Bush Tank Town Brown Ale
column5: Boulder Strong Ale Fest. Hazy dark brown appearance wit ha brown head. Whiskey, light veggie, oaky, toasty malty aroma. Rich sweet caramel, whiskey, oaky flavor.

column1: Bull & Bush Tank Town Brown Ale
column5: sampler at Bull & Bush on 9/30/11. cloudy brown pour with a thin tan head. whiskey nose with dark fruits, oak and roasted malts. medium body with sweet malts and more whiskey. sweet warming finish with more dark fruit notes.

column1: Bull & Bush Tank Town Brown Ale
column5: Draft at the brewpub. Pours a very dark brown that’s almost black in the glass Completely opaque with very faint mahogany edges. Half finger beige head that quickly settles into thin ring. Not much in way of lacing. Sweet boozy aroma with lots of bourbon but only slight oak. Lots of bourbon and not much else. Medium bodied with a blast of bourbon heat and sweetness that lingers throughout over the sweeter malt notes into a dry hot finish with plenty of warmth in the chest. Underneath is slightly smokey with hints of caramel and toffee but this is overpowered by strong bourbon. Very one dimensional and too hot for me.

column1: Bull & Bush Tank Town Brown Ale
column5: Murky hazy chestnut brown, with an aroma of oak bourbon, or some similar liquor. Taste was pretty smooth bourbon booze, some brown & caramel malt, featuring a lingering booze warmth in the back of the flavor. Booze wasn’t too heavy overall, but it dominated the other flavors enough.

Deep and dark, murky amber with a frothy head (tightly packed bubbles). Creamy and smooth with a sharp finish. Bitter / alcohol flavors tag team, providing a sharp, bold finish. Sweet malts with a one-two hop-alcohol punch. Some fruity notes (pear, spiced apples). Some sourness and a little tartness. Has an element of smoke too. Some cloying cobwebs in the back of the throat.

column1: Bull & Bush Patios Vat Dunkel Weiss
column5: Tap@ Bull. Clear amber color with ivory head. Caramel, banana, spicy aromas. Medium bodied. Spicy caramel, clove, banana, toast flavors----not bad

column1: Bull & Bush Patios Vat Dunkel Weiss
column5: Draft. Pours a thin poorly retained ligh beige head, with minimal lacing, over a slightly hazy dark amber (SRM 15) body....nose is apple, clove, banana hints, wheat cereal, no hop tones....taste is apple, clove, hints of toffee/caramel sweetness, hints of banana, wheat, finishing soft with minimal hop bitterness....mouth feel, medium body, no astringency, mild acid on the finish. The banana/bubblegum tones are light as is the color. Would increase the dark roasted malts a bit, consider a higher fermentation temperature, and perhaps use a more estery yeast. BJCP 8/3/14/4/7

column1: Bull & Bush Patios Vat Dunkel Weiss
column5: Tap at Bull & Bush Denver. Aroma is banana and clove. Pours cloudy golden, like a wheat beer, with a thin white head and no lacing. Good smooth dunkel with the banana and clove coming through on the finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Bull & Bush Patios Vat Dunkel Weiss
column5: Aroma is fruity and nutty. Banana and nutty citrus and nutty maybe. Is hazy and tastes like a shandy beer. Is enjoyable and refreshing, but think berry or citrus shandy when drinking. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Bull & Bush Patios Vat Dunkel Weiss
column5: On tap at the brewery. Pour is hazy orange with a bright white head and good lacing. Big clove, banana, citrus, straw, biscuit, and grass in the aroma. Taste is big spice, banana, bubblegum, bread, grass, and coriander with a medium spicy finish. Medium mouthfeel with high carbonation. Definitely not a dunkelweizen and I agree with some of the other raters; this one is just a pretty well-crafted Hefe.

column1: Bull & Bush Patios Vat Dunkel Weiss
column5: Pour on tap at the brewery, hazy orange pour with thin white head, aroma had nice notes of biscuit and bread, phenolic pepper and banana notes with slight clove and coriander, hints of orange and lemon as well. Taste is fairly nice, with fruity esters of pear and peach, hints of orange as well going into some banana and clove notes, finishing fairly sweet. Not sure why they called this a dunkelweizen...this is pretty much a well made hefe.

column1: Bull & Bush Patios Vat Dunkel Weiss
column5: pours a cloudy reddish orange, with minimal grey head. Aroma of banana, clove, ash, burnt sugar. Medium bodied. Flavor has plenty of wheat character, with notes of roasted nuts, banana, bread. Not bad.

column1: Bull & Bush Patios Vat Dunkel Weiss
column5: Tap @ brewpub. Pretty light appearance for a dunkelweizen- it’s a slightly dark yellow/orange hazy appearance. Some clove and banana scents in a somewhat spicy wheat nose. Quite malty wheat flavor that again isn’t very dark as you would expect from a dunkelweizen. Somewhat spicy and almost mash-like flavor. Not all that good.

column1: Bull & Bush Patios Vat Dunkel Weiss
column5: seems more like a regular wheat vs an actual Dunkel, but the flavor is good. Very strong to the banana with just a touch of cloves. I like it.

column1: Bull & Bush Patios Vat Dunkel Weiss
column5: On tap at Bull and Bush Pub. Very hazy light orange, almost no head, and it dissipates quickly. But the aroma is very nice. I’m getting mostly orange citrus, with some cherry (?!) and a hint of wheat. Taste is more or less the same, just without the cherries. Lots of orange citrus, wheat, some grassy hops without much bitterness, and maybe a touch of caramel malt. Light-medium bodied. Easy to drink and kinda delicious. Just not different enough. But I can easily see myself drinking one for breakfast/brunch.

Tap, black body, skiff of tan foam, good lacing. Aroma is roasty black malt and faint metal. Taste is malt and caramel, cherries. Finish is very clean, slightly dry. Palate is smooth, not thick, carbonation very understated. A clean, dry, session porter. Classic.
Draft: Poured a pitch black with a tan color head. Aroma was roasted malt. Taste was similar with roasted malt and caramel, finished with a bitter dry bite.
On tap, brownish black pour. Roasted coffee with some chocolate. A weird bitterness at the end tastes acrid. Thin mouthfeel for a Porter.

Great Alaska Beer And Barleywine Fest 2011. dark brown color/ fleeting head. Mocha, medium roast malt aromas. medium bodied with soft co2. Dry chocolate, coffee, medium roast malt flavors--a bit thin.

Growler filled from the Brewery. Dark brown with a light brown head. Roasted malt aroma with chocolate and caramel. Mostly sweet taste with just a bit of bitterness. Medium body, with mild carbonation and a smooth mouth feel. One of my favorite Homer brews.
Smoky, mocha flavor with a good hops bite in the end. Rich body. Bonus point for the reused Sobe bottle.

22-Jan-08 (Draft: Duggan’s Waterfront Pub in Homer, AK) A dry, moderately roasty porter with minimal sweetness and a light hop presence. Mild, dark chocolate comes out more in the finish. The nose is only mildly aromatic and offers notes of chocolate and dark roast. Medium in body and carbonation level. Dark-brown body is opaque through the center. Small, tan head settles to a sprinkling of powder and thin ring. This is another relatively standard offering from Homer Brewing, a beer that seems about average for the style. Very drinkable and enjoyable, with no noticeable flaws, though more pronounced aromatics would help.
The Homer Brewing company is one of my favorite local breweries. Almost every single beer it produces is excellent. China Poot Porter is one of the best Porter’s available in the state.
had during a trip to alaska, just wrote down porter so i’m assuming it’s this one. smokey with fruit, very enjoyable.

Strong coffee/mocha in the aroma. Hell, even my sister noticed it. A nice dark brown color though needs some work on the head (like all the beers from this brewery). Warm, well-balanced mocha taste, with some nice floral hops in the finish. The best of the 5 beers available in ol’ Homer AK.

On tap at the 2003 Great Alaska Beer and Barley Wine Festival. Cloudy dark orange/brown with little head and a nose of smoked meat. Lots of malt with smokey sweetness balanced by hop bitterness. Interesting variation on a barley wine.

Poured a lightly hazy amber color with a small, off white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of toasted dough, nuts, citrus fruits, spices and earthy yeast. Taste of passion fruits, pine, toffee, citrus fruits, and more toasted dough.

tap at the brewpub. darkish light brown with a thin white head. smells of old carpet. smooth particle board malt flavor. easy hop finish that is earthy and light. just right finish. an excellent meal beer.
tap at brewery. copper/brown pour with thin rocky off white head. almost no aroma. soapy body. floral hops, hop oil, watery, thin malt. not so good.
An unclear orange beer with a disappearing head. The flavor is slightly malty while the flavor is malty with notes of oranges and yeast.
Draft at Mountain Sun. Pours light orange with a thin head. Aroma of perm solution, kind of like ammonia. Earthy hop flavor. Decent finish.

Draught. Body is light amber. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), moderately hoppy (grapefruit). Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Mild, sweet, clean aroma of herbal, haylike hops and light honey sweetness. Clear golden body with a fine bubbled, low, white head that recedes to partial cover. Sweet honey and somewhat grainy flavour with floral hops and berry-like fruitiness that lingers in the aftertaste. Light body with fair carbonation. Sampled on tap at the brewpub with ClarkVV, Olivier_MTL and Rastacouere.

Light golden, lasting white head. Refreshing and light beer, that offers hay and honey pils malts to match the floral and citrusy hops that may have more soapiness than they should. Surprisingly estery, mango and melon notes, yeast derived. Mellow tartness, light bodied, gentle carbonation.
Draft at Mountain Sun. Pours cloudy yellow with a medium white head. Flowery, honey aroma. Sweet tasting. Light honey and flower flavor. Refreshing.

Draught. Body is hazy light yellow. Aroma is moderately malty (grain), trace hops (herbs). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Going after the Coors Light crowd, are we?
Has that smooth, sweetness that's typical of Babe's brews but balances out the hoppiness very well. Plenty of grapefruit citrus in the finish.
Jaké asi může být točené ve vinárně? Naštěstí byla žízeň, takže to dolů celkem padalo, ale opakovaně bych nemusel.

On tap at Zamecka Konirna in Vrchlabi: The Lure: Yeasty cheese and wet barn emanations prove to the blind the unfiltered nature of this vycepni. A little mineral, subtle, but complex. The Festivities: Wet earth lingers on the back of the tongue, as hay and milky, cheesy personalities walk along in the front. Eminently quaffable, I found this unfiltered vycepni more flavorful than the filtered lezak, which goes to show the power of the filtration. This one reminded me somewhat of Cambridge’s sublime helles. Transcendence: That unicellular being has so many talents.
Pale golden color with lacing off-white head. Aroma has caramel, hay and malt. Taste is malty sweet with somewhat bitter aftertaste. Flavors of caramel, malt and hay.
Docela standardní ležák ochutnan v batallionu u draku v Hradci Králové.....
# 154 et # 1510; 12/2015 et 8/2019. Good czech pilsner but nothing special. Herbs, yeast, malt in taste, very crispy. 0,5 l, draft, pub, Pilsen (Czech republic).
PET from Cesky Brod-Liblice, CZ, Malt,cereal,biscuit and grassy aroma, Hazy golden, lasting head, Sweeter taste, fair bitter ending, Tasty brew.

Poured from a 500ml bottle, 4.9 % abv, kindly provided by djoeye. Spotty lacing from a two-finger thick white head. Hazed golden content. Pale malty nose, citric support. Moderate oily hops and bread to the taste profile. Slightly bitter sweet end. Just alright. (Shared with djoeye and Finn, PivotekaH7, Tromsø 30.06.2018).

Aroma; malt bread fruit. Look; off white head, misty golden body. Taste; malt bread grain syrup malt, and finishes maltfruity. Feel; okay body, soft, ok co2. Overall; okay beer. [bought@BaseCamp Pivni Galerie, brought to session w Finn,Rune&Aleš @PivotekaH7 30jn2018]
Uklar. Gyldengul. Høyt kritthvitt skum. OK lacing. Maltaroma. Smaken det samme. Blir tørr etter hvert. Behagelig øl.
2018 wonderful traditional Czech type lager, full taste, higher bitterness, very drinkable. . One of Best Czech beers.
Bottle. A classic Czech style ležák of rather superior quality. Nice look, medium ful body, thr right balance of hops and malts in taste.
Příjemný, osvěžující ležák s klasickými tóny tohoto pivního stylu- vyšší říz, plnější tělo, sladová chuť a jemná pěna. Pohoda pivo :)
Zajímavé pivo s hodně specifickou hutnou chutí. Po čtvrtém mi už ale přestalo chutnat a ráno z něj byl nepříjemný bolehlav.
Draught at Pivovarsky Klub in Prague. Served very cold. Clear dark rediish brown look, non-lasting creamy orange head. Fresh fruity scent. Medium bitterness. Lingering fruitiness in the aftertaste.

On tap at the brewpub: The Lure: Yeasty proclivities and fresh grapefruity hoppiness are aided by the bread and hay of the malts. Plantanes surge late, this promises to be quite interesting. The Festivities: A vivacious hay bite, citrus fruit liveliness and pear sweetness all team up for an unpretentious, uncomplex, but very well-made světlé. Transcendence: Bright sunshine helps me get on with the day every time.

(6/25/08) Draught at Pivni Galerie in Prague. Deep golden color with a small white head. Aroma has some butterscotch, some malt and a hint of hops. Sweetish flavor with some malt, butterscotch and some light bitterness in the finish. Light-bodied. Not very pleasant.

bottle, 6.5%. Being near the expiry date the ber spent the last days tucked away quietly in my fridge. Nevertheless, when I opened it there was a fountain of foam all over my room. The rest, which I managed to pour into my glass, was full of floaties. Fruity nose, fruity flavour. Not bad, but rather unusual. Malty, slightly dry and bitter in the finish with a hint of warming alcohol. I think I may have to re-rate this some time.

[i]Bottle (50 cl, says anv 6.5 % on the label) from Furseth, mange takk![/i]. Hazy deep golden with a medium fluffy white head. Tropical fruits (peaches, mango) dominate the aroma along with butterscotch and some floral hops. Medium bodied with soft carbonation, well balanced with a short bitter finish.
Bottled. A hazy orange beer with a thin off-white head. The aroma is sweet fruity combined with a dusty hoppy note. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of hay and straw, leading to a dry finish.
Clear yellow colour with a white head. Sweet fruity aroma with a light grassy note. Malty, grainy and fruity sweet flavor with a light dry and grassy finish.

Bottle: on the label it stands 6,5%: Clear yellow colour, with a werry thin head. Flavor has gas, hay grainy,and a dry hopy nose. Flavor has almost the same, but has a thin to medium fruity body.and a short fruitu/dry hopy finish.

Bottled. Golden coloured. Unclear. Off white fluffy head. Fruity and a bit too sweet aroma. Flavour has grassy and herbal notes, but is dominated by fruits. Is medium bodied. Quite dry. Has a mild bitterness in the end.
Bottled. Golden coloured. Apples in the aroma. Sweetish malty flavour with a fruity touch. Rather soft.

Bottle. Pivovarsky Klub, Praha Golden colour, fluffy head. Loads of butterscotch here, in both aroma and taste. I like diacetyl, but here not much else is sensed. Still, hops back it all up in the end, in the finish. Diacetyl bomb!

’05 bottle, at pivovarsky klub. deep golden with a fluffy head. aroma of honey and nutmeg. quite mellow with some alcohol showing, hints of plum and mulled wine. not awful but somehow when i think christmas beer i don’t think pale lager

column1: Krkonošský Medvěd Pivo s Příchutí Třešní
column5: Bottle beer shop galleries Prague. Drunk from bottle. Nice Morell cherry aroma taste sweet cherry decent hoppy bitters ok body. Tasty stuff.

column1: Krkonošský Medvěd Pivo s Příchutí Třešní
column5: Bottle thanks to Svans Hærge. Clear brown look with a huge frothing baige head. Cherry and candyflosh aroma. Flavor is....different. Very very soapy. Like a fruity soap resolved in water or a poisonious herb, giving it a super harsh bitterness mixed with a cherry mouth aroma.

column1: Krkonošský Medvěd Pivo s Příchutí Třešní
column5: On tap @ the brewpub. Pours hazy amber with a big creamy off-white head. Aroma of sour cherries.Taste is the same, watery sweet mouthfeel, candylike in an artificial way, not good.

column1: Krkonošský Medvěd Pivo s Příchutí Třešní
column5: Draught at the brewery. Brown with an off-white head. Aroma moderate malty (caramel, roasted, chocolate, some cherries) and hoppy. Flavor moderate sweet and bitter. Medium body, almost flat. Very fine.

column1: Krkonošský Medvěd Pivo s Příchutí Třešní
column5: Dark ruby color under a foamy beige head. Aroma of sour cherry and coffe. Taste of sour cherry, some bitterness, little watery texture. Not a complex one, but i think, it can develop...

column1: Krkonošský Medvěd Pivo s Příchutí Třešní
column5: (bottle) Slightly hazy, reddish amber colour with a medium-sized beige foamy head. Sweet and slightly acidic fruity nose of ripe dark cherries with a soft toasty malt-character and caramel in the background. Sweet and slightly bitter flavour, light bodied with a soft carbonation. Moderately cherry-fruity taste with dark and slightly toasted malt, accompanied with caramel the fruitiness is almost gone towards the malty and slightly bitter hoppy finish. Drinkable but the components do not really harmonize.

column1: Krkonošský Medvěd Pivo s Příchutí Třešní
column5: Bottle, pasteurised, 500ml. Red brown colour with tan head, short lived. I have to say that I am not a great lover of Fruit beers, but I have had enough of them now so that I thought I knew what to expect. The first signs are good, the aroma is sweet cherry, pure and simple, but the flavour! chemical, cough medicin, cherry pip with a chunk of roasted barley. Very sweet in places, not to my taste at all.

column1: Krkonošský Medvěd Pivo s Příchutí Třešní
column5: Bottle (purchased at PivniGalerie, Praha): Chestnut coloured, hazy, almost no head; fruity (cherries, almonds) nose; sweet, kind of artificial sweet, flavour; quite dry (!) bitter finish with some fuity notes in the aftertaste. The fruity taste doesn’t harmonize at all with the grassy hop-bitterness..............An odd brew !

column1: Krkonošský Medvěd Pivo s Příchutí Třešní
column5: On tap at the brewpub: The Lure: Soda pop with a dark beer base. Toffee candy with a commercial cranberry/cherry flavoring. Quite sweet of course, and sadly reminiscent of Cherry Coke. The Festivities: Artificial sweetness and potent fizz just cannot help the berries. Cherry jam for an industrial dessert. Transcendence: Those summer fruit sodas never work out that well, do they?
