Some spicey phenols and some citric character. Banana is still up front in the flavor. Phenolic and yeasty. A nice hit of bitterness. Some DMS. Doughy on the palate. It hit the spot this time.

Strong aroma with banana, clove, and lemony citrus. Dark, cloudy golden in color and a medium head. Very apparent wheat malt flavor, along with the spicy, estery yeast and pervasive citrus which carries through to the sharp finish. A by-the-numbers German Wheat, but doesn't really suffer for it. Very citrusy and served with an un-asked for slice of lemon. Why anyone would want it is beyond me, this one is very lemony as-is.

Bottle at the DC Spring RB Tasting. 2010 vintage. Thanks nimbleprop! Poured a really dark, virtually pitch black color with a small/medium sized tan head. Aroma was lots of rich malts, some age is found on this one, but not nearly as much as I would have expected for it being a 9 year old beer. Bakers chocolate, roasted malts, some dusty attic. Unadulterated. Chocolate. Roast. Super solid. Really good even 9 years later.

2010 big thanks to nimbleprop. Big roast and dry the way I like impy stouts. Black pour with good head and lacing. Dry finish with a lit caramel angle. Coffee. Dark chocolate. I really like this one. Bottle.
From a 750 ml bottle vintage 2010. Pours black with a tan head. Aromas are dark chocolate and old money. Flavors are bitter dark chocolate and sweet pit fruits.

2014 bottle #199/550. Not much pop on the cap and little carbonation on the pour. Flavor is good but the texture is thick and goopy without the carbonation. Light anise, some smoke, burnt chocolate flavors. On par with a flat Parabola.

From Sep 2006 Poured from 22oz bomber(2005) a very dark brown/ with a very large head of foam that shrank slowly leaving just a fine layer. The smell is hugely sweet..I note caramel and chocolate with a pretty big nose of alcohol. I know it's still summer but the aroma gave me visions of sitting in front of a fireplace with a few feet of snow outside....err... I digress. The taste is really big on roasted malt, coffee, caramel, and chocolate and is sweet as all heck right up to the finish where there's a bit of hop bitterness and some alcohol warmth. After a few sips, I noticed more bitterness from the chocolate and coffee flavours so the over all sweetness of this stout calmed down a bit and I was able to enjoy it more. Good and tasty stuff but I could not drink more than 1 of these at a time for sure. ;^) Bottom line: This is a very tasty RIS that one should try given the chance. My thanks to Nutbrown for this sample!!
Black, beige-brown head, aroma of chocolate, coffee, wood, roast, caramel, toffee, brandy, flavor of coffee, wood, roast, toffee, brandy, sourish, medium bodied.

Bottle thanks to Jim M. This was a hell of an extra. 2011 vintage. A: Pitch black with an extremely dark mocha head and legginess. N: Burnt brown sugar, licorice, smoke, toast, coffee and espresso, smoke, earth, lots of rich cocoa, marshmallow - even a bit of woodiness despite not being barrel aged. I could go on - but I kind of stopped rating it just to enjoy it.... T: Very sweet and substantially bitter and roasty. Very well balanced. M: Huge silky body, thick, creamy, very light alcohol presence, and soft carbonation. O: This is a tremendous treat. Unlike Vanilla Rye, it’s potent without breaking one’s will to drink. I really wish this was easier to get it, because it is fantastic.

Bottle sample at a tasting at our place. Thanks tom L. 2008 Bottle. Clear black-red. Cocoa, hints of cherry, then mild coconut aroma and ash. Bitter and ash in the mouth. Slightly carbonated, full-bodied, slightly smoky finish.

At a tasting, thanks, small brown creamy head, opaque black color, aroma of coffee, charred dark bread, chocolate cake and smoke and mud hints, flavor of coffee, chocolate cake and some dark chocolate that gets stronger and bitter, lightish sweetness, quite bitter for a IRS. Nice but not too exciting.

Bottle sample at a tasting at kerenmk’s place. Thanks Tom L. 2008 bottle. Black with a bit of brown foam. Aroma of roast, coffee, a bit of licorice, soy sauce, some oxidation, dark fruits, smoky note. Slightly oxidized flavor, sweetish, with roast, coffee, a bit of cocoa, sherry note, some dark fruits, salty hint, and a bitterish finish. Full-bodied. Very good and complex. Possibly a bit over-aged, but it aged pretty nicely.

1.5 L bottle, courtesy of Bov. Pours dark brown with a golden orange glare and a small tan head. Aroma is roasted and breadish. Sweet breadish roasted flavoured with a light caramelish touch. Lingering roasted malt flavoured into the finish. Dry lasting dark malt impression.
Draught at Seeland Bräu. Roasted malt, melon and cork in the taste. Medium bodied. Low bitterness. Sweet malty. Beautiful lacework. Nicely balanced and easy drinkable. Pleasant finish.

[i](Shared w/ tbone_ & oh6gdx)[/i] Dark opaque brown, disappearing beige head. Nose is grainy seeds, some syrupy malts and slight coffee. Flavor has roasted malts, mildly sour, dry and grainy. Not much hops. Medium bodied, coarse carbonation. This one has probably gone bad.

Hand bottled, plastic bottle 1 ltr Dark hazy nut brown color, small off-white head. Slightly toasted, sourish aroma with underlying diacetyl. Sourish beer with caramellish notes, light toasted notes in the finish. Not really feel infected, but certainly not a beer to have 4.0 average (as it was here).

Bottled (from draught?) (Thanks Bov). Deep murky rubyish colour. Aroma is mild roasted and acidic coffee along with some sour wooden notes. Flavour is quite sour and acidic fruits and coffee along with some strange sweetness.

[2002-09-15, 8-5-8-4-15] Dark amber colour. Pleasant aroma of malt and roasted malt, very light aroma of coffee. Mostly characterized by the roasted malt, some more burnt malt and the related bitterness. Good final, as usual. Very interesting and quite original, I would call it 'Cappuccino lager'. [2002-01-16, 7-5-7-4-14] Dark amber lager. Malt aroma, light but nice. Delicate texture, malt taste, rather sweet for a lager. Good final, stronger than the usual dunkels.

Beautiful dark brown and bright colour, few foam. Complex and dense aroma of malt, yeast, chocolate and hazelnut. The flavour does not quite live up to its aroma and is quite sweet and light. The finish is very long and sweety. An original and very pleasant beer.
Dark brown colour with few foam. Subtle and great aroma of herbs, cream and caramel. Deeply balanced with a long buttery finish. Excellent !
very dark brown colour, few head, nice lace, malt and caramel aroma, notes of prune with a touch of alcohol, very sweet, slightly oily, long malty caramel finish
Bottle 50cl, a cloudy golden beer with huge head, nose on wheat light lemon fruit notes. Aroma on sweet malt, wheat, sour background, finish is erratic, just correct.
Dorée avec très légère mousse. Nez malté paille. Gout malté doux, paille, pâte avec un coté fruité acidulé. Corps moyen. Fin sur le malté doux fruité. . Sans plus pour le style.

Bottle 0.5l from Brauerei Knoblach,taste at home. 30.07.2019. Pour it hazy yellow color with medium white head. Aroma light banana and clove. Taste smooth easy drinkable, light banana, wheat, cereal, easy drinkable, smooth finish, full body, nice.

10.04.2019 -- 0.5l bottle in a bavarian beer set, 6.49€/6pack, bb 28.06.2019. pours a murky pale orange with a big head. aroma of cloves, some banana. flavour of bread, slight banana, not too sweet and not too sour, not watery either. balanced, quite drinkable.

500 ml bottle. Cloudy muddy pale orange, foamy head. Clove, light banana, citrus notes, estery notes. Mild dry fruity sourness. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture, lively carbonated, pleasant dry finish. Good.
Good Weizen. Opaque yellow-amber with a white head. Fruity aroma, mainly banana. Taste is a fine blend of grain/wheat, some fruit, even a very gentle, distant bitterness. Very drinkable.

Bottle. Gushing! Hazy pale gold, thick, creamy but not extremely stable, white head, some lacing. Aroma initially definitely ripe bananas, later much more cloves, biscuits. Taste dry, smooth, slightly sour, a little mealy. Carbonation medium to low, tingling at the beginning.. Bitterness low, fitting. Aftertaste bananas, cloves, mealy, slightly spicy. Very nice. A classic Weizen.
Zajebista pszenica, mocno bananowa, mało goździka, pite w barze i więcej nie pamiętam.

resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, cereal, hay, bread, caramel, pale, golden, amber, orange, red, light sweetness, medium sweetness, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, very bitter, lightly sour, medium sourness, heavily sour,
Tap @ Knoblach. Pours muddy Golden with a white head. Aroma of Spice, wheaty, slight caramel, banana. Taste is sweet, yeast - banana, wheat, malty, Spice.

330 ml shared aluminum vintage bottle picturing Claude Dornied. Best before date not visible, but obvoiusly long gone given the rusty cap. It was kindly provided by Vidar. Misty nut brown body with a big bubbled tan colored rim. Dried fig and dates and overripe tangerines on the nose. Sweet with heavy notes of dried fruit. Full bodied and hard to swallow.

Flaske (best før???) delt med Asle Bjørn juni-13: rar flaske, aroma av overmodne julefrukter som fiken og dadler, med en sherryaktig karakter. Hva er en "strong pale lager/mperial pils"?. Ganske stor maltsødme. Det var godt til å begynne med (...). Lurer virkelig på hvordan en fersk utgave av denne smaker - I’ll keep my eyes open. Trenger en kraft-ipa etter dette.
Aluminium bottle from a German airport. Dak gold, floral hops. On the sweet side. Unremarkable, unoffensive.
Bouteille d’aluminium, avec une belle étiquette. Bière blonde forte malté, un malt liquor mais brassée avec des levures de basse température. ordinaire.

First aluminum bottle I ever had, thanks to a kindly Marine family in Boblingen, Germany. Pours yellow with a slight head and the flavor is a mixture of hops and straw. Not particularly inspiring, but a valiant effort nontheless. Alcohol is very noticeable.

I had this beer many years ago at one time when I was only giving ratings to the beers but was too lazy and stupid to write down my thoughts. I will update this as soon as I get my hands on this beer again.

Comes in a wacko aluminium bottle. They obviously has spent much more money on the packaging than on ingredients or training for the brewers. The nose is full of alcohol and grain. Pours pale yellow with brief head. It is thin, unclean and fruity with cloying sweet finish.

My parents bought me this beer in Berlin in 'das Kaufhaus am westen' or something like that. Bonus points for the interesting bottle (my bottle has another picture) But i do not completely understand what aviation has to do with beer. Indeed just another strong, too alcoholic pilsener. Indeed a bit more sweet and fruity. Alcoholic palate.

Typical pilsener appearance, clear golden with rapidly disappearing head. Strong and sweet nose and flavour, obvious alcohol. Should be different from "Engel La Bière de la Grande Armée" and "Engel Frohe Weihnachten", but that's perhaps only by the label.

officialy it wasn't presented that way, it was made for a beerpub in Deventer. Being a staff member of a beer pub I was able to get hold of it, and in my opinion it was the best "springbok" i've tasted this year made by dutch breweries. It had a lovely clear and goldenbrown color,fruity nose, and a nice hopy aftertaste(their new brewmaster originated from la Trappe) likes bitterness in his beers.

On tap at Hotel Goldener Löwe, Kufstein, Austria Friday 16th August 2019 after a cycle ride (about 13miles) from our campsite at Walchsee. Pours orange/gold with a white head, soft carbonation, the usual wheaty characteristics are on display, its quite good, soft, a little ripe banana.

Honigfarben, trüb mit stattlicher Krone. Säuerlich-hefiger Geruch mit der sortentypischen Bananen-Nelken Kombination unterlegt von Weizenmalz. Recht milder Antrunk mit angenehm dosierter Kohlensäure. Geruch und Geschmack gleichen sich. Das Malz hat eine schöne staubige Note. Der Körper ist dicht und eher sämig, was die Süffigkeit leicht beeinträchtigt. Alles in Allem ein gutes und typisch oberbayerisches Weißbier.

5 August 2018. At Ammutson, Vienna. Cheers to Anke! Pours hazy ochre with a lasting, foamy, white head; some lacing. Aroma of banana, bread & butter, honey, flowers & hand soap even, clove, nutmeg, wheat. It tastes medium fruity sweet, hints of banana & bread, buttery too, and light spicy bitter, clove-like, with a wheaty sour back. Dryish, spicy & peppery hoppy finish, a bit yeasty & bready. Medium body, slick/creamy texture, fizzy carbonation. Nice one!

From tap at Ammutson, Vienna. Hazy, light orange with a white head. The aroma is very yeast with lots of spices, cloves, nutmeg, gingerbread, banana and pear. Medium body with a light to medium sweetness and a light bitterness. The flavor is medium malty and again yeasty - sweet biscuit, wheat, banana, orange, pear and less cloves than in the smell. Rather filling and full of flavor - maybe already a little bit overpowering. Aroma: 7 Appearance: 4 Taste: 6 Palate: 4 Overall: 11

A hazy dark yellow beer with a large white head. Harbal and clovy nose with low banana aroma. Medium sweet flavor with low bitterness and nice balance. High carbonation and good drinkability and mouthfeel. Quite nice and well balanced good weizen.

Light orange color, medium white head. Aroma banana, yeast. Hefe with most dominant banana taste, very high carbonation, light sweet. Finish is a bit weak, missing some citrus notes, but nevertheless very good.
Rating number 3500. Bottle from Maestral, Bol. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aromas and flavours of banana, wheat and cloves. A bit thin, yet quite refreshing and tasty.

500 ml bottle. Pours cloudy dark orange with foamy head. Banana aroma is dominant, some clove, vanilla, yeast. Mild taste. Almost no bitterness, a bit sweet and acidic. Creamy mouthfeel, lively carbonated. Finish a bit weak, but overall good Weißbier.

Bottle at Pivoteka. Murky ochre, huge thick white head, lasting. Aroma... Banana, caramel, light apple/glue. Full, light cloves. Nice, soft caramel and banana driven taste. Sweetish yet carbonated enough not to be cloying. Bit empty finish. Not world class but a very good weizen!
This beer got a pretty good balance between the Aroma and the bitterness. I’ve personally drank it many times already!

Flasche 0,33l: Helles Gold, dezente Trübung, mäßig stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; frische + leicht fruchtige Nase, dezente trockene Zitrusnoten, kräftig Malz, Getreide, eher trockene Hopfennoten, Hefearomen; frischer + leicht fruchtiger Körper, trockene Zitrusnoten, Hopfennoten, kräftig Malz, Getreide, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, recht trocken, leichte Hefearomen; angenehmer malzig-trockener Nachgang

Aroma; pale malts, pale caramel, modest hops. Look; offwhite head, pale golden near clear body. Taste; pale malts, caramel note, soft bread note, grass, pale fruit, and finishes mild and somewhat sweet. Feel; light body, ok co². Overall; just a helles, I think. [btl @im hauslicher Umgebung] 43539
Bottle at a tasting. Loads of corn, loads of sweetness, loads of vegetables. Nothing much more. Below average.
Donated by MisoW, many thanks. Gold n color with medium white head. Aroma of yeast, diacetyl. Malt, light hops. Taste, malt, diacetyl, light bitter hops.
Bottle at home tasting 04/2019. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma of malt, sugary. Taste is medium sweet, malty, caramel, sugary.
0,33 l Flasche. Goldenes, leicht trübes Bier. Riecht und schmeckt säuerlich, hefig, leicht muffig.
Mellow but quite drinkable. Grainy flavours, not overly intense, yet clearly distinct from a common Lager. Could enjoy a little more bitterness.
Pretty big dissapointment. After such a beautyful small bubbles foam came dms in the smell. Good that it was only a small bottle.

Draught at Brasserie 4:20, Roma. Pours cloudy yellow with a large, frothy white head, long retention. Medium grainy sweet malt, light mineral character, yeast notes and a dry finish. Medium-light body and medium carbonation.
Etwas dünn und zu getreidig für meinen Geschmack. Ausgewogen in der Perlung, angenehme Balance aus Hopfen und Malz, dazu überraschend erdieg Anklänge.
Helder geel bier met schuim. Smaak is licht zoet, niet echt bitter hoppig, met iets van graan en een klein beetje citrus. Standaard bier.

Flasche gekauft bei Bierlinie in Berlin. Sehr helles Gold-gelb, klar, viel Kohlensäure, wenig kleinporiger Schaum. Aroma: säuerlich, Zitrushopfen, klassisches Pilsaroma. Geschmack: würziger Antrunk, etwas Zitrus, Getreide, weniger bitter.
330 ml bottle. Bright golden, decent head. Floral, grainy, hoppy, metallic and citric aroma. Crispy bitterness. Light bodied, nicely carbonated. Bitter-metallic finish. Nice bavarian Pils.

Bottle @ Camping Piantelle, Lago de Garda. Pours pale yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, grain. Light sweetness, little hay. Flavor is sweet, malt, grainy, little sugar, hay. Medium body, average carbonation, sweet finish. 210717

0,33l Flasche. Gelb und klar, weisser fester Schaum. So muss ein Pils aussehen. In der Nase Honig und Getreide. Kräftig herber kerniger Antrunk. Schönes Pulsaroma. Echt klassisch. Langer bitterer grasiger Abgang . Gefällt mir.

Mild herberm sehr getreidiger Antrunk. Dabei überrascht die weitestgehend nicht vorhandene Bitterkeit, helles Malz, harmonisch. Der Hopfen ist nebensächlich, die Bitterkeit bleibt gering. Gut. 7/9/10/9/9/10

(bottle, 33cl) Clear, pale golden colour with a blond medium-sized foamy head. Slightly grainy malty nose with mildly herbal and slightly peppery hops. Moderately bitter and slightly sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with a medium carbonation. Initially slightly grainy and strawy malty taste with present herbal hops; bitter and mildly sweet malty finish with a slightly salty note. Tolerable Pils. 21.X.15
Bevuta alla spina in un pomeriggio torrido, aspettando ’ryche e theater, il suo lo ha fatto, nel senso che mi ha dissetato benvolentieri...

Bottle. Light golden, small to average and mostly diminishing head. Light to moderate malty - lightly grainy and dryish - lightly sweetish aroma, light - some herbal/grassy hoppyness, faint metal. Body is light to medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, light metal and herbal hoppyness. Finish is average, malty - lightly grainy and dryish, light - some metal and light herbal/grassy hoppyness. Dryish pils with sharp metal in the finish. Nice hoppy aroma though.
Klare goldgelbe Farbe, ordentliche weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch getreidig, hopfig, leicht würzig. Geschmack würzig malzig, grasig hopfig, ordentlich gehopft, gutes Pils!
Bottiglia Colore marrone scuro. Maltaroma con prugne Corposo. Sapore gustoso arrosto maltato. Dolce, buono. Gustosa doppelbock.

Bottled at Bar Central, Stockholm. Clear mahogany colour, mid sized head. Caramelly nose with some brown sugar. Sweet with medium-full body and rounded mouthfeel. Caramel and treacle. Long resinous bitter finish.
Bottle - clear brown color, white head. quite easy for a Doppelbock. malty, raosted malts. soem dark chocolate. medium sweetness. rather dry. nice.

“Maxlrainer Jubilator“, Flasche (50 cl) von Grabsch, Berlin-Lichterfelde. - Tiefdunkles Kastanienrotbraun, klar. - In der Nase fülliges, gediegenes dunkles Malz mit feinen Röstnoten, Kakao, mild zitrusfruchtigem Einschlag und milde holzige Herbe. - Antrunk massiv dunkelmalzig mit schwerer Malztiefe, Bitterschokolade, Kakao, aufgelockert durch verhalten zitrusfruchtige Hopfenherbe. Mild rezent, weich und sehr schwer, fast ölig. Im Abgang komplexe, sehr aromatische Hopfenherbe mit Noten von Mokka, trockenem Kakao, roter Frucht und Vanille. - Famoser, enorm malzschwerer und runder doch komplexer, tiefgründiger Doppelbock. Ganz große Klasse! Besser geht es kaum noch.

Bottle, 500 ml from Pivoteka. shared with JFK10000. Pours brown, medium off white head. Nutty, malty, some caramel, some chocolate, sweetish, some fruit. Light bitterness in finish. Smooth. Medium bodied. Surprisingly good.

Aroma of toffee, lots of caramel, some chocolate, lots of dried fruit. Clear deep amber to dark brown color with coppery hue, small off-white head with lacing. Medium sweet, caramel taste, toffee, some milk chocolate, nice bready finish. medium body, soft carbonation.

Dark ruby colored, medium creamy off white to beige head, nice lasting and lacing. Aroma is of malt, some caramel, bit of chocolate, lots of dried fruits, bready. Taste is medium+ sweet malt, caramel, dried fruits, bready, some chocolate, light+ bitterness, some alcohol and warmth, quite dry finish. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, creamy. (bottle, Pivoteka, Zagreb)
Tap @4:20 (Rome). Caramel clear pour, medium ivory foam. Nose is chocolate, caramel, honey candy. Mouth is charming caramel, roast, barley.
Njemački doppelbock sa 7.5% alk. Obožavam ove doppelbockove. Velika količina alkohola se toliko i ne osjeti. Izvrsno je izbalansirana piva punog okusa i lijepog mirisa.

Pivoteka. Clear dark brown/bronze. Lasting off white head. Chocolate, grainy, full light maltiness. Cocoa pops. Malty, cocoa lighr alcohol, caramel, dry grain. Lean, smooth, not too full. Ok, clean. Sweetish. Not bad. Ends dry. Not bad. Don’t like the finish, otherwise quite nice.
Złociste klarowne piwo z z niezłą pianą. Aromat słodowy, w smaku podobnie. Przeciętne piwo oktoberfest, typowe dla browarów bawarskich, które odchodzą od stylu wiedeńskiego. Alkohol 5,8%

Clear amber body with a tall, vanishing white head. Malty aroma with notes of honey, nuts, cereals. Taste is sweet with a strong boozy note that makes you feel the beer is stronger than it actually is. Long sweet finish. Medium body, soft carbonation, sticky texture.
18-10-18 // taster from a 500ml bottle at klingelbeutel Mainz. Clear golden, white head. Mild süffig malzig.

Bottle. Clear dark golden colour with a medium white head, nose is grassy, grainy and malty with slightly boozy hints, taste is quite sweet, aromatic malty and herbal/woody with a not overly dry finish.
A decent celebration beer with good herbal note and a good drinkibility. Maxlrainer always seems to be a slight bit off but always is decent. A generally good beer that does not overwhelm.
Cerveza refrescante,malta ligera a la nariz con algo de nueces,moderadamente carbonatada deja un ligero toque de malta con poco lupulo al paladar,para enfriar bien y tomar para refrescarse
Pours golden with medium head. Another decent but forgettable Bavarian Oktoberfest beer.

Dunkelgelbes Gold mit mächtig viel feinporigem Schaum. Komplexes Malzaroma heller und dunkler Malze. Durchaus vollmundiger Antrunk. Kernig würziger, ja herzhafter Malzgeschmack. Der kräftige Hopfen mit harzig-holzigem Einschlag klingt lange nach. Tolles Märzen!

0,5 l bottle. Best before 09. Jun 2013 golden, clear, frothy, white foam caramel, hay, cereal, leaves, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, sticky, slick feel, average carbonation,
Poured a yellow color with an off white head. Aroma was sweet. Flavor was sweet, really malty and some toffee and caramel notes.
Bottle. Clear golden color with off-white head. Aroma is sweet papery malts, sweet. Taste is the same. Very sweet and boring. Oily mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Meh.

Aroma; pale malt, grain, caramel, grass. Look; offwhite head, clear straw golden body. Taste; pale malt, grain, caramel, leaves, grass, and finishes in the pale malt department. Feel; ok body n co². Overall; not much party here. [btl @im hauslicher Umgebung] 43538

13.06.2018 -- 0.5l bottle from marktkauf, bb 16.06.2018. pours a clear golden with a frothy head. aroma of sweet malts, spices, booze. flavour of sweet malts, bread, and booze. it does have a touch of a strong lager, but is still drinkable. 03.02.2019 -- (bb 25.09.2019) phenolic touch in the aroma turns me down.

Flaske 500ml fra Schönefeldt Flyplass. Delt med Rune på rom 312 Elite Adlon Stockholm 17 Jan 18. Gylden. Lavt skum. Litt lacing. Karamellaroma. Smaken malt & krydder med hint av søte nøtter. Bra juleøl.

500ml bottle kindly shared by Finn. Clear amber body, slowly diminishing pearl white head leaving lacing rings down the glass. Distant grain and earthy malts on the nose. Modest taste profile of caramel malts, bread and hints of dried fruits. Mid-sweet malty end. Medium bodied. Accepted, rather anonymous. (Hotel room, Stockholm 17.01.2018).

Festbier? My godnesss. Not much fest in this one. Quite dull and boring stuff. Deep golden color with a fine white head. Moderate intensity in the aroma. Medium body and an average carbonation level. Tad sweet and a moderate bitterness. Malty and herbal/grassy flavor. [Bottle from Schönefeld Airport in Berlin, Germany] Brewery #1827
Bottle. Grainy, light caramel aroma. Amber, offwhite cream. Sweet malty base, Alfredo sauce, light apple. Spicy finish.
Couleur dorée, légère mousse. Nez malté, doux et legumes. Gout malté céréales assez rapide avec forte astringence, vieille pommes, bière 1er prix. Vraiment pas géniale toom oberkirch
Bottle. Blonde. Floral, soft soapy aroma and flavor. Soft malts, but fairly dry. Bready. Unexciting.
21-01-17 // 500ml bottle at home. Pours a deep golden, clear beer with a solid white head. Taste is sweet malty, some grains, bread, sweet caramel touches. Nothing special but ok.
From a Bottle.Pale gold in colour,no head,fruit and berry aroma,chemical sweetness that was too much for me.

Sometimes as a beer lover you have to make sacrifices and this was one of them. A very poor attempt at a fruit beer which thankfully seems to have been taken off the shelves at least in England.No doubt the brewer who produced this did it under duress from the Marketing and Finance people.I can think of no other reason.Personally I would rather resign than have my name associated with this apollogy for a beer.

Bottle: Light, golden color. There is basically no head to it, and what is there fizzes right away. There are currants in the aroma, but it also smells strongly of pine. Syrupy taste of currants, with something else there also. The other tastes completely mask what I'm sure is a completely non-descript lager. I like fruit beers, but this is a disaster. STAY AWAY! (So much for bringing something back from England that looked different: it was!)

Bottle. Gold colour, no head and moderate condition. At least they avoided the temptation to make it purple. Raspberry and blackcurrant mask any obvious beer aromas, save for a slightly lambic acidity. Saccharine sweet and harshly chemical in the mouth. Dry and sharp on the throat in the finish.

The incorrect spellings are as they appear on the bottle! This smells more musty than fruity, in fact it smells plain wrong. Looks like a flat lager. Flavours are syrupy and chemical. Sickly, nasty stuff - this is not a beer it is a terrible alcopop exercise. The finish clings to the roof of your mouth, a reminder of how bad this is. Please, drink a lambic!

330 ml bottle. Clear pale golden, foamy head. Straw, grass, metal, biscuit malts, hay. Hoppy metallic bitterness. Light bodied, oily texture, lively carbonated, dry bitter finish. A solid Pils, which could be also from the north of Germany.

Bottles picked up from REWE Getränkemarkt and consumed at home also at Gasthof zum Alten Wirt, Lagenbach, Sunday 7th April 2019 after a cycle ride. Pours pale gold with a large white head, clear as a bell. Clean tasting, crisp, light fruit, grassy, a little sweetness. Could be a little crisper and drier but pretty good nonetheless.
Clear golden with little white head. Aroma is herbs wheat grass slight musty basement moss slight alcoholic. Taste is bitter hops with sweet notes. Drinkable but a bit too bitter for me.
Bottle from Erzengel cons 2017-05-13 Göteborg AR: bready, bread syrupy AP: pale yellow, thin white head F: lemon, hard bread, dry grass,
*Many thanks to Martin for this bottle! Smooth fresh beginning. Floral hops with a dry fresh body with hints of grain. Smooth bitter dry grainy aftertaste, nice and solid Pils.
Mild hopfiger Beginn, weich herb. Zwar etwas trocken, durch die leicht grasige Hopfennote wird dies aber ausgebessert. Süffig, minimal metallern im Hintergrund. Okay. 8/8/9/7/5/8

33cl bottle. Pours clear pale golden colour with a huge good lasting white head. Aroma of pale malt, grains and greenish hops. taste of mild grassy hops, pale malt, straw, nothing special but good drinkability.
33cl bottle. Pale colour. Average head.grass aroma.Spices and grass flavour. Dry finish.
Clear golden with medium white head. Aroma is malt, straw, hop and grass. Flavour is malt, grass, hop, straw and a little bitter.
Bottle: Drank after a day trip to Salzburg, disappointed as this comes from "Hallertauland", plain, thin, weak... Food Pairing: Teewurst.

Bottle picked up from REWE, Zolling, consumed at home Attenkirchen, Bavaria, Sunday 14th April 2019 whilst listening to Low - Ones & Sixes and cooking a big Mexican meal from the Thomasina Miers book. Pours light gold with a white head, excellent clarity. A little bitter bite, dry, really quite dry, ok it's a touch thin but just a little bit, a little metallic edge. Good.

Many thanks to Koelschtrinker for this bottle. Smooth mild beginning. Watery with grainy sweetish parts. The bitterness is not too deep, refreshing watery with a bit sweetish grain in the aftertaste. Weak, even for the style.
Heller, wässrig herber Antrunk. Geringe Bitterkeit, kein Hopfen, hell malzige Beinoten. Monoton aber frisch und süffig. 9/8/7/7/8/7
50cl bottle. Pours clear pale golden colour with a mid-sized most good lasting white head. Aroma of pale malt, mild grassy hops, watery. Taste of mild grainy pale malt, mild hops, watery palate.

Bottle 500ml. [ As Schlossbrauerei Au Auer Leichtes ]. Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, pale malt, wheat, light moderate yeasty. Flavor is light moderate sweet with a average duration, pale malt, thin. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20160422]
Bottle @ Århus tasting. Pours pale yellow almost water. Aroma of grain, light pear, musty like malts notes, excraft. Taste is rather sweet, thin, borring.
Bottle. NIce head with good duration. Color is hazy pale yellow. Aroma and taste are yeast, wheat malt, fruits and has a watery finish.

Bottle. Frothy white good mostly lasting head. Pale yellow colour. Light malty and hoppy and yeasty aroma. Very week fruity esters. Light bitter flavor. Very week fruity esters. Short light bitter finish. watery palate.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty and light fruity. Flavor is medium sweet. Sweet finish. Watery. 220416
Pours a very light golden color. The flavour is clean, has some grassy hop flavour, a bit rough.

Ecco, invece questa è una birra onesta, una buona helles anche abbastanza gradevole in bocca; sono lieto che il mio pronostico pilsesco non abbia avuto la realizzazione prevista. Ora posso pure mettermi a studiare Epicuro.

33cl bottle; Clear, pale golden colour with a mid-sized foamy white head. Sweet malty and grainy nose with a touch of sour dough and grassy hops. Sweet-bitter flavour, light to medium bodied with a moderate carbonation. Pale malty and slightly doughy taste with herbal and slightly grassy hops. Quite dry and slightly perfumed malty and herbal hoppy finish. Decent Export. 29.VII.09
The bottle looks good, the beer in the glass also. Starts fine hoppy, flowery and fresh. Modest spicy with a very light sourishness. Very drinkable and good beer!

Bottle (clear-glass, excavated by suspicious Quach-Duck!): Clear, golden, white - slightly lacy - white head; swet grainy-malty nose with a shy hoppy background; moderate bitter-sweet flavour, light to medium bodied, soft MF; slightly lingering sweet hoppy and pale-malty finish. Tastes far better than it smells.........
(bottle) pours a clear pale golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of pale malts with light spicy floral hops. flavour is mostly just sweet grain. medium body and carbonation.

clear-glass bottle (suspicious!), bought in Wolnzach. Shy beery aroma, very very pale yellow colour and a small white head. light-bodied, not to say watery, shy malt and hop flavours. I think this is not the best from this otherwise reliable brewery...

Clear glass bottle Hazy pale yellow, foamy lacing white head. Ok bitter Hallertau aroma at first, then a skunk comes sneaking in. Gunpowdrey malt, skunky hops. Light body - what was the purpose of putting it in a clear bottle again? Oh yes to resemble the golden pale lagers in theese bottles from other breweries - very smart move.
Trocken bitter-hefiger Antrunk. Wässrig getreidig, bitter bleibend. Leicht bananig, kurzer Nachhall. 9/7/8/6/7/6
0,5 l bottle BB 15. Jul 13 dough, bread, cereal, citrus, banana, golden, cloudy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, creamy, slick feel, average carbonation,
It’s unclear golden with a huge, creamy head. Both aroma and the sweet flavor has notes of yeast, fruit and wheat, and the finish is spicy. A very nice leichte Weisse.

Thanks Erzengel for the bottle! Pours a cloudy dull pale yellow with a large white head. Smells very mild a hint of wheat. Taste is a bit of clove and wheat though it is very watery. Slightly bitter aftertaste. Active carbonation that is somewhat course. The body is light and watery. This beer doesn’t have much going on for it except that it is only 3.3%ABV - but that isn’t enough.

Vielen Dank an Eike für dieses Bier. Schön hefetrüb im Glas, Geruch leicht wässrig. Der Antrunk ist wässrig mit recht viel CO². Dabei kaum Aromen wahrnehmbar. Im Hauptteil ist eine leichte, in Ansätzen erkennbare Hefenote auszumachen, die in der omnipräsenten Mineralwassernote leider (komplett) untergeht. Der Nachgeschmack ist typisch Mineralwasser, schön feinperlig, angenehm mild und absolut neutral. Ganz in Ansätzen ist nach einiger Zeit auf der Zunge noch ein letzter herber Nachklang auszumachen, der aber auch durch die Kohlensäure hervorgerufen worden sein könnte. --> Als Bier: Grausam! Als Mineralwasser mit Bier-Aroma: Super! Das Ganze hat 12° Stammwürze und nur 3,3% Alkohol - da hat man ein tolles Weizen unter Garantie mit 1/3 Mineralwasser aufgegossen... sowas gehört verboten!!! [tastes like mineralwater with a hint of Weizen... the water is dominating the aftertaste completely, there is nearly no body and nearyl no weizen-aroma! Disgusting!!!]

(bottle) Cloudy, pale golden colour with a blond, firm and tall foamy head. Yeasty, wheaty and fruity aroma with notes of citrus and banana, accompanied by clovy spices. Slightly sour and bitter-tart flavour, light bodied with a sparkling carbonation. Slim malty and sourish wheaty taste with fruity notes of citrus and a tinge of banana; slightly sour-fruity and bitter-tart finish with notes of cloves and traces of herbal hops detectable. A decent and refreshing Weizen light. 01.V.12
Bottle. Clear golden, medium head. Malty nose. Quite a bit of bitterness, very little fruit, somewhat metallic flavours. Light body. The unsuccessful little brother.

(bottle) pours a hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of wheat and grass, peaches, straw and light banana. flavour is mostly wheat, with a hint of caramel, summer fruits and a slightly tart finish. light-bodied with fizzy carbonation.

Bottle Slightly papery wheat malt aroma, a bit spice. Hazy straw gold, big rocky white head. Neutral wheaty flavor, a hint cloves, a bit marzipan - refreshing. Lightbodied, but still has a reasonably full mouthfeel. Quite lightfooted beer, bit actually nice comming back from a run.
Hm. Tastes like Holsten with lemon juice and sugar poured into it, which is precisely as bad as you’d think.

The third fruit beer from this brewery that I had the misfortune to try.Just as bad as the other two-like them it has nothing going for it.Only suitable for under age drinkers on a saturday night somewere very boring.
Lemon pledge aroma. Watery mouthfeel. Bit to sweet. Not much in the way of beer flavour. Not unenjoyable but would not make a repeat purchase.

Color is a light clear golden yellow, thin white loose head that fades fast to leave a thin ring and very tiny spotty lace. Smell is soapy musty lemon, straight up weird and not to pleasant. What lacks in smell makes up for it in the taste. Its a quick little surge of lemonade, not to sugary but pretty darn sweet, partially artificial like those lemon drop candies. Actually alot like that but much quicker. Thin creamy feel and lightly crisp and quick. Over way to soon, I need more. Don't know what to think of this one, a bit hard to finish even though it plays around with a refreshing quality thats a bit nice, but its just to strange for me to really like. This concoction may have been the brain child for the Malternative style lemonade drinks, who knows?

Aroma is very strong lemon smell almost over-powering. No head, clear in appearance. Carbonation bubbles. Flavour is very lemony. It doesn't seem like a beer taste, but more like a lemon drink with beer added. This is more a shandy than a beer.

Pale yellow w/ very little head retention. Light lemon, pepper, & skunk nose. Sugary, syrupy feel. Taste like sugar water flavoured w/ a lemon syrup (kind of has a Mr. Clean thing going on as well). Might be getting some hops in the finish, but I'm not sure.
once upon a time a skunk and a glass of lemonade got marriedand had this beautiful child

Maybe my opinion was affected by the fact that I drank a bottle after several hours of yard work on a Sunday afternoon, but I actually didn't think this beer was horrible. Yeah, it's a mediocre Euro-lager, slightly skunky due to the green bottle, mixed with some artifical tasting lemon flavour. But it was a lot less offensive than I expected, and did a nice job quenching my thirst. I won't be rushing back to the store for a case or anything, but as a fruity summer drink, it hit the spot better than any alcopop.

They can keep this beer back in Europe. Pale yellow with no head. Light skunky aroma with of course lemons and citrus, artificial at that. Sweet with a slight bitterness that hangs in the roof of your mouth and the back of your tounge. I belive I am starting to have an ill feeling, sugar water.

Pale yellow, with a light white head. The nose is lightly skunked with citrusy lemon notes and a light hint of ginger. Very sweet body, spritzy and citrusy with a light bitterness towards the end. Nice try. The LCBO making a mockery of beer variety.
bottle bb 5/6/18 chiara limpida buona schiuma media persistenza limonata piuttosto dolce
Sehr süßer Antrunk, Zitronenlimonade, dabei künstlich, dumpf, wie so oft ider der Süßstoff erkennbar, wenn auch weniger stark als sonst. Nie bierig, hell, süffig. Meh. 6/8/9/5/7/5
Clear straw color with white head. Aroma is classic artificial lemon with some powdered sugar. Taste starts really sweet and artificial. Quite bad.
Clear yellow with little white head. Aroma is clear buttered corn, honey, some light fruits. Sweetness, with a little sourness. Grainyness, medium carbonated. Could be better.
Bottle. Pale yellow, light offwhite lace. Oxidized, bad lemonade, poopy, super sweet sugar base, cardboard lemon finish.
Bottle. Clear yellow color with small white head. Aroma is citrus. Taste is bad lemonade. Medium carbonation. Meh.

Bottle shared by a group of men in Colin’s hotel room during the Bamberg Jolly of 2014. Pours clear, very VERY pale yellow - there’s almost no colour to it - with a supple, creamy white crown. Very sweet, with notes of ripe lemon and faint dough. Light bodied with average carbonation. Sweet finish with more ripe and sugary lemon, bready aspect. Pretty good balance for a radler. Fine overall.

Very pale and light yellow color with a sparkling white head. Aroma is very citric, matly and with an odd vegetable notes, maybe cardboard. Flavor is sweet with lemonade reminders. Body is average as well as the carbonation.

Bamberg jolly Day1 24/01/2014. Bottle shared in Colin’s room. Very pale yellow / green coloured pour with a thin white head. Aroma comprises of stale wheat malts and sweet lime cordial. Flavour is stalish oxidised wheat, sweet, and somewhat refreshing lime zest. Palate is pretty flabby and dull.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein hellgelbes Bier mit wenig Schaum. Geruch süß nach Limonade. Geschmack nach Limonade, Bier kann man bei diesem Radler nicht heraus schmecken.
Highly carbonated, with some malts and bitter hops. Ginger ale type beer. They suggest drinking with a lime, and that would add flavour.

Corn aroma, palest yellow, tiny white head. Stale malt flavour, very bitter bite in the after taste. Big bitterness happening here. This beer improved toward the end. I quite liked the label, two sombreros dancing about a cactus!

Very pale yellow, funky aroma maybe grassy. A lime might improve this one. Flavour is likewise a little bit off, but I think that's what they are aiming for so it is a bit of a tough call. If you you like Corona, you might like this.

Part of the appeal of Mexican lager is that it comes from Mexico. The taste does not factor into the equation. Take away the exotic, warm locale, take away the clear glass bottle, and what you have left is imitation piss. Very unpleasant stuff, this.

Medium grass like aroma light hop nose. Like they suggested on the label it is light gold in colour and this is what they were going for. Nice white head with small beads that didn't vanish in 30 seconds. Moderate carbonation. Yes it is quite "quaffable" Although I never had it with a lime it is a nice light lager. It is a bit bitter in the finish. It could do with a little less bitter then it would be more "quaffable" But overall I would say it is quite decent. Way better then any Corona could ever hope to be.

(22oz bottle) Medium-large brown head atop a brown-black body, nice lacing. Aroma is medium sweet, chocolate, some coffee, light smoke, melon, cherry. Taste is medium sweet, chocolate, smoke, light coffee. Watery medium body, hint of syrup, fairly drinkable.

Deep dark opaque brown/black body with hige frothing tan head. Light wine, smoked licorice, mild coffee aroma. Sweet chocolate flavor with a nice clean finish. Thinner than expected based on appearance and hearty aroma. Thanks Hopdog.

Bomber acquired in a trade from a BA. Label stamped brewed on date 4/15/04. Poured a dark black with a huge light brown head. Audible Pssst heard when I popped the cap off the bottle. Aromas and tastes of chocolate, licorice, vanilla, coffee and some roasted malts. Body was on the thinner side.

Poured a black color with a large tan head that left light lacing on the glass. Aroma of dust, chocolate, fudge, toffee, burnt wood, and vanilla beans. Taste of chocolate, roasted malt, and nuts with a dry finish. Thanks hopdog!

6 oz sample. Solid, inky black, very full-looking. Rather sweet, chocolaty nose, just a hint of roasty coffee and malt. Sweet and milk-chocolaty, no apparent hoppiness until the very finish, quite drinkable but I found it rather simple and dull overall; I expect more pizazz from a good porter, I guess.
6 oz sample a brewpub. Light smoke and carmel in nose. Good dark brown color. Chocolate coffee tasting with a little sour hops in the finish. Full bodied. Nice porter

From a growler filled at the brewpub: Dark brown with a slight ruby tinge to it. Small tan head, medium lacing. Aroma is roasty, smokey, some dark fruit, light caramel. Flavor is chocolate, roasted coffee, some hints of dark fruit, and a little hoppiness at the end. Very full mouthfeel.
6 OZ sample at the brewpub. Clear dark brown with a good head. Huge smokey malt aroma. Full mouthfeel, ends bitter, very robust. A slight sour fruitiness is in there too.

column1: Rock Bottom Des Moines English Cream Ale
column2: West Des Moines, Iowa, United States
column5: On tap at the San Diego brewpub. Yellow and clear in appearance with a big poofy white head. Great lacing. Very good wheaty malty flavor with a slick tongue slippery palate. Low carbonation. Smooth drinker with a tettnager hop finish. Pretty decent cream ale.

column1: Rock Bottom Des Moines English Cream Ale
column2: West Des Moines, Iowa, United States
column5: (Des Moines) Golden color with a small but dense off white head. Light malt and balanced hop aroma (rather dull). Sheets of lace on the glass. Creamy palate. Sweet malt and vanilla flavors. A slight of sourness, but otherwise a nice cream ale with a malty finish.
Clear golden color, light aroma, light flavor, but well balanced and easily drinkable, much better than true light beers.

Straw color with a small white head. Light hops and malt aroma. Quite smooth for a light beer. Nice hops flavor (Tettanger). One of the better "lights" I've had. This would be a great outdoor summer session.
on tap-disappearing white-hazy gold. A-lemon, banana, some spice, wheat. T-lemon, banana, spice-clove, wheat.

Draft at brewpub. Golden and cloudy on the pour with a thin white head. Nice banana on the nose. Definitely get more esters on the tongue which add a bubble gum to the proceedings. Finishes clean for a very good hefe.
Tap at dg’s. Light pour, cloudy, typical yeasty phenols in the nose, and very nice clove notes, easy drinking and smooth. A bit less intensely flavored than some of the best, but a solid hefe.

Murky soft yellow. Swirling the yeast sediment at the bottom of the bottle and pouring it made the murky swirls drop down into the glass, eventually dispersing and transforming this beer from a transparent yellow runofthemill beer beer into a cloudy, almost perfect looking hefeweizen. The smell was quite sweet, citrus everywhere, big lemons and grapefruits, punkcy. Taste is a little less exciting. A bit bland, smooth oranges and lemons, not as acidic as the aroma hinted.

Pours a hazy yellow with a small head. The aroma is awesome with tons of banana and orange. The flavor is messy, lightly minerally with a off kind of perfume-y bitterness, there is lots of banana and some booziness, just seems a bit sweet and unbalanced but it seems like it could be brilliant with some tweaking, who knows. I do love the way this beer smells.
TAP: mostly clear light gold pour, clove on the nose, banana/clove on taste - very good Hefeweizen.
Tried at the 4th Annual Festival of Iowa Beers. Good Hefe smells but low carbonation and generally weak/watery flavor.
Perfectly clear. Nice clove in the finish. More clove than banana. A bit garbagy. Good flavors but something is just slightly off.

Served with a lime, but other than that fairly solid. Pale gold slightly hazy. Clovey, citric aroma, flavor is similar. Clove rich lemony with some bubblegun sweetness. Fairly light overall but not bad.

On tap at the brewpub. The body was a hazy dark gold. The aroma was lots of banana with light clove and some vanilla. The taste had some subtle bananas and some light cloves. This was simple and solid.

Drank a pint of this yesterday on tap at the brewpub. Dark black with a light beige to white head. Excellent head retention. Delicious chocholate and roasted coffee flavor. Nice malt character to the body. Previous tastings of this were not as impressive. Currently the best of the Court Ave ales.
Dark mahogany color with a dense light tan head. Faint malt aroma. Dry vapid and insipid malt flavors. Only slight coffee and chocolate. Very boring ale.

On tap at the brewpub during the 2006 Crescent Moon Beer Bus Trip. Mahoganey amber color with an off-white head that produces good money. Hoppy with a great palate. Very earthy flavor- downright Hobbit-like.
Very dark red with a cream-air head. Roasty caramel with a tight bitter finish. Quite good!
A wonderful color, amber red hits it right on the nose. More hops than I expected (not necessarily a bad thing) but still weak.
Deep copper color with a hint of ruby. A liht small tan head. Light floral hops aroma that turn a bit more malty as it warms. Thin feel. Watery malt and hops flavors. Just plain thin.

Draft at the brew pub. Clear reddish-orange color. Thinnest of thin off white head which didn’t leave any lace. Aroma was of very weak brown sugar and nothing else. Tasted of lightly toasted bread. There was also a fruity note, kind of like grape candy and some cherry. Dry with delicate bitterness at the end. Eh, not my bag.

On tap at the brewpub. The body was hazy dark brown and rust colored beer. This was topped with a thin white head. The aroma had malty caramel with some fresh bread. There was also a little bit of pancake syrup. The taste had some dry wood and cinnamon. There was also some toffee. This was nicely done.
Super dark, reddish brown with a beige head. Robust cooked caramel aroma. Sweet finish. Good warmer.
Bark brown color with a smaller light tan head. Some lace. Dark and dry malt flavors dominate and carry through and linger. An interesting brew that seems so lure you to have some more.

Picked up from Waitrose, Thame in a 4 pack. I am assuming that this is the same beer it was 5% as I recall and poured light brown, I hate beer in cans but being at a Festival (Toweresey nr Thame) convienience are sometime sone of the overiding factors. Fairly bland, lack of malt and hops, pity I had another four to drink really.
From a bottle.Light brown in colour,poor head,toffee and bread,hard to finish,if only their beer was as good as the food.

Bottled. Copper bronze moderate head and condition. Very pleasant aromas of caramel and hops that reminded me of some American IPAs, malt and hops are well balanced in the mouth but a metallic note develops into the hoppy finish.

Bouteille claire 330ml. De couleur dorée foncée et claire. Nez d’alcool liquoreux sucré et de grains de malt sucrés avec des notes fruitées (agrumes). Mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-doux ainsi qu’une texture aux notes sirupeuses. Léger goût fruité (agrumes chimiques) qui liasse rapidmeent place à un goût sucré (grains sucrés, notes de sucre blanc) ainsi qu’à un léger goût d’alcool ainsi que des traces herbeuses en finale. Post-goût court, composé d’un léger goût d’alcool liquoreux.

250ml bottle pours a bright golden color with a small white head that dissipates almost immediately. Aroma is syrupy sweet with some orange. Taste is sweet with some orange and mild hop bitterness. Medium body and light carbonation. Not a very good beer.
250ml bottle. Horrible. It was only a quarter liter and I was already drunk and could barely finish it. It would be a fight between this and Coors Light for worst beer I’ve ever had.

What is with the French and their obsession with ruining beer by adding things that just don’t belong? They’ve done it with tequila, with congnac, and now with Grand Marnier. Although I’m willing to bet it’s orange flavouring despite the claim that there is 5% Grand Marnier in the beer. Starts off a golden yellow with no head to speak of. Aroma is lemon-lime soda (that’s right, not even orange in the aroma!) mixed with beer-in-the-carpet smell (you know what I mean). Flavour is sickly sweet with an artificial orange taste mixed in with a harsh poor quality pale lager. COME ON! Does anyone honestly think this is GOOD?!

Clear bottle, best before date: 28/02/04; eye: orangy with yellowish reflections, no head per se, no effervescence, clear; nose: orange, madera, alcohol; mouth: in that order Grand Marnier, sweet Grand Marnier, finale all sugary, medium boyd, thin and syrupy texture, not that carbonated; overall: too sweet FRANÇAIS Bouteille transparente, meilleure avant : 28/02/04; oeil : orangée avec des reflets jaunâtres, pas de mousse pour dire, pas d’effervescence, claire; nez : orange, madère, alcohol; bouche : Grand Marnier, Grand Marnier sucré, finale tout en sucre, corps moyen, texture mince et sirupeuse, pas très carbonatée; en résumé : trop sucrée

(Bottle 33 cl) A beer with 5% Grand Marnier - well, that’s a first. Beautiful deep amber, not much head. Pronounced orange-flavour from the added liquor and lots and lots of sweetness. But actually quite delicious. The label is printed on the bottle. 191203
Clear and fizzy. Taste much cake. Fine foam and escaping with imperceptible bitter. To understand.

very pale yellow although slight head with lots of lacing. It is the taste that leaves something to be desired. tastes much like fake citrus flavoring (similar to Labatt’s Lager and Lime). considering its elevated alcohol content, this beer belongs more in a "cooler" category of which it would be scoring some high marks. As a beer, however, it is sorely lacking.

Medium yellow in colour. This is quite possibly the worst beer I have ever had. Aromas of model glue, skunk, and Grand Marnier. If it were possible for an orange to fart, the smell of that fart would be the same as the smell of this beer. Ridiculously sweet flavors of orange and alcohol. Thin bodied and disgusting. I don’t mind Grand Marnier in my coffee, but it DOES NOT belong anywhere near a beer! The epitome of a drainpour.
Blond color. Sweet aroma, citrus fruits and honey, more Cointreau-like than Grand Marnier… Similar comment for the taste, sweet. Not a good idea!
22oz bottle. Aroma is rich malted barley. Sour flavor. Just like a Siletz. Some chocolate, malts. Tart? I like the Spruce Ale much better than this offering, nothing can survive in that one.

Bottle courtesy of patrick767 at Fort Wayne Winter Gathering. Small tan head with virtually no lacing, opaque, no carbonation observed, and a dark brown hue. Nose was malty, lightly roasty, hoppy, sour/tart and chocolate. Flavor was sweet, chocolate, malty and sour/tart tasting.Smooth, watery mouthfeel and light in body.What’s with the sour/tart nose/flavor? Infected or was this the intent of this beer?Weird and didn’t like it for that reason.Next!!

This bottled brew from a Patrick767 at a rating party poured a head of foamy fine to medium sized dark brown colored bubbles that were and left behind a opaque dark brown colored body and a poor lacing. The aroma was hoppy coffee and dark malt. The semi-flat mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish. The flavor contained notes of sweet and dark malt. Off the mark old tasting flavor. Not one that I would likely drink again.

bottle - I don’t want to take credit for supplying this one. I’d guess it’s a bad bottle, but I see a number of other raters have noted a certain off, sour flavor, so I think they have bottling/quality issues. Anyway, it smells like roast malt and chocolate. However, while the taste has some dark chocolate in it, it also has a bad, sour element that says infection to me. A date on the bottle would have been nice, but I don’t think it was all that old. Too bad. It looks good and even smells pretty good, but it’s downhill from there.

Mahogany dark beer with a foamy beige head. Dusty chocolate in the nose with an odd tartness. This beer had hints of rancid orange juice. Tart cherries, funky chocolate, odd orange rind. I can’t tell if this is supposed to be funky or not, but as many others have noticed it, I’m guessing it is on purpose.

Bottle: Courtesy of patrick767 at the local tasting. I’m wondering if there is something just naturally off with this brew or if it’s a bad bottle. Either way here it goes. This looked nice enough...a dark mahogany colored brew with no head. The first thing that hit me was a sour metallic aroma that was overpowering. There was some slight malt and chocolate notes there but they were just getting beat down. This pretty much tasted just like it smelled except for some mild woodsy notes to help it. Overall I’m not impressed and don’t think I’ll ever seek this one out.

Pours murky brown with a small tannish head. The aroma has some spice, tinniness, roasted chocolate malt and lightly soured cream. Medium / thin body with lightly spritzy carbonation. The flavor starts with sour dark fruits and light chocolate. The finish is lightly spice and roasty, but still sour. Meh....

From a 22-oz. bottle--Poured a thick brown-black body with a small tan head. Nose of toffee, coffee, molasses, and sweet malts. Flavor was bitter and piny as well as malty and sweet. Tart and roasty finish. Quite good.
Bottle. Deep brown, with a thing light brown head. Sweet, malty aroma, with coffee, toffee and molasses as well. Bitter, coffee bitter, with a sweetness that seems to come from molasses.

Pours dark bown with a thin tan head. Smells of roasted malt but little else. Tastes thin and watery with a ton of bitterness and some sweet qualities, but not nearly enough to balance out the bitterness. No fruit hints to speak of. This does not taste at all like the other Baltic Porters I’ve sampled over the past 6 weeks.
Hellmalzig und hefig im Antrunk. Steigende Süße, dann unausgeglichen zuckrig. Leichte Kräuternoten. Ok. 8/8/8/8/5/7
Bottle. Deep golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, sugar. flavour is sweet, malt, sugar, fruit, yeast. Medium body. boring beer.

Bottle 330ml. Clear medium to light dark yellow colour with a small average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, marzipan malt, moderate yeasty. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration, candy, sweet yeast - malt, fruity. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120622]
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, fruits, alcohol and malt, Nice and warming.
Bottle@Ulfborg. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of fruitiness, some bublegum, sugar and malt. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some sugar, malt and alcohol. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 330ml @ fonefan Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, sugar and dried fruits, Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. It pours a clear, golden body and a dense, off-white head. It’s rather sugary on the nose, with fruit syrup and some piney hops. It’s quite dry on the palate, but tastes quite a bit like white sugar. Medium body, pleasant carbonation. There’s fruityness and bitterness too in the flavor, but it’s still a rather boring one. Yet another generic Belgian style ale that I don’t see a use for. 120622
Bottle, 6.5%. Clear golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, yeast and hops. Flavour is malt, yeast, phenols, fruit, medium sweet, hop and a little bitter.
33cl, exclusive brew, from De Bierloods Adegem, complex brew, balanced, hazy, rocky head, nice brew
Bottle 33cl. (bought @ Bierloods) Dark golden color, with white head. Aroma coriandre, yeast. Medium body. Taste sweet, coriander, bit citrus, yeast notes. Aftertaste sweet. Not bad.

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: BCTC 2015. Pours a hazed amber with a medium sized white head. Soft malt, light oxidization, cranberry on the nose. Medium bodied, sweet, oxidization, fruit. Tart and oxidized on the finish, a bit weird.

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Poured from a 12oz bottle bottle into a tulip glass. A - Brew pours a dark Amber with a medium-bodied off-white head. A - I smell semi-sweet cranberries and straw. T - The attack of the sip brings a small amount of tartness, but the moment I gulp is when the full puckering effect sets in. This is followed by a taste subtle cranberry sweetness that continues through the finish. Brew has plenty of cranberry flavor, but is not overwhelmingly sweet or tart. Very well-balanced and refreshing. P - Beer is well-carbonated. The opening bite of carbonation and tartness work in harmony, grabbing your attention right at the start of the sip. I do wish the beer had a bit more thickness to it. Was too light-bodied despite having a lot of flavor. O - I picked this beer up on a whim when in visited my home state of WI for Christmas (I’ve been living in Memphis, TN for the last 5 years). I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed the brew. The Brewers were faithful to the true flavor of tart WI cranberries. I’ve tasted too many disappointing fruit ales that were packed with sugar. This beer was well-balanced, tart, a tinge sweet, and refreshing. I definitely recommend this if you like fruit beers and especially if you like cranberries! "Never turn your back on your beer." Earlier Rating: 1/13/2015 Total Score: 3.5 Poured from a 12oz bottle bottle into a tulip glass. A - Brew pours a dark Amber with a medium-bodied off-white head. A - I smell semi-sweet cranberries and straw. T - The attack of the sip brings a small amount of tartness, but the moment I gulp is when the full puckering effect sets in. This is followed by a taste subtle cranberry sweetness that continues through the finish. Brew has plenty of cranberry flavor, but is not overwhelmingly sweet or tart. Very well-balanced and refreshing. P - Beer is well-carbonated. The opening bite of carbonation and tartness work in harmony, grabbing your attention right at the start of the sip. I do wish the beer had a bit more thickness to it. Was too light-bodied despite having a lot of flavor. O - I picked this beer up on a whim when in visited my home state of WI for Christmas (I’ve been living in Memphis, TN for the last 5 years). I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed the brew. The Brewers were faithful to the true flavor of tart WI cranberries. I’ve tasted too many disappointing fruit ales that were packed with sugar. This beer was well-balanced, tart, a tinge sweet, and refreshing. I definitely recommend this if you like fruit beers and especially if you like cranberries! "Never turn your back on your beer."

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Bottle. Amber with a beige head. Fermented cranberry and hay. Tart enough to keep the artificial sweet at bay with a heavy cereal finish.

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Aroma is cranberry sauce, yeast and malts. The flavor is cranberries/cranberry sauce, malts, mild sweetness and a tart finish.

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Honestly this smell is amazing!!! The taste, another story. If you are looking for a strong cranberry taste and no beer, this is what you want. Very sweet/tart finish! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Bottle. Reddish amber pour. Cranberry juice on the aroma and taste. Slightly metallic. Okay.

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Orange with a slight rosy hue. Smell is cranberry and waxiness, very similiar ot ng fruit beers. The flavor is tart, good cranberry, flaovr, light malt backing, light and refreshing. Not bad.

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Proudly claims on the front of the bottle "made with real Wisconsin cranberry juice." Pours a reddish brown color with a thin head. Scent is mostly that of cranberries and earthy grains. The cranberry flavor is quite evident in its flavor. It is nicely complimented by the malts and wheat used as well. Taste finishes a little tart and dry. The taste is better than average but I can also see people saying this beer is too fruity for them. I like the taste but I find the texture to be a little to thin where more carbonation is needed. A nice fall season beer from Wisconsin cranberries. Fall doesn’t get much better in Wisconsin!

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Purchased at Breeze Thru Liquors in Wauwatosa, WI; enjoyed during a relatively lazy and unusually moderate Saturday afternoon in mid January. Appearance is a relatively light amber with a bit of a red hue, light white head. Aroma of cranberry juice, with a light bready malt. Taste is like a crisp cranberry cider, slightly sugary, with a crisp finish. I’d consider this more of a cider than a beer, and it’s kind of enjoyable. I don’t mind it.

column2: Black River Falls, Wisconsin, United States
column5: Combination of tart fruit and malty cracker reminds me of nothing so much as the nostalgic but not quite pleasant taste of communion wine and wafers. I love cranberries, and I love beer, and while this is balanced, it’s kind of boring. I might like it more paired with some heavy holiday food.

What, I've never rated this? One of the first beers I had from Toronto. Black pour really rich and creamy with a bit of roasted sweetness and coffee finish, balance and refreshing enough to drink as a beer not just dessert, good.

Dark brown with a thick tan head. Nice and roasted coffee aroma with a slight hint of cream coming up at the end. Good roasted barley notes as well. Subtle coffee at the start that builds up as you drink. Nice and roasted without tasting burnt. A bit thin-bodied but really good flavor.
341ml Flasche. Schwarzes Bier, brauner cremiger Schaum. Starke Kaffe Noten. Antrunk säuerlich. Kaffee, Malz.

From Nov 2007 Another brew I got in a trade with autumnaldave. Thanks Dave! It pours from 341ml bottle a very dark brown with just the slightest reddish hue and a near 2 finger head of tannish foam. It recedes to a fine layer over time and it has some good lacing. The smell is nice..I get coffee , roasted malt, and a touch of chocolate. The taste kind of fooled me; The first thing I noticed on my palate was a dark chocolate flavour followed by coffee(yeah, it starts to take over after the first sip) and roasted malt and there's some sweet malt kicking it up in the backgound. There's a bitterness there that I figure comes from both the coffee and the dark chocolate and it's absolutely delicious. The mouthfeel is medium bordering on heavy and the carbonation is light. Very easy drinking, this son of a gun, and so smooth on the tongue. Man, I could kick back a few of these. To tell you the truth, I'm not a huge fan of coffee)I prefer tea) but the few "Coffee" brews I've had have realy impressed me.... Bottom line: Another very nice Porter that I can only recommend. Thanks again, Dave. It was another excellent sample to throw in as an extra!!

Thanks to Luc for this one! Pours a very dark brown with a medium beige head that leaves good to very good lacing. Nose is of coffee for sure but not quite the bright and freshly roasted one you’re used to. Maybe it is the mix with all the roasted malt and sweet milk chocolate (lactose?) that is throwing me off, though. Taste is lightly ashy, a bit acidic and offers more chocolate and that lactose sweetness. Body is light, carbonation moderate and it feels a little bit thin overall. Still a fair coffee porter.

Sampled from a 12oz brown bottle this beer poured a black color with a huge foamy dark brown head that lingered and left good lacing. The aroma was vanilla, brewed coffee, toasty malts and moderate bitterness. The flavor was rather bitter with sourish brewed coffee, roasty malts and floral hops. Long finish. Medium body. Ok.

An easy go-to of porters, I often pick this up when having a couple over company. Deeply coffee but still light on the tongue, Mill Street always wins in wafting aroma. Be happy to hold this and sip it back, letting the sweetness settle on one’s tongue.

Half a finger of tan head, fades quickly and clings to edge of glass. Dark brown colour. Aroma is strong of cold steeped sweetened coffee, roasty. Very strong coffee flavour, thin and slightly acrid. Strong roast, dark bitter chocolate in the finish. Med carbonation. Nice coffee beer, but the porter character is very subdued,

Bottle from the brewpub in Ottawa. Pours hazy very dark brown with creamy, stable light tan head. Clear aroma of roast and malt, with estery notes and touches of coffee. Roasty flavour with notes of coffee and malt and touches of oats and hops. Subtle hints of metal. Estery and slightly coffelike and lactic aftertaste. Decent.

Black with a large beige head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, vanilla, dates. Medium-light bodied, creamy mouthfeel, slightly sweet on the palate with only a hint of coffee roast/bitterness. Taste is chocolate with a hint of coffee with vanilla creamer.

Single can purchased from mom & pop store in Kindersley, Saskatchewan on 06/02/2012. Colour: Light yellow with low white head lacing. Nose: Sprite, trace barley, yeast is around but not dominant....quite light. Taste: Light sweet, light bitter, light sour. Typical light beer, but without the pungentness and dominant sweetness of some. Barley is quite noticable and welcome.

341mL. For some reason, this is quite an improvement over GW Pils and Lager simply because it does have some sort of flavor and that would be quite an unexpected jolt of DMS/cooked sweet corn. Pour is light yellow with almost no carbonation. No head formation. Still, yellow water. A rare 1/5 for appearance. Nose is big DMS. Taste combines DMS with cardboard, and tannic astringency. Oatmeal is somehow present in the body. Really one of the oddest beers I’ve had. Certainly not good, but interesting and not really offensive.
Cannette 341 ml. 4%. Couleur jaune pâle paille. Assez légère mais goûte le malt et est rafraîchissante. Bonne light.

One of the best light beers I’ve drank. It’s got aroma, flavour and feels good. 3.5 for a light beer? Well, yea, when compared to other lights. Dumped out of can on to carpet...carpet soaked up beer very well. Kidding. Standard Canadian lager aroma and colour/ cap. Tasty beer considering - not to sweet, a good ammount of barley, grass and the faintest hint of hops. Fairly smooth with a decent carb attack, light bodied and some dry wheatish finish. This doesn’t seem like a light beer. Western puts out good brew that I’m finding myself drinking more and more.
Can. Beers of the World Live, NEC. Light gold with a small head. Aromas are grain with floral, soapy notes and some citrus. Flavours are light grain with prickly notes. Soft on the finish. Dull.

I’m not usually in the habit of drinking light beers, but this was in the fridge and I’d never tried it before... Pale gold, decent head that vanishes under the attack of lots of carbonation. Not a lot of aroma to speak of. Surprisingly flavourful for a light beer-- pale malt with some soft apple notes. Very watery palate, but it seems that you can’t escape that with light beers. In the end, when compared to its light beer peers, this was very good, but compared to standard pale lagers, it comes across as weak (hardly surprising).

Pale gold in colour with lots of carbonation. Not a lot of aromatics with this one... perhaps a wiff of malt and chemicals. Although the palate is as watery as you’d expect from a light beer, the flavors (again with the light malt) are not too muted at all. You could do a lot worse.
Poured with a small foamy head that lasted till finish. Pale golden in color. Lots of carbonation. Smooth taste going down with little after taste. Great for a hot day sitting on the patio

Pale golden color...foamy head...highly carbonated. This beer is probably GW’s best beer. Its light, smooth flavor was hardly barely noticable and it had no aftertaste. For a light beer I think it fairs well. A good lawn mower beer.
It is a nice beer to go with desserts. Ice cream is best. It is a good beer if you have a bbq or a pit party.
50 cL bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is crisp apple fruity and slight acidic. Sweet apple fruity and slight sulphorish to medium dry apple fruity into the finish.
Bottle at Papsø. Clear amber coloured with a small white head. Fruity aroma of apples with notes of apple core. Fruity flavour of apples with notes of apple core. Tart finish of apples.
clear light brown, small white head. dry apple, clean aroma. flavor is dry apple, slight bitterness that works well.
Bottled. A dark golden cider with a thin beige head. The aroma has notes of apples. The flavor aplles, over ripe fruits, and vinegar, leading to a tart finish.

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of chriso. Pours a hazy golden with a tiny, rough white head. Dry and tart apple aroma. Medium body, completely still, dry apple notes with a spicy cardamom edge - a little ginger too?. Dry and tart finish with a slight but never overpowering astringency making this pleasantly drinkable. 220511

Had a real hard time figuring how to get this cider listed. I believe it to be made by a relatively small orchard/cidery in one of the remote sections of the West Country. Regardless, this was without question or reservation, one of the best dry, English ciders I've ever tried to this point. Its color was pale and lightly clouded. Its aroma was unique to the fact that it matched its tast of raw apple peels. I can't say that I've ever made that assimilation before, but that was the impression I got. One of, if not the, sweetest of all the English ciders I've tried which was classified as "Medium Dry". Subtle aftertaste which reminds of those wonderful peels again! Well worth going out of your way to track down.
Pours a dark amber with a thin white head. Aroma is nutty, caramel, and a sweet dark fruit. Flavor is cracker, caramel, and grape/prune. Has a medium body. Not bad, if a touch medicinal.
On tap at Goose Island Clybourn. Clear dark copper with a small head. Aroma and taste of caramel, light fruit, malt and warming alcohol. The body was medium and the carbonation low.

2/3/16 Chicago (12 oz draft pour into snifter glass at Goose Island Clybourn Brewpub).Very dark rosy brown, thick pour, foam and carbonation. Chocolate, caramel and toffee aroma. Taste similar to aroma, with roasted coffee the predominate feature. Thin creamy texture and body, easy going down. Glad I picked this one to start the evening.

On tap at Goose Island Beer Company - Clybourn. Reddish brown appearance with a tan head. Aroma of caramel malt, roasted grain, light fruity esters, chocolate, toffee and a hint of cinnamon spice. Similar flavor, pretty tasty overall.

Sampled on draught in a snifter glass at the Goose Island Brew Pub on Clybourne. Very dark reddish brown colour with a beige head. Roasted malt and coffee aromas. Very full, fruity taste, with coffee flavours along with a very slightly tart baked apple and toffee tastes. This beer has a very good malt flavour and plenty of fruity hop notes. A really lovely, complex beer to be savoured slowly.

Tap at Goose Island Wrigleyville. Not much aroma, some chocolate with a hint of maple. Pours deep red in color with very little head. Sweet mixture of chocolate and dark fruit with a full bodied smooth finish with a touch of maple. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
May 11, 2013 - tap at GI 25th anniversary party. Brownish red pour with big head. Aroma and taste were sweet malty. Had again at Clybourn on 12.29.14 - bumped up overall by 1 to get a 3.4 rating.

Draft in a sampler at the Clybourn brewpub. Pours a clear, deep copper color with a small off-white head. The aroma is faint. Notes of caramel, toast, brown sugar, chocolate, and booze- but all are stronger in the flavor. Medium-bodied, with a malty, uneven mouthfeel and low carbonation. Didn’t really work for me.
Draught at Goose Island Clybourn, Chiciago. Clear dark brown - offwhite head. Chocolate, roasted malts, berries, ok sweetness, cocoa, light bitterness, fruity, coffee notes.
Actually a pretty decent take on the style, wasn’t expecting that. Probably their best spring seasonal.

Rates very well for appearance, with a nice, long lasting head (somewhat surprisingly.) Aroma is mainly alcohol with some toffee and rum. Flavour is also pretty alcoholic, not much malt and finishes quite bitter. Actually tastes a lot like my stock of 99 Coopers Vintage (!) but I don't really like that either.
AIBA 2003: Not particularly interesting, a bit bland for such a strong brew, sweet and malty, with a slight hit of alcohol at the end, aswell as some rusty metal, no length.

Very faintly hazy, dark honey amber with a large lasting beige head, Faint biscuity malt and chemical metallic aroma. Medium-strong plain sweet bready malty and medium bitter flavours hold the alcohol at bay until it breaks through at the finish. Unlike the description states it lacks any real complexity and any definitive hop character. It's really just a slightly above average lager with a high ABV and that alone does not justify its existence.

04’ bottle from Duane. Hazy/muddy orangish/dark yellow. Slight vegetal character up front in aroma, backed by tons of cani sugar/candied fruit. Flavor on par, huge candi sugar, very cloying. Sticky mouthfeel.

Bottle. Color is a hazy orange with a sparse head. Aromas are grassy and sweetly fruity. I’d agree with others that pears and peaches are good descriptors of the fruit aromas. Flavor is pretty much on par with the aromas... sweet fruits and a bit of a yeasty and grassy undercurrent, all of which give way to a warm alcohol finish. Mouthfeel is fairly thin, which works well for the crisp flavors that it is working with.

Pours bright orangish golden with a mostly receding wispy tan head. Aroma of peaches, alcohol, pear, and citrus. Taste of pear, peach, fruity esters, citrus and higher alcohols. Full bodied, lightly sticky with lush carbonation. A good tripel, although it’s lacking some refinement.

Bottle from River’s Bend. Poured cloudy yellow with an average fizzy white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate yeasty, sour citrus and small alcohol aroma. Medium body with thick particles. Medium sweet & sour citrus flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. Solid beer.

Thanks for the bottle, Duane. Dark gold and orange body with a light white head. The aroma is perfume and sweat with some peach pie. The taste has some nice peach pie and cinnamon. A highly carbonated body complements the sweet and slightly funky beer. That nice note of peach continues throughout the beer. Nicely made.

Thin white head on top of nearly clear golden body. One empty, the bottom of the bottle contained all the yeast, therefore a clear look. Aroma was of honey and sweet cotton candy. I expected the same for the body, but found that to be quite dry and bland. Actually disappointed, because this lacked the flavor that the aroma lead way to. Bottle was from 2002, so maybe it lost some wallop after time. Will try again if I can find.

Got this one thanks to dmac621. Pours out a strange very cloudy orangy color. Little oxidized, but other than that the aroma is very sweet. Taste is of some sweet fruits, honey and yeast, also little alcohol on the finish. Not bad, but not great

2002 bottling. Cloudy yellow color with a tight white head. Big fruity, yeasty, earthy, honey smell is lightly oxidized. Medium body. Good flavors mirror the smell with a light sweetness up front followed by sharp dryness in the finish. A good triple here, enjoyed this one. 122306

Sampled blind at "Better Know a Style: Abbey Tripel" tasting. Clear pale with dense pff-white head. Slight dough, very fruity, alc, slight dry. Alc, dough flavor, yeast, red-green apple. Medium creamy body. What a mess, alc is too strong and it’s too sweet and fruity.

sampled blind at "Better Know a Style: Abbey Tripel".pours clear dark golden with dense white head. nose is malty, musty, fruity, yeasty. flavor is boozy, dried fruit and red fruit, yeast, and grainy. full body.

column4: Ortliebs Brewery & Grille at Sunnybrook Ballroom
column5: Another great brew now available at Ortleibs Sunnybrook ballroom. This one has a nice amber color, aroma of malt and caramel, and a great finish.

column4: Ortliebs Brewery & Grille at Sunnybrook Ballroom
