column5: Excellent amber-style ale, perfect amber color, thin off-white bubbly head, very balanced aroma with lots of both sweetness & hoppiness in the nose, the flavors were the same way, very balanced, sweet malty profile up front, but then the spicy hops took over toward the finish, rich malty aftertaste with the dry hoppiness as well, all around a great balanced beer that was very drinkable
As a fan of Tawny-ales I really recommend this! Appearance and flavor is top-class. Really nice work done from this small brewery.

This is the first time I get the chance of testing a beer that is only 10 days old. In a couple of weeks it will probably get even better. The aroma and palate from the Golding hops was like a meadow in May. The colour a bit dark amber with a little cloudiness ( 10 days after fermentation stopped)I´m really looking forward to the development of this bitter.
250 ml bottle. Slightly hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is fruity, malt and citrus. Taste ripe peach, hint of banana, pinch of wheat. Light body, medium carbonated.
Peach, apricot. Sweet and dull lambic, watery limonade tasting. Boiled cabbage.
Bottle. Slightly hazy deep golden color with a thin head. Aroma of wheat with notes of apple. Some saltiness in taste. Medium thin body.
Bottle at home. Yellow color, middle foam size. Good balanced beer. Drinkable and fits into style.
Hazy golden appearance. Aroma is citrus, malt and fruity. Flavour is peach, apricot, wheat, banana and malt.
Piwo zółte zmętnione z białą pianą. W aromacie troche landrynki i trawy cytrynowej. W smaku łagodne, onpodwyzszonej kwasnosci.
0.33 bottle C: hazy peach N: overripe peach, apricot, powder sugar P: mid carbonation, ripe peach, hint of banana, pinch of wheat, finish is abrupt and watery.
Bottle @ camping. Hazy pale yellow w a white head. Aroma light malty (bread, apricot, wheat). Flavor light to medium sweet, light apricot. Light body, medium carbonated.

Tiny 250ml bottle from Perla in Lazur, drunk overlooking the Sea Garden in Burgas on a hot, windy August evening. Pours lightly hazy straw with a thick white head that didn't last, heavy lacing and some rising carbonation. On the nose, ripe apricot with hints of herbs and citrus. In the mouth, sourness from the start but mingling with the bitterness by the end, rising sweetness, light flavours similar to the aromas with a sharp finish. A Witbier with a dose of Lambic. Not bad.
Het zurige dat de gewone Lambic zo lekker maakt, zit ook in de witte. Past net iets minder goed. Not bad though.
Backlog. Growler. Pours straw yellow. Nose and taste is sweet, touch of alcohol. Smashed apples. Lighter medium body.
Pours yellow/straw with a fizzy body. Smells of artificial apple juice and boozy. Tastes like strongbow with a more alcopop taste.
An odd cider. Normal, mild aroma of apple juice. Light gold color. Flavors of sour apple and sugar, as well as a light spice I can’t name. Unfortunately none of these flavors are very good.
I thought this cider had a little too much of an alcohol taste to it. It was okay and drank easily like ciderguy said, but I'll still stick to the ACE Pear.

This was a rather obscure find. It had a mostly fabled existance but was eventually tracked down in Central Illinois at a place called Friar Tuck's in Springfield. After tasting it, it probably was more meaningful as that ever sought after enigma which was destined to never be found. Regardless, it was found and unfortunately disappointing. It was basically flat and exceptionally sweet with an aftertaste I wasn't sure would ever go away. It was a slightly clouded pour with a aroma of stale fruit. With the exception of the aftertaste, it drank rather easily. If you have a chance to find it, try it and see if you agree.
Kiedy to bylo, w jakiejs chyba restauracji. Smak nijaki, soja, ciecierzyca, slonecznik. Aromat zaden, wyglad mizerny. Dobre tylko dla kierowcow
Było całkiem OK jak na polskie bezalkoholowe piwa sprzed paru lat. Takie zwykłe, bez smrodów, z trochę wyraźniejszym niż w lagerach, chmielem.
BBE 03-03-2016. Peruslagerin väri ja olomuoto. Tuttu vetinen paperinen riisin tuoksu. Kuohuva, samettinen, vetinen, riisipuuroinen. Kuiva jälkimaku. Kohtalaisen karmea.
På tapp i polen. Gyllengul med vitt skum. Humlebesk doft. Lätt och lite söt med lite beska i början.

Erstaunlich einfach zu trinken und vom Aroma her absolut annehmbar. Leicht im Malz, etwas Hopfen, gut im Getreide. Geschmack wirkt frisch, danach immer laffer und zum Schluss hin der klasse Holzeimer. Ist aber sonst ganz ok.
Bottle ordered in Poland. The beer has got a clear golden colour with an airy head and thin body. Aroma of mild hops and bread. Taste of mild hops, citrus fruits and grass. Refreshing.

The aroma is hoppy, a little malty; not pleasant as such, but not offensive, as is often the case with pilseners. Pours light, orangy brown, clear, with a small, unstable head. Sweeter than it is bitter; would be quite nice actually, if not for this characteristic low alcohol note. Body below medium; carbonation above medium; sticky; finish mildly bittersweet. Not great for sure but I expected worse; when you can?t have a regular beer, this might be a solid fifth best thing.

Aromat przyjemnie słodowy i chmielowy (czeskie klimaty). Barwa złota, krystalicznie klarowne. Piana drobna i średnia, szybko opada do cienkiej, ale zostaje lacing. W smaku karmelkowe, słodowe, nawet lekkie. Goryczka wyraźna, niezła.
Butelka 330ml, Kolor: Złoty - klarowny, Piana: biała, średnio ziarnista, mała, Zapach: słodowy, Smak: taki nijaki, słodowy, trochę chmielu,
Bottle in train to Ostrava. Pours golden color, small white head. Aroma and taste are malty, only some hints of hops.

Can. Pours clear pale golden with quickly vanishing white head. Clear, grainy aroma of wholemeal bread. Watery, citric flavour with notes of perfume, stale malt and yeast. Mild, sour aftertaste. Unbalanced. Bad.
Can, 4.2%. Marzipan aroma?! Clear golden olour. OK stable white head. The flavour has a strange fruity marzipan note. Rough bitterness. Strange and bad.

Überaus milder Geruch, fast neutral. Wässriger Antrunk, etwas karamellig, würzig, soweit wie es eben bei einem wässrigen Bier geht. Im Abgang leicht herb, weiter wässrig. Test vom 15.1.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 7,4,6,3,8,4 - 4,65

Identical parameters as Leader Price beer but this is not same beer. Aroma was clean, fresh with aromatic Polish hop character followed by sweet malts .Gold with large yet weak head. Bitter hoppy front with malt lightly highlighted. Medium dry finish.
Yellowy colour, disappearing head. Nice malty taste, no alcoholic traces, an OK lager.
Golden with ok head. Some toffee and malt in the aroma. A malty, bready flavour and a paperlike palate.
Golden with a fine head. Bready and malty aroma and flavor. The flavor is too thin though. Some bitterness in the finish.
bread, caramel, butter, herbs, amber, clear, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, good beer
Przecież tego piwa od 2 lat już nie produkują znawcy xD to co aktualnie jest produkowane to nie jest produkt z Cieszyna i ma zupełnie inna butelkę.

Blind test - 25 koncerniaków. Wygląd: Barwa jasnozłota, klarowna z drobno i średnio pęcherzykową niską białą pianą, która szybko redukuje się do znikomego krążka, nie pozostawiając lacingu. Aromat: Znikomy, utlenienie, mokry karton, lekki diacetyl i nuta słodowa, chlebowa. Smak: Tak jak w aromacie, z odrobię większą słodowością chlebową. W ustach półsłodkie, treściwość średnioniska, wysycenie niskie. Goryczki brak. Finisz półwytrawny z jabłkowymi estrami i lekką chlebową słodowością.
Mocno słodowy, brzydko pachnący, mało goryczkowy, słaby pils. Bardzo przeciętne piwo.
Nie jest źle, bo dość czysto (z lekkim DMS chyba tylko). Przyjemna słodowość, chmielu mało. Ale ogólnie w porządku piwo.
Butelka 0,5 litra. Wypite dość dawno temu i nie powtarzane, stąd brak szczegółów recenzji.
Ljust gyllengul öl med vitt skum. Doft och smak är lätt maltig, majssötma, lätt fruktighet och säd.

Ciemnozłote, przejrzyste, piana niska, ale utrzymuje się długo i zostawia trochę śladów na szkle. Aromat słodowo-chmielowy z wyraźnym żelazem. W smaku dobre mimo metaliczności, fajna goryczka. Lane w schronisku górskim wchodzi znakomicie.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.

Lane 0,5 l. Piany nie ma. Barwa ciemnozłota, głeboka, nawet ładna. Aromat ledwo wyczuwalny, słodowy. W smaku nieco żelazowy, trochę maślany, goryczka jak na eurolagera niemała. Mocno wysycone, pozostawia nieprzyjemnie wypełnia. W sumie nie pozostawia koszmarnych wspomnień.
Pours brown to black with a tan head. Smell is mild cocoa. Taste is mild, dry, bitter cocoa. Didn’t care for this.

On tap at the brewpub: Toasted bread and roasted crumbs...Lots of caramel sweetness over peachy fruitiness...Weirdly close to a black and tan in its conflicting flavors, relatively important sweetness, and overall drinkability...An important bitterness comes from the roasted malts and the accompanying hops...
Thick frothy light brown head. Dark mahogany color. Smoke and coffee aroma. Chocolate and coffee flavor with smoke overtones.

2004 draught. Appearance shows a dark brown/near black body with a tinge of violet peeking through near the edges of the glass. Low head retention. Aroma seems quite bitter and black with lots of coffee, though a bit more roasty and full than the Smuttynose. Flavor turns out to be not dominated by black malt and instead is quite roasty and coffee-like. Some good sweet tones throughout and though this is a pretty dry rendition, it dosent get too bitter and astringent. As it warms the body produces an almost velvety sensation on the palate. Ends with good bittering hops, not overdone. Lightly nutty and has hints of mocha. Medium to medium-full body and little to no thinning.
Deep brown with ruby highlights and a large off-white foamy head. Aroma of chocolate,roasted malt and nuts. Flavor is hoppy,spicey,malty and sweet.

- dark black color with brown overtones, short white head, very nice roasted malt aroma, burnt, with a strong bitter coffee presence, clean; bitter, burnt malt flavor, coffee flavors, also has a fruity-winey-alcohol flavor especially in the aftertaste, slightly dry, light mocha flavors are noticeable too - complex, good texture, very well done
Pours a dark rust orange with white head. A sweet caramel malt and light fruit aroma. A dry grain, light smokey and fruit malt taste. A light sour and lingering dry malt afteraste.
On cask at the brewery. A great example of an ESB, without any real deviation from the style. It’s malt-forward and balanced, with some light fruity esters and caramel sweetness.
Draft at the brewpub. Pours hazy copper with a fizzy beige head. Tastes like toffee malt, earthy, boozy, and nutty. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like booze, toffee malt, earthy, and nutty.
Tap at brewery. Pours mostly clear dark amber. Aroma and flavor are bready and toasted malts, faint caramel, faint grassy and floral hops, and some woodiness. Medium body.
On draft at the brewpub. Pours a clear light mahogany with an off wite head. Nutty aroma. Flavors of toast. Light bitter roast finish.
On tap at brewery. Dark copper with a thin off-white head. Aroma and flavor both have caramel, resin, grain, sweet bread, and herbal hops. Good carbonation.

Location: Draft at the Brewpub, 7/12/13, My 50th ESB tick! Aroma: The nose has some rather light hop notes, caramel and nutty malts Appearance: It pours a clear light amber color with a small head and not a lot of lace Flavor: The flavor is light and clean, with a clean malt sweetness and a nice, light hop bitterness Palate: The body is light, it has a nice, clean mouthfeel, and drinks quite easily Overall Impression: This is a nice, clean, easy drinking ESB. The nose and flavors lean toward the subtle side, but aren’t bad at all. I liked this one.

Bottle... Mostly clear amber ale with a small, fat bubbled white head. Aroma-wise, I could pull absolutely nothing out of the glass. Medium to full-bodied with light carbonation. Beefy, grainy flavor that leans slightly bitter. Finishes lightly bitter, a hint astringent, and then dries out. Bottle courtesy of landhoney!

Draught @ Brewpub: this one pours a slightly hazy, amber color. There was a small off white head that left a little lacing. The nose is a little lighter. It has mainly pine and citrus notes to it. Some sweet malts too. The taste is good. It is just a bit bitter. Pine and citrus notes. A decent malt body behind it. A nice, easy drinking ESB.
On tap at the Southern New Hampshire Brewers Festival 7/27/2013 Light gold, sweet rich malty backbone with a hint of earthy spice. Nice ESB

Flasche 0,5l: Kräftiges Bernstein, Kupfer, glasklar, kräftiger stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; frische + fruchtige Nase, leichte Süße, dezente Würze, fruchtige Hopfennoten, grüne Früchte, Sternfrucht, Getreide, Malz, leichte Hefenoten, Brotteig; frischer + dezent würziger Körper, dezente trockene Hopfennoten, Malz, Getreide, cremig, deutliche Kohlensäure, leichte Hefenoten, Brot, Brotteig; malzig-trockener Nachgang
Fles 50cl thuis. Kruidig, maltig, zoet. (12-2015).-------------------------.
This is a beer I had today at the Heidelberg Christmas Market. Nothing stood out about it, but it was a beer.
Aus der Flasche im Heidelberger Brauhaus getrunken. Klares Amber im Glas. Sehr süffig.

0,5 l bottle, bought at Rücker, Lengerich. Clear bright dark copper with a nearly two finger foamy light beige head. Looks really good. Sweet malt with present hop on the nose. Taste is malty with a lot of toasted grain, spicy, low bitterness. Surprisingly nice in my opinion.
0,33l Flasche. heller Bernstein, wenig Schaum. Röstmalz und Karamell Duft. Sehr getreidiger Geschmack. Holz, Karamell.
Clear amber beer with minimal white head. Aroma of caramel malts. Light Sweet with a long bitter end. It is ok.

Bottle from my Advent calender. Beautiful clear Amber beer with medium sized white head. The aroma is a mix of several light notes that I find hard to identify, only the malts are intensive. Light body and a dry bitterness. Some caramel, honey, some different malts and a sour component that gives the taste an interesting direction. Drinkable, but I find the beer is lacking some punch.

Bottle @ home. Ambrato carico, ai limiti del ramato. schiuma beige, molto fine persistente. Aroma di malto tostato, caramello, miele di castagna. Gusto dolce amabile, caramellato, mellifluo. Poco nulla amaro. Acidula. Rotonda, poco calda, carbonatazione fine. Abbastanza equilibrata, manca un filo di bilanciamento con l’amaro. armonica.

Kastanienbraun mit mittelhoher feinporiger Krone. In der Nase spielen Honig und Karamell, Nüsse und Rosinen. Im Geschmack ist es eher trocken und ebenfalls nussig. Der Hopfen bindet sich leicht herb ein. Der Abgang ist leicht säuerlich.
Raisns in aroma and flavour (indicating it was a bit over the top). Sweet and dry.
Blond coloured. Mature aroma with notes of raisins and prunes. Sweet bready flavour. Thin. Over the top.

I had this one at the Kerstbierfestival in Essen, Belgium, Dec 2002. Cloudy dark blond with a small head. Fruity, yeasty old attic aroma. The taste is slightly fruity, apple?. Mild bitter finish. Rerate: Had this one again at the 2003 Kerstbierfestival. Rather flat, no bubbles left. Still there was a nice taste of spices, liquorice and fruit.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Cask at the 28th Ealing Beer Festival. Pours clear golden amber with a small bubbly off-white head. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, fruit and hop. Quite heavy sweetness and very light bitterness. Light body, oily/watery texture, soft carbonation.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Cask at The Black Horse Inn, Naunton. Clear amber colour with a thin creamy white head. Aroma: light sweet malts, dried fruits. Taste: light sweet fruity malt, caramel, hops. Bit of a thin watery body but otherwise an easy drinking ale.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Mid-amber with a gentle malty aroma. Taste is largely of toffee without a huge hop input. Finish is bitter without being overpowering. Pleasant low-gravity bitter.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Cask at The Pheasant Toddington. Poured a deep amber colour clear with white head. Nose is malt caramel. Taste is malt bitterness caramel and toffee. Pleasant.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Cask @ Archies, Prestatyn [090615] Amber, stuck bubbles, thin white head Aroma of slight coffee?, soft fruits Taste of light sweet fruity malts, light hops, getting a vague hint of fruity coffee Palate - Light body, soft, smooth. Finish of light sweet caramel malts Overall - Not much to say about this

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Cask @ Hole In Ye Wall, Liverpool. Amber with a thin head. Light texture, light easy drinking golden ale. Sips down the palate well although feels slightly thin. There’s some caramel sweetness in its nose.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Cask at the Bishop Blaize, Richmond. Amber body. White head. Boring appearance. Nose is nuts and spice. Smells like poor quality homebrew. Bittersweet. Dry finish. Bad.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Queens Head, Stow-on-the-Wold. Fairly plain. Soft fudge and walnut. Smudgy powdery hop bitterness. Unremarkable. The Gold is the best of the three regular Donnington beers, and this is second best.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Draught. Good low abv bitter which is enhanced by drinking it at one of the Donnington pubs.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: A nice cask ale from the Cotswolds. Very smooth, very drinkable. With only 3.7% alcohol, I could drink this all day.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Cask at The Black Horse Inn, Naunton. Clear deep amber colour with one finger creamy white head. Aroma: malty, dried fruit. Taste: light sweet malt, fruits, bitter finish. Light thinnish body, easy drinking.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Rather disappointed in this beer which I must have first drunk over 40 years ago and if my recollection is correct certainly liked then. Appearance is a little muddy, which is how I recalled it. Flavours were toffee, a certain amount of diacetyl with medium-high levels of bittering hops. Where it fell down for me was in the conditioning which was almost non-existent,. I haven’t been too harsh though as this could have been due to shortcomings at the pub. One I will look out for in future to give another chance.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Cask at The Pheasant Toddington. Poured clear chestnut colour with white head. Nose is malt caramel biscuits taste is caramel malts yeast toffee. Pleasant.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: On draught in Swindon, so not quite the Cotswolds. Dark woody colour, decent white head and medium bodied. Some earthy fruit on top of caramel malt. Pretty good and very drinkable.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Cask at the Fox Inn, Great Barrington. 20th July 14. Not a bad bitter, fairly sweet, nice malt character, OK

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Queens Head, Stow-on-the-Wold. Diacetyl in the nose. Honeyed flavour. Soft and accessible, but a little dry and dull and slightly spoiled by the diacetyl (which, reading the other comments, seems to be a standard feature of the beer when served at this pub).

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Had this at The Queens Head in Stow. Malty and caramel, bronze color and a nice head. Preferred the BB also on cask.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Draught at a pub in Stowe-on-the -Wold. Nice simple bitter that is good for sessioning. Best drunk in a small pub owned by the brewery if you ask me.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Cask at the Prince of Wales, Farnborough BF (at the bar - may have been part of the BF range?) - 12/10/12. Clear golden/amber with a decent off white head. It’s appearance was the highlight of this beer! Pale malt nose and a touch of the vinegars. Taste is pale malt a little fruit and hops. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, bitter finish. Dull.

column2: Stow on the Wold, Gloucestershire, England
column5: Queens Head, Stow-on-the-wold, Cotswolds. Darkish brown/amber, creamy head, caramel and butterscotch malts & light bitterness. A lovely session drink for sure, very moreish. There were 2 staunched lager drinkers in our group and they happily quaffed SBA all weekend. And I do mean all weekend...
pretty good. hoppier than i expected. good color, good aroma, wasnt overpoweringly hoppy, but certainly on the high end of it.

Brown bottle, 341 ml; eye: amber with golden reflections, white head that fals rapidly to leave a ring around the glass, light effervescence, clear; nose : butterscotch, madera (?), hops (floral); mouth: starts all in hops, a bit of caramel, finale in hops but wrapped in cigarette, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, relatively thin, good carbonation; overall: disappointing FRANÇAIS Bouteille brune, 341 ml; oeil : ambré avec des reflets dorés, petite mousse blanche qui laisse un anneau autour du verre, légère effervescence, claire; nez : butterscotch, madère (?), houblon (floral); bouche : commence tout en houblon, un peu de caramel, finale en houblon mais enveloppé de cigarette, légèrement sucrée, moyennement amère, corps moyen, relativement mince, bonne carbonatation; en résumé : décevante

A pale orange beer with an orange head and chunks of sediment floating around. The flavor is of oranges and over ripe fruits. While the flavor is sweet with primary notes of berries. It is very carbonated.

This opened with a resonding POP then proceeded to erupt from the bottle slowly yet determinedly. Huge head falls quickly. MMMM cooked corn aroma. What’s for dinner here?? Cidery, thin, unpleasant paper palate. Not good. It’s been a long time since I’ve poured one.....
Aroma:Cooked vegetable,fruit,garbadge... Appearance:amber good head.. Flavor:this beer was inefected...
Robe orangée aux reflets rouges surmontée d’une mousse beige persistente. Arômes nauséabonds. Citron... Pas de corps...

(341ml bottle) Enormous off-white head atop a clear amber body. Aroma is medium sweet, lemon, herbal. Taste is moderately sweet, sour lemon, some caramel. Light body with hint of stickiness. Can you say infection? I knew you could.

Sampled from bottle at RBSG 2005 post-Cider Tour Sunday Boise is For Lovers tasting. Lemon-butter nose, wow that’s an exciting new sensation!...medium dark amber with basically no head....sour, lactic and grotesque body, hints of malt under the noxious poisonous weeds, vinegar and toxic water...avoid at all costs.

Bottle sampled @ RBSG 05’ (Montréal) Post-Cidery Impromptu Hotel Room TastingThar she blows! This was quite the gusher to watch. Copper color, noce of diacetyl and monkey hair. The flavor is unattractive, inspires sanity. Finishes, bad, bad, bad.

Rancid butter aroma. Opaque brown-amber with lots of floaties. Caramel, butterscotch floral and stale cardboard flavour is marginally better than the aroma. Medium light body with light, fizzy carbonation that evaporates as you look at the glass. Obviously a bad bottle, but other ratings don’t inspire me to seek out a second tasting. Sampled at the post RBSG’05 hotel room tasting.

column1: John Bull Premium Ale / Bitter Ale
column5: Tap @ Fox & Hounds, Åbenrå. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are caramel, fruits, malt, hops and has a slight acidity to it.

column1: John Bull Premium Ale / Bitter Ale
column5: On tap as John Bull Bitter at John Bull Pub in Aalborg. Deep copper coloured body. Filmy layer, clingy lacing. Slightly roasted grainy malts on the nose. Mixed taste of caramel, bread and leafy hops. Bittersweet end. Rounded mouth feel. Decent bitter. (17.08.2017).

column1: John Bull Premium Ale / Bitter Ale
column5: From old tasting notes. Amber orange color. Big rocky white head.mtangy butterscotch malt aroma. Light toasted malt flavor has a mild nutty character. Subtle yet flavorful. Brief mild malty aftertaste.

column1: John Bull Premium Ale / Bitter Ale
column5: Draught, 5.3%. Hazy amber colour. Small stable off-white head. The flavour is grainy and quite dry. Medium bitterness. Slightly high carbonation. A very average beer, but it probably has a broad appeal.

column1: John Bull Premium Ale / Bitter Ale
column5: On tap @ Budavári Sörfesztivál - Clear amber colour with medium off-white head. Subtle caramel and raisin aromas with some biscuit. Taste is caramel, breadcrust, biscuit, some honey and herbal hops. Light body, medium carboation, slick texture, dry finish. Not bad, drinkable.

column1: John Bull Premium Ale / Bitter Ale
column5: On tap at corvin sorfeszt. Clear amber colour small white head. Light malty nose. Taste tipic irish red. Meh.

column1: John Bull Premium Ale / Bitter Ale
column5: amber colour, 1 inch of slightly off-white head; aroma of fruity notes, caramel, biscuit, slight toasty notes; taste of well balanced hoppy bitterness and malty sweetness with minimal hop dominance; correct bitter

column1: John Bull Premium Ale / Bitter Ale
column5: Tap at John Bulls in Budapest, copper with a cream colored head, slightly sweet to start with caramel and honey with a light bitter finish. Good beer.

column1: John Bull Premium Ale / Bitter Ale
column5: pours a beautiful bronze colour with a snow white head. Light and refreshing with a dry bitter finish. A proper session beer!! he he

column1: John Bull Premium Ale / Bitter Ale
column5: Draught @ Fox and Hounds, Aabenraa. Pours clear amber with stable white head. Clear aroma of malt, fruit, and caramel, with touches of hops. Bitter, hoppy flavour, with notes of malt and fruit and touches of nuts. Bitter, slightly rough finish. Not bad.

Bouteille 341ml. De couleur dorée et voilée. Nez de grains de céréales sucrés avec des notes de légumes bouillis sucré, de houblon herbeux (gazon) et des traces de miel. Mince-moyenne en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture légèrement aqueuse. Léger goût de légumes bouillis sucrés lors de l’entrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de céréales sucrées avec quelques traces de miel et de carton mouillé puis en finale l’on retrouve des notes amères de houblon herbeux. Post-goût court, aux notes amères de houblon herbeux.

A light golden lager with a thin dissipating white head. A strong honey oxidized malt, sweet and cloying, In mouth, a dead unpleasant sweet malt, maple notes, but no body. This beer is dead. Old Stock VI evening, March 23 2007.

Bottle from Dépanneur Laurier - marked best before 09/2004! Pours a dark gold hazy body topped with a thin but lasting foamy head. There are also plenty of huge yeasty chunks. Fair malty aroma with some sweet and floral hints. Taste is mostly watery and has a short dry finish. Hopefully, it seems that it has been retired from market.

It's most definitely not an interesting beer, but just didn't seem as bad as below. It pours clear yellow with the usual over-carbonation that manages to make just a shy white head. Aroma is cerealic malt, saazy hay to be more accurate. The taste is grassy malt, carbonated and sweet. Not unpleasant nor pleasant.
yellow, quick dissapating white head. very grainy with some hard candy and honey notes. why was the mona lisa smiling? she wasn't drinking this, I know that for sure.

(Bottle) I must admit that MartinT can place a smell! Aroma of stewed, diced tomatoes with parsley - canned even? Pours near headless; deep amber with small sediment floaties. Slight malt with heavy water. So bad that I'd serve it to my Italian friends... :)

Laborious, overboiled tomatoes in condescending cereal...Limping in water...This "brewer" has supposedly targeted the Italian restaurant market of Montreal and brews almost exclusively for them...Why such an effort? If you can call it effort...

Bouteille 341ml. De couleur ambrée et légèrement voilée. Nez de caramel doux et aux faibles notes rôties avec des notes de houblon herbeux et de miel. Mince-moyenne en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi qu’une texture aux notes aqueuses. Faibles notes de légumes bouillis sucrés lors de l’entrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un moyen goût de caramel très doux aux notes rôties avec des traces de pain mouillé et de miel puis en finale l’on retrouve des notes amères de houblon herbeux. Post-goût court, aux faibles notes amères de houblon herbeux avec des traces rôties.

Bottle, 341 ml, best before July 2003; eye: amber with golden reflections, nice white head that lasts, clear, some lacing; nose: caramelized malt, floral hops, light madeira, lactic, basement, flower; mouth: weakened caramelized malt, nice bitterness, hint of pepper, a bit of basement, finale in bitterness mixed with a little caramel, lightly sweet, mildly bitter, medium body, slightly oily texture, good carbonation; overall: not so bad FRANÇAIS Bouteille, 341 ml, meilleure avant juillet 2003; oeil : ambrée avec reflets dorés, belle mousse blanche qui perdure, claire, un peu de dentelle; nez : malt caramélisé, houblon floral, légère madérisation, lactique, cave, fleur; bouche : malt caramélisé affaibli, amertume, petite pointe de poivre, un peu de cave, finale en amertume avec un léger caramel, légèrement sucrée, moyennement amère, corps moyen, texture légèrement huileuse, bonne carbonatation; en résumé : pas mal

Bouteille de 341 ml achetée 6 mois après la fermeture de la brasserie. Arôme: Odeur de caramel, de fruits avec un léger goût de fumée. Apparence: Couleur ambrée légèrement voilée. Petit col blanc mousseux. Quelques matières en suspension. Fine dentelle sur le verre. Carbonisation moyenne. Saveur: Goût de caramel avec une touche de fruitée. Durée de l’arrière goût moyen. Palette: Corps et texture mince. Carbonisation moyenne. Arrière goût de caramel brûlé. (Rating #98)
Me to friend ’Can you pass the corn’ Friend: ’Nope, there is none left, but I am sure this will do instead’. Me: ’Yup this beer is a great substitute’

It pours very boring almost headless clear pale caramel. Aroma of shy malt and caramel hints. Taste is mostly bland with a slight vegetable hint (parsley, shallot), sweet and watery. No distinctive vienna maltiness, it could be a blonde with colouring, I'd put it under American Dark I guess. Worse than the golden cap one from my perspective.
Golden, light white head. Smokey hints in the nose, some citrus hops and just a bit of sweet malt. The body is sweet with a hint of honey. Lightly smoked with a touch of hops at the end. Too sweet.
Malt aroma, copper, a small cream head. Harsh malt taste, sweet, thin, regular stuff.
Milky, slightly malty aroma, sweet. Sweet but not to complex kind of a malt. Some roasted finish. Aftertaste was slightly better.
Dark orange-amber. Frothy tan head. Malty, mildly peatish aroma. Medium body. Caramel & licorice flavour punctuated by notes of peat & nuts. Sweet finish.

Bronze colour with a fairly thick off-white head. Sweet aroma with a bit of malt. Subtle flavours, definately that of a lager, but fairly nice. Overall a decent beer, fairly subtle tastes and aftertastes though. I sampled this beer at Joey_Capps' on 13-September-2003 in Hamilton, Ontario.
Aroma is herbal and light caramel. Amber color, off-white head, good lace. Light bitter, light sweet and herbal flavor. Long lasting light bitter and dry finish.
Pours a medium golden yellow. Aromas of orange, caramel, and some spice. Flavors are sour, orange, clove and other spice.

Notes from early 90s. 25 clbottle from Slaghmuylder, 6%. Aroma’s of malts/grains, slightly sweet, fruity, herbs/spices. Flavor: quite neutral, grainish. Light bodied. Finishes, malty/grainy first, then moderate bitter. Nice.

One of those beers the famed beer shop Hopduvel in Ghent commissions at Van Steenberge. An orange blond bear with stable, off-white head and fruity, estery and yeasty profile, a bit thin mouthfeel seen its strength and dry finish with warming and somewhat wry alcohol. A side by side tasting with Van Steenberge’s own Piraat and Boucanier beers would seem interesting - but in any case, this Stropken clearly bears the Van Steenberge stamp.

20/VII/14 - 25cl bottle from De Bierloods/Zytholoog (Adegem) @ home - BB: n/a (nothing on the label or cap) (2014-826) Clear dark orange to amber beer, big fizzy aery light beige head, pretty stable, adhesive. aroma: bit dusty, oxidized, sherry notes, orange peel, some almonds, cardboard. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: bit sourish, orange peel, some caramel, sugary, little metallic. Aftertaste: bit malty, oxidized, sherry, orange peel, sweet, pretty metallic.
Clear blond, white head. Honey and hops in aroma. Liht body, good carbon. Bitter taste. Hops and quina on palate, purely bitter and hints of orange peel. Bitter aftertaste. B@H
bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts fruits and spicy flavor malts fruits spicy and some hops

(25cl bottle thanks to bu11zeye) Cloudy light orange with head like slightly whipped egg whites. The aroma is of oranges, rose water, strawberry candy, peaches. Taste is lemon, bitter lettuce. Highly carbonated, dry and light bitterness on the sides of the mouth.
bottle thanks to bu11zeye. poured clear yellow with a fluffy white head. aroma was citrus, and light grain. flavor was lemon, spice, and pepper. body was light with high carbonation.

(25cl bottle thanks to bu11zeye) clear yellow with a lasting film of white bubbles. Nose of melon, earth, rhubarb, smells quite odd. Taste of melon, spicy, watery, Belgian yeast, tons of spices. Long duration and very carbonated.

Bottle @ De Hopduvel in Gent Belgium: Hazy yellow colour, with creamy big White head. Aroma is domintated of fruits, flowers citrus. Flavor is is yeasty,fruity and lots of sweet maltynes, Medium citrus finish. Medium body.
Old rating, @ Demevallei, Aarschot. Hazy brown colour, beige foam. Sweet plums, chocolate, some anise. Rather tasty brown beer.

Bottle at De Heeren van Liedekercke, shared with Anke and Pieter. Pours cloudy dark brown (almost black) with a small, off-white head. The aroma contains brown sugar, caramel, dark chocolate, licorice, malt, some spices. It tastes medium to heavy sugary sweet (and this does not contain candi sugar?) and light spicy bitter. Some warming alcohol. Medium body, slick/sticky texture, fizzy carbonation. Remarkable how this doesn't become really cloying, but remains quite tasty.

Une robe brun foncé, opaque. Un col de mousse très court, écumeux, beige. Nez très lacté, chocolat au lait, glace vanille, notes légère de fruits secs. Bouche très fidèle au nez avec une dominance de chocolat au lait, cocoa très forte. Caramel, toffee. Très légère amertume houblonnée en soutien d’une bouche ample, douce, gourmande. Texture assez épaisse, presque laiteuse. Alcool très masqué. Brune très ronde, gourmande, dessert au chocolat, mais pas sur le sucre candi ni les fruits confits.

Bottle @ De Heeren van Liedekercke. Hazy red brown with a lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, nutty and roasted malt. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish. 190317

Bottle sample from backlog notes shared by Tmoney99. Pours a slightly hazy reddish brown color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have sweet malts, caramel, molasses, dark fruits, raisins, earthy, spices, interesting.

Appearance: Dark brown, seems clear. Ok amount of tan head. Aroma: Dark malt, perfume. Some dark fruit. Taste: Dark brown, dark fruit, quite sweet. Pretty smooth. Bought: Trade with tderoeck - thanks!, 330 ml Info: 15/7-2016, 66/100, BB: 30/11-2015v
Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl. @ Cerveceria Internacional, Sevilla, España. A: Dark brown / marron oscuro. T/S: Malt, caramel, yeast, raisins / Malta, caramelo, levadura, uvas pasas.
Bottle shared. Hazy brown with barely any head. Aroma of malt, nutty notes, light raisin, yeast and caramel. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Very thin off white head. Hazy amber pour. malty aftertaste

Bottle at home. Aroma is malt, yeast, raisins, caramel, fruity notes, nuts, some brown sugar and dark chocolate, a certain spicy note. Flavour is medium sweet with a surprisingly bitter finish. Medium bodied. Very nice, I like how the bitterness compliments the sweet flavour.

Bottiglia. Il naso riconosce indizi di orzo. L'intensità olfattiva è normale e la maniera in cui permane è sufficiente. Il mantello birroso superiore è caratterizzato da una schiuma dalla buona tenuta. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Il liquido è di apparenza velata e anche qui la grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine, con carbonazione allegra e vivace. Il colore è giallo dorato brillante. Il corpo è rotondo. L'amaro è nella media. La forza gustativa è normale e si prolunga in modo sufficiente. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di facile beva. Il finale è semplice e dissetante. Il retrogusto è di decente intensità. Sulla lingua si percepiscono sentori di miele, crosta di pane, cereali, erba e agrumi.
Bottle @ home Dark copper, cream head quickly fading Light chestnut, honey, caramel, sugar An anonymous beer...

Bottle 330ml BBE 2013 (Saveur) Deep amber-copper color, good creamy white head. Mostly cardboardish-papery aroma. Medium-bodied. Sweetish, some odd milky twist, cardboardish. Sweetness covers alcohol, but late burning notes. Past its prime, don’t know if it was any good younger.

Bottle 33cl, a clear amber beer with good head. Nose is on barley sugar and grain. Aroma is nice, smoked malt, red fruit, toasted notes, good, surprised to get a smoked beer from corsica, light metallic notes at the finish with again nice smoked touch.
bottle from Saveur-Biere. Clear amber colour with a red glow. Full-bodied, good malty base, quite tobust with a sharp hoppy touch. Interesting and quite nice.

Small bottle. Gift from Gitte, brought home from Bergamo, Italy, actually. Low grey-shaded blond head. Brownish red body with good clarity. Clean and dry, toasted malt aroma. Herbal and tobacco-like notes from the chestnut added, both in aroma and flavor. Medium full, fairly sweet malt body. Alcohol is noticable, not disturbing. Slick texture. Medium strong body. Finishes drier than the initial flavor. Not an archetype Vienna, yet a tasty and interesting one.

Bouteille de 330 ml. Nos yeux observent une bière de couleur orangée et un col modeste. Au nez on découvre des arômes de céréales et de levure. En bouche le corps est moyen avec une effervescence moyenne. On goûte des saveurs de levure un peu fruitée, de grain avec une présence d’alcool.
ambrata non intensa leggera caastanga finale leggermenter amaro riscaldante

Oggi in Antica Latteria in Via San Luca, vedo passando che hanno la Pietra Strong; siccome non la trovo spesso in giro, ho deciso di fermarmi (avevo mezz’oretta) e bermi una birretta in santa pace. La Pietra Strong è una birra molto semplice, con carattere poco interessante e un calore alcolico elevato, che mette in ombra anche il sentore di caldarroste della sua controparte normale; esso si manifesta nel pieno delle sue potenzialità soltanto nel retrogusto.

Bottled 0,33L. Creamy and compact head, good adhesion and duration. Scorched dark red color, much fizzy and lightly load. Determined alcohol scent, toasted malt, dry wood and ash. Prickly and harmonious taste. Overbearing bitter with decided hoppy notes. Balanced end, a lot smoked and balmy. Amazing. Thanks to CEZ for this beer.

Date: 09/04/1997 Source: Brewpub cloudy yellow, light citrus aroma, sweet malt flavor with subtle hints of citrus and clove, just a touch of bitterness Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

Medium gold color. Medium head. Aroma is malty and slightly sweet. A medium bodied hefeweizen. Malts are fruity and slightly sweet. Hops are slightly spicy and mild. Not your typical hefe, it has a lot of hop bite to it and not much of the banana and clove flavor. Nice balance. Smooth flavor. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is slightly bitter.

Mildly opaque, straw colored and a tiny white head. Light and zesty nose, wheat and some sewwt fruitiness. Light, refreshing and clean. Pretty wel hopped, but hey it is the PNW. Nice, well drawn out finish. Lively carbonation and just a bit of cloying.
Opened bottle and there goes the foam! Poured to a Hazey dark orange color leaving behind a smell of a rich coco. Taste almost earthy and a hint of some citrus fruits.

Hazy dark amber color with a medium frothy white head that diminished slowly with fair lacing. Modeate citrus hoppy aroma and hint of chocolate. Medium body. Medium bitter flavor with a medium biiter finish of moderate duration

Bottle opened with a load hiss and poured with a huge head, like the whole glass was head. Pours a lightly hazy amber with golden notes and a huge foamy off white head. Aroma of grapefruit, pine, caramel, cardboard and nuts, some citrus. Flavor of grapefruit, bitter hops, probably the most extreme hop bitterness I have experienced. Also getting some pine and other mixed citrus notes, caramel and some toffee. Very tingly mouthfeel. I think some infection may have set in on this one. But still ended up being a decent IPA.

Picked up a single 12-oz bottle at Three Cellars in St Francis, Wisconsin. Pours a semi-hazy golden orange brew with a thick and lumpy off-white head that slowly dissipates and stays thick throughout. Aroma of citrus zest, a touch of oranges, mild caramel malt and a touch of toffee. Taste is medium bodied, well-carbonated with flavors of light caramel and apricot flavored malts, grapefruit and lemon zest with some toffee. Finish is semi-bitter that quickly disappears to a mild APA light bitterness.
DLD. Pours a clear orange. Bitter and quite hoppy. Hints of plant sap and resin. Medium to light bodied. Long bitter finish. Medium carbonation. OK

Poured a volcanically effervescent amber with a voluptuous frothy white head that would not stop erupting. Had to place the bottle in the sink and pour it over a duration of several minutes. Nice initial aroma of pine and grapefruit rind with a bit of sweetness. Taste follows with dry notes of rind, grass and a bit of bitter earthiness with a touch of toffee sweetness. Slightly spicy. Extremely bubbly body gives it almost a hoppy-tripel feel. While it is likely that the foam phenomenon was more due to the bottle’s age than its intended construction, I must admit it added a bit of liveliness to what could have been otherwise a forgettable beer.

pours dark apricot, no head. sweet grapefruit aroma. the taste has a certain hoppy bitterness, with citrus flavors. finishes bitter. my reaction to this relatively simple IPA is "nice. what can i say?"

Had to wait for this one. I guess they ran out, but two weeks later it was on tap. Not a big IPA, maybe a little conservative, especially with the hop choice. I like a little more body, too, and this one seemed a little thin, more like a regular pale ale than an IPA. I don’t know; just so-so for me.
Nice hoppy scent, but not enough in the actual beer. Still, you could probably grab a six pack of this for a good night.

Date: 03/29/2006 Mode: Bottle Source: Trade opaque orange, thin fine off white head, sweet citrus aroma with sweet carmel malt and lots of grapefruit character, slightly thin body, big bitter hop flavor with a long bitter finish Aroma: 8/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 4/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.8/5.0 Drinkability: 6/10 Score: **/4
From notes. Had this on a Nile cruise with Charlie. Pours brown with a thin head. Some caramel. For what is available in Egypt this was very drinkable.

I was told that this beer has replaced Sakara Premium. I never expected to find such a good beer in Egypt. Dark golden colour with a very fine head. Nice hoppy aroma with herbal notes. The flavour is bitter and hoppy with intersting spicy and herbal notes. It is also very refreshing. If you go to Egypt: Drink Sakara Classic!

Sampler at the brewpub in Boerne, Texas. ~ 4 oz pour. Pour is cloudy muddy black brown with really no head. What exists is light tan. Aroma is soft coffee, roasted malt and pine hops. Fresh nose. Taste is gentle fresh coffee roastiness, blended nicely with the roasted malt and bright spruce and pine hop notes. Really nice integration and balance. Finish is mineral chalky, residual and lasting. Yum. Palate is medium to full bodied, carbonation is light and fine giving the beer a really soft feel. I really liked this beer.

It’s the only blender on the block that can puree a brick .. Looks like flat coke .. medium bitterness.. nice whiffs of coffee pot and used grounds .. . touch of spritz .. . low lacing, low foam .. . good but needs to be fuller and more coffee .. . and more cowbell..
Draught at the brewpub Dark brown color. Nice coffeish aroma. The flavor as well is very much like a coffee, with a good roasted aftertaste, not too dry. Alcoholic coffee, not bad.
Dark as night with that nitro look. Wonderful roasted coffee flavors with touch of chocolate. Very creamy and flavorful.

Another wonderful beer from the DD stable. This stout is much like the Porter in flavor, but Nitrogenated and more bold in character. A welcome addition, I will be enjoying plenty of this. If your a coffee lover you will love this stout...
Milky white head with unmistakable coffee flavors. A bit watery for my tastes, but still very good.

From Apr 2008 I got this at LiquorMax in Ft Collins, Co. This pours a clear very bright amber gold(2008) with a 2 finger head of foam. Very good head retention and some very nice lacing. The smell is of floral hops with a big dose of grapefruit, some fruit, and some sweet malt hiding in the background. The taste has the grapefruit right up front with some bready notes and some caramel malt sitting on the side and giving some balance and actually ends up dominating the finish. There's also quite a bit of fruitiness to this DIPA that adds both bitterness and sweetness to the overall flavour. Mighty nice this one. Pretty darned easy drinking as well. With this one, the taste is much better than the smell would indicate. It has a medium to medium light mouthfeel and the carbonation is fairly lightly done. Another very nice, very tasty, very drinkable brew from Full Sail. Imagine that! Cost: US$3.41 What a bargain!!

Bottle 12 ounce bottle poured to wine glass Amber, appears clear, big white foam that slowly disappears Smell: hoppy but not as hoppy as other northwest IPA Taste: bitter Feel: good carbonation, good follow through, dry finish, bitter aftertaste Overall: very good beer with nice aroma, balance taste drank: Wednesday, May 03, 2017 6:03 PM

Pours a slightly hazy golden amber color with a cream colored off white head. The aroma is hop resin, pine, citrus, and rye. The flavor is pine, hop resin, pepper, and rye. The mouthfeel is medium, as well as, the drinkability.
Orange color with white head. Aroma contains citrus and pine. The flavor is bitter with some pine and orange. This is very dry for an IPA but I like it. Overall nice!

Slightly hazy copper wth a lasting off white rocky cap. Big balanced aroma between sticky piney and floral and orange rind hops with a big pale malt and slight caramel maltiness. Big stern but balanced flavor that leans floral and citrusy but is malty and full and biscuity enough to back it up. A little standard but damn tasty, full and balanced.
Bottle. Pours a rather hazy amber color with a moderate off white head on there. Nose is grassy and stale. Taste is oddlt Sweet. Not great.
Clear gold with a lot of fine carbonation and moderate head. Malts are buiscity with some toffee. Hops are citrus, pine, herbs with a dry finish. Nice. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear orange copper with creamy off white head leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is dank and tropical fruit. Medium mouth, juicy hop, dank, lingering resin finish, very good.

Pours clear coppery amber with a thick and rather persistent pale buff head. Aroma delivers a strong note of resiny and slightly woody hops, as well as orange and grapefruit notes. Bold flavor ramps up these tones and adds more wood, as well as notes of malt and pear. Finish has just a hint of spice, while body is firm and smooth yet fizzy and lively. Slip one down your throat - you will knot regret it.
Gold. White head. Drinks like a mild beer with medium light body and full bitterness. Not really an imperial.

Golden copper body with a thin white head. Complex nose, initially alcoholic, but unfolds a vast array of hop notes, primarily citrucy, spicy and fruity followed by a flaked barley hint and some caramel malts. Tasted equally complex. Dry finish. Lacks a bit in body, cleans up too quickly. It makes me want another sip right away. Exceptional complexity and decent balance.

*Best before 03.06.10. Mild-weicher Antrunk. Schöne Karamell- und Bananenaromen im Hauptteil, Nelke, Gewürze. Kaum Herbe, schön weich und hefig-süffig. Schokoladig-Karamelliger Nachgeschmack mit schöner Nelkig-Bananiger Hefe. Lecker.
bottle, kindly delivered by MoritzF! Cloudy brown colour, mid-sized off-white to beige head. Malty, slightly wheaty with caramel and chocolate. Shy fruity sourness in the background.
Bottle. Caramel malt, banana and clove aroma. Cloudy dark brown color with nice tan head. Tangy, sweet toffee malt, clove and banana flavor. Nice body. Nice wheat taste - subdued esters/spices.

It’s hazy, almost unclear dark brown with a huge, creamy head. The aroma has light notes of clove, caramel, yeast and weak banana. The flavor is moderately sweet with notes of clove, caramel and very light banana. It ends quite spicy and with a light bitterness. It’s rather different from most of this style.

Bottle 50cl. @ [ Fastelavns Tasting Ulfborg ]. Unclear medium brown color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, caramel, moderate yeasty, banana. Flavor is moderate sweet and light light bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium to light, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20090221]
Cloudy dark amber with a big and creamy off-white head. Spicy cookie-like aroma with strong clove. Dry-ish spicy flavour.

Dark brown colored with red hints. Little light brown head. Chocolaty and slightly roasted aroma with some grainy tone. Medium bodied. Flavor is similar with grains still, some chocolate here too. Well, basic dunkelweizen.
Bottle, 5.2%. Weak banana aroma. Cloudy dark brown colour. Good stable tan head. The flavour starts off with some banana, turns roasted, but mild. Good mouthfeel.

Bottle 50 cl. Clear dark brown with an orange hue and a small off-white head. Sweetish aroma of overripe fruit, burned caramel and yeast. Medium body with sweetish banana and burned caramel. Very soft mouthfeel. A whiff of phenols. Discreet bitterness. Very pleasant. 011108
bottled, at home in the evening, body chocolate brown, head is very strong. off-brown, aroma is majorly yeast, taste is clasic hefeweizen with caramelly note (very weak), all in all quite OK
On tap at marleys in phoenix... reddish clear pour.. nit much head.. sone kight hopps ..just ok
Orange-gold pour with a foamy head. Sweet malt and citrus hops are the features of this somewhat middle of the road pale ale.

Tap at Cooperstown Phoenix. Pours an orange yellow color with a small white head. Aroma is malty sweet with little to no hops present. flavor is malty sweet and thin with very light hops in the finish. Nothing special.
Ugh, flavor to me was stale, hops & malt very sub-par. You call this a pale ale? I call it Stale Ale

On tap in a plastic cup. No points docked for that. The color was that of an Arizona sunset with the discoloration of the polution creating an almost orangish/pink hue. At least thats how it looked to me in the cup. There was a shallow puddle sized creamy froth. Reminiscent of an AZ rain. Medium nectar with nice mellow effers. Aroma was light with fruity flowers. Flavors are real easy going, bright and fruity with a nice bittering on the finish. A perfect sessionable Pale Ale for the hot days of AZ. I had a few cups of this. I highly recommend it.

Went to Coopers Town Phoenix just before going to see smackdown judgment day<!-- BR --> This beer was served to me in a plastic cup! WTF!..Dark amber with no head or lacing. Light, watery sweet aroma with a light hop and sweet malt flavor and watery body. Did I say this beer was served to me in a plastic cup!? WTF. A bit to sweet for my taste... I wouldnt order another but the two foot hotdogs were good.
On tap at Cooperstown. Very little hop aroma or flavor.with medium bitterness. Little disappointed in this pale ale. Lacking in malt and hops.

Tap, Alice Cooperstown in Phoenix. Had a medium hop aroma. Darker golden color with small off white head. Well balanced flavor with some mild malty sweetness and some hop flavor as well. Smooth easy drinking beer to have with your dinner.

I drank this beer at Alice Cooper’stown Restaurant in Cleveland. It has a nice color, smell, and poured with a good head. The beer cover’s the palate well. You can taste a hint of spice, and some sweetness. The aftertaste is smooth with no bitterness. A very good beer. I wish they sold it in bottles for the home.
A pretty decent version of a pale ale. Brewed by Four Peaks for Alice Cooper'stown club in Phoenix. You have to go there anyway, it is even a bonus that they have their own decent beer!

column1: Trafalgar Prince Of Wales Cream Ale
column5: Tall nice bottles that block light. Not widely available Average for the brewery and this style, which is a big notch up from national brands. Satisfying pour and taste.

column1: Trafalgar Prince Of Wales Cream Ale
column5: May 2001 - another decent offering from Trafalgar... Big smooth head on it. Goes down easy. Could use a touch more hops for my tastebuds but its an enjoyable beer.

column1: Trafalgar Prince Of Wales Cream Ale
column5: For a cream ale, this beer wasn't too bad. Perhaps the ambiance of the Price of Wales Hotel helped. As for the details: clear amber w/ a finger of off-white foam; mildly malty nose w/ a light spiciness; light body; Mild malt flavour but balanced (for the style) toward its earthy, hoppy finish.

column1: Trafalgar Prince Of Wales Cream Ale
column5: Golden-orange colour, slightly hazy, with a respectable but short lived white head. Aroma is mild, malty and slightly fruity. Body is on the light side, and not as creamy as the style should be. Flavour isn't bad, but seems to lack direction - it's kinda malty, kinda fruity, kinda bitter, but none of the flavours really come together. And the finish is somewhat sour.

column1: Trafalgar Prince Of Wales Cream Ale
column5: Aroma of melted plastic. A bit cloudy yellow with almost no head. Sour, slightly malty ale.

column1: Trafalgar Prince Of Wales Cream Ale
column5: Aroma was hoppy and sweet malt. It was golden in colour with a thick head that lasted for a bit and was a pillowy light straw colour. There was sediment in the last part of the bottle, I supect that wasn't supposed to be there. There was more sweet malt in the flavour then anything else. Little bitter and little hops. I didn't find this beer mild or pale as the style suggests. I found it more rich and dark. I'm getting the impression that this beer style varies quite a bit. Someone else who rates this let me know.

I can't overstate how impressed with this beer I am. For the most part, I try to stock up on Great Divide Hibernation and Great Lakes Christmas around the holidays. Unfortunately, it's been hard to find "enough" of either near Philadelphia. Based on the can and the description, I decided to give this a try. I have to say that it's right up there, and very similar to, Hibernation. It's very malty with just enough hops to make it interesting, beautiful caramel color. The head is a beautiful tan with dark ruby body. Taste is caramel, vanilla with notes of chocolate chip cookie. I won't pass this up next year.

DATE: January 3, 2018... OCCASION: Thursday on a short week--can't beat that... GLASSWARE: Mad Elf snifter... pours a dark purplish body rife with barnacles of bubbles... its head is a brief surf of off-white rush that settles to a nondescript pencil-thin rim... deep plum and berry are released early, with hints of boozy bourbon wood and thick roasted malts... syrupy thick, moderately lively, intensely warming, and mildly alcoholic... it's agreeable enough to mask its weight... a woody pulp pervades, with cherry, vanilla, rum, and medicinal varnish... caramel comes late... this is bold, biting with its heft and malt... Lancaster runs out a reasonable example of this style, though its flavor profile is not as diverse as some better offerings...
Caramel, coffee, chocolate, and roasted malts are in the nose and taste. Very smooth at 9% and certainly a sippin beer. Love the wolf label design, too. Cheers!

Pours brown, amber with a tan head and an aroma of caramel and malt. Tastes of sweet caramel, wood and malt upfront with a moderately bitter body and finish of hops. The alcohol is fairly well hidden within the sweet malt and hops with a hint in the finish. It’s medium to full bodied with moderate carbonation. Based on the appearance and aroma, I was expecting a scotch ale-like taste but it is much different. I’m a big fan of a caramel, malt backbone and this balances well with the hops and further adds to the complexity with some wood and does deliver as a big beer. The wood and resinous hops make this an earthy beer. This is well done!

Bottle. Pours clear reddish brown with large spongy beige head, spicy caramel malt aroma, adequate carbonation, bitter caramel malt taste with cinnamon and cloves, thin body, long spicy bitter finish. A bitter one.

3/2/18 Had watching Secret Life w/ Abby. Ortho shelf today and a blizzard on her way home. Poured from bottle. Dark red brown with small head. Smell is big spicy caramel malt. Dark and somewhat fruity. Taste follows with huge caramel malt flavor. Lots of warm spice rounds it out. Slightly sweet with some bitterness. Reminds me of fezziwig but a lot bigger. Medium palate with lots of spice on the finish. Big, warm and a bit boozy. Overall I love it! Perfect beer for a cold winter day watching movies with a cat in your lap. Reminds me of Old Fezziwig on steroids. Also, it’s incredible with fresh oatmeal chocolate chip cookies!! Wonderful and I’ll have it again next winter!
Smells of spice and wood with a murky Amber coloring. Initial taste is wheat with aftertaste of spices (nutmeg cinnamon). Nice winter treat!
Bottle. Opaque brown color with light tan head and lacing. Nose of bready malt with raisin notes. Bready with fruit notes (raisins) and some alcohol in the finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle. Pours a dark brown with a reddish hue. Large khaki head. Aromas of leather, nuts, and chocolate. Flavor is woody, a little bitter, dark chocolate, other heavy malts, roasty and earthy notes, dark berries. Medium to heavy body. Little carbonation. A little spice and a little smoke. Warming alcohol finish.

Pours a dark cloudy caramel with a white head that shows good lacing in the glass. Aroma of sweet malts and maple syrup slightly smoked. Sweet upfront with an earthy bitterness to offset slightly. Full creamy mouthfeel. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a mahogany color with a thin white head. Aroma is caramel and biscuit malts. Flavor is sweet caramel, nut, and biscuit. Has a smooth feel with soft carbonation. I enjoyed this.
On tap at brewery. Headless dark red pour. Most distinctly tasting of bread on ends of sips. Pretty decent.

Krueger’s Alt, on tap at ROB. Brown body with a thin buff head. Earthy, caramely nose. Sweet body, toasty and leafy, with heavy emphasis on brown sugar notes. Not enough earthiness or bitterness to pierce the sugars.
Tap: light amber with no head. Lots of caramel in aroma and flavor. Tiny hop presence in finish. Very clean easy drinking beer.
on draft at the brewery. amber color, woody tannic caramel flavors with some american-style hopping. definitely better than decent but not mind-blowing. have the euphoriAle first.

Red amber, with a thinnish white head which lasted despite being smaller in size. Large nose, mostly fruity hops, pine balanced out well an equally large malt nose. Sweet and slightly bitter flavors mixed well together, caramel malts, light hops, sugar sweetness rounded out the flavors. Lacing left let me know where each sip started and ended.

Tap. Reddish amber colored. Nice retentive white head and fair lacing. Malty aroma with a bit of hop balance on the nose. Sweetish notes of caramel seem to predominate the nose. Clean tasting, malt stands out with caramel and honey flavors. Decent.

Ruddy copper color with a soapy beige head. Malts, malts, and more malts in the aroma. Some licorice, honey, alcohol. Nice complexity with the grains, and the hops are strong enough to provide a fine counterpoint. Some noticable butterscotch flavors. It is a warming brew and a perfect accompaniment to the snow storm outside.
Bottle. Red brown color with beige head. Aroma - Caramel, sweets, nuts and raisins. Malty flavour with nuts.

How: Draught. Where: De Prael Proeflokaal, Amsterdam. Appearance: Amber colour with a tan head. Aroma: Caramel, sweet malt. Body: Full bodied, good carbonation. Flavour: Alcohol, caramel, yeast. Bitter finish.
Dark brown/black color, with a thick creamy head. Aroma is full and sweet chocolate malty, but not very complex. Sweet taste, chocolate malty. Bit dry and sharp alcoholic palate.
From Voldby, DK. Bottled, 150712. Amber with white head. Aroma of yeast and alcohol. Flavour with fruit and malt
Bottle@home, 0.50cl. Brown head. Hazy, brown color. Aroma hops, malt. Taste sour, metal. Palate dry, sour. Overall heavy.
Sweet, appley aroma. Dark, murky brown in color with an effervescent off-white head. Complex dry fruit, buttery (diacetyl?) ...a solid quad with a slightly dry finish.

pitch black with a good solid white head... Aroma has some hints of (cheap) whisky, there’s some peat/smoke and some coffey taste has coffey and liquorish, finish is short, bitter but warming Body is disapointingly light, it’s pretty high on gass though... Ok beer
Draught. Dark, red-black body, medium beige head. Aroma a bit weak, like rye bread. Taste a bit of cherry, dark, very sweet, good finish.

On tap at Wildeman in Amsterdam, November 2010. Vintage 2009. Hazy dark brown with a nice creamy tan head. Aroma of malt, dried fruit and caramel. The taste was too boozy, also a bit stale. Not exactly impressive.

Bottle: Amber to deep amber coloured, hazy, some floaties visible, smaller off-white head with a little lace; sweet roasty-coffeeish nose with a sweet-fruity background; moderate to solid sweet flavour with only a light bitterness, nearly full bodied; sweet toasty and coffeeish finish, dried fruits underneath & a little bitterness in the aftertaste. At last a non-infected brew from De Prael ! too sweet, nevertheless....

column4: Grumpy Troll Brewery, Restaurant and Pizzeria
column5: Black pour from 22oz bottle. At Lakehouse. Bottle from the brewery. Tons of foamy off white head. Graham cracker and malty. Cocoa. Decent stout

column4: Grumpy Troll Brewery, Restaurant and Pizzeria
column5: On tap at the source for ck1’s birthday. The end of the family holiday weekend, extended. Poured a very dark brown with a bit of a white head. Nice lacing. Aroma has a lot of chocolate, caramel and a bit of roast. Taste follows; chocolatey with some caramel malts and some roast. Perhaps a bit thin. Quite tasty with no alcohol presence. Finishes nicely bitter-sweet. 14.4

column4: Grumpy Troll Brewery, Restaurant and Pizzeria
column5: black color witha dark tan head. Great aromas of coffee, chocolate, and roasted malts. Flavor is of chocolate cake, coffee, and rich roasted malts. This brew has a wonderful roasted malt aftertaste that just lasts and lasts. This is a great brew

column4: Grumpy Troll Brewery, Restaurant and Pizzeria
column5: Draft at a sampling event. From notes. Coffee and chocolate with a little vanilla. Not too bad.

column4: Grumpy Troll Brewery, Restaurant and Pizzeria
column5: Has some nice coffee scents and has a nice black pour with fading head. Taste is a pleasant coffee taste with a little bitter roast finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column4: Grumpy Troll Brewery, Restaurant and Pizzeria
column5: 22 ounce bottle that poured a dark black color with a tan frothy head. Aromas of roasted coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate, and some cream. Flavors are the same as the aroma, they blended nicely and was a real good stout overall, I wish I had more.

column4: Grumpy Troll Brewery, Restaurant and Pizzeria
column5: Thirsty Troll Brew Fest. Pour is black with a tan head. Aroma shows dark chocolate, coffee, and moderate roast. Flavor shows the same with cocoa powder and dark fruit notes appearing from time to time. Overall body is full and finishes with some nice roasted bitterness as well as a touch of alc.

column4: Grumpy Troll Brewery, Restaurant and Pizzeria
column5: On tap at brewpub, has a very dark apperance with a creamy white head, overall it was light on the aroma and the taste both, some notes of chocolate and coffee just not enough, has a thin mouthfeel.

column4: Grumpy Troll Brewery, Restaurant and Pizzeria
column5: The Dan Journal #341. Tasted 3/28/10. 220z bomber. Pitch opaque hue with a khaki head. Aromas of chalky cocoa dust and dark chocolate. Good malty nose. Full bodied with a thick body and a great rolling palate. Flacors of dark chocolate and bitter coffee. Great flow with great flavors. Good chocolate flavor but still has a dry finish. Nice drinking with a ton of chocolate.

column4: Grumpy Troll Brewery, Restaurant and Pizzeria
column5: Picked this beer up at WHole Foods in Madison, WI. Apparently they are starting to distribute which is great. Pours a black color with a nice tan head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Flavor is somewhat sweet and smooth. Good beer!
Caramel, malty aroma with no discernible hops. Malty sweet flavor with some caramel and some lemon undertones. Very mild and pleasant, but uninteresting.
Reddish brown body with small creamy head. Aroma is sweet caramel, toasty, malty. Taste is creamy, medium sweet, caramel, hint of roastiness. Some mild hops, but, as it should be, it's a malty beer.
One of the better porters I have had. Deep black body with a moderate tan head. Roasted start with a slightly hoppy finish.
Nice black body with small tan head. Aroma is mildly sweet and roasty bitter. Taste is strongly roasty, coffee bitter, pleasing malty, finishes with decent bitterness. Full body.

column1: Dodging Duck Old Speckled Duck ESB
column5: On tap. Dark brown and filtered. Nose none as served way too cold. Taste of mild maltiness and light hops. Very drinkable and smooth. Good take on an English style ESB.

column1: Dodging Duck Old Speckled Duck ESB
column5: Nice take on an ESB by a small brewery/restaurant. Since I don’t have the brewer next to me, I can say it was pretty good--but I would still prefer a Fuller’s to this.

column1: Dodging Duck Old Speckled Duck ESB
column5: Draught at the brewpub, as Old Speckled Duck ESB Cloudy amber color with a brown-green hue. The aroma is light, with malt. Good mouthfeel, strong malt sensation, mellow, strong hopping, quite aromatic. A very good American Pale Ale.

column1: Dodging Duck Old Speckled Duck ESB
column5: As with most everything at the Dodging Duck, this was very good. Using my new rating scale, I would have this again.

column1: Dodging Duck Old Speckled Duck ESB
column5: Great malt taste with a hoppy finish. I could drink this beer all day, but I like to try the others as well.

column1: Dodging Duck Old Speckled Duck ESB
column5: As with legion242, the brewer was sitting right next to me. He’s not much of a talker, but his ESB is very good. Nice malt flavor.

column1: Dodging Duck Old Speckled Duck ESB
column5: Good rust color; nice malt nose. Very close match to Fuller’s ESB. Hard to rate with the brewer sitting next to you, but good nevertheless.

column1: Dodging Duck Old Speckled Duck ESB
column5: Caramel and toffee malt (L); floral and earthy hops (L); a hint of plums. Deep copper to plum body. Moderately sweet, lightly acidic flavor becomes a lightly acidic, moderately bitter finish. Medium body, watery texture, average carbonation. The bottom line is: the hops are great on this beer! I would love to taste more caramel malt though.

column1: Dodging Duck Old Speckled Duck ESB
column5: A nitrogen pushed ESB?? Very interesting, very original. Let this puppy sit for a bit til it warms.....then enjoy. Very smooth and easy to drink, malty flavor as expected, bitter hop finish. The nitro gave it a cask-like mouthfeel and taste. Good work!

column1: Dodging Duck Old Speckled Duck ESB
column5: One of the best bitter's this side of the pond. It's now being served up nitrogenated! Being somewhat of a regular, I can tell you this beer is very well received by others. It's a real treat to have such a great Brewhaus just down the road.

column1: Dodging Duck Artful Dodger Barley Wine
column5: Draft. Backlog. Pours ruby red. Nose/taste of caramel, fig, and sweet malts. Medium body.

column1: Dodging Duck Artful Dodger Barley Wine
column5: Deep Ruby color. VERY thin. No complexity. Terrible, undrinkable. Real disappointment.

column1: Dodging Duck Artful Dodger Barley Wine
column5: Big caramel, toffee and butterscotch malt (H); plums, dates, madeira, cask wood; floral hops (L). Deep plum-ruby body with no carbonation. Moderately sweet flavor becomes a moderately sweet, lightly bitter finish. Medium-full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. The bottom line is: two years of aging has brought a pleasant softness to this beer. Quite the sipping beer as it is much like an aged fine whisky.

column1: Dodging Duck Artful Dodger Barley Wine
column5: Ray was kind enough to seve me some of this stuff out of a growler before I left. Hops, grapes, and yeast in the nose. Flavor was very full and rich....came together very nicely and masked the 9.5% exquisitely. More balanced than the barleywine brewed 30 minutes up HWY 281 from Dodging Duck.

column1: Dodging Duck Artful Dodger Barley Wine
column5: I had never had Barley wine until the Brewmiester handed me a taster. I was very impressed, being a port wine drinker, this was right up my alley. A bit strong on the palate ,but very complex. A true after dinner representation of the great beers brewed here...

Coppery red body with small beige head. Aroma is sweet & sticky, malty, almost cloying. Taste is English-style barley wine, very malty medium sweetness, finishes with nice alcohol warming. Minimum bitterness. Some roastiness in finish, almost mocha.

Medium golden, quickly disappearing head. Aroma of corn smothered in yeasty sourdough and honey, along with a spicy aspect that never plays out in the flavor. Very sweet, almost cloying nose. Not any appealing maltiness. Mostly a wheaty adjunct flavor. Lingering lemon-tinged sweetness in the finish.

The beer pours a limpid golden amber color, the head creamy in its texture, the color a bright white, and the head impressive in size and as it dissolves, a fine coating of lace is left to conceal the glass. Nose is malt sweet, buttery, citrus crisp and clean with the start a pleasantly malt sweet, top is fair to middling in its feel. Finish is crisply acidic, hops are persistent in their spicy bite, tart and droughty aftertaste, to be a 100% honest this is the first beer I’ve sampled from them that I liked, the rest were not even worth my time to review.
Hazy straw color. Aroma is mildly sweet, slightly astringent. Some yeast. Taste is medium sweet, full body but not much flavor.

On tap at Thunder Canyon, pours black with a reddish tinge and a small tan head. Aroma brings out toasted malt and a touch of oats. Flavour is quite laid back, with toasted malt, a little chalk and even littler cocoa. Weak on the palate with not much going on. Meh.

On tap at the downtown location. Nose is sweet malts and light roast. Pour is dark brown, off white head. Flavor is rather one-dimensional. Sweet toasted malts. Very thin palate. Watery. It’s one of the most refreshing stouts I’ve ever had. Just needs more of everything.
On draft st the brewpub. Pours cola brown with an ecru head. Light malt nose. Flavors of vinegar and some toasted malt.
Draft at brewpub. Pours black with a thin nitro head that leaves some lacing. Not much going on on the nose. Slight coffee vibe on the tongue. Meh!
(Draught) Pours an opaque black body with a medium brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, molasses, caramel, and cola. Flavor of roasted malt, chocolate, and coffee.

On tap at the brewpub (nitro pour). Pours black with a thick tan head. Aroma of sweet malt and roasted malt. Flavor is dry, smooth, with bitter chocolate and light roast. On the bland side but drinkable. 6/4/7/4/14 (3.5/5)
Black pour with tan head and lace. Toasted malt and chocolate aroma. Sweet chocolate malt, light coffee, and a nice malt bitter. Thin and watery almost like a cask ale offering.

On tap at TCB, pour is a nice black.. but being a NE Ohioian I pit this against GLBC BOStout, and this is a poor representation of the name... while not terrible it possesses everything a solid stout should.. its just not outstanding like its counterpart.
on hand pump-pours a foamy light tan head and black color. Aroma is dark malt-roasty, dry, molasses, perfumy. Taste is dark malt-roasty, dry, molasses, perfumy, earthy hops bite.

[Tap] Pours a very dark brown color with a small tan head. Roasted cocoa and charred malts in the aroma. Chocolate, vanilla, thin lactose and sweet oat notes in the taste. Sweet, with a lingering roasted finish. Good mouthfeel/body. Nice and sessionable.

On tap at Real, Wild & Woody Beer Festival, pours a clear golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma brings out considerable piney hops and biscuity malt in good balance. Flavour is infected with diacetyl, along with piney hops and biscuity malt. Shame about the infection. Could be good, but not as is.

Draft - Orange citrus malts with a caramel backbone. Cooper with a decent white head. Pine and resin with a sweet malt backbone. Light orange and spices are also present. Decent and well balanced IPA.

An orange amber ipa with a thin lacing off white head. In aroma, biscuit malt over classic smooth floral hops, grapefruit notes, nice. In mouth, a nice biscuit malt with smooth floral hops, grapefruit pulp, very classic and quaffable. On tap at Broadway location.
On draft at the brewpub in Tucson. Pours a clear copper with an off white head. Dish soap nose. Smooth mouthfeel. Muted fruit hops. Clean finish.

Draft at brewpub. Pours orange with a thin white head. Nice line note on the nose. Tastes of the proverbial pine cine dipped in sugar. (maybe its only a proverb in my head.) nice bitter one the finish. Solid.

On tap at BJs in Tucson, AZ.. Nice floral hop and biscuit malt aromas. Clear medium amber with a white head. Initially very floral hop taste (which I think was accentuated by the spicy shrimp I had right before it), then followed with a pine and citrusy bitterness. Really good deep caramel malt balance with a bit of molasses behind it. Finishes with an earthy bitterness and residual candy sweetness. Very unique and tasty IPA.
On draught at Thunder Canyon. Pours a clear copper color with a thin eggshell head. Darker than I like my IPAs. Taste is sweet caramel malts and bitter citrusy hops. Thin bodied. Ok.

Thanks to Maltajo for driving me to the brewpub! Cask pour with extra dry hops. Pours a hazy gold pour with a thick creamy head. Big resiny citrus pine hops aroma, super fresh. Pungent citrus pine hop combo in the taste, with a thick creamy malt body. Awesome treat!
Cloudy orange pour. Creamy white head. Citrus hops on the nose! Light caramel, crackers. Flavor is loaded with citrus, lemon/lime zest. Creamy wonderful body. Amazing cask ipa!
On tap at brewpub. pretty tasty stuff, pours a darker but still clear golden colour, frothy head that retained for an entire pint, bitterness was nice and up front pretty tasty stuff. good offering

column1: Beer Works Double Vision Belgian Ale
column5: Okay, I was served this by accident the other night but was not upset about it. I would definitely try it again.

column1: Beer Works Double Vision Belgian Ale
column5: Tap. Pours hazy amber with little white head. Smells of oats, rye, earthy, and piney hops. Drinks smoothly with mild lingering hop bitterness. Light to medium bodied. Tastes of toasted oats and earthy hops.

column1: Beer Works Double Vision Belgian Ale
column5: on tap-pours an off white ring for a head and hazy amber/copper color. Aroma is sweet medium malt-caramel, some medium fruit. Taste is sweet medium malt-caramel, some medium fruit, spice hops, hint of banana.

column1: Beer Works Double Vision Belgian Ale
column5: From tap at Canal Street. Pours clear and golden orange with a small off-white head. Aroma is mild spiced and light phenolic. Malty note too. Spiced, phenolic and slight malty. Dry, no real sweetness. Ends phenolic and light bitter.

column1: Beer Works Double Vision Belgian Ale
column5: A hazy reddish amber to copper ale with almost no head. In aroma, a sweet malt with cherry notes, and light solvent. In mouth, an oily sweet candy malt with coriander, warming alcohol, silky. On tap at Lowell BW, Jan. 10 2009.

column1: Beer Works Double Vision Belgian Ale
column5: 2010 Tap. The first Belgian Red that I’ve ever had, this is like your favorite Belgian Golden Ale, except with stronger caramel and malty notes and less hops. Aroma of orange and cinnamon. Tastes of cinnamon and figs with strong carbonation and citrusy hints. A smooth, clean drink that can be quaffed with eagerness.

column1: Beer Works Double Vision Belgian Ale
column5: Draft at Fenway 2/20/09. Pours a dull red color with a small white head. Nose is caramel and sweet, lightly hoppy. Smooth palate. Flavor is sweet with some hop notes and a decent bite.

column1: Beer Works Double Vision Belgian Ale
column5: Served in a tulip glass, with class (does this also save them on ounces doled out?). Rosy bodied and flowery tasteing, like I stuffed my mouth full of a field of wildflowers. Not exactly what I was expecting. Some grape flavor to the brew as well. I liked it, but probably would have liked the flavor influences combination re-jigged a little differently. Crafted well enough that the high ABV doesn’t hit your brain too hard, however.

column1: Beer Works Double Vision Belgian Ale
column5: Light brown with rubu highlights in color and a small off-white head. Aroma of sweet malt,fruit,spice , caramel and brown sugar. Flavors of clove and spice, coyingly sweet with a slick mouthfeel.

column1: Beer Works Double Vision Belgian Ale
