Beforehand there’s sugary candy choc sweetness, blended unevenly with sour hoppy bitterness. Not awful, not briliant, but I’ve had worse. Bittersweet.

Cask conditioned - handpump - NBC Club Northampton. A mid brown coloured bitter which has loads of bitter hoppiness. The aroma is fruity blackberries etc. A very tasty beer which suprised me as Archers do tend to concern themselves with short run beers far too much.
The Oak, Bank, New Forest. Decent enough. Mildly hopped best bitter. Pleasant bramble fruit flavours. A typical Archers beer.
(Cask conditioned, ath the Royal Oak, York, England) Amber colored bitter with a medium white head. Fairly drinkable, yet not overly exciting.

Cask Conditioned, at the Wenlock Arms, London. Amber with a fine white head, possessing a dark reddish hue. Presented as always in good condition. Feeling fuller and richer then its 4.2% ABV would imply, it’s a good ale.

column4: New Belgium Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Decent sized head with light carbonation. Hazy orange in color. Sweet fruity aroma of spiced apples, apricots and floral hops. Very light flavor. Dry and fruity with a slight bitterness. Dry palate which puckers the tongue. I expected more from this.

column4: New Belgium Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Bottle: Hazy amber body with a white head. Aroma is fruit, apple, pear, berries. Flavor is tart apple, pear, mild hops, alcohol, honey-covered grains, apricots. Thin body, bubbly carbonation.

column4: New Belgium Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: cloudy yellow golden amber. off-white foamy head. nose slightly grassy, a little hoppy. flavor is mildly hoppy, not too bitter. warm and creamy mouthfeel. lively/snappy carbonation. light malt flavor too. is this the original fat tire recipie from years ago?? just kidding!

column4: New Belgium Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Pours cloudy amber. Aroma of apricots, flowers, and a light caramel. Flavor is much the same as the aroma.

column4: New Belgium Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Got some floaters going on...fine-bubbled head, slowly dimishing, off-white. Aroma vanilla ice cream, slight grassiness, some...figs/dates. Taste: wow diacetyl and acidic bite, some sweetness. Butter toffe/caramel, *barely* dry finish. Okay as a....what is it, anyway? Tastes a bit similar to that buttery O-fest I had a few hours ago.

column4: New Belgium Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: 750 ml bottle. Poured a medium, hazy orange color with a white head. Aromas and tastes of fruits, yeast, caramel, and citrus (oranges). Light alcohol in the taste.

column4: New Belgium Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Poured a hazy copper color with a small, off white head that left light lacing on the glass. Musty aroma of various fruits (apples, citrus), yeast, and a light caramel maltiness. Very fruity, citrus, apples, pears, sweet caramel maltiness, and a lightly bitter finish. Light alcohol was noticed as well.

column4: New Belgium Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Beer pours cloudy light brown in color with a nice off white head. Aroma is restrained malt with light hoppiness and a dash of yeast. Flavor is yeast with a nice restrained hoppiness. Great thanks to Legion242 for sharing.

column4: New Belgium Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Hazy, orange amber (quite attractive), good, somewhat loose lacing, fading fast. Aroma of pepper and caramel. I had three flavor impressions, flowing in order with a second or two between each: 1) yeast! 2) bubblegum 3) bitter finish (hello hops)! Quite an interesting beer. Not as deep in flavor as it might have been. (750ml bottle shared by Legion242--thanks!)

column4: New Belgium Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Cloudy orange color; Head dissapated quite quickly. Nice malt nose. Resembles the FT in only the famous "biscuit" profilr. Nice effervesence. More malt later in glass. Pepper and malt. Very nice. As it warms, hops raise their hands and say "present".
Cask Pint at Wibbas Down (JDW), Wimbledon, London in Sept 2009 - Copper in colour. Hoppy; earthy hops. Malty; caramel, toffee. Earthy bitter throughout. Dry bitter finish. (2009-09)
Frisk smag af sødlige malte og en god bitterhed i eftersmagen. Mild i humlen.

500 ml bottle conditioned, from Voldby Købmandsgaard. ABV is 5.0%. Moderately gushing bottle. Copper colour, large to moderate off-white head. Earthy, woody and spicy aroma, also hints of blackcurrants. Fizzy mouthfeel. The flavour is quite dry, again with earthy and woody notes, and a spicy and hoppy medium bitter finish. Would buy again, and drink it fresher.
En halvsløj omgang, flot at se på men kedelig. Malt, gær smag...... ................. Free Føroyar!!!

Flaske på The Globe i København: nydelig kobberfarge og tett, fint skum som varer. Deilig aroma av portvin og bringebær. Herlig, fyldig smak av bær og plommer/svisker og litt krydder i ettersmaken. Masse godsmak med bare 5%! Flaskemodnet, og det kjennes. Lekker.

Bottle @ Voldby Ølmesse. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, sweet fruit, peach, grass. Flavor is malt, sweet fruity, grassy hops. Medium body, soft carbonation, light bitter finish. 250812

Bottled 07/07/12. More amber coloured than copper with a rocky white head and copious lace as it poured extremely aggressively. Yeasty and fruity. Notes of candy sugar. A decent body. Sweet fruits in the mouth. May not be entirely as intended but it’s quite tasty.
light frech watery aroma,orange, clear, light brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, dry finish.
Light brown coloured and clear. Has a white head, fully lasting, looks good. Faint aroma, malt and caramel, perhaps faint grain too. Moderate sweet flavor. Dry texture.
Bottle.Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Dark yellow colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Some caramellic notes. Average moderate bitter finish.Creamy palate.
Dark appearance with a full, tan head. Stout did have a dry flavor, but seemed to lack the roasted malt flavor I enjoy in a stout.

Pours an amber color with a quickly dissipating off-white head. No lace from this brew. I don't detect any cocoa in the nose. I can't quite describe what I am smelling here, but it isn't strong. Just mild malt aroma. Soft, light to medium mouthfeel. Smooth, with cocoa on the finish. Not bad, but nothing to write home about. Sam doesn't usually sell this one outside of his restaurant, but I guess it is one of his only "light" offerings.

Dark chestnut brown. Light cocoa nose - I wish I could find more but the brewpub served it ice cold and since they should know better I wasn't going to give them patience. A light nutty note. In addition to being near-frozen, it was way overcarbonated for the style. Reminds me of when the BJCP "expert" judges criticized my homebrew mild for being undercarbonated when it had the perfect cask level of about half what you'll find in a lager. Book learning isn't good for much if you haven't logged the miles. Back to the beer...vague milk chocolate and a hint of malt.

Dark brown color with a tinge of red poking through. Light chocolate and raisins in the nose. Sweet malt poking around too. Light hoppiness at the beginning getting towards a sweet candyish, sweet malty middle. Good flavors, but finishes light and short.

I love this beer. A session ale from Dogfish...bite your tongue. I quaffed this ale in the brewpub on my last trip down. Dark and rich in flavor. The Chocolate stood out till the last tilt of my mug. It inspired me to brew my own Chocolate mild when I got home.

This ale has a deep copper hue and a small, creamy off-white head. Fully diminishing. Leaves interesting lacework on the glass. The aroma is lightly malty with notes of milk chocolate and toasted cashews. The flavor is lightly malty and pungent with small hints of the baking cocoa up front. Well-balanced with moderately pungent and lightly bitter hops on the backside. Light-bodied with a lightly creamy mouthfeel and fizzy carbonation. Short, crisp, clean finish. Excellent session beer. Recommended if you can get your hands on it.

Tap @ St. Clemens, Århus. Pours hazy amber with a lasting white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, grassy hops. Flavor is malt, caramel, flowers, grassy hops. Medium bodt, soft carbonation. Could use some more hops and bitterness. 060213

Big beige lasting creamy shiny head. Clear deep amber body. Grainy perfumy malt aroma with resiny wooden notes. Dry-sweet grainy fruity taste with papery notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft mouthfeel. Dry roasty caramelly papery aftertaste with spicy notes. Where are the hops? (0.25l draft at brewpub.)
@ Sct. Clemens. Hazy amber with a big and lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, caramel and moderate hoppy - flowers. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. 100611
Tap. Hazy amber/orange with medium off-white head. Flavour is malt, dry, little caramel, bitter, little floral and hops.

From tap@Apollo, København. Abv is 7,9%. Brief offwhite head. Body is clear, deep golden to pale amber. Doughy malt aroma. Mild hop nose, apples and sweet lemon. Sweet and unfresh malt flavor, honey and butter. Moderate hop bitterness, some earthy and lightly spiced tones. Thick, oily texture. Medium body. Alcohol well masked. Sweetish malty, faintly bitter finish. Raw and unrefined, not a favorite.

Tap @ Apollo, Cph. ABV 7,9 % - same recipe as last year Pours clear golden with a fine, big, frothy, light off-white head. Lots of bubbles. Aroma is malty sweet, light caramel and hint of butter and some grassy and fruity hops. Highish carbonation, fair dry mouthfeel. Flavour has a small hint of butter, caramel base and some fair grassy hops. Light herbal and slightly citric bitterness in the finish. Not that impressive.
Clear amber with a large off white head. Fruity aroma with hints of hops and diacetyl. flavour had mild hops, fruits, spices, diacetyl and malty hints.
Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a clear golden color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter finish.

Draught at brewpub Apollo in Copenhagen, on July 10, 2009 Marked 6.3% ABV Slight hazy copper color, creamy tan lasting head. Hoppy, bitter, grainy, butter taste. Fresh hoppy scent. Moussy mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.
Draught@brewpub. Amber colour, mediumsized beige foamy head. Aroma is bigtime bready malts along with mild fruity hops. Flavour is bigtime yeast, bready malts as well as some big grassyness.

as "rousse" like pictured. pours hazy light copper with a large off-white head offering decent retention and lacing. spicy toasted fruity caramel - old grains, overly citrusy - obvious contamination; rotten berries - with their acidity; cardboard, floral and spicy honey perhaps, faint herbal notes. moderate carbonation, light body - watery; semi-sweet caramel-spicy finish. blah. minus the infection, it is still probably a poorly crafted honey amber.

Bouteille de 660 ml achetée au Marché du Boisé à Trois-Rivières. Dégustée le 30 mars 2004 (tulip). Bière rousse voilée. Mousse beaucoup, col épais et durable. Très effervescente, bulles moyennes. Odeur de miel crémeux, de levure. Assez sucrée, très douce, assez amère en finale. Très bon, goûte juste assez le miel, pas trop sucrée.

Bouteille 660ml. de couleur ambrée-cuivrée et claire. Nez malté de caramel doux avec des notes épicées (poivre), de noix, de plastique brûlé et de fruits (agrumes). Mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture très légèrement huileuse et aqueuse. Goût très légèrement fruité aux petites notes sûres (agrumes) avec quelques notes épicées (poivre et clou de girofle) et végétales (légumes bouillis) suivi d’un goût malté de caramel doux aux petites notes rôties avec des traces de miel et en finale l’on retrouve une très légère amertume de houblon herbeux avec quelques notes de noix. Post-goût moyen-court et très légèrement sec, légèrement amer de houblon herbeux avec des notes fruitées (zeste d’agrumes) et de noix. (2006)

Olive bottle, 500 ml, gift from M’man received on June 6 2009, savoured on June 18 2009; eye: copper, clear, no effervescence, beige head that falls and turns into a tiny ring, no lacing; nose: malt, light caramel, light nuts; mouth: malt, light caramel, slight ash, slight hops, finale in caramel malt, medium-light body, rather carbonated, lightly sweet, slightly bitter, watery texture with a syrupy side; overall: ordinary FRANÇAIS Bouteille olive, 500 ml, cadeau de M’man reçu le 6 juin 2009, savourée le 18 juin 2009; œil : cuivre, claire, pas d’effervescence, mousse beige qui tombe et se transforme en un petit anneau, pas de dentelle; nez : malt, léger caramel, léger noix; bouche : malt, léger caramel, très léger cendré, très léger houblon, finale en malt caramel, corps moyen-léger, plutôt carbonatée, légèrement sucrée, très légèrement amère, texture aqueuse avec un côté légèrement sirupeux; en résumé : ordinaire

Bottle (660ml) shared with HogTownHarry & GregClow -- courtesy of HogTownHarry. Pours ruby-amber with an average size semi-lasting tan head. Weak aroma of caramel malt -- slightly sour and funky. Watery flavour of caramel malt, light hops and a harsh finish -- I’ll repeat what HTH said below: "sour, dry and stale". Crap.

bouteille de 500ml, bière de belle couleur cuivré passablement foncé, avec un son au déversage de coca-cola, la mousse se formait comme sur su coke. nez désagréable , surette et aigre, la bouche est mince, acide, aigre et aussi désagréable, mauvaise bière.

Bottle (660ml). Shared with blankboy and GregClow, my bottle via trade with Viper666. Rather attractive clear ruby pour, average diminishing head. Sour and thin aroma, weak persimmon malt and dry lemon juice, somewhat funked up - but I suspect it’s not SUPPOSED to be sour. Taste - this is sour, dry and stale - like a cold remedy stirred with a spruce branch. Watery, acidic, harsh - quite medicinal. Even though this is obviously stale, I suspect it was never very good. There’s not much honey here ...
Une bonne bière rousse sans amertume et douce. Belle couleur rouge. Léger parfum. Pas de mousse. Effervescence moyenne. Une bière à réessayer, elle coule bien.
Deep reddish amber hue, light foamy head, fruity, caramelized malt, roasted nuts aromas, follow through on a medium-bodied palate with buckwheat cereal, sweet flavors in a roasted malt finish.

Well this didn’t really excite me much - honey and malt and some spice in the aroma, but then it was a little thin and there was some sort of oddly off flavour mixed in. Quick finish to a pretty routine beer.

column2: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
column5: Draft… Pours a murky dark brown with a mid-sized, delicate, fat-bubbled, beige head. The aroma presents smoke, chocolate, apple, and boiling mash – both intriguing and disturbing at the same time. Medium-bodied, but thin with lifeless carbonation. The flavor is roasty, chocolaty and moderately bitter – fairly one dimensional. Finishes appley and mildly bitter with a dash of instant coffee.

column2: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
column5: Black pour with tan head and lace. Chocolate, coffee, and roasted malt. Roasted malt, and a good malt bitter finish. Just a tad thin and watery but good.

column2: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
column5: Part of the Brewzzi Sampler tray - all pours were in small flute tasting glasses, approx 6 oz (healthy pours). This was the seasonal selection - pour is clear dark brown with a smallish off white head. Aroma is mild roast, along with a milk sweetness. As with all the other Brewzzi beers, very subdued nose. Taste is a nice pine hop and roast malt combination. Simple, but clean and well balanced. Palate is light to medium bodied with a nice soft carbonation. The hops give this a nice dry fresh finish. The last beer I tried on the sampler tray, and my favorite.

column2: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
column5: On draft - Stogies and Stouts at Dunedin Brewery 02/08/07. Poured the standard stout look. The aroma is very light and I can just make out some roastiness. The flavor started out with a watery mouthfeel that created a neutral taste. Then some of the flavors showed up in the form of roasted malts, a bit of burnt malts that combine with a vague hoppiness to create a slightly dry, bitter and nearly astringent quality. Since the flavors were so subtle nothing really jumps out and seems out of place yet there really isn’t enough there either.

column2: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
column5: Draft at the brewpub. Fairly roasty aroma with coffee-tinged components and a fairly robust dose of hops. The body is a dull matte blacka nd holds a thin mocha head that is both bubbly and diminishing. Fairly hoppy fore melds with the roasted/bitter notes of the grains and some mild chocolate and dark chocolate notes to pull out some decent flavor, but the watery finish shows a lack of follow through and left me fairly underwhelmed on the whole.

column2: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
column5: My trepidation in trying brewzzi's was unfounded. This was a seasonal batch according to the waiter and to his own admission better than the black dog stout. This was a tad hoppy for a stout and almost reminded me more of a porter. Think Rogue shakespeare stout. Lots of burnt characters in this: nose, palate, finish. Very smoothe and clean. Finishes with hops. I just wish they wouldn't serve it in iced up glasses.
Bottled. Dark golden with average head. Spicy, flowery hop aroma. Dry with hard, sharp and thin mouthfeel. Good hop presence and salty, bitter finish.

First tasted this at the Paisley Beer Festival in April 2002. Cask, handpump dispense. Clear dark garnet in colour with a thin white head. Fruity citrus note in the short aroma. Thin resiny mouthfeel and good lacing. Mixed malts give a digestive biscuit base with thick cut marmalade and golden syrup. Strong floral notes apparent in the long bitter aftertaste. Finish is malty with a fruity citrus bite of orange and pommegranate. A decent ESB but surely not in the Strong Ale category?
Cask Stillage at the RUFC, Bromsgrove 16/07/2005 Amber mid brown coloured with a slightly hazy appearance. Strong in alcohol. Nutty full malt finish.
Handpull at the Babington Arms (JDW) Derby. Deep ruddy brown body, rather harsh, maltier than the other rather poor ales I’ve tried by this brewer but still an unrefined and undemanding beer.

Draught straight from Barrel, Bodicote Beer Festival. Deep dark red with whispy white head. Lots of grain, some greenish in the flavour, drying and bitter. Tastes its alcohol, not too refined or balanced.

Lagery pale gold pour with a faint haze. Densely creamy head and lacework aplenty. Gently sulphurous, grapefruit-hoppy nose. Milky smooth, flattish, citrussy and sourish. Lingering digestive-biscuit wheatiness and balancing bitter afters. Excellent summery sessions, ironically.
Cask Handpump at the Golden Pheasant, Plumley 09/01/2003 Golden amber coloured and slightly sweet. Some bitterness in a dry finish.
Draught Real Ale, Handpulled. Light brown beer. Aromatic lemony hop flavour with delicate malt flavours. Well balanced, great session ale, but not really a winter warmer.

column4: Monte Carlo Brewpub at the Monte Carlo Casino
column5: A nice brown color with a light tan head. An aroma of caramel and buttered popcorn. Too much diacetyl. Some spices in the taste with buttered popcorn and caramel.

column4: Monte Carlo Brewpub at the Monte Carlo Casino
column5: This smells like buttery popcorn, or even more disgusting smells like my friend's feet after a soccer game
a hazy yellow beer w/ some citrus notes in the nose. The brewer added tangerine to the mix. Very drinkable, not spectacular

Tap @ Vista location. Listed as ER IPA. Poured a clear copper color with an off-white head. Hoppy aroma of citrus and pine. Citrus hop flavor with a caramel malty base. Mild bitterness on the finish. Light-medium body.

ER IPA-on tap-pours an off white head that laces and hazy gold color. Aroma is grapefruit hops (cascade+), faint medium malt. Taste is mellow grapefruit hops-some bitter (cascade+), faint medium malt-sweet. Mild carbonation.

This IPA pours with a golden orange body topped by a very thin head with little lacing. The aroma is slightly sweet yet bitter and woody. Not the typical aroma for an IPA. The flavor is slightly sweet and malty to start then bitter and hoppy with slight fruity notes, piney notes and a touch of wood. Medium bodied, smooth and dry.
At the Pizza Port Real Festival: Pours a hazy amber color with a small even white head. Aroma is floral hops with a decent malt balance. Flavor is piney citrus. Body is medium. A good beer.
Nice amber color with hop floral nose. A bit sweet in my opinion and could use some more hoppiness, but a nice beer.
Copper colored & unfiltered, this is a nice rendition of an IPA. Lots of hop on the nose & palate

30cl bottle from De Achelse Kluis bottle shop. F: medium, white, quick diminishing. C: gold, clear. A: malty, caramel, honey touch, bit herbal, fruity. T: sweet malty, grainy, honey, quite sweet all together, bready, base beer is not bad but totally covered with honey, medium carbonation, drinkable.
Flesje thuis gedronken. Goudgeel helder bier met matig schuim dat snel weg trekt. Aroma van toffee en honing. Smaak is zoet en snoep achtig. Weinig nasmaak.
Der Honig ist irgendwie unnatürlich und das Getreide haut hier voll durch. Von wegen organic und so weiter - meiner Meinung nach kommt hier alles künstlich rüber. Nicht so meins.
Dit bier is niet heel complex. Hop en honing voeren aldoor de boventoon. Redelijk zoet. Prima voor 'n keer!

Thin white head left a blotchy cover on a translucent pale orange coloured, slightly effervescent body. Honey & syrup aroma. Medium bodied, sticky on the palate with a prickly back & cloying aft. Honey, malt, syrup, jam & stewed fruit tastes
nodelse wikarus on das schiffka draskis on das met, bettarus originalski trunkus
30cl bottle. A clear golden beer with a small white head. Aroma of sweet grainy malt, cereals and cardboard. Taste of sweet pale malt, honey, grains, low bitterness.
Mild süßer Beginn, in dem der Honig erkennbar ist. Die Herbe ist sogar noch geringer, geringfügig getreidig, eintönig. Trinkbar. 8/8/9/8/7/8
Bottle 0,30ltr: Clear golden colored brew with an slightly sweet bitter taste, some nice hints of honey. Maybe some more honey make the beer great.
Fles 30cl thuis. Heel licht. Fris, wat zoet. (4-2012).------------------------.

Tap @ 2004 Toronado Barley Wine Festival. Light amber color with an off white head. Light caramel flavors with a bitter bite and minimal fruit. This was listed as "Hop Two 0" with 9% abv and with all Maris Otter hops.

Glows red/ gold with an oily fisheyed head. Nose reveals a little piney resinous hops with some orangey citrus. Not quite as thick as I expected with a promenant nutty charactor and an overlaying smooth bitterness which becomes more pronounced in the finish.

cloudy orangish color leaking into a brownish state at times and topped with a halo of suds and a thin but large island of suds in the middle..apricots, mandarin oranges and all types of juicy hops are in the nose..the first sip releases a huge mandarin/bitter punch with lots of super juicy hops flying everywhere..it tasted like chewing on big dank nuggets..so juicy..a mixture of concord and green grapes..some pine and ruby red grapefruit too..Juicy!

Sun Shinen through the staind glass windows of the house of jesus, or so I am told, but a unique gold. Smells just like pink grapefruit. The hops go on an assualt and attack the back of the mouth and then finishes like a bitter 5-alive.
50cl bottle. Pours hazy deep golden colour with a huge good lasting off-white head. Aroma of mild yeasty and dry fruits. Taste of mild sweet fruits, banana, some spices and yeast, easy to drink.

Heller, wässrig hefiger Antrunk. Trockene brotige Bitterkeit, was aber schnell nachlässt. Eher wässriger Nachgeschmack. Trinkbar und erfrischend, das ist Wasser aber auch. Immerhin sind keine störenden Fehlaromen vorhanden. 9/7/8/6/8/7
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a white head. Has a fruity maltysspicy banana aroma. Fruity wheat malty thin watery banana flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy yeasty banana finish.

0,5 l bottle BB 23.10.2014 Golden-orange color, cloudy and with a creamy tan foam head. Remarkable thin and flat. Some banana and wheat / cereal aroma. medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, average carbonation,
Hazy yellow coloured. Banana and yeast in the aroma and in the flavour. Thin.
Bottle. Color hazy yellow with medium white head. Aroma yeast, paper, banana. Taste sweet, orange, banana.

It’s unclear orange-golden with a huge, creamy head. The aroma has the same notes as the moderately sweet and mild, slightly watery flavor: light yeast, fruit and wheat, and the finish is slightly spicy.

50 cl bottle, BBE 11.01.2012 Floury aroma with baking yeast, some cardboard, gooseberry bush and marshmallows. Flavour has wet cardboard and some flowery notes. Watery palate. Not good, but what can one expect from leichte weisse?

50 cl bottle. Thanks Timo A. Pours cloudy copper colour with large foamy head. Aroma of mild apricot, wheat, mild spicy notes, herbs and some caramel. Flavour of mild wheat, apricot, some herbs and spices and some hay. 3212

Beer No. 13 on my tour through Austria, Germany and Denmark. Bottled 500ml. -from the bottle in my hotel room. Sweetish malty, light yeasty and fruity with metallic finish. Not so watery as I’ve expected but also pretty tasteless.
The foam stability is good, body light. The Aroma is malty, a bit sweet, some hops. The taste is malty, light but not watery, low on hops. Ok.
From the backlog, late 90s trip to Regensburg. The rather scanty notes of the time had this down as a slightly bland example of a German lager.

Selten ein so gutes Bier getrunken. Es ist süffig und leicht zugleich. Es hat einen angenehm malzigen Körper mit fein abgestimmern Hopfenspitzen und hinten raus einen spritzigen Abgang. Klare Empfehlung.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.
From bottle. Transfer of an earlier rating without text recorded, rating only.
Bottle. Blonde. Malty, soft grassy notes in the aroma. Malty, satisfyingly grassy hopbitter flavor. Bready. Well balanced helles.
Klare hell goldgelbe Farbe, mittelgroße weiße schaumkrone. Geruch leicht floral hopfig, grasig bitter, helles malz. Geschmack mild hopfig, floral bitter, leicht getreidig, gut!
Bottle looks very simple, but okay. Beer in the glass zippy, small head. Starts mild, malty, modest dry. A bit metallically. Finish well balanced, still mild. Okay.
Beer with light color, medium body, malt flavor, average carbonized, (bought a 50cl bottle in German supermarket during Bavaria trip).

Ganz klassisch und wie erwartet mit einer leichten Wuerze nebst den ueblichen Verdaechtigen wie Butter, Vanille und Getreide. Recht einfach zu trinken, ebenso sueffig, aber auch durchaus simpel und ohne grosse Ueberraschungen.
Gezapft in Fürth. Leichtes Sommerbier ohne besondere Merkmale oder Charakter. Golden-klar, etwas Schaum und wenig Kohlensäure. Geschmack und Aroma. Süßer Malz, Hopfen, wenig Bitterkeit.

I kept looking at the label and despite knowing that "hell" is a reference to being light or blond or whatever - expotr hell ... makes me think that they want to get it the hell out of Germany. For all the good beers brewed there, I can see why they wouldn't miss this one.

Nice pale gold colour. Rather sluggish and low on fizz out of the bottle, leading to a rather flat mouthfeel for a lager. Restrained aroma with hints of tropical fruit, but nothing very pronounced and certainly not much in the way of malt. Clean and fresh, with some lemon, throughout the palate, ending up quite acidic, but the finish is short. OK, but it gets dragged down by the dull mouthfeel. Not really my thing either. 500ml bottle (not bottle conditioned) from beersofeurope.co.uk

Bottle. Initial softness quickly followed by a decent crispness. Sweet cookie spread with a slightly rancid salted butter flavour. Peanuts. In fact, slightly stale candied peanuts. Interesting - but not really my thing.

500mo bottle drunk at home on a cool September evening. Thickly hazy pale gold, loads of head and lacing and fast-rising carbonation. Aromas are light clove, bubblegum and dusky grains. In the mouth, thickly frothy and smooth, some sweetness, flavours much like the aromas with some eatery raisin and apricot, crisp rich finish. Classic Weizen.

Color naranja claro, muy turbia, translúcida. Espuma blanca, de casi tres dedos de espesor y excelente retención. Aroma a cereal, un toque cítrico no muy bien equilibrado, notas de heno, flores y clavo. Sabor a cereales, galleta y clavo, final de ligero amargor herbal, la esperada sensación a plátano sólo aparece, levemente, en el posgusto, alcohol bien integrado. Textura sedosa. Carbonatación media alta.
Buena cerveza alemana de trigo, densa, sabor a platano y pan, de espuma tambien densa.
0.4L draft, no discernible banana in aroma, highly carbonated, even a bit stingy. Tastewise extremely watery, offly bitter with a barely distinguishable banana finish.

Pours cloudy golden to orange with a tall frothy white head. Aroma: banana esters, wheat bread, overripe apples, restrained clove. Light plus body. Lively carbonation. Taste: relatively dry. Banana and apples in front. Bread and clove in the background. Low bitterness. Fairly decent weizen.

Leicht ins orange gehend, nicht komplett hefetrüb und etwas nelkig riechend zeigt sich das helle Bischofshof Hw. Der Antrunk ist frisch, mild und süffig. Im Mittelteil geschmacksstark vollmundig. Danach leicht säuerlich abklingend. Ich muß sagen, ein klasse Bier. Durchgehend mild und süffig mit ausgeprägtem Geschmack.
Tiene una cabeza blanca, grande y espumosa. En aroma se puede observar el trigo, la vainilla y el caramelo. En boca es ligera, refrescante, con un sabor dulce.

Es la cerveza típica weiss sin mucha complicación muy buena espuma pero poco carbónico sabores frutales d carne como plátano y ciruelas. No está mal es buena para tomar una cerveza agradable. Empeoranunnpoc si aumenta la temperatura

On tap at Bischofshof Regensburg. Cloudy gold with a white head. Aroma of ripe banana and clove, some spices too. Banana, cardamom, clove in the mouth, full body, chewy texture, fine fizz and spicy finish. Very good and balanced.

0.5 l bottle @ Mijas, purchased in a SuperCor. Pours hazy orange with thick, but quickly disappearing head. Nose is slight (too slight) banana and yeasty notes. Same taste with short sweetish finish, light body and soft carbonation. A bit mediocre.

Bottle from Goretti. She found it in Regenstauf, after she found out that the brewery doesnt stock this one. great! very dark golden for a Kristall. white head. banana and clove. well carbonated. full body. low sweetness. quite nice!

500ml bottle from beersofeurope.co.uk. Light gold colour with white head. Big sweet wheat, big overripe banana, light sour wheat, light banana candy, white bread, banana bread, yeasty, light soapy. First time trying this style, tastes like a lighter version of a hefeweizen basically.

6/10/2018. Bottle courtesy of Boris, cheers! Pours clear dark gold with an off-white head. Aroma of banana, foam banana sweets, caramel, malt, yeast and light herbs. Medium plus sweetness, light bitterness. Moderate body, oily texture, average to soft carbonation.

Bottle. Pours clear dark golden with whiteish head. Aroma is very sweet, fruity, perfumy, wheaty. Flavor is sweet and bitter, grains, wheat, malt, fruity notes, bit oily. Finish is watery. Overall: drinkable.

Bottle from Beers of Europe cons 2018-06-11 Uddingston AR: banana foam, yeast, flour AP: coppery clear, high frothy cream beige thick lid F: banana foam, yeasty, flour, syrup, sweet mouth feeling, rich carbonated

500ml bottle. Clear, orangey golden colou rwith average, fluffy, moderately lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Sweet-ish, wheaty aroma, hints of banana, a touch of papaya. Taste is mellow wheaty, fruity, notes of young banana, very cautious hints of strawberry, a touch of clove; smooth and soft palate.
500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours clear gold with a large pillowy white head. Aroma is wheat, banana, yeast. Taste is bubblegum, clove, wheat. Great one.

Bottle thanks to Nikos! Pours hazy golden, medium creamy white head, nice lacing. Aroma is wheat, lemon, grass, clove. Flavor is light sweet, very light bitter, grassy lemon clove, hints of acidity. Light body. Underwhelming.

0,5lt bottle @ Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos Not very strong typical banana aroma, crystal clear appearance with typical a lot white head that remains, taste very carbonated (as it should be for the category) but not as swee(more sour) as a regular Weizen with yeast, again very lively in your mouth with a light-medium body and not very long aftertaste. For the hot (greek summer) just the right Weizen option.
500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours clear amber with white froth. A little bland, tends to be a problem with kristallweizen’s. Hint of clove, light fruit. It’s OK just a little bland.
Orange amber in color with little aroma. Medium hop presence with some citrus and malt.

On tap at Delafield Brewhaus. Poured hazy medium amber with a sticky cap of whitish head.. nice lacing followed it down. The aroma picked up sweet, toasted caramel and bready notes first and foremost.. floral character emerged with warmth.. very sweet overall. The flavor was sweet as well, with dark fruits and toasty caramel leading.. a touch smoky on the back-end, also picking up some earthy and fruity bitterness.. OK balance. Grainy sugars throughout the palate, along with sharpness from the bitters and carbonation.. spicy and warmer feel than it should’ve had.. this seemed under-attenuated.

Draught at the pub. Pours a hazy amber with a clumpy film of off-white head. Leaves wide swathes of lacing down the glass at first which settles in to a spidery array of white lines. Aroma is a surprising citrusy hops. Flavor is a little odd, sweet and piney but lacking backbone. Thin feel, mild lingering bitterness.
Had this one on draught at the brewpub in Delafield, Wisconsin. Hazy, reddish brown pour, a filmy, tan head, potent piney hoppiness and a dry finish, very well done!
Amber to brown color with a light tan head. Full malt aroma with a hint of hops. Malty and hoppy flavors. Caramel sweetness well balanced. A bit hoppy for style.
Medium copper color with a thin lacey head. Mellow malt and hop aroma. Flavor is mostly caramel malt with a medium bitter finish. Good adherence to style.

A dark brown beer with a creamy, long-lasting head. Mild caramel scent. The taste was kind of a dark bitterness. The hops were pretty pronounced, with just a bit of malt holding it back. As I got deeper into the beer, the bitterness faded a little, letting a bit of caramel come forward. Nice creamy mouthfeel. Interesting beer.
Annoncée blonde mais devrait être rousse. Peu mousseuse. Très épicée. Longueur en bouche très intéressante.
From bottle. Transfer of an earlier rating without text recorded, rating only.

F: big, white, long lasting. C: deep gold, light hazy. A: fruity esters with a lot of honey, bit orange, spicy, mellow fruity, bit yeasty. T: fruity, bit sulphur, honey, bit spicy, yeasty, grainy, too sugary for me but otherwise good Belgian ale, 33cl bottle from Bierwinkel De Hopduvel in Gent.
Grosse bulle très présentes, peu de mousse. Légèrement ambrée. Gout de levure, peu sucrée, légère amertume. Houblon très présent.

Bottle 33cl bought at De Hopduvel in Gent. Pours blond with a very small white head. Nose: murky, slightly sweetness, malt, cardemom. Taste: medium carbonation. Sweet (honey), slightly malty, medium body. Zeste of an orange. Some cardemom.

Bottle, 33cL. Fair, Bouillon in July. A pale yellow, light cloudy beer with a medium foamy head ; medium retention. Grainy aroma, fruit (citrus, peach), sugary like a soda :( Light sweet, light warming background, dry note. Light to medium body, average texture, average to soft carbonation, sugary fruity lasting finish. Overall, drinkable but close to a alcoholic soda...
33 cl. bottle @ a restaurant in Bouillon Hazy golden. White head. Yeasty fruity aroma. Nice mature blonde.
Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist glass, from the fridge. Great taste of yeast and barley.

6/IV/15 - 33cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ home - BB: VII/15 (2015-417) Clear orange beer, small aery irregular off-white head, dissipates immediately. Aroma: lots of orange peel, pretty sweet, bit spicy, malty. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of orange peel, soft bitterness, quite some honey. Aftertaste: bit oxidized, lots of honey, orange peel, soft bitterness, spices.

Ardennes blonde (not La Chouffe) with off-white, rocky, very thick, very stable, sticky head leaving pretty lacing, and an orangey golden colour, clear but misty after adding deposit, as it should be. Rich fruity nose of orange, pear and melon, yeasty, hints of honey, ginger, sweet white wine, peppermint, straw and a faint sulphuric note reminiscent of fried egg. Fresh apply onset with citrussy freshness, full enough mouthfeel with strong carbonation, smooth caramelly malt background, drying from the middle onwards, finishing mildly hoppy. I usually do not like the Bouillon beers that much, but this certainly is one of their better brews, well-balanced and tasteful.

column1: Audomaroise Blonde à la Rhubarbe / Bière des Hayettes
column5: Bottle. Alright, not so much rhubarb character. Easy enough. Thin and refreshing. It’s alright.

column1: Audomaroise Blonde à la Rhubarbe / Bière des Hayettes
column5: Bottle from « Au comptoir de la bière" - Callian. Short withe head with some bitter notes. Opaque clear yellow body with no particular taste, not even rhubarb. Nice bitterness in mouth.

column1: Audomaroise Blonde à la Rhubarbe / Bière des Hayettes
column5: Bottle@Home. Sweet and spicy aroma with hints of banana and lime. Hazy, yellow color, white head, good lace. Sweet, light fruity, hint of rhubarbre, light bitter, average body. High drinkablility.

column1: Audomaroise Blonde à la Rhubarbe / Bière des Hayettes
column5: 75 cl swingtop bottle Blonde a la Rhubarbe. Light golden in colour, hazy, the initial big white head quickly reduced. Wet cardboard dominates the nose, some sweet fruitiness also appears. Sweet sirupy flavours with some butter. Sickening. The rhubarb is hard to detect. A big bottle that I simply did not manage to finish.

column1: Audomaroise Blonde à la Rhubarbe / Bière des Hayettes
column5: 75cl bottle. Cloudy golden beer with a small head. Aromas are sweet syrupy rhubard with margarine/vegetable fat. Hints of spices with some sourness. Flavours are rhubarb and vegetable fats with caramel malts, vanilla and spices. Some citrus comes through when warmed up. Quite dry and fatty on the finish. An interesting beer.

column1: Audomaroise Blonde à la Rhubarbe / Bière des Hayettes
column5: Great appearance, cloudy pale body and a very storng frithy white head. The aroma is that of rhubarb but quite light with a bitter edge, the flavour is again quite light with a fruity feel. Overall a good quality beer.

column1: Audomaroise Blonde à la Rhubarbe / Bière des Hayettes
column5: Big 750ml swing top bottle. BBE Sep 04. Opens with an explosive pop, but beer stays steady in the bottle. Hazy pale yellow with mouse head. Aroma is initially co2 and rhubarb. Moussey, sharp, prickly mouthfeel. Metallic taste, especially in the finish, is dominant. When the co2 has burned off what’s left is a soft, laid back, gently fruity beer of little character.

column1: Audomaroise Blonde à la Rhubarbe / Bière des Hayettes
column5: Bottled. Hazy golden, rich lively head. Fruity and sweet with dense, clean mouthfeel. The rhubarb flavour is there, but it’s well hidden. Balanced, but too restrained to be really interesting.

column1: Audomaroise Blonde à la Rhubarbe / Bière des Hayettes
column5: yellow-gold colour, slight white head, not very stable. Flowery, slightly sourish nose. The suggestion is rhubarb, but that might be the label hinting. Taste is at first very neutral, then a real vegetable flavour emerges. However, this does not remind me of rhubarb at all. Slightly gingerish, or galanga root, rather - or an aroma of water-paint. Good carbonation, not too much, neither too little. A slight acidity rounds off quite nicely. Very restrained beer. I would have preferred the rhubarb more outspoken, but i can live with it.

The tripel in this series which Huyghe took over from the former Meesters brewery. Orange blonde tripel with loose, quickly dissipating head; fruity aroma, peach, apple, coriander, iron; sweetish fruity taste with yeasty spiciness, bit metallic with thin mouthfeel and thin finish with not too well hidden alcohol. Unbalanced.
33cl, from De Bierloods Adegem, not complex brew, not balanced, clear, small head, nothing special

Bottle, 33 cl. (bought @ Bierloods) Darkgolden color, whith small white head. Aroma coriander, spice. Medium body. Taste spices, malts, coriander, little fruity. Spicey and bit hopsbitter finish. Dry.

(Bottle 33 cl) In this original version simply known as "Meesters Bier" at 7,5% ABV from Brouwerij Meesters in Galmaarden. Hazy, orangey golden with a huge, frothy head. Very complex, spiced aromas - some fruit. Very dry and refined. Somehow closer to a Saison than a Tripel. 150896 and as "Meesters Galmaarden Tripel" at 270798

Orange-gold, very small white rim. Spicey nose, touch of salt, and coriander. Perfumey taste, crystal and colour malts, aniseed, coriander. Very spicey finish. Aggressive burning mouthfeel for a short time, but refreshing in the end. Not bad, but the dryness comes more from the spices than from the fermentation.
Blond beer with a big white creamy head. Light fruity aroma. Fruity and chalky taste. Very light bitterness. A relatively easy drinking tripel.
Notes from back in spring 2003 in Wayne, PA. Very deep obsidian color woth tan head. Aroma of chocoff and roasty malt, plus molasses, which appeared in the flavor. Decent.

Black in color, thin bubbly tan head, the nose carried some smoked & roasted aromas, but the flavors were a bit bland & tasteless, the aftertaste was a bit smoked & burnt as well, much rather have the milk stout
Black with a creamy light brown head. Chocolate and coffee aroma and taste with some slight berry notes. Pretty good.

10th Columbus Tasting (Christmas 2007)Looked great, smelled great, and then...tasted like bitter chocolate. It is like when you were little and use to sneak the chocolate from the pantry only you find it was unsweetened, and then the bitter finish made it end worse.

Bottle shared at Columbus Tasting 10. Poured a very dark, thick brown. Smelled of burnt coffee. Taste was VERY much thick black coffee. Hoppy and bitter on the end. No sweetness what so ever here, and I was not a huge fan. But more becaus of the style then the beer.

Had I known this beer wasn't rated, I would've made more notes. This is a solid RIS with a decent caramel colored head. The flavor and finish are roasty and bitter, not as sweet and malty as some. The only detractor was a noticeable amount of diacetyl (buttery flavor). Without that, it would've been close to "excellent."

Deep black/ brown color with a nice smalle tan head. I have to mention that Travis served this one a bit too cold, with a chilled glass at that. A bitter chocolate, dark chocolate flavor. Actually tastes much like a cohcolate soda. Nice cocoa aroma, roasted, not alot of, if any coffee hints. Creamy dark chocolate finish. Not all that thick either. A damn fine stout.

A black hole in a glass with a creamy covering that had an ice-like shine gleaming from it..Roasty chocolate aroma...the flavors were a superb blend of chocolate mousse, chocolate milk, nice roasty bitter chocolate bars..mmm..not too thick of a mouthfeel so it was very pleasant and relaxing to drink..a very solid stout from this very unknown brewery.

Tap at the TrashZone, Yokohama. Dark red-brown colour with an off-whtie head. Heavy lacing. Aroma of chocolate, fruit, hops. Flavour is similar to the aroma, chocolate, fruit, hops, some spices. A bit watery.
Tap at Thrashzone. Dark brown colour. Aroma bready malt, roasty, bit of chocolate, spicy, ginger. Taste is a bit chocolatey, nice sweetness, bit of spice. Pretty smooth, nice creaminess, pretty good.
Tap at Devil Craft. Dark deep collured brown/black ale. Surprisingly strong flavoured for abv, malty start but dominated by dry long hoppy finish. A very good pint.

Half in Devil Craft, Shimbashi. Darkish brown with reddish edges and tan head. Nose is roasted grain, lots of chocolate and coffee.Taste is chocolate, coffee, caramel and bit of fruity ale notes, like crystal malt and touch of English hops.

Draught at Thrash Zone. Big chocolate and caramel nose. Earthy, rather dry, with licorice. Sweet and rich flavor with caramel and chocolate. Not at all cloying. Licorice, grass, and earth flavors. Great stuff.
Draught at Thrash Zone, Yokohama. Clear dark brown - offwhite head. Chocolate, roasted, light burned, bitter dark chocolate, ryebread, dryness, light hoppy. OK.
Very large off white head, mahogany body.Toffee apple nose, slight brown bread yeast. Apple and blackcurrant opening slightly bitter roast finish. Malty and full bodied. Nice work.
Bottled (5%). Mahogany colour, rich head. Heavily roasty with notes of cork. Medium sweet and medium bodied. Spices and yeast play vital parts of the picture. Salty bitterish finish.
Wow a lot more full bodied than I had expected for a beer of lower alcohol content. Lots of interesting things going on . One of the two great regular taps at thrash zone
Tap at Thrash zone, Yokohama. Dark brown with a good tan head. Excitingly complex aroma and flavour with decent roast and caramel. Interesting to say the least.
Bottle pours out amber cola color topped with a nice head. Nose is smoked meat some bacon wood and rich malts. Taste is more of the nice smoke notes heavy malts very nice.
Ever had a good one outside of Germany? Me neither. Not bad but feels a little disjointed with an infusion of sweet wood. Middling.
300ml draft at Sylvans near Fuji. Fine long lasting head, hazy brown, excellent fine smoke aroma. Delicious malty Rauchbier with just the right balance of hops.

300ml keg at Raku Beer, Hiroshima, Japan (¥800): This one was definitely a beer that surprised me & went down far easier than I'd expected, particularly considering how little I've enjoyed pretty much ever other rauchbier that I've tried. The nose & taste thankfully weren't as pronounced or overpowering as I'd anticipated, there was a lot coming through but it seemed more balanced with this one & the bread malts helped things in that department too. Further on & some earthy malts made a surprising appearance which helped this one to become the only rauchbier I've managed to finish & it's by far the best of the style that I've ever tried too.
Aroma is lots of ham. Which i hate. Some bready malts as well. Taste is some sourness but the bitter salty ham has it all. Also kind of watery. Not for me.

On tap at Doutonbori. Amber-brown with a large white head going nowhere. Smoked ham and bacon aroma, pretty gentle, sweet caramel malt. Flavour is similar, umami, meaty feel. A touch tame and light for the style, but makes it a good match for grilled food. Nicely balanced overall.
12 ounce bottle thanks to Mick. Pours a clear copper color with a large white head. A big sweet smoky nose. The flavor is big smoke, caramel, toffee. Quite good.
Light brown. Has a big smoky aroma. Lots of smoke on the palate, toasty malts, full body, pretty good balance.

Fall Keyaki 2015. Dark brown with a beige head. Bacon with maple syrup, caramel, roasted malt, cacao nibs and prune. Taste is sweet and smokey, but not overly sweet by any means. The finish is dry and smokey. Very enjoyable if you like smoked beers.

후지벚꽃고원 브루어리 - 라우흐 5% ABV 비릿하게 올라오는 가쓰오부시향. 몰트를 훈연한 목재의 원료를 가쓰오부시 훈연에 사용하는 것과 동일한 것으로 사용한 모양이다. 콧속을 도는 쾌락에 집중한 훈연맥주 거품은 없지만 안에 남은 강한 탄산감, 고동색의 엑체를 잔에 따를때 확실히 풍겨나오는 훈연향. 스모크 프로세스에 집중하느라 다른 부분은 상대적으로 튀지 않는 편. 라우흐 맥주들 중에서는 스모키함이 약한편에 속한다. https://twitter.com/MaekJuBot
On tap. Pours a dark amber color with a medium white head. A big bready biscuit nose. Light berries, toffee, some toast. Quite smooth, good.
Good example, solid, heavy, banana and cloves balance. Solid, drinkable beer. Draft at hibiya christmas market. Came.back.next day for some more.

Bottle from Maruho. Pours a murky bronze-gold, pillowy creamy head, lacing. Banana and wheat off the top, caramel, nicely toasted malt. Flavour reveals caramel sweetness, lingering clove, good balance of its parts. Further down the glass a spirit note crept in a tad. Smooth feel, full and mouth coating. Very well done, having recently had Aventinus this is a top quality weizen bock.
Draft - Banana and caramel. Cloudy copper with a decent white head. Caramel sweet and banana. Banana fosters which is hitting the nail on the head.

Glowing amber color with frothy white head. Big nose of apple, cinnamon and spice. A great christmas smelling beer, even though I had it in October. Rich full bodied, but perhaps a bit too clovey and estery for my liking. The apple cinnamon lingers in the finish. Good, but on the verge of cloying.

Keyaki Fall 2015. Cloudy deep gold almost like mango juice with a nice big soapy head. Clove, cinnamon, banana cream pie and some apple on the nose. Rich and creamy mouthfeel. Fairly sweet with a nice spice-laden finish. Very enjoyable.

Bottle at KyotoLefty’s. Aroma: Pear, rich banana, wheat, coriander and yeast Palate: Full-bodied. Flavor: Banana, pear, wheat, coriander Comment: Great blending of flavors. Rated 3.8 Bottle with 3/2014 Drink By Date. Aroma: Malty, roasted grain, caramel and banana notes with cinnamon spice. Palate: As this was aged 6 months in my fridge the body was a bit lighter than if it had been fresh. Medium Body. Flavor: Very much like the aroma. Comment: Look forward to retasting when it’s fresh as well as from tap. Rated 3.6/
Mild apricot aroma. Nice fruity malt flavor, creamy peach, then usual banana cake, hints of alcohol, peppery finish. Another well crafted and rounded Fujizakura brew, on par with some German legends.

7% on tap at Bungalow. 600 yen. Sold Out! Another keg arrived while we were there, saved again! This is a souped up version of their great weizen with a bigger bolder biscuity malt profile for winter. A lovely cloudy honey gold. Spicy, cinnamon, biscuity, zesty full bodied. An incredibly tasty beer where you don’t get the alcohol at all. This beer will not disappoint - fantastic stuff.
Bottle from Yamaoka. Pours a dark cloudy orange. Aroma of sweet banana and wheat. Fantastic creamy, banana taste. Great lasting flavour, one of the best weizen bocks I?ve had.

I really liked this. Used to drink it on the way up Fuji - by car that is. It is/was a good example of the style and good solid yeasty nose, dry and crisp. Sparkling on the tongue, quick clean finish.
0,35 l can, thanks larsga. Grassy hops, rather light, but there is some malty body. OK, but not very exciting.

Medium offwhite head. Yellow body with light carbonation. Dense, firm malty aroma with hoppy notes. Dry grassy malty straw taste with some darker notes. No obvious aftertaste, maybe a bit drier and grassier. Clean, clear mouthfeel. Well balanced, with a bit of taste. Quite nice. (0.35l can from some Tokyo grocery store.)

330 ml can. Bright yellowish golden colour. Clear. Tall fluffy white head that clings to the glass. Relatively strong malt character with some sweetness. Little hops to be detected. Rounded texture with not that much carbonation. Light drying hop bitterness. In the finish there is a little hop bitterness. Nicely balanced.
Bottle. Pours gold, white head. Aroma is malty, slightly bitter. Flavor is malt, slightly bitter and sweet.
Light golden color, light hoppy nose, sweet malty light body. Weak, don’t bother if you are in Japan.

I bought a can of the premium fuji-san on a recent trip to Japan and cracked in open without really knowing what to expect. A strong hoppy flavour and the alcohol really seems to hit you quickly. A darkish colour and a full body make this one of the better Japanese beers. Still you couldn’t have more than a few of these.
A golden/Orange color with an off-white head. A slight malty scent. A mildly sweet malt flavor with just a bit of a bitter follow. Better than the vast majority of other Japanese Macro Lagers.
Typical clear yellow color and sweet rice krispy aroma of most Japanese macro brews. Plain, bland and watery with a bit of sweetness. Nothing noteable but not disgusting like some others I've had.

column1: Hideji Inoshishi Weizen (Darken Boar Wheat Special)
column5: Botella in Miyazaki, tasted by the river. My 100th Japanese rating.. according to my scribbles on papers and in books. Unclear amber colour. Sweet malty and wheat aroma. Good mouthfeel. Sweet malty and wheat flavour with caramel and some dark fruits.

column1: Hideji Inoshishi Weizen (Darken Boar Wheat Special)
column5: Pours a hazy light copper color with a white head. Aroma is strong clove, bubble gum, wheat, and some slight pepper notes. Flavor is banana, clove, wheat, bubble gum, yeast, and a light peppery finish.

column1: Hideji Inoshishi Weizen (Darken Boar Wheat Special)
column5: Bottle. Slightly dark gold color, very tall, fine white head. Cloudy. Definitely darker than usual, similar to a Schneider. Lots of visible carbonation. Medium strong aroma of banana, wheat malt, clove. Relatively rich. Very rich wheat malt flavor, lots of bananas and cloves. Quite sweet, with very little citrus or sour flavors. Excellent wheat malt. Very rich and flavorful. Slight sour flavor kicks in at the finish to bring a bit of balance. Maybe a bit too sweet, but truly excellent wheat flavor. Near the top in terms of Japanese weizen. Full and rounded flavor.

column1: Hideji Inoshishi Weizen (Darken Boar Wheat Special)
column5: Bottled. Cloudy amber, small head. Papery caramelly nose.Sweet and medium bodied with rounded mouthfeel. No esters, no bitterness, not much really.

column1: Hideji Inoshishi Weizen (Darken Boar Wheat Special)
column5: Bottled, thanks to the ever generous omh crew. Pours out in a cloudy amber colour with a small white foam. Strong malty aroma of biscuits, wheat, caramel and vanilla. Medium to light-bodied with creamy flavours of caramel, cream and vanilla. Mild finish of milky chocolate, wheat and fudge.

column1: Hideji Inoshishi Weizen (Darken Boar Wheat Special)
column5: Bottle from Tanakaya shop in Tokyo. Copper-colored dunkelweizen that’s light on spice and tastes a lot like their White Weizen but for the gobs of sweet malt - very much like caramel malt. No hops to be found, really. A sweet, very wheaty malt bomb. Nicely done, guys!!!! One of my favorite dunkelweizens, as they’re usually higher in alcohol than I like, but this is only 4.5%.

column1: Hideji Inoshishi Weizen (Darken Boar Wheat Special)
column5: Also called "Darken Boar Wheat Special" on the label in English. Deep cloudy orange, but not very active. Some ripe fruit wheat style aroma and something almost medicine like, not quite clove, closer to menthol mixed with clove honey. That "whatever it is" comes out as a tartnes that leans toward lambic. Loads of sediment eventually smooth out a bit of the tartnes. I have encountered a similar tartness in Hitachino wheat over here, thought it was too young, but maybe thery are going bad on the shelves. Otherwise, calling it a German wheat is not quite right, perhaps its an emerging style from these Nippon brewers. In either case, I will have to say it doesN't work for me.

I had this about a year past expiry, but it was still very nice, though it was showings its age. Dark brown color, light brown head. Nose the had wafts of caramel, maple and dark chocolate. Light bodied for 7%, with a rich chocolately mouth. Slightly sour with moderate bitterness. Dark chocolately dry finish. Very nice.

Keyaki fall 2016. Malty nose with honey and caramel and some alcohol on the nose. Syrupy body, more sweetness with some bitterness that kicks in mid-palate to finish. Well-balanced. Maybe a tad young, but I’m not a big barley wine fan anyway. Decent I guess.

Draught at Keyaki. 2015 version. Still quite green, bozy and unbalanced, average really. Tried a 2010 version last year which was quite dusty and probably past its prime. Still don’t get the hype about that one, price doesn’t make much sense either.

Cute little mini-bottle care of Time Maloney. Golden amber colour with hints of orange, hazy opaqueand with a white head. Nose is must grain, orange, tangerine, yuzu fruit, citrousy, vanilla, pithy orange fruit, orange liqueur. Taste is acidic citrousy, rich tangerine, orange pithy, yuzu, slight creaminess and pithiness.

On Tap at Oedo Beer Festival in Kanda, 2015 version, from a super small, 5 litre steel keg. Pours nice amberish golden, small head. Looking beautiful and fresh. Aroma is sweetish, some honey, malt character and also some herbal bitterness. First sip reveals some sweetness, herbal bitter flavour intensifies a bit but is still balanced with the strong and sticky body. Nice, but definitely too young - this beer would taste terrific after a few years of ageing. I even feel a bit guilty to drink it in this not-prime condition as the flavours are still edgy, somewhat green and still need more time to come together.

Tap at Bakushu Club Popeye, Tokyo. Hazy gold. Surprisingly elegant aroma with floral and honey notes. Taste is slightly syrupy but rather drinkable. Also very light and delicate on the tongue. Not really what I’m looking for in a barley wine but certainly an intriguing one.
Tap at Popeye, Tokyo. 12.0 %. Clear amber color, not much head. Aroma has alcohol, bread and light fruityness. Medium-bodied to full-bodied. Alcoholic kick, woody and dry. Some bitterness. Simple.

On tap @ Popeye in Tokyo, Japan. Aroma brings coriander, lemon, herbs, faint wheat and orange zest. Appears a dark golden copper with a thin foam lace. Complex flavors of malty syrup, orange peel overtones, soft peach, wheat, barley, bread and coriander. Overall, this is extremely good. Complex and fruity with well masked that comes out more in the finish for a nice warmth. A+ rating.
Keg at Popeye, Tokyo. Hazy amber, small head. Minerally melon aroma. Sweet with full body and rounded mouthfeel. Fruity and caramelly with crystal malt and minerals. Long bitter finish.

Draft at Popeye in Tokyo, 07/05/2013. 2012 vintage. Clear amber pour, little head, small ring of lacing. Aroma of fruitcake, golden raisins, sweet sherry, toffee. Taste is fruity malts, toffee, nice piney hops, toasted character, moderate bitterness. Medium body, not too sticky. Maybe too young, but still decent and worth a try if you dig the style.
Draught at Yellow Ape Craft, Osaka. Clear amber - white head. Dried fruits. Light oxidation. Ryebread. Ok hoppy. Rather sweet. Nutty. Ok bitterness. Alcoholic. Nice.
Cornflakes. Sweet malts with hints of orange rind. Mild bitterness with a peppery finish.

Bursztynowe, lekko zmętnione, piana biała trzyma się dobrze. Aromat cytrusowy podkręcony lekkimi żywicami. W smaku cytrusowe z owocami cytrusowymi, wytrawne o bardzo dobrze zsynchronizowanym aromacie i smaku. Na finiszu trochę ściągające, goryczka średnia.
Citrusy. Begins a bit sweet, soon turn bitter and is finished with a pleasant cereal maltiness.

On tap pours out a hazy orange color topped with a small head. Nose is citrus orange tangerines mango hops and a light malt sweetness. Taste is more of the citrus mix with a pithy grapefruit bitterness on the end.

Bottle from COSTCO variety 6-pack. Pours darker orange, well, you can even say its lightly hazy amber. Malty nose, bit of caramel, some light aromatic hop character but mainly wet malts and some light sour character. Tastes has malt backbone, somewhat rough or unpolished feel, light sweetness and quite a lot of bitterness. Again, not the best condition - but it was released in COSTCO just recently, so the beer should not be that old. Maybe a bit heat-damaged? That means I should drink other beers from my 6-pack quickly as well. Overall decent but the same beer has tasted much better in the past.

5.5%ABV. APA. Tapped out deep gold. 10ºSRM. Nose has lush tropical fruit aromas with mango, table grapes, green papaya, guava. Mouthfeel is juicy. Palate has biscuits, soda crackers, white bread. Hops are pine, sap, grass, leaf, cilantro, parsley, mango peel, lime leaf. Finish is medium with a leafy, sappy bitter.

Japońskie Rising Sun ma bursztynową barwę, jest nieco mętne. Piana, która osadziła się na powierzchni jest wysoka, biała i pozostawia ładne ślady na szkle. Aromat cytrusowy, słodki, przyjemny. W smaku lekkie, z nutami słodkich owoców, cytrusów. Goryczka wyraźna, grejpfrutowa, ale przyjemna, nie zalega. Wysycenie średnie. Dobre piwo!
Citrusy hop aroma. Nice balanced out bitter taste with some cookie/malt aftertaste.
Pours orange with a small head, aroma of fruits, pineapple, mango, flavor is bitter with fruits, mango, pineapple, medium bodied
Poured at Shelton Festival, hazy yellow with medium white head that lasts. The aroma is citrus and pine. Medium body, grass, grapefruit, bitter finish, very good.

Bottle from World Beer Market (Sake no Taniguchi) web shop. Yeasty nose, with roast malt, caramel, and small fruitiness. Dark amber color. Nicely rounded toasty malt, a quick move to moderate bitterness, a touch of light chocolate, and a bit of brown sugar. Medium body. Very malty, smooth, and tasty. Perhaps a touch too yeasty.

Draft at Nakameguro Taproom. Reddish amber color with a nice two finger off-white head that lingers. Good lacing throughout. Biscuit and caramel aromas with some stone fruit, peach and molasses. Kind of scratchy on the palate with the fruit hanging on but the malt flavors really stand out. A nice rounded sweetness.

Medium amber color. Frothy white head. Minerally fruity nose that is distinctively a steam beer. Clean palate with nice fruity notes. Long lingering minerally after taste. Don’t care for the style too much but this is nicely done

Baird Beer Bay Steam 2015 5% bottle picked up at 山岡酒店　Yamaoka-Saketen and about 2 months old. Pouring a deep amber color I can see how this evolved into their Red Rose Amber Ale. A biscuity sweet caramel nose. The taste is a nice chewy maltiness with nuts, light fudge and caramel. The aftertaste gives you a roasty chocolate kind of vibe. Tasty, I think I like this more than the Amber - cheers guys. Paired with a honeydew melon it really made the flavors of both pop bringing out some citrus notes, yum. 3.5-3.6
A bit too sweet and tired hop aroma. After trying five really good beers from the brewery today I expected more. Not a good beer, but not a bad one neither.

330 ml bottle. Appearance is a hazy amber colour, topped with quite a big two fingered head of white froth, which retains well. Aroma is subdued, but is typical English IPA, no big fruity hops, mainly florals and some malty and caramel. Tastes are similar, floral hop bitter, malty flavours. Light to medium bodied.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.
Bottle from Ales and Lagers in KL. Cloudy red with white head. Stone fruit and washing up liquid aroma. Sweet and sharp with cherry notes.
Bottle. Hazy caramel color. Aroma more caramel-coffe and tea like. Despite heavy body, it has kind of APAs nasty bitter taste. Interesting but not very enjoyable for me.

Bottle from a liquor shop in Sawa, Ibaraki, Japan. A hazy golden/amber coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Hoppy, citrus, malty aroma. Tastes similar, hoppy, citrus, malty, slight sweetness.

Aromat: nieco słodowości, miodu, karmelu Wygląd: bursztynowe, nieco zamglone, ładna piana, ładny lejsing Smak: landrynkowe, słodkie, karmelowe, goryczka ziołowa, nieco zielska Podniebienie: gładkie, ciało średnie, nieco wyklejające
Bottle. Definitely more English than American. Pours thick amber with thin head. Big malty character on nose and taste. Some deep citrus flavour. Ok but more amber ale than IPA.
Hazy brown body. Extremely malty ale with notes of caramel and dough. Not an IPA

Tao at Whole Foods in Cupertino. Aromabis muted caramel and slight wildflower. Pours hazy copper with soapy, chunky moderate off-white head. Flavor is breads malt with an obscure orange flower in the back half. Kind of has a malt extract aspect to it. Faint metallic.
Malty, a bit nutty with a faint chocolate background. Biscuity finish. Low to medium background bitterness. Some roastiness.
From tap : 400 ml, at: Nisha bar’o perspektyva labai geras ..

Bottle from a liquor shop in Sawa, Ibaraki, Japan. A murky brown coloured pour with virtually no head on top. Malty, caramel, fruity aroma. Tastes similar, malty, fruity, caramel. A little thin but very easy to drink.
Very chocolaty aroma. Sweet and bitter taste. Cloudy with a white head and tasty.
Draft at Skaal. Clear amber brown with no head. Caramel, slight roastiness, raisins, earthy hoppiness. Dry. Not overly complex.

Copenhagen 13/3 2018. 33 cl bottle from Meny. Chaotic looking label with Japanese Bowman ready to unleash an Arrow. Pours murky, hazy brown with yellowish head. Settles as thin layer of foam barely covering the surface of the beer. Moderate lacing. Aroma is strongly sweet. Brown sugar, caramel, toffee, butterscotch. Some sourish bitterness in the background. Medium carbonation and medium thick texture. Flavor is notably sweet but with a good balance in the medium bitterness that follows. Aftertaste is bitter. Finish semi dry. Nice easy to drink Brown Ale which have a bitter bitter edge to blance the inherent sweetness.
330ml bottle bought at Lola Terrace (Tokyo). English-style Ale, with roasted malts, smooth and good body

250ml Keg at Baird's Harajuku Taproom, Tokyo (¥600): Quite a pleasant offering from Baird, albeit one that came through slightly lighter than expected but at least it was fresh & had some bitterness showing too. The beer was easy to drink & balanced with some subtle hops showing without being overly pronounced & overall the beer was quite a clean, sessionable offering that was well worth trying too.

English-style brown ale from this English-owned Japanese brewery, bottle bought at Heilig Hart’s webshop. Tightly lacing, irregular, moussy, pale greyish white, stable head over a lightly hazy, translucent ruddy mahogany brown beer with coppery red hue. Aroma of pink peppercorns, red bell pepper, caramel candy, freshly cut red apple, raw rhubarb, cooked turnip, red beetroot, horseradish even, unripe peach, redcurrant, grape peel, sourdough, damp soil, dried old orange peel, unripe blue plum, light grapefruit juice, cloves, vague liquorice. Fruity onset, lots of red apple crispness, hints of peach, pear and some light pineapple, sweetish core with mildly souring edges, medium carbo, slick and supple mouthfeel. Light but well-dosed malt body, with a nutty, fuller, caramelly sweetish side to it on the one hand and a sharper, cereally graininess on the other side but adding a bitterish toasty quality later on, bit resiny, with ongoing fruity aspects; ends dryish, with sourish impressions lingering alongside a herbal, softly spicy and lightly citrus peel-like hop bitterishness which remains elegant and subtle, penetrating the bittersweetish, nutty and toasty malts with a soft bitterness without becoming overpowering as would be the case in an American-style interpretation of this beer genre. Remains crisp, fruity and juicy, nothing really complex or otherwise ambitious going on here, but to the point, very quaffable and elegant. Has the lightness and quenching features of any proper English brown ale - a style remarkably diminishing in its country of origin. Fits its style denominator quite well.

330 mL bottle shared by ebone1988 for the stupid book. The pour is a mahogany brown color with a light egg shell colored ring of head and maybe a spot or two of lace. The aroma is seeet and candy forward. There is a little bit of bitter malt and a light toffee on the back end. Very light. The flavor is a little sharper. The alcohol up front is a bit of a turn off for me. There is a light fruitiness and the candy is there. The alcohol is overwhelming the other items. The mouth feel is a little light but decently carbonated with a lingering malty alcohol coming through heavily. Not too bad. 6 4 6 4 14

Bottle. A- Mild tart cherry, roasty. A- Dark brown color, dark liquid, beige head. T- Roasty, leather, cocoa, watery. P- Medium body, slightly thin texture, slightly flat carbonation, weak finish. O- Should start by saying this was 4 years old (3 past the best by date) so it was bound to be a tad less than desirable. Rather weak and a bit dry. Tasted like stale weak coffee water.

A lighter porter, with flavors of coffee and chocolate. Has a thinner feel. Appearance is medium brown at best. I thought this was a European porter because of the flatter feel and density, but noticing from Japan...which kind of explains it. Good beer...I just prefer something heavier and more robust.
Roasted chocolate aroma. Well balanced between malt and bitterness. Roasty finish.

Bottle from COSTCO variety 6-pack. Pours dark brown woth light brown foamy head. Nose is soft, has light tartness to it, otherwise roasted and exhibits lots of dark malts. Tastes smooth, not creamy per se but goes easy, has good roast character, nice bitterness and just a touch of fruity tartness coming mainly out in the lingering finish. Dry roast continues even longer. Pretty good example of a classic porter.
Draft. Dark brown pour. This one is flat on draft, not sure if it is the bar or keg, smooth and cola-like, touch of smoke.

Buena Porter entre chocolate y café un poco más cafetera . De buena espuma ddensa y muy agradable. De sabor agradable no muy intensa pero con una profundidad muy agradable se notan las maletas intensas. Muy agradable y de lcohol justo

I tried bottle which was more then year old and it was ... like thick water with some darker malts. Light intensity flavor, like brown porter with not much roasted character. Even a bit brown ale alike but without sweet/sour balancing. No thx.

Pours dark mahogany with thin head. Aroma is tart cherries and light chocolate. Taste is dark chocolate (heavy) and raisin (light), warming to coffee and roast. Finish is light roast. A curious, interesting porter.

Pours a deep brown with a thin beige head. The aroma is lighter and has roasted malt, licorice, chocolate, nuts, and some thin earthiness. The taste is also a bit light, but it is pleasing. Flavors are a balance of chocolate, coffee, licorice, with subtle amounts of roasted malt, caramel, and nuts. The aftertaste is a minor chocolate. Its medium in body, with a smooth, creamy texture, and is soft in carbonation. Nothing wrong with this one, but you should be able to find better options.
33 cl bottle. Pours almost black with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee. Taste is roasted malt, nuts, coffee, chocolate and licorice notes.

On firkin at Commercial Tap House on 05/16/2011. Clear dark amber body with a medium creamy tan head. Light roast and bready malt aroma. Sweet roast, bready malt and dry earthy hop flavor and a slightly sour note. Medium light body with moderately low carbonation.

Cask pint at McGrath’s Pub in Harrisburg. Clear, dark brown with a small ring of cream. Light nose of chocolate and spicy caramel. Flavor is the same with a bit more spice that provides a slight hop tingle. Light-medium body is softly carbonated of course, and sweet but has just enough hop and roast for a nice balance.

Cask @ the brewery. Pours a dark brown color with a tan head. Has a light roasted malty caramel aroma with weak hoppy hints. Light roasted malty caramel and chocoalte flavor. Has a fruity malty caramel finish.
Nice from victory downimgtown. Aroma sweet and buscuity. Taste well balanced subdued mild enhanced by cask serving.

From Cask at Local 44 west Philly. Ample white head that left a lingering lacing. Strong Sweet aroma of nuts and malt. Mild carbonation with full mouth-feel. Malty and sweet with subtle hop finish. Good session ale.
Bronze colored with a lush burnt-caramel head. Grain, caramel, and Munich malt nose. Flat, bland malt with perhaps a tinge of cardboard. Not awful, but certainly underpowered.

On tap at Holy Smoke. Pours a clear light cola brown with a thin white head. Toast, and a light sweetness. Sweet, but very light, chocolate notes. Nice balance of toast and soft hops and some gentle sweetness. Very light finish with some crisp bitterness. Great session beer.

Hand pump deep reddish clear pour beige creamy head ..... sticky lacing aroma of sweet and toasted caramel malts .... taste is of very sweet and toasted malts sticky and light not a bad brew to start with clean finish and nice creamy mouthfeel

dark brown with large tan head. nose of some roasted malt. some bitterness before medium crystal malt with roasted malt and little hop flavor. some english character before a dry finish. overall a slightly roasty version of the style, but solid

This beer is a very interesting beer, in the fact that is actually a small beer, and not really a traditional mild per say. So what exactly is a small beer? It isn’t really a style, but a very old brewing practice, where brewers would actually get two beers out of one mash. When a brewery would do a strong beer, such as an old ale/barleywine with a high gravity wort, they would actually sparge again, and use the second runnings of the mash, to make what was called a small beer. Small beers of course, would be lighter in color, alcohol, and flavor, making them perfect session or drinking beers. They were sold for much cheaper than the old ale, and were the drink of the common man who didn’t have all that much money for beer at the time. Victory’s Milltown Mild is a small beer in that sense, as it is brewed from the second runnings of their world class barleywine Old Horizontal. Milltown Mild comes in at a very modest 3.3% abv, and is served cask conditioned, pulled from a beer engine at the brewery. Milltown Mild pours to a beautiful, bright, deep golden color with a thick and creamy white head, from the sparkler used on the swan of the beer engine, and a very soft carbonation. The nose on this beer is very nice, with aromas of light sweet malty aromas, and hints of grassy hop aroma. The palate is very soft and lean, with some good biscuity/toasty malt flavors, and just a slight touch of ripe fruit. Milltown Mild finishes slightly malty/fruity, and refreshing as well. I could drink a lot of this beer!
12oz bottle-A light amber body with a small off white head and an aroma of malts and hops. Taste of the same but much better than the blond. Could of been worse.
Bottle. A reddish brown color with a light tan head. A strong cherry aroma with a malty cough syrup flavor. Rating from 2005 notes.

During my stay in Aniheim to take the family to Disneyland, this was one of only two local beers I could find. All stores had imported beers or the Macros. This beer safely made it with me across the country traveling in my dirty laundry bag. Still it had a sizable head and nice red color. Alittle yeast at 1st. JB and I enjoyed this 24 oz bottle while barbecuing.
Hazy red orange with big head. Nice flowery aroma. Yeasty taste to start , some malt in the palate. I enjoyed this beer. Special thanks to Ron for crossing the country with it to share with me.

(12 oz bottle: Hi-Time Wine Cellars in Costa Mesa, CA) Ladies and gentlemen, step right up. Welcome to a review chronicling a momentus occasion, for what you are about to read will fill you with awe. What I have here is a bottle of Brewbakers beer that is NOT infected! Yes folks, as astonishing as it might sound, believe it! And not only is it not infected, it’s not even a horrible tasting beer! Okay, it’s not the greatest flavor, but I’m just happy it isn’t sour. It’s fairly malty and very sweet, but the sweetness is sugary rather than malty. Mild hops is barely detectable, so this is just a sweet beer, but for some reason, though one-dimensional and pedestrian, I think it’s reasonably enjoyable. Nose echoes the sweet, malty flavor. Dark amber color with a ruddy tint. Small off-white head maintains a thin layer for awhile, and some small patches of lace are left on the glass. Thanks for attending my review, now exit carefully and have a great evening. Come back soon!
Light amber color with a smallish tan head. Sweet malt alcohol aroma. Taste was pure garbage malt with an almost as bad caramel. Thin bodied. I wanted to brush my teeth after this one.
Amber-orange, small head. Malty brew with a tinge of hops in the finish. Drinkable but nothing distinctive about it.
Very orange in color, head faded fast! flat almost, light smell, not a favorite not will I jump to drink again.
Orange-like color and a small head. Subtle malt and hop aroma. BeerLimey has the flavor pegged. Pretty blah, drinkable.

Pale clouded amber, decent head formation. Subdued aroma, clean malts and a hint of fruit. Relatively clean palate, a touch of caramel, a touch of sugar, sour hoppiness in the finish. Not much emphasis or anything going on.

column1: Audomaroise Ambrée à la Chicorée / Bière des Cossettes
column5: Bottle 75cl, a cloudy amber beer with nice head very creamy. Nose is on vanilla and cereals, aroma is sweet like with grain, caramel and cereals notes, spicy touch on pardise sides and licorice, creamy body.

column1: Audomaroise Ambrée à la Chicorée / Bière des Cossettes
column5: Bottle from Carrefour, Coquelles, Citi Europe 21.03.11 consumed 24.03.11 Pours hazy light brown with tan head. This was a real gusher out of the bottle, unsure why this was so, it had been left still for some time & lightly chilled. Some sweet malts and yeast, light fruitiness although this is a very slight astringent bitter note (chicoree) otherwise it is fine. A6 A3 T6 P3 Ov13 3.1

column1: Audomaroise Ambrée à la Chicorée / Bière des Cossettes
column5: Couple of pints at The Penguin. Pours a not especially attractive murky copper with a tall, lurid yellow-cream head that trembles like blancmange. Slightly sharp, yeasty aroma with suggestions of rhubarb, liquorice Allsorts (especially the purple ones) and...the pig pen. Bright and yeasty with plenty of rhubarb/apple fruit, a suggestion of spice, ladles of oak...and those Allsorts again. There’s quite a yeasty, autumnal English feel to this one, and it’s drinkable but a bit tedious by the 750ml bottle.

column1: Audomaroise Ambrée à la Chicorée / Bière des Cossettes
column5: Bottle@Home.Very spicy aroma with a fruity sourness. Hazy/cloudy amber, yellow head, good lace. Sweet, fruity sourness, quite spicy, light bitterness. Soft mouthfeel.

column1: Audomaroise Ambrée à la Chicorée / Bière des Cossettes
