The almond, and apparently basil, provide a uniqueness in a beer that I have not tried. A pretty decent effort and recommended if you can get your hands on this limited release.
Average stout. There is really nothing special about it but its still a good beer none the less.

RBSG2003 (extended) (On tap at the brewery) This beer rocks! Deep, hazy copper brew with a small, quickly diminishing head. The aroma? Wow! Me likes! Fruity, leathery, smokey and very astringent. Mysterious. Musty and old smelling like weathered paper and a good, single malt scotch whiskey. The flavor is malty with blasts of light molasses, but also pungent and lemony. Warm alcohol as well. Heavy and full-bodied with a syrupy mouthfeel and pillow-soft carbonation. Short, sweet finish. Excellent, world class scotch ale!

OK, my first brew to rate without a rating. I sampled this brew in the brewers Pub in Kalamazoo, MI. This brew pours a small white head of fine bubbles and a light reddish transparent body color. It has a mild fruity aroma and a flat taste of cherries. Overall, I found it to be very nice and drinkable, but had to place the tastes. Of course that was after sampling seven beers across the street at bells and several of Kraftbrau’s 5 oz samples of some of there other brews.
Sweetish flavor with a slight bitter ending. Local fresh beer well brewed with nice lacess on the glass.
Bottled. Golden color. That hensfood aroma again, yet slight of it. Not such alcohol feel as one would think. Sweetish flavor with a slight bitter ending.
Tap. Dark golden color. Interesting dark malt flavor on a lighter body. More aroma than I expected.
tap @ now defunct brewpub on 16 Nov 2011. dark brown with small head. roasted malt & sweet with a rather weak body. thin and bland.

Bottle. Dark brown with red. It is opaque. A nice thick head of almost oatmeal consistency leaves lacing. A chocolate and yeast nose. I taste coffee first and ashes after that. Grass flavor and that doesn’t seem to belong here. Some roast, too. Feel is thin. In a nutshell, this tastes like cold coffee.
On tap at the brewery. Pours very dark brown with a tan head. Roasty, smoky aroma with cocoa. Flavor is also roasty, with coffee and cocoa. Light palate. It’s decent.

Very dark brown pour with a small white head. Subtly roasty malt and bread aroma. Nutty bread flavor with a little bit of a spicy noble hop finish and a touch of brown sugar. Medium body with a crisp lager finish and moderate carbonation.

pours brown/black with no head. light earthy, coffee aroma. some sweet roasted grains come through but flavor drops off pretty quickly. the palate is quite thin. makes for easy drinking, but fails to leave a lasting impression.
pours black with small medium brown head...aroma is of roasted coffee and chocolate...flavor is pretty weak, and is of coffee and bitter chocolate...thin palate

draught. deep dark brown with a slight red tinge on the edges along with a small white ring of head. aroma has some nutty roastiness. somewhat hollow and metallic body with the aforementioned nuttiness that shows up in the aroma. fairly average overall.

Draft sampler at MBC. Poured a dark brown color with an average off-white head that diminished slowly. Moderate roasted malt aroma. Medium body. Good roasted chocolate flavor with a medium soft finish.

On tap at MBC. Dark brown body, thin off-white head. Thin roasty, toasty, nutty aroma. Flavor of dry chocolate and nutty notes, dominated by toast. Thin palate that gets a bit tart in the aftertaste. Easy drinking, but too thin with a weak finish.
This one has a pretty low ABV. I was not overly impressed, I prefer their stout to this one. A nice chocolate undertone with a malty taste. Thinner than one would expect for a dark beer.

GABF 2010. Pours a deep red amber with thin head. Aroma is big sweet caramelized malts, big caramunich, vienna breadiness, toffee, earth leather, slight fruitiness and light hops. Flavor is caramel, toffee molasses, light earth, grass, nuts, biscuit, with a medium finish and light astringency in the end. Ok.

On tap at the brewery. Rating #9 of the beer. Pours garnet in color with a trim beige head. Smells and tastes of raisins, rye, black licorice, earth, and malt. Bolder in aroma than flavor, but this is still pretty awesome for a Dukles -- easily the best I’ve had since I was in Germany.

Deep mahogany body with a nice top. Not much nose is able to be coaxed from this one. The body proves quite sweet for the style, plenty of unfermented sugars. Perhaps this batch is a bit under-attenuated? A fine medley of caramunich and vienna malts and the like. Enjoyable.
Pours a reddish brown. Aromas of chocolate/nuts/ and some fruit. Flavor didn’t stand up to the aroma. A little chocolate/coffee taste.

Pint from draught at the Milton Tavern. Sweet, sticky, rich. Caramel-toffee malts with notes of nuts and spice. The alcohol definitely brought a smile to my face, similar to what scrizzz reported (funny!)...I found myself grinning ear-to-ear by the time I finished the pint.
draught at brewery. rich toasty even breakfast oatmeal aroma, rich heavy clear brown, nice lacing. heavily malted complex goodness. long roasted finish. makes me smile

At the brewpub. Served way too cold, around 4-5 degrees C. Nice burgundy colour. No aroma at all until about 10 minutes of trying to massage some heat into it, but once it had warmed, it gave off a lovely rich malty aroma, toffee, caramel, rye bread, licorice and light spice. Full-bodied. Flavour shows a big maltiness, molasses, licorice, dark cherry. Yeast gives off an interesting minty and herbal character. Once warmed, is a solid brew.

Dark brown with auburn highlights. Aroma of earthy, chocolatey malt. Full body. Smooth, dark malt palate. Slight raspberry note. Chewy, toffeeish finish. Served way too cold, this beer was useless at first glance, but opened up as it warmed and is actually quite a good bock.
Didn't care much for this one.Brown in color, beige head. Slightly metallic malt nose.Flavor is all malt but with a yeasty, fatty ending. Decent body

Gold Medalist at the 2001 GABF. The new batch was just recently released with much anticipation (at least on my behalf). Very dark color, very modest flavor. Very mellow and perfectly round. The malt is teeming with nuttiness and baked bread and the alchohol gives way to licorice and vinous notes. Although not really a big beer, this is definitely a very well crafted brew.
Deep copper in color. Nice thick, creamy head. N'Western hops present and quite sweet. Bold hop accent but lower on the bitterness than I was expecting (needs more). Overall a nice beer to drink.
Draft - Light toast and caramel. Muddy brown with a small white head. Raisin, some prune and sweet toasty malts. Kinda like a dubbel. Not bad

A typical inoffensive red beer with a surprisingly nice aroma. Just a hint of hops in it, balanced by sweetness. Flavour isn’t much... A bit of bitterness over smooth malt. Not very intense, but not bad. I’d compare this favorably to Rickard’s Red or Upper Canada Dark, at least. Hoped for more from a brewpub, but that’s what the Granite is for.

[2483-20090913] Tap. Generic grainy yeast straw aroma. Clear, brown amber body with a quick foamy off-white head. Grainy yeast flavour has some fruity grapes and hay. Medium body. Fair. &#40Called "Old Mill" @ Tracks; Brampton, ON&#41

2009-09-13. Dark amber brown body with a small white head and lace. Tangy/yeasty malt aroma. &#405+&#41 Flavour has a tangy dry malt character, sweeter caramel notes, light bitterness. &#405+&#41 Average palate is lightly carbonated. Meh. On tap at the brewpub as ’Old Mill’

Dark red-amber. Small purple-grey head. Light malt, fruit (cherry?), & hop aroma. Medium body. Fruity (cherry, grape), at first, giving way to light malt & a moderately bitter finish. Slight carbonated, mineral water character.

This suburban sports bar has had a brewery on premises for quite some time. They produce a lager and an ale, though from what I've heard only one at a time. Old Mill Ale is a dark amber ale with pleasing fruity-hoppy aroma, reminiscent of leaves, pears and maybe melon. The body matches these flavours with a slight bitterness in the beginning, followed by a sticky maltiness, a product of the extract nature of the brewery, but not offputting. Carbonation is nice and low, making for a pleasantly drinkable pint.

On tap. Cloudy straw pour with quickly diminishing white head. Nose is all tarty cranberry and strawberry. Up front is the same. Not getting much of the syrup, but I can’t imagine what this would taste like without the added ingredient. Finishes with a salty earthiness. Not getting a yeasty "wheat beer" character. Just not very good.
taste was like a blue freezee. wasnt bad by any means just a little to sweet for my liking
Tap, pours bright yellow. A bit heady. Aroma is very cranberry like. Has a nice sweet flavour. Not much maple but the cranberry is nice. Nice smooth finish
Beer Fest, Toronto: Aromas of cough syrup and lolly pops. Taste is sweet with wheat and cranberry. Watery. Disappointing

On tap at the brewery. Appearance: Amber orange, small white head. Aroma: Cranberry for sure, some strawberries and wheat. Flavour: Quite sweet and malty, some cherry and cranberry, almost ’cooler’ like, not a bad little tipple.
341 bottle from 6-pack purchased at brewery. Pours light gold with thin white head. Strong berry smell. Fairly strong berry taste with a dry finish. All in all a decent summer beer.

A fine looking hazy wheat ale with an aroma of jolly ranchers and it tastes okay but is reminiscent of a bagful of artificially flavoured halloween suckers floating around in an okay american wheat. Sorry CK I love you and this beer is well made but I don’t get it. It’s like a girl drink.

341 ml bottle - pours a clear medium gold colour with very little head. Aroma is mainly fruitiness with cherry upfront, some cranberry, and a hint of green apple. Flavour a bit strange - a bit too saccharine and not much maple at all. I guess cranberry is in there, but the whole thing kind of reminded me a bit of cherry fluoride. A decent grainy presence in the body saves this one from being completely ridiculous. Didn’t get much wheat. First Church-Key brew I’ve had that I’ve been slightly disappointed by. Oh well, I guess there had to be one.....interesting experiment though.

Bottled sample via gregclow. Light gold in colour with fairly strong carbonation. Aromas of cherry, some cranberry, a bit of lemon, herbs, and some light sweet malts. Some tart cranberry flavors, along with some very mild maple notes. There’s an odd artificial sweetner flavor there too that just doesn’t work for me. The body is very thin, and there just doesn’t seem like a whole much else going on.

This wheat beer poured a light cloudy yellow colour with a frothy white head. To the nose was a full blow of fruit. Almost medicine like, cough syrup to be exact. Very hard to get around the sweet cranberry smell. Swedish berries come to mind. First sip is sweet and all I can taste is the cranberries. Still reminds me of cough syrup with a beer base. At least its not as sweet as some other fruit beer I’ve had before. This beer is a one bottle per day beer, I don’t think I could handle any more.

On tap at the brewery. Pours yellow with medium white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of coriander, orange peel, perfume. Taste is of coriander, orange peel, perfume, lavender. Palate: Light body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Good. Interestingly fresh. Nothing off.

Clear brilliant golden win a thin Rocky white head. Wheaty nose with some gentle earthiness, a kiss of Clove and maybe some lemon zest. Medium body with a bit more lemon zest than the nose hinted at, with a quiet wheaty and bland toast finish. Meh.

This beer pours a hazy straw color with a thin white head that evaporates quickly. Spotty lace. Wheat and malt in the nose. Light-bodied with flavors of herbal wheat, bready malt and mild hops. The finish is wheaty with a short grassy hops aftertaste. Average overall.
Tap. Golden pour. Bananas and wheat on the nose. Very wet and slightly sweet. Grassy and earthy with nothing truly remarkable. I would pass the next time.
On tap at Woody’s in Golden. Hazy yellow appearance with a white lacing. Wheat malts, citrus zest, herbs and light spice. Pretty refreshing.
On draft at the brewpub it is a clear golden color with a slight head. The aroma is of pineapple and the taste is very thin with s bitter aftertadte. There is no clear flavor tor mr
On draft at the brewpub in Frisco CO. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Light wheat nose. Flavors of bread. Light crisp finish.

Tap at brewpub. Pours mostly clear yellow/gold with fizzy white head. Aroma is cereal and biscuit malts, light wheat, light citrus, and light floral notes. Flavor is dry malts, light grassiness, and light citrus esters; crisp, dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.
Draft at the brewery. Pours almost clear yellow gold with a thin, fizzy white head. Tastes like creamy lemon, nutty, wheat. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like light musk And grains.

Bottled. Light yellow- orange color with a thin white head. The aroma is mostly wheat with light notes of orange. The taste is thin bodied, wheat flavor with light orange and malt. Overall a pretty bland beer.

column4: CraftWorks Restaurants & Breweries -Rock Bottom Corporate Office
column5: Pretty decent hefeweizen on draft at the King of Prussia restaurant. The beer poured a cloudy and hazy dark straw color with a fairly small white head. There was only a minimal amount of lacing left from the head. The nose had lots of banana, clove and pepper, as did the flavors.

column4: CraftWorks Restaurants & Breweries -Rock Bottom Corporate Office
column5: Rated on 9-10-2011 at Mad Anthony Oktobeerfest in Fort Wayne, IN. This draft beer has a small off-white head that is long lasting, opaque straw body and spotty amounts of lacing. The aroma is malt, wheat, sweet, bananas, spicy, and clove. The taste is lightly sweet, malt, wheat, bananas, clove, and light spice. The mouthfeel is light tingly carbonation and this beer is medium bodied. This is an easy drinking and session beer. The various flavors come together nicely and I would drink this beer again.

column4: CraftWorks Restaurants & Breweries -Rock Bottom Corporate Office
column5: Dark hazy orange pour, served with a slice of orange floating on top so you know what your palate is about to get. Smells like citrus, banana, wheat, and clove. Tastes pretty much like that, but with some hops that I couldnt get from the smell, and more of a wheat finish. Medium bodied and quite refreshing. It’s like a beer-snob’s version of Blue Moon.

column4: CraftWorks Restaurants & Breweries -Rock Bottom Corporate Office
column5: Draft at Rock Bottom La Jolla. Nose of banana, wheaty bread, and apricot. Murky yellow with a medium glass lacing pale yellow head. Flavor is big banana and wheat. Great hefe.

column4: CraftWorks Restaurants & Breweries -Rock Bottom Corporate Office
column5: Scottsdale. Cloudy yellow. Aroma has lots of banana, yeast, cloves and bublegum. Flavor is smooth and sweet with yeast and spices. I enjoyed this.

column4: CraftWorks Restaurants & Breweries -Rock Bottom Corporate Office
column5: On tap at Rock Bottom Minneapolis on 05/26/2009. Hazy orange body with a medium frothy off-white head. Sweet banana and clove aroma with some faint fruit notes. Big banana flavor, some yeastiness, and a bit of faint clove on a wheat background. Medium body with moderate carbonation.

column4: CraftWorks Restaurants & Breweries -Rock Bottom Corporate Office
column5: Cloudy/hazy yellow with a very nice, long-lasting and lacing head. Aroma is coriander, clove and wheat, bubblegum. Taste is sweet bubblegum, strong clove and astringent coriander. Burns the tongue. Ending leaves a smooth, foamy and silky coating on the mouth. Sampled on draught at the brewery in Arlington, VA.

column4: CraftWorks Restaurants & Breweries -Rock Bottom Corporate Office
column5: spot on kid!... desert ridge location. hazy pale yellowish shade of brown with a light white ring. grain and banana hit the nose first followed by light spice/clove, floral, earth/dirt and a light citric tartness. definite bruised banana flavor with some wheat and vanilla. bitter dry finish. medium body leaves a light lactic-like film in my throat. it feels vibrant and sparkly from the carbonation. it tastes good up front but seriously lacks on the finish and back of the tongue...

column4: CraftWorks Restaurants & Breweries -Rock Bottom Corporate Office
column5: Give me a break with the location madness, this beer is in Ballston Vigineeaaa. Do you think I don’t know how I spelled that? Pours darker cloudy bananana yellow with a 1.5 inch white head. Aroma of banana and a little onion. Cigarette smokers just kill, I mean really fuck up, your beer rating experience. God knows what the hell it smells like? Fucking parlaiment nicotine and formaldahide? When is the rest of the nation going to grow up to Austin’’s no smoking rules? Surely Virginia will be second to last next to South Carolina. Maybe there’ a luttle sweet banana and mild clove in there. Tastse like some wood, oak, and light banana yeast with a little vanilla. Good lacing. Dry, woody finish.

column4: CraftWorks Restaurants & Breweries -Rock Bottom Corporate Office
column5: Sample at Desert Ridge location. Pours the standard hazy yellow with white head. Nose is spice, clove and banana. Palate is cloves, Belgian-like spice, banana and a touch of an apple-like taste. Medium mouth feel with ok lacing. Not bad – refreshing beer.
Scottsdale: Clear pale and golden with a light Eastern European hop aroma. Light caramel flavor and a smooth medium bitter finish round out an average pilsener.

Well, ther’s nothing especially wrong with it, and there are no specifically bad flavors. It’s just, well, bland. The words "mild", "mellow", "understated" and "subtle" figure way to prominently in my notes.

Just had this back to back with the Southern Tier IPA and it is much less hoppy. Orange-yellow color, moderate white head. Aroma is more sweet than hoppy. Aroma of sweet malt(crystal) and pine. Flavor is pretty sweet. Sweet finish.
Brewtopia 2004: Hazy orange with a thin white head. Spicy pine resin aroma, full thick fizzy body. Very bitter throughout. A nice IPA.
Brewtopia’04. Hazy, heady beer. Again, a very bready, doughy smelling brew, some raisin aromas. Flavor was grainy, some pine, salt at the end, Could stand to be a bit more bitter.

This produced a huge, long lasting, creamy, off white head over a muddy, orange-amber colored beer. The aroma was too bready for my liking coming from an IPA. Hints of Apricot in the aroma too. The flavor got back on track a little better, but overall this just misses the mark somewhat.

On tap at Brewtopia 2004... Hazy, golden ale with a small, creamy, white head. The nose is fruity and malty with notes of butterscotch, toffee, apricot and grapefruit. The flavor is of pine, pineapple and apricot with a hint of toffee. Full-bodied with an astringent mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Lengthy, bitter finish.

On tap at Brewtopia. Good nose, pine with a n onion or garlic thing, maybe the "Everything". Brownish orange color. Sweet and little plasticy. Finish is little sweet. Not bad, though some might be turned off by the everything part IMHO
On tap at Brewtopia ’04. Poured orage/ yellow with a decent hops aroma. Taste was medium hoppy that faded in and out with some bitterness. A decent beer, but less hops than I would expect.

draught at brewtopia - I quite liked this one - amber/brown in color, not much head - bready aroma, with moderate hops and some spice and herbal notes - same with the flavor - quite a malty IPA, but the sweetness is balanced well with the hops and biscuit/bread-like aspects of this ale (they’re not kidding when the say "well bread beer") - I thought this was a pretty classic IPA.
(brewtopia04) Cloudy amber with particulate. Aroma is medium sweet, grapefruit. Taste is medium sweet, grapefruit, herbal, toasty, light caramel. Light-medium body.
Klassisches Dunkel mit einer netten Sueffigkeit, daneben mit ordentlich Malz und ausgeglichener Perlung. Dazu Nuesse und Karamell.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours out in a hazy dark brown colour with steady head and medium body. Aroma of malt and roasted barley. Taste of malt, hops, caramel, leaves and spices. Spicy-woody finish. Nice one.
Many thanks for this bottle to Erzengel. Pours a brown color with a large off-white head. A odd aroma of almost sour malts.

Amber-copper and slightly hazy in the glass. The beer starts smooth, a bit dry-malty, hints of sour. The mainpart is smooth, slightly sourish, malty, slightly dry. Interesting, but not very deep in aroma. Highly drinkable. The aftertaste is medium, dry-malty, slightly sourish and smooth-bready. Not too-bad typical Brauhaus-Dunkel. Ok for a session, with food or in the Biergarten, but nothing to enjoy on your own in the evening…. --> 7/12/7/7
Herber Antrunk, kurze Zeit später verbrannt röstig. Abseits davon wässrig, wenig malzig, wie die anderen Biere langweilig und einfallslos. Trinkbar – mit Abstrichen. 11/6/7/6//6

Draught @ Privatbrauerei Klute - Brewpub, Poppenbeck 28, Havixbeck, Nordrhein-Westfalen, 48329 Germany. Clear medium amber orange color with a average to large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, light bread, dark bread, grain, dusty, light hoppy. Flavor is moderate sweet and burnt sugar bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20090529]

Pours a clear amber, copper with thick cream-colored tingted head. Aroma is hops and definite nut tones and light vanilla sweetness. Falvor is of nuts. Tinge of brown sugar. Hops are more nuttyu body is light with fair carbonation.

Draught at the brewpub as Klutes Landbier Dunkel. Weakly sour aroma, but not really unpleasant. Hazy amber/orange colour. Big stable creamy taan head. The flavour starts off a bit sour. Hay-like flavour, quite watery. Thin mouthfeel. The sourness does not really go away, but it gives some character to an otherwise bland beer.
Grassy, herbal, hoppy aroma. Cloudy, orange/honey color, beige frothy/creamy head, good lace. Light bitter, malty, herbal, more than moderate full. Long lasting finish, light sweet and malty.
bottle from Dieppe Tourist Information. Amber-red colour, mid-sized off-white head. String malty start, slightly graiyn, with some caramel toffee and chocolate, herbal-earthy hops in the finish.
taverne de Thor Rouen. Bière qui rappelle au nez et en bouche les IPA en plus léger , belle robe , manque un peu de consistance.
Bottle 75cl, a clear copper amber beer. Nose is on caramel, toasted caramel, marzipan. Aroma is on sweet caramel, marzipan, butter caramel, spicy finish, good.

Bouteille de 75cl. Couleur ambrée bien limpide. Mousse généreuse qui tient bien. Au nez on est sur la tarte aux pommes, genre crumble. En bouche on est sur le caramel et le beurre salé. C'est très rond, très doux. Une bière très agréable, bonne surprise.

Bottle 75cl. Cloudy brown with an off-white head. Very weak aroma, but some undefined sweetness (malt), which goes in direction of caramel. High carbonized and unfortunate not a beer with much taste. Some hops are present, but it is not in balance. Short finish.

Kind of a strange beer. It is pretty bland for being 7% but it’s not bad I suppose. It does have aromas and flavors of apricot, grapes and honey so it is kind of sweet but none of the mentioned attributes give it enough zing to make it memorable. It also has a rather light body given the alcohol.

75ml bottle from the covered market in Etretat, Normandie, France. Poured almost flat with rising bubbles, aroma of cherries and apricot, reddish amber. Taste is sour and thin with an oily malt texture, bland for a 7% beer. Belgian candy sugar sweetness. Is it trying to be a Belgian sour, Biere de Garde or what?

Bouteille de 330 ml dégustée chez Le Quincampe (Paris, France). Arôme: Légère odeur de céréale et d’agrume. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence d’un moyen col mousseux et d’une finedentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût de caramel fruité avec une pointe de céréale. Durée moyenne de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de caramel en arrière goût. (Rating #4920)

33cl bottle. Dark red with small, grey head. Nose : delicate smoke, caramel, burned bread, wet laundry, dough. Sip : oily texture, delicate carbonation. Low to medium density body. Sweet caramel and burned dough flavour. The beer is a bit soapy too. Delicate smoke and leather. Some honey notes. Overall it's a bit too funky. I wonder who will come back to this beer after trying it. Not me.

Bottle. [thanks Feldthaus] Pours murky amber with a firm, staying, frothy, yellowish head. Aroma is malty, some yeast, mild citrus, light biscuity. Lowish carbonation, fine dry mouthfeel. Flavour has sweet caramel, some berry notes, a bit grainy, some yeast. Softly citric bitter. Okay.
Not distinctive but a well balanced beer and was thoroughly enjoyable. Nice deep copper color, moderate head and pleasant aroma.

Enjoyed this while chatting to the new brewmaster of the Houston Two Rows.. . pours a medium brown with a light sturdy head, low lacing . . nice hop presence, some light notes of maple also, very nice mouthfeel to.. man! put this on cask! .. . A nice brew! .. . "Couldn’t find a meter, so here’s $4."
On tap....nice color, aroma is hops, spices, and malts. Notes of cirtrus, pepper, and a bit fruit come out. For an english style esb, not bad. Actually one of the better ones I have had.
Tap at Dallas location. Small head, average reddish-amber. Malty w/strong cololate notes. Not really bitter at all but drinkable.
Sampled draught at TwoRows, Dallas. Nut brown. Flowery and yeasty. Sweet with hard sharp mouthfeek and a metallic finish withmedium bitterness.

Black brown color with a nice medium to large sized brown creamy head. Pretty good lacing. Nose is chocolate roasted malt, coffee, and some cardboard, and maybe even a strange garbage smell. I wonder how clean all the tap lines were at this brewery.......Taste is of chocolate, stale coffee, and brown sugar. Pretty smooth. Just ok in my book.

On tap at the brewery, probably there best offering. Pours with a thick, light brown head covering a black body. Nice lacing. Strong, forward, sweet coffee ground taste. Brown sugar and coffee aroma. Goes down smoothly.
Pours balck with a nice head. Aroma of deep coffee. Mouthfeel of chocolate but dominated by, you guessed it, coffee. Nice and roasted. Starbucks should sell this stuff.
Very black; head was slight and thin; great coffee notes in the nose. Great mouthfeel- good depth. Very pleasently surprised. Yummy.

Cola-fizz in the glass, caramel head, 98% opaque with only the faintest tint of red against a bright light. Dry coffee aroma, with a hint of candy-like flavor. Chocolately notes in the flavor, making it a bit like a Kahlua candy. Except, this is aggressively dry. Unfortunately, what stood out for me was an aroma and flavor like Prego-brand Extra Chunky Garden Vegetable Spaghetti Sauce. The body reminded me that this was a porter, not a stout. Decent beer, if I hadn't been so frequently reminded of spaghetti sauce.... (on tap, Grapevine, TX location)
Sampled draught at Big Buck, Grapevine, Texas. Very black. Big coffee aroma. medium bodiued and really roasty. Dry, but not very firm. Bitter salty finish.
Draft at Humperdink’s in Arlington. Amber color. Aroma of butterscotch. Taste is plain caramel with a mildly bitter finish.

I like Irish red’s and this one was very lackluster. Nose is soapy, malty, and of caramel. TAste is sweet and oddly sour, with some fruityness and a toasted quality. Very watery and the finish is weak.

Had at Humperdinks on Greenville. Amber body with a wring of off-white lacing around the glass. Aroma of alcohol, malts, dried fruits, and some peat. Watery with an odd malty taste that didn’t go down well.

Pint at The Ram, Salem ,Oregon Typical amber coloured ale, small off white head. Weak,bland aroma, malty. Malty taste, backed up with minuimal hops. Watery on the palte. Overall on par with Killians Irish Red but ok for $2.50 an imperial pint ( 22oz) happy hour.

On tap at the Lake Oswego Ram. Pours amber/red with a small white head. Like all of their beers this had a very watery body, kinda lifeless after the first sip. Soft caramel malt flavor up front, a touch roasty, but bland and watery. Finish had very little hop character, not crisp.
Sampled draught at Humperdinks, Dallas, Texas. Perfect amber appearance. Roasty, peaty and light bodied. Sweetish with thin mouthfeel and a metallic finish with low bitterness.
Pours light amber with a slight head. Malt, floral and and hops on the nose. Biscuit on the tongue. Mild English style ale.

Bottle: Deep golden, a bit unclear, stable medium-sized off-white head, grainy and slightly bisquity nose with some citrussy edges; light to moderate bitter-sweet flavour, light bodied, soft MF; slightly lingering citrussy-bitter finish. 0.K.…
slightly cloudy with a large head that rapidly disappears. Sweet grassy aroma, a bit fizzy, metallic taste.
Golden, clear and slightly hoppy.Not a lot of body considering its reasonable strength.Pleasant but not very demanding.

Subtitled: The Green Man Ale. 500 ml bottle. Light copper color. Decent white head. Light hop and malt aromas. Rather biscuit flavor with a slightly citrus bitter. Medium body with frothy carbonation. Mild overall, but a decent ale which finishes with a respectable amount of floral bitter.
Bottle thanks to father. Aroma is caramel and biscuity, floural hop, but minimal. Taste is similar, over carbonated and you can really taste the pasturisation.
Bottle at home ... amber ... light fruity hop ... balanced fruity ... light fruit little malt ... gentle floral hop ...

500ml bottle from Waitrose. Gold with a large loose off-white head; caramel aroma; malty with some fruit but little bitterness; leaving a sticky unappealling finish. There are much better organic ales than this.

Really, really unpleasant ale that is blatantly made by someone who cares about ’organic’ products, but has no knowledge about, or interest in, beer. It tastes disgusting and lingers unpleasantly (after a deceptively ok cereal malt nose).

Bottle picked up from Waitrose, Witney, 29-07-06. Copper coloured beer that had a large white head. Aroma was a little strange it’s bizarre that this is organic coz’ I felt that if anything the aroma was a bit chemically. Fairly uninspiring in the taste dept’ some maltyiness and low levels of bitterness, just a bit to safe really.

(Bottle 50 cl) Mahogany brown with a warm, reddish glow. Tall, handsome, beige head with good retention. Lovely fresh aroma of roasted malt. Surprisingly light body with lots of fruit and plenty of malty accents - not really burned malt though. Quite pleasant and drinkable but lacks some balls. 160206

A hazy deep red beer with a huge orange head. The aroma is sweet malty and slightly acidic and roasted. The flavor is sweet again combined with hints of acidity, but also notes of roasted malt, caramel and hints of sulphur. I think of this like more a Mild than a Porter.

Bottled: Reddish coloureed. Clear. Huge beige head. Sweet and light roasty aroma. Notes of sterin. Mild flavours. Light roast and sweetness. Some yeast present. Is smooth and easy to drink. Medium bodied. Has a light roasty notes in the end.
Bottled. Dark reddish brown with big head. Yeasty aroma. Yeast and coffee in the flavour. High carbonation level. Rather sharp and short finish. Quite light bodied.
Cask Handpump at the Fat Cat, Sheffield 22/12/2002 Dark red coloured strong in alcohol and rich on the palate. Slightly bitter finish.

Bottle conditioned. Dark brown with a very large off-white head. Roasted malts and nuts in the aroma with some light chocolate and coffee. Taste is dry and hoppy in addition to the above. Quite highly carbonated, light mouthfeel, drinks below its gravity. It would be better with a little less fizz.

Bottle conditioned. Mahogony in colour, quite light for a porter. Aromas are earthy sweet roast malts with some nuttiness. Flavours are nutty roast malts, chocolate and not so much earthiness as the aroma. Dry, hoppy and nutty. At this strength its a proper olde style porter.
From A Bottle.Black in colour with a red tinge,large head,a light coffee aroma,taste is of roasted dark malt and bitter chocolate,very smooth.

Beer #14 at Chelmsford Beer Festival, with Duff. This was a fruity porter, with some coffee hints, a smooth finish and a fairly light body. Perfectly pleasant, but I was expecting something a bit more beefy, and with greater punch, from a beer of this strength. Cask (gravity dispense).
Cask@Chelmsford BF. Quite easy going for a porter, lightly roasty, light tart mouthfeel, decent length and medium bitter.
Botella de 50 cl @ Cata de cervezas de St. Austell. Color cobrizo, espuma blanca escasa con poca retención. Aromas a cereal, malta, cítricos. En boca, maltosa y notas cítricas y florales. Correcta.
Bottle. pours golden almost without the head. Aroma is metal, some fruits, copper, some dry notes. Taste is metal, copper, dry, some butter, cereals, some bitter notes. Nice beer!
Dorée et transparente, avec un col de mousse disparaissant logiquement très vite, un nez très agréablement malté et une bouche maltée elle aussi. Un très bon pale-ale de soif !

Golden, hazy, white beerhead, with thin, fine foam, ok retention. The aroma is honey, floral, mint, and malty, slightly toasty. Light sweetness, light bitterness, soft carbonation. The taste is coincided with aroma. High drinkability.

Bottled. 15cl sample. The aroma has toffee malt, light floral/piney hops, bit herbal tones. Clear, copper coloured beer with a thin head. The taste is malty sweet, has herbal tones. Overall a bit boring.

(Bottle) Clear amber gold, tiny white head. Nice aroma of toffee malt and restrained hops. Light body with rather fizzy carbonation. Sweet toffee malt, hints of stewed apples and tea. Some restrained bitterness in finish. Very quaffable.

Color ámbar, cobrizo, cristalina. Un dedo de espuma sin retención alguna. Aroma herbal y a caramelo. Gusto en la misma línea del aroma, añadiría cereal y un ligero toque floral, amargor medio. Cuerpo acuoso. Pale Ale cumplidora y económica.
Bottle from Tescos. Nice crisp REFRESHING pale ale. I like it I would buy again

Thin off white head left a spotty cover on a pale copper coloured still body. Malt, caramel & English hops aroma. Medium bodied, soft & creamy over the tongue with a well carbonated clean back. Floral tastes with sweet malt, sugar, sweet berry & herbal tastes followed by a zesty citrus finish.

Can on BA flight from Bermuda to LGW. Very surprised by this one! Aroma is a bit of corn and open field wheat with faint spice (pepper) and floral aspects as it warmed. Clear light gold with moderate white head and slight patterns. Taste is fruity and floral. Nice beer.

RBESG 19 Grand Tasting. Expired in 2015, hah. Brown-amber body, light off whtie head. Sweet taste, brown sugar most of the way. Lean brown sugar-like malty taste, with the oxidation actually working in its favor some. Glad to have tried it!
Bottle. Unclear deep amber color with white head. Aroma is chocolate, caramel. Taste is caramel, raisins, chocolate, just a bit oxidized. Oily mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Quite nice!

Dark amber body with a small, good lacing beige head. Aroma is caramel, raisins, roasted malt, some diacetyl. Taste is caramel, brown sugar, red fruits, a bit of leather and toasted nuts. Slightly sour, buttery and caramel finish. Medium body, soft carbonation, watery but smooth texture.
0,5l Flasche. Mahargoni farben, orange-beiger Schaum. Kork und Malz Aroma. Würzig malziger Antrunk. Karamell, Gras. Ok
500ml Bottle - Dark brown with red tinges. Raisins, fruitcake and a hint of leather in the aroma. Fruity taste with raisins, plums, berries and a hint of spice. A rich, fruity and tasty bock.

Clear, deep amber to brown colored, small+ off white head. Aroma is of caramel, toasty malt, some fruity and light herbal notes. Taste is malty caramel, bit toffee, toast, fruity marmalade and light+ herbal bitterness, dry finish, bit alcohol. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, sticky.
dunkelbraun-rötlich. malzig süß, angebranntes karamell, Rosinen, leicht bitter. Für ein Bock leicht wässrig. Gut.

Thanks to Kraddel. 500 ml. bottle sampled. BBF 11.03.2012. Yeah… Dark brown amber, little in the way of head. Nose is 100 % oxidation, akin to thin Coca-Cola mixed with sherry, thinned by age & lots of sweetness, big thin sherry note. Taste is pure oxidation, low carbonation, Coca-Cola mixed with sherry, nasty bitter leaves in the finish, off-putting, syrup,… Thinned by age / oxidation body, low carbonation. Totally gone, okay I suppose if not for the unpleasant aftertaste.
Pours warm brown, not much head. Smell is dusty, sweet, caramel. Taste is bit bitter, sweet and caramelly. Easy drinking beer.

on tap at the brewery. purple brown, clear with a modest but lingering head; aroma of red berries, treacle and wet gutters; very sweet and sticky with hints of nutella and choc topping, mild tinny bitterness; decent ingredients but a bit sweet for my tastes

Bottle. About 6 years old. Pours a black color with a longlasting tan head. Has a sweet roasted malty aroma with some hint s of chocolate. Sweetish malty roasted flavor with some hints of chocolate and licorice. Has a roasted malty finish.
Draught at The Bishops Arms, Gothenburg, Sweden. Firm, but almost frothy head. Really freshlooking! A fresh, yeasty flavor with a touch of smoke. Definately my kind of stout!
On Draught at The Bishops Arms, Göteborg, Sweden. Black. Frothy head. Full aroma of chocolate and coffe. Very tasty, medium dry, roasted feel and with a flowery finish. This one is surprisingly fine!

Sampled cask conditioned at Oliver Twist, Stockholm. Dark black with beige head. Rich aroma of dark chocolate and coffee. Medium dry and light bodied, but still firm and soft. Superbly balanced with a flowery bitter finish. Very fresh and sensationally good. I can only hope this is not a once of brew.
* Old rating, 0,33l crown-top bottle, best before 05.10.06. Mild-herbes Bier. Grasig-frisch, intensiv herb zum Nachgeschmack, würzig.
Hazy orange color with medium white head. Sweet aroma. Slightly bitter and malty lager.
Fredagsbaren på Biologi, Aarhus, DK. Bottled. Golden with white head. Aroma and flavor of malt. Notes of hay and citrus.
on tap at the berlinerbierfest06, last beer of the first night. golden, lightly hazed, aroma of grass and stonefruit, reasonably bitter, not as messy as most bio pilses

Bottled. Floral aroma, sweet with hints of pear and apple. Cloudy, off-white head, good lace. Bitter, floral, maltsweet underneath, pear, apple towards the finish, very bitter end. Sticky but dry lips. Very nice.

Deep golden beer with lively carbonation to a very fine & dense white head; end of bottle fully hazy. Very malty nose, slightly toasted & sweetish, even bready. Parsley-stuffed German Sauerbrot, water-soaked. Quite worts-like taste, like not fully fermented. Sweet main taste, but allways with this sourish bready flavour blending in. Despite the worts character, rather light, grist slickness. "Bof!" It fhis is what they drink in Åsgard, I’m going to teach those Vikings a little drinking lesson, bringing a few Rocheforts along...
Bottle. Good head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma is very malty. Taste is watery, yet very distinct taste of hops and malt.
Bottle. Yellow cloudy colour with a white some what lasting white head. Weak malty dominated taste. Watery body.
Bottle. Creamy white good fully lasting head. Yeloow cloudy colour. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Watery flavor, short finish, not the best classic german pilsener.

(bottle) Cloudy and hazy orange to golden colour with a diminishing frothy white head. Sweet worty and yeasty, slightly fruity aroma with a touch of hops in the background. Sweet flavour, medium to light bodied, smooth carbonated mouthfeel. Sweet malty taste, slightly fruity (honey); sweetbitter light-hopped finish. A bit too sweet and too yeasty, but all in all drinkable Zwickel-Pilsener.

Murky brown. Big over abundant foam. Almost a gusher. Nose is musty dark malt . Flavour is nothing. It's like a big brewery beer with some dark malt thrown in for colour... Really disappointed.... ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy dark brown pour with almost no head. Sweet malty caramel smell. Has that slightly burnt taste I’ve found in other brown ales. Not a big fan of that. Thick and rich. Very different from the cream ale. This ones a bit much to Me.

Pours a hazy brown with a bit of off-white head. Smell is fruity and malty and has a bit of floral hops. Palate is on the lighter side of medium bodied and has good carbonation. Taste is slightly sweet and spicy, then gives way to a slightly bitter aftertaste. Pretty good!
On tap at the bistro. Very light aroma with similar yeast as the other beers. Not too much to it at all. Not as dark as I thought.

Probably the lightest tasting brown ale I have ever had. It was not very thick and it was a clear brown colour, minimal darkness to it. small notes of dark malts, light chocolate flavour. Overall not too interesting

many pints on tap at the brewpub. very dark brown with a light tan head. choclate malt aroma. the flavour is mostly malt but the hops creep into the finish. this drinks more like a mild ale then a brown. good stuff, id have it anytime.

On tap @ the Bistro. Pours brown with a tan head. Light aroma of chocolate, and some sweet and roasted malt. Decent flavor, at 4% it is light and easy to drink. Plain brown ale...need some banana flavor in there to call it the Monkey Brown.
Clear dark warm brown with no lace. Malty aroma yields subtle berries. Soft carbonation. Real roasty chocolate malts in a clean and solid body. Sessionable.
At the brewpub. Dark brown, still head. Nice roasty aroma. Good malty, roasty taste. Easily the most flavourful beer I had there, a great brown ale and one I would session frequently if local.

[1557-20080801] Tap. Roasted mocha bread aroma. Clear, dark brown amber body with a medium-lasting creamy light tan head. Flavour has a little sour roast and some coffee hints. Medium-full body. Not very monkey-ish but nice and mild. (@ Pepperwood Bistro; Burlington, ON)

THIS WAS A VERY DIFFERENT BEER FOR ME .IT WAS SWEET AND TANGY WITH FRUIT OVERTONE REMINDED ME OF RABBID RABBIT WITH A LOT OF ALCOHOL.HAD IT IN 2004 AND WISH THEY WOULD BRING IT BACK CHEERS TO THE GUYS

This is very complex. Sweetness and tanginess right up front gives way to subdued fruitiness. Pretty red-orange color with a rapidly diminishing head and carbonation level. Notable alcoholic presence. Great on a cold evening, but appropriate anytime. Quite good.

Really an unusual brew. Not a Dubbel per se, but excellent none the less. While the residual sweetness breaks through to leave the taste of plums and raisins. Then come the hops. Full flavored here in the typical Floyd's fashion yet nicely blended to compliment the overall experience.

Surprisingly complex...I bet this was the millionth batch that finally turned out good! Candy Sugar and dark fruits added to a huge alcoholic first sip. I compared it to an Orval that accidently got dry hopped for 90 minutes. I hope this becomes a regular and makes me fear the upcoming Alpha Kong Quadruppel!

WOW! what a cool brew-Nick FLoyd himself brought this keg out to the tap at the brewery in Munster. I am not familiar with the style of brew, but he said it tastes like Duval. Candy aroma, apperance was cloudy beige-palate was sweet sweet sweet-nice subtle hop bite to round it all out-maybe they will try to make this a regular?

Draft at the brewery. As Trippelbock Reserve, 10% ABV, 17 IBUs. Dark reddish color, no head, no lace. Heavy on caramel, molasses, and toffee. Dark fruit and brown sugar as well. Rich and strong. Full bodied. A little sticky. Nice stuff.
Shared, aged bottle via PUBR. Hazy copper pour, huge caramel malt some hops, major malt in the flavor

750ml bottle. Reddish brown pour, small head. Aroma is rich malts, toffee and raisan. Malty sweat taste with some toffee. Smooth yet complex. Velvety feel. Mild carbonation. Very good start to finish.

A family favorite. Aroma is red apple peel, some toffee, and a corn syrup malt extract (in a good way). Pours deep red brown with no head but noticeable carbonation. Taste is sweet with instant iced tea, apple peel, and malt. Very easy on the palette despite the ABV and dangerously easy to chug. Still a dependably great brew.

750ml bottle from Jesterdeal. Older bottling. Thanks. Pours a dark brown color with a minimal off-white head that quickly dissipates to fine ring. The aroma is quite pungent with rich malts, caramel, toffee and some molasses. The flavor mirrors the aroma, lots of complex toffee, caramel, molasses, raisins and dark roasted grains. The palate is full and viscous with soft carbonation. Finishes long and dry with lingering toffee. Overall: one of the best dopplebocks I have ever sampled. Good stuff, highly recommended for lovers of this style.

Dark orange with small off white head. Aroma brown sugar, bread, candied fruits. Medium full body, strong warm alcohol presence. Flavors of molasses, caramel, citrus, dark dried fruits. Pretty sweet. Some good flavors here but I thought with this one the alcohol was not well hidden and interfered too much.

Bottle shared by jayhawk73. Thanks Jeff! 2008 Vintage A: This beer appears a burnt orange hue, perhaps slightly dark brown. The head stands in at an eighth inch and leaves some good lacing in its wake. S: The aroma is pleasant and consists of lager malt, caramels, brown sugar, and toffee. T: A delicious bock beer. Well balanced and full of flavor, this one is not too sweet or hot. Delectable toffees and sweet breads, along with caramels in soaked in alcohol. M: Surprisingly smooth and creamy, it seems as though a few years of aging has worked some magic on this beer, though I have no point of reference. D: Very tasty. I easily consumed my half of the 750 mL bottle. Would definitely drink again. Serving type: bottle Reviewed on: 02-01-2011

750mL bottle, quite old. Poured crystal-clear, deep coppery-amber with a dusting of smoked tan head.. nice color to it. The aroma picked up warm, aged molasses, caramel, chewy dark bread, and a hint of chocolate.. alcohol amplified, and did nothing but help enhance the goodness. The flavor found similar stuff.. aged molasses, maple, and rye bread at the core, with peppery alcohol and warm, slightly jammy dark fruits around.. a little acidity helped guide the deliciousness through the finish. Heavier-bodied with low-moderate carbonation on the palate.. felt great.. loved it!

This one has been sitting in my cellar for a few years. Dark amber pour, thin lasting brown head. Very nice big aroma of molasses and brown sugar. Smooth drinking, no hint of alcohol or boozy taste. Sweet. Make a nice after dinner sipper. Very malty, taste of dark fruit and molases. I’m going to get a fresh one to compare but really enjoyed this one with a little age.

I don’t remember much about this one, other than thinking it was a bit weird that we had to pay an extra 50 cents to taste it during a tasting of beers on tap at the brewery/vineyard. My guess is that it was higher in alcohol? Seems like commonplace these days... Most of their beer was pretty forgettable.

Sampled from 0.5 l bottle from ’Rudat’, best before April 2018. Clear, golden yellow with a thin, foamy, stable, white head. Sweetish, slightly grassy aroma of grains and hints of straw. Sweetish, slightly bitter, moderately grassy-spicy taste of grains and some straw, followed by a short, slightly bitter, moderately grassy-spicy, a bit dry finish. Almost medium-bodied, smooth and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Easily drinkable but not really ’premium’, what do I have to expect from the standard version now?
Bottle 0,5ltr: Clear golden colored brew with an dry biiter taste with an little sweetness. Hints of some hoppiness, could be better.

Bottled 500ml. -from Rudat Dortmund. Pale golden coloured, medium sized white head, mild cereals in the nose. Malty, light grainy, slight herbal hoppy and touch of metal in rather short bitterish finish. Usual pils.

Thanks Ogi! Poured a golden tinged yellow with a thick white head that went away slowly. Hm, nice. The aroma isn’t bad, mild herbal hoppy pleasant note, with mild sweet maltiness... slightly too light though. Dry grainty taste, however, ending strangely salty. Weak salty/bitter finish. Not too lean, OK body, but this is just on the slightly worse side of generic. Which seems to be the norm for the brewery.
Klare goldgelbe Farbe, ordentliche weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht hopfig, grasig. Geschmack getreidig, grasig, hopfig, leicht metallisch.
#413 Ein mildgehopftes Pils, das mir im Nachgeschmack zu mild ist, aber insgesamt ordentlich und grundsolide daherkommt. Test vom 21.10.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,10,12,10,9,10 - 10,45

0,5 l bottle shared with McTapps. A simple to drink but rather good pilsner. Nose and aroma are bit of citrus. Very easy to drink with a bit of an earthy end. Good pilsner. Negative: some sips were bit of dishwasher.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Clear golden in colour, flavour of citrus fruits. Quite refreshing, but also very boring.

Strong smell of malt and hops, rather sweet. The white creamy head is small, the body is pale yellow. The taste is rather bitter with a metallic finish. The body is light and dry with a normal carbonation.
The head is medium, the body light. It smells a bit sweet. The taste is malty, a bit hoppy, very watery. In the aftertaste very watery a bit hoppy. 5/4/4/3/7/3
it´s a very fruity beer!!! you can realax and enjoy the beer!! good in this saison!! i hope cardinal brew this beer more!!

clear bright golden-orange colour, few head, biscuit aroma with light fruity notes, medium-bodied, slightly sparkling, crisp and clean with a touch of bitterness, dry malty and earthy finish - the first interesting brew from Cardinal since 20 years

Danke an minutemat. Alkoholischer, leicht oxidierter Beginn. Karamellig malzig, weich, süffig herb. die Karamellnoten bleiben konstant, der Alkohol im Hintergrund. Keine Röstnoten, die Süße bliebt in annehmbaren Rahmen. Untypisch aber nett. 10/8/9/8/7/8

330ml bottle from Stansted airport. Pours clear reddish caramelly colour, off-white head. Aroma of sweet caramelly malts, yellow plums, wood, turpentine. Taste is freaky. Strawberry jam, marmalade, alcohol, wood, tar, sherry in taste. Sweet liqueur taste is aftertaste. Medium bodied, average carbonation. That's some really weird stuff. I've no idea why it's under baltic porter, but label says same. There are no hints of any porter style in this beer. But in weird way I can drink it.
Not a Baltic porter! Golden coloured and clear. Has a white head, medium duration. Heavy sweet malty aorma, alcohol too. Heavy sweet flavor, warming alcohol.
light malty aroma,amber, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light sweet nice alcoholic finish.

Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Dark yellow colour!. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. moderate bitter vinius flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. This is a barley wine not a baltic porter.

33cl bottle shared by Arve_Christian (thanks!) Pours slightly hazy amber with an off-white head. Smell a bit strange. Aroma of caramel, malt, sour wood with hints of smoke, fruits and some basement notes. Alcohol is quite well integrated for a 11% beer. Quite sweet with some wooden sourness and a bit harsh bitterness in the finish. Quite strange, but interesting enough. (2013-06-05)

On bottle from Zürich airport, bb 20.01.2017, bought june 2012. Golden color, good foam. Immediate light smaker aromas, mild honey Medium body & medium/ high complexity .on the sweet side, balances alcohol quite well. Enjoyable

Bottle from a deli shop at Heathrow. Pours clear dark golden with a big creamy snow white head. Aroma is spicy and perfumed grainy. Taste is spiced grains, lots of alcohol, reminds me more of a strong lager, this is not a porter. Burning alcoholic aftertaste, my lips feel numb.
Dark amber with a small white head. Malty aroma with caramel and grain, and lots of alcohol. Sweet malty flavour with hot alcohol and a hint of chocolate

Bottle. Pours with a thin white head that disappears quickly, clear coppery orange color. Sweet maltiness, candy, and fruits in the aroma. Candy sugar drives the flavor, vanilla, and just an overall sweetness with booze that I really don’t like. Thicker body, and just doesn’t suit. Bleh really.
Sweetish-arificial beginning. Fresh, hints of malt, not too sweet, but quite artificial. No real Tequila there, only undefined sweetish beer. Easy to drink with a slight bitterness in the end.
330ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pale sweet pish, basically. Not very good at all.

I’ve tried all the Bandidos varieties, and I have to admit this was is my least favourite. Pours a clear golden color, with a small white head and basically no retention. Malty aroma is overpowered by citrusy smell, as well as something that should be tequila supposedly. The taste is slightly fruity, slighty bitter with a weird, again supposedly tequila-like finish. Meh.

Bottle. Pours a yellow body, with a small white head that diminishes quickly, leaving almost no lace. Weird tequila aroma as soon as I open the beer, some faint malts too. But taste is nice. Sure, not a beer per se, but that lemon really softens the result, had a tequila beer before, and this is really better. Average carbo, thin body, watery texture. Not that bad really, better than expected.
Bottle 330 ml. Unusual citrus and tequila aroma, seems artificial. Sweetish taste with some tequila. Didn’t like it.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Poured a crystal clear light amber with a thin broken white head. The flavour is moderate bitter, weak citrus sour, weak sweet with a lime lemon sweet palate. Truly awful, but a country nonetheless!
33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with jmgreenuk. very thin head. Clear pale golden pour. Some tequilla. Not great.

Bottle shared massive thanks to jmgreenuk. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of tequila and lime. Flavor is moderate sweet. A little malt in the palate. Light bodied with moderate carbonation. More like an alcopop than a beer.
Bottle. Light yellow with no head. Shandy aroma. Sweet sticky taste with some hints of tequila and lime.
light soda,golden, clear, light sweetness, light body, fizzy, dry limonade.

Bottled 0,50L. Blonde yellow color with modest bubbly aspect and short head duration. Fresh dried grassy aroma, medium alcoholic nose. Not much crisp mouth, simple and watery body with modest bitterish final.
Apple juice color with no head. 4/10 Smells like soda; citron/lemon flavour. 6/10 Has the typical beer taste, but watery with no after-taste at all. 5/10

Bottle from small market in Roma. Can as Kantel Birra Lager. Pours light gold with a a light white head. Aroms is very light. Light bodied. Flavor is slightly sweet, and there are hints of grain and hop. Very slight hints.
,33l can in Florence. Cheap package of cheap beer. Robust fruit (cross taste, maybe) up front with weak everything following away. Grass, dirty, spritely and tasty. not terrible.
33cl can. Monday, August 29, 2011 very little head. Pale golden pour. A bit crap.Uninspiring.
Notizen: -etwas süß -mild -Ab Mittelteil leichtherb -süffig Test vom 28.10.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 10,7,8,8,3,7 - 7,40
bottle, malthoppy aroma, pale white minimal head, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, little sweet end, classic eurobeer,

My girlfriend brought it back for me from Italy. In any case, it pours a golden straw like color with a quickly dissipating white head. Has the pale lager smell, but only in a faint way. Kin of metallic taste with some sweet notes. There is actually a little bit of bitterness in there, but not in any good way. It tastes mostly like an uninteresting pale lager and that is what it is. Drinkable for the most part.
Can at Ripa Hotel.  Clear golden - white head. White bread. Egg. Metallic. Cardboard. Light hoppy. Hay. Light grassy. Plain.

Canned (thanks C. Neunzig). Yellowish golden colour, small white head. Aroma is sweet malts, some mild grains and cardboardy notes. Flavour is grainy, maizeish, mildly fruty and bready malty. Mild bitterness in the finish as well. Still rather sweetish maizeish unbalanced stuff.
Can in Firenze. Pours gold with a foamy white head. Smells corny without much hop. Flavor is pale malt without much hop. Likely never again.
33cl bottle. Pours plae & clear piss yellow with a off white head. Thin & watery. Corn & grass. Not much to offer!
Can, 4.7% as Hell Bier, in Rome. Golden colour, white head. sour maize flavour, otherwise drinkable. No real sewer flavour.

Canned. Pale yellow in colour. Minor white head. it has a light mashy aroma with some hops. The falvour i watery and metallic. The carbonation is rich and it has a light bitter aftertaste. Thanks to Dorqui for this one!
Canned. Pale golden colour, small white head. Aroma of malts and hops and weak rubber. Flavour salty and hoppy. Salty finish. Very strongly carbonated. BAH!

Can "Hell Bier" (BB 04/2007) Very pale yellow, small creamy head, some lace. Sweet aroma of malt cereals, also notes of yesterday’s paper. Very tasteless - some sweet corn. Slightly harsh in the finish. I agree with Mads about the motto ...

Hell Bier. Bottled. Light and much evanescent foam. Yellow pale color. Clear, limpid and discreetly bubbly. Simple and light scent, much watery with a light malt’s note. Fresh and watery taste, much simple and with a bitterish finish.

Canned: Pale yellow coloured. White quickly diminishing head. This is almost like drinking water. Is light sweet with some very very vague hops. This is definately not a pilsener. A pale lager by best, although mineral water would fit better as discription. My new motto must be "KILL the ITALIAN SWILL".
Bottled(330ml). -like other G.B.P. beers this one is cheap and not so good, golden coloured, little head, refreshing, malty aroma
On draft at the brewery, Princeton location. Poured a sarkish murky brown with a nice head. Licorice came through strong in both the aroma and taste.
This stuff is liquid licorice. Pours an anise color with a significant white head. Taste of licorice and anise on the tongue with other hints of sweet malt. Favorite beer of the day.
Pours a murky brown color with a caramel colored head. Has an aroma of coffee. Roasty caramel taste with lots of licorice. Decent but not a 99.
Pours dark brown with tan hea. Aroma is caramel, vanilla, rye and woodyness. Taste is sweet with a smewhat creamy mouthfeel.

Draft @ princeton triumph. Dark brown pour with a little tan head. Smells like I’m sniffing rye bread, flavor follows. Initially I wasn’t sure what to think, but its a great rye beer, what i put any other up to.
Draft. Pours a brune body with an off white head. Rye seeds, malt, and some spicy fruit. Light bitter earth finish and a light spiced warming. This was nice.

GABF 2007. This smelled and tasted of straight up caraway seed, like it was concentrated and liquified. It’s not bad, but I’d like some more balance of flavors (like some more characteristic maltiness, although there is some chocolate lurking underneath). Don’t really know what to make of this.
A very nice tasting beer. It has a aroma and flavor of a rustic black rye bread. Sampled it at the Philadelphia location on 2/21/2008

Dark brown body with a small tan head. The nose is sweet and herbal with tons of rye, caraway and clove. Lightly sweet taste with caramel, toffee, spicy rye and caraway seeds. Medium body is soft with light carbonation.

On tap at the Philly location. Pours a deeper hazy amber with a medium creamy off white head that left some lacing. Aroma of rye bread, grainy malt sweetness, a touch of some fruitiness. Flavor was rye bread, dry, some malty sweetness but mostly dry, spicy and very drinkable. Well done.
From the bottle pours deep red on the nose light hops but not much taste little lager style nothing inspiring but ok for a warm afternoon
Nice taste, easy drinking, typical summer-beer. OK to have tried but won’t tru hard to find it again
Brunrød farve med lidt mere smag ens deres Høker-bajer. Kan sagtens drikkes under frokosten.
33 cl flaske 5,0% ok lager øl, god smag og nem at drikke. Men langt fra de bedste fra Hancock.

15-11-2018; bottle; at home (bought at an unknown location). The looks of the beer are nice, I give you that. Dark, but not black. The color of the beer is a lovely reddish chestnut, with a lovely glow. The beer is crystal clear. On top of the beer there is a rather thick nice frothy layer of slightly off-white foam. Foam retention is very good. The aroma's of the beer are rather average. Malts are simple and give some beady and slightly toffee aromas. A bit simple and not very strong. Hops give some herbal bitterness. In the mouth the aromas are a bit to thin and watery. Could be stronger. Because it is a bit mild now, it becomes a bit dull. The taste is the same. The malts are sweet, but not very. A bit shallow. Hops are bitter, but not vary. A bit rough and not to balanced. There is also a malty savoury note; a bit grainy. Could be better. The palate of the beer is low average. Medium-light body, a bit thin and sticky texture and medium carbonation. The finish is mainly dry and not to interesting. The dry sensation lingers on for quite some time. Not the most interesting beer. Expected a bit more.
On tap at Den Blå Café, Strandbyn, Denmark. Clear amber copper with white head. Light sweet caramel malty with grassy citrus hop finish. Semi dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.
Ravfarget klar med fingerhøyt beige skum. Lukter brunt sukker og noe nøtter. Lett. Vannete smak med noe maltekstrakt, kort
A danish, brown, clear Dunkel with light head. Aroma is coffee, caramel, prune, light meat, light walnut. Taste is bitter sweet. Pearly. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fine dunkel, with ok body. Good with lunch. Mainstream beer, with not much new.
Brygget med lagermalt, istedet for pilsnermlat. Det giver en lidt mørkere øl, også i smag. Den skulle være lagret i mindst 90 dage, så for en gangs skyld er der tale en en rigtig lager.
Nice Belgian tripel. Yeasty, fruity and with some mild hopping. Solid brewing.

33cl Brown Bottle, best before 24 Feb 2008, drank a little after then, but cellered correctly. Poured into a Straffe Hendrik Chalice. It looked a lovely golden, clear brew, with a good white head on top. Good carbonisation, almost lively, as the bubbles cascaded upwards. very little aroma, some yeast and hops, but not much of anything. Plenty of flavours to savour, hops, yeast and malts, a proper tripple in all aspects (apart from smell). Impressive, good alcohol presence without it knocking you about, well balanced and pleasant to drink.
23rd February 2008. Slightly fruity malt. Smooth tripel - no rough edges here. Lingering dry malt finish. A lot of sediment in the bottle.

Bottle conditioned, 330ml, aged 4.5yrs. Hazed orange gold with white head, big lumps of yeast carefully negotiated. Fairly basic Belgian type beer, sweet, but with plenty of alcohol, pear, some spice notes. Ending fairly blandly.

Tasted this beer, more times. Bottle, 33 cl. Hazy darkgolden to orange color with off-white head. Aroma bit yeast, malts, some spice, and a hint caramel. Medium body. Taste bit yeast, fruits, spices, some light bitterness. Good but not complex tripel.

1 yr old, 33cl bottle. Slightly cloudy, yellow, straw color with small white head. Aroma is citrus, alc esters that give off an almost syrupy sweet quality. Sweet, grainy, big spice, defintely coriander, lemon, red apple, grapefruit, slight sour, cloying. Medium to light, fizzy body. Overall I think that its really sweet and heavily spiced, moreso then the style typically calls for. Alc. is more subdued for the style as well, which in opinion, is a good thing.

33 cL bottle, 5 year old vintage. Pours hazy orange with a diminished white head. Aroma is mild dry wooden and mild spiced yeasty. Mild caramelish nite and light yeasty. Light malty finish with a mild bitterness coming through.
Bottle.33cl. Very nice trippel, looked very nice in the right glas... frothy head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour.

Bottle at Kulminator. Dated 09/06/04. Dark golden color, a bit hazy, with a white head that left quickly. Aroma is musty or yeasty with light stone fruit. Medium body and very smooth carbonation. Seems to have acquired a touch of oak. Another old b.c. beer that’s aging well. It is dry. Finishes near astringent. A very good experience. Malt? Must have been in there somewhere.
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a huge white creamy head and some lacing. Heavy aroma and taste of fruits and spicy. Semi hoppy finihs. Well balanced.
Kieler Bier 4.8%. Dark amber, caramel malt and nutty aroma, medium bodied, toasted caramel malt, toffee, slightly bitter fruity finish. Lovely Altbier from Kiel 🇩🇪
From backlog. Bottle at Christmas Party at The In-laws. Amber with offwhite head. Malts, hops, sweetness.

30th Oct 2018; two 0.4 litre glasses in the brewery (on-tap). Amber body, slight haze; off-white topping. On the sweet side with malty molasses ruling both the aroma and taste, liked it (hence having two large glasses).

Copenhagen 9/5 2018. 1 l swing cap bottle from the Brewpub in Kiel. Yellow serious looking label with a hoppy logo and a very short durability period (less than a month). Pours hazy amber with big, bubbly white head. Settles as 2 cm thick creamy layer of foam. No lacing to speak of. Aroma is surprisingly sour with a more subdued sweetness. Milk gone bad, light butter and more light caramel sweetness. Light carbonation. Thin, watery texture. Flavor is rather sweet followed by more subdued bitterness. Aftertaste is sweetish. Quite strange tasting with the dairy products after expiry quality that it has. Will not become a favorite except if I run out of butter.

On tap in the Kieler brewpub. Dark amber, little bit hazy with not bad white head and some lacing. At first there are aromas typical for standard Czech pilsners, later some light malty. sweet aromas appears. Taste is little bit sweet, malty with no sign of bitterness, very dry, watery. Acceptable with food.
Keg at the brewpub in Kiel. Pours copper with an off white head. Quite a sweet malty dark fruit beer. Enjoyable.

Wenig Aromen, wenig Geschmack, aber dafür ne ganz ansehnliche Optik und eine vorzügliche Süffigkeit, die in Kiel Legendenstatus genießt. Fass. Oft und in allen möglichen Gebinden...bis hin zum großen Holzgefäß ☺ . Oh ja, da werden Erinnerungen wach...

Had the beer in a bottle filled at the brewery. The beer looks nice. The color of the beer is a nice amber. A lovely orange glow comes from the beer. The beer has a nice cloudiness. However, for an unfiltered beer it is quote clear. Nice little gas bubbles are floating towards the top. On top, a nice layer of slightly tinted soft foam is formed. The foam is very unstable and collapses quickly, leaving only a thin drape of foam. The smell is lovely. It has this nice aromas that are typical to this type of beer and that takes me back to by trip to the baltic states. It has a nice fruitiness in it. I smell some strawberries. There are also some lovely malty aromas. The fruit tones give the beer a lovely sweetness. This is balanced by the malts. Those give the beer a nice bitter and slightly savory smokey aroma. It is in good balance and really invites you to drink. The taste is also very nice. It has a nice hoppy bitterness, that is almost immediately present. After this the smokey, somewhat roasty malt aroma fills the mouth. This gives a nice savory and bitter contrast to the hops. The sweet fruitiness, reminding of strawberry, completes the beer. Its very nice and well balanced. The palate of the beer is nice. The gas bubbles are small and give the beer a nice tingly kick. A very nice beer. The finish is also nice. The tingling sensation remains on the tongue for quite some time. The taste dies away slowly, making you remember the lovely taste for a long time.
Vom Hahn in der Brauerei. Süßlich malzig, etwas Karamell. Kaum Hopfen, kaum bitter. Recht viel Kohlensäure.
Amber color with a medium head. Aroma has caramel. Taste is very sweet and has caramel and butter.
Malzig, würzig, süffig, wenig Kohlensäure, leicht herb bitter, wässriger Einschlag, okay

Draught @ Ricklinger Landbrauerei. Pours slightly hazy golden with a creamy white head. Aroma of malt, grain, caramel, little fruit, hay. Flavor is light bitter, malt, caramel, fruity hops. Medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish. 270417

Draft at the brewpub. Clear orange with thick white head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, malt, fruity and light perfume notes. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Light medium bodied with light carbonation. [21-08-2016]

Bottle. Pours clear golden with white head. Aroma is malty with light bread and biscuit, yet some grassy hoppiness. Taste is malty with bread and biscuit and light caramel. It has some hoppy notes of grass and straw.
50cl bottle shared with Kermis. Thin white head. Hazy golden pour. Very malty. Light bitterness

Draught @ Ricklinger Landbrauerei shared with kermis. Clear orange golden color, medium sized white head that lasts for quite a long time. Aroma is malts, very grainy. Taste malts, lightly bitter. Don’t get anything else. Average body, a bit low carbonation. Ok.
Et lille bryggeri der brygger rigtig godt øl. Denne øl smager af det øl er lavet af. Korn. Lidt humlet, og meget sødlig.
Holzig, süßlich, nussig, Körper sehr schlank, kaum Schaum, irgendwie unausgewogen.

0,5 flaske (bb. 20.08.15 - vi snakker om ferskvare!) med vippekork, direkte hjemført fra bryggeriet av Willy, og delt med ham på brygga: lett uklar gylden med fint skum. En behagelig duft av honning brer seg i klubbhuset. Myk, avrundet smak med honningsødme, og med en liten humletann i avslutningen. Meget lett å konsumere, vi er fornøyde.
Aroma: sweet and hay. Flavour: malty sweet with notes of hay. A slightly creamy mouthfeel. Colour: golden amber with a white head.

Bottle @ Brewery. Thanks Simon. Pours Hazy deep Golden with a White head. Fruity hoppy nose. Marmelade and grass. Dry and bitter flavor with a touch of bready malts. Amazed to have Ricklinger beers this good. 10 years ago They had massive issues.

Mich erwartet das typische schlicht gehaltene Streifenetikett auf 0,5er Bügelverschlussflasche. Das Bier gießt sich in einem leuchtenden gelb ins Glas, hat durch die weggelassene Filtrierung eine deutliche Trübung, perlt stark ab und stellt eine langlebige grobporige Blume auf. Nun die Geruchsprobe. Der Hallertauer Hopfen birgt hier eine äußerst kräutrig grasige Note und bereits beim riechen eine deutliche Bitterkeit. Der Antrunk passiert mit einer feinperlig prickelnden Spundung den Mundraum. Sofort tun sich kräutrige und florale Geschmacksnuancen auf. Ich könnte wetten, dass hier auch Tettnanger Doldenhopfen drin ist. Der Körper präsentiert sich mittelwürzig, eher leichtfüßig und dafür auch leichtgängig. Im weiteren Verlauf zeigen sich die 35 Bittereinheiten mit deutlicher Herbe, die ich beim Pils natürlich sehr begrüße. Durch die Unfiltriertheit erreicht das Bier eine sehr weiche und etwas sämige Textur. Insgesamt ein sehr gutes Pilsner und ich würde ganz frech mal den direkten vergleich zu den Pilsen von Mahrs Bräu, Keesmann, Waldhaus und Tettnanger ziehen.

Bottle from Germany from www.biershop-bierpost.com. Slightly hazy golden coloured body with a solid white head. Aroma of grain, spice, and floral hops. Mild sweetness, medium bodied, medium carbonation, bittersweet finish.
Many thanks for this bottle to Beerhunter111. Golden in color with a small off-white head. Aroma is of caramel, malt and alcohol. Taste is the same.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldenes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, getreidig, Heu. Geschmack malzig, fruchtig, getreidig, minimal alkoholisch.

500ml bottle. Clear golden colour with average to huge, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Bitter hoppy aroma, hints of leaves, tobacco, cautious malty background with a touch of cookies. Taste is minimally sweet malty, minimally grainy, a touch of cookies, bitter hoppy overtones with a cautious fruity touch, hints of tobacco, considerable presence of alcohol in the finish. Decent.
Bottle @ Zentraleuropäischer Wahnsinn. Medium head with medium duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are malt, little butterscotch, caramel, grass and hops.

Bottle @ Zentraleuropäischer Wahnsinn. Clear dark golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, fruity and moderate hoppy - straw. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. 300513
Bottle, 6.5%. Buttery and citric aroma. Almost clear amber colour. Small stable white head. The flavour is very malty, slightly buttery. Has a spicy hop note with a rough bitterness in the finish.
50 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small off white head. Aroma is light herbal and mild grassy. Toasted malty and light breadish. Bitter and toasted malty into a dry and bitter finish.

0,5 l bottle from Kiste 107, Nienburg. A lot of pressure in the bottle. Pours out black with a more than two finger creamy beige head. Smells malty with some fruity background. Taste starts strong dark roasted malty, less fruity. Increasing dry, shy hop in the second row. Log lasting aftertaste, mid bitterness. Heavy stuff.
God stout nydt på en dejlig teresse i Marstal. Fin bitterhed, tilpas sødme. Ikke så tung som andre stout

Draught @ Ricklinger Landbrauerei. Pours black with a creamy light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, light coffee, licorice, dark chocolate. Flavor is light bitter, roast malt, coffee, licorice, some earthy notes, cocoa. Medium body, average carbonation, dry and light bitter finish. 270417
Bottle from Ricklinger. Almost black with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and licorice. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 090417
Bottle .Dark brown with a tiny brown head. Malty and roasted tones. Malt, coffee, fruit and hops. Medium body with a bitter / roasted finish.

Draft at the brewpub. Black with a thick beige head. Aroma of roast, light burnt notes, toffee and chocolate. Flavour is moderate sweet and light heavy bitter. Medium bodied with a strange iron note spoiling the finish and soft carbonation. [21-08-2016]

Draught @ Ricklinger Landbrauerei shared with kermis. Opaque very dark brown color, medium to full sized creamy long lasting beige to mocha colored head. Aroma is malts, dark malts, lightly earthy and lightly iron. Taste malts, some roast, iron, malt bitter. Decent body, soft carbonation. Hmm ok beer.

Gerade einmal 5% schlagen hier zu Buche. Das Bier ist tiefschwarz. Die Schaumkrone ist langlebig und zerklüftet sowie cremefarben eingefärbt. Die Flaschen ist im Bügelverschlussformat mit Tangastreifen als Etikett. Zunächst riecht man erstmal und erwartet Kaffee, verbranntes Toastbrot und Lackritz. Aber man riecht hier widererwartens Pinie und Grapefruit. Hier wurde wohl wieder schön mit Aromahopfen gearbeitet. Im Trunk kommen dann die gewohnten Kaffee und Bitterschokoladearomen. Sehr rauchig, trocken, röstig bis verkohlt, unsüß,ätherisch. Wichtig ist: Keine Asche. Asche schmeckt nicht gut im Stout. Dann hats der Braumeister definitiv übertrieben. Dieses hier ist genau richtig und für 5% herrlich gewürzt. Die Brauerei merke ich mir mal.
Ikke så meget at sige. En stout som (jeg synes) en stout skal smage. Den har smag og er rigtig mørk, lakrids, brændthed og stor fylde.
Pechschwarzes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Toffee, Karamel und Röstmalz im Geschmack, trocken und sehr bitter im Ausklang. Schön!
Tap. Pours dark gold with a thin white head. Hoppy malt and bread aromas. Sour malt and bread flavors. Light bodied and refreshing palate.
Brilliant golden. Lightly (kolsch) yeasty aroma, with that hint of sulfur I enjoy. Bright clean malt flavor, good yeast signature. Light and brief, but to style and rather enjoyable.

Yellow-gold in color, with a head that tries hard to keep up. Creamy and smooth on the palate; crisp and carbonated near the finish. Light malt flavors; some fruitiness, too. Has a sharp, metallic "edge," which wasn't necessarily a bad thing. Nice and flowery hop aroma. Dryish finish. Clean and refreshing. Pretty good Kolsch.

Bottle, from Coop. Pours cloudy yellow. Aroma is buttery, slightly floral and grassy. Body is light and dominated by carbonation, yet not lacking the malt backbone. Quite round, but lacking any flavours, just some sweetness and hints of butter. Not bad for a macro lager though.

02.07.2019 -- 0.33l bottle from a coop in basel, bb 07.01.2020. pours a hazy pale yellow with a medium head. aroma of sweet grains, not unlike a non-alcoholic beer, but also some sulphuric hops. flavour is quite fruity, with notes of pears, banana, maybe peaches, and coriander. taste reminds of a witbier. quite sweet but not cloying. interesting.

08May2019 Sweet grain and cereal malts, caramel, molasses, light citrus fruits. Hazy, pale gold, medium, creamy, white head. Light sweet. More sweet grain and cereal malts, caramel,molasses, soft carbonation, medium bodied. A sweet mess. Draft at 2. Akt, Zürich.

From tap at the brewery's restaurant. Very hazy pale straw-yellow with a white head. The aroma is lightly yeasty and lightly malty, spicy, lightly fruity with bread and biscuit. Medium body with a light sweetness and a very light bitterness. The flavor is lightly to medium yeasty with pear, stone fruits and lightly to medium malty - sweet grains, biscuit. Aroma: 6 Appearance: 4 Taste: 6 Mouthfeel: 3 Overall: 10
best beer of Feldschlösschen!!! just once a year :-( i really recommend to try it if you can! (at coop)

Review: Green bottle at 33cl of Feldschlösschen Frühlingsbier: ABV: 4.8% vol A seasonal spring beer. On the nose I get a light aroma, very faint, a bit malty and metallic, not great. For the appearance it is a yellowish looking beer, with no head to speak of, looks pretty shite to be honest. Yellow goes a bit cloudy after a while too. Doesn’t look great. Found the taste to be slightly strange, a bit pointless to be honest. Bit cardboardy and overloaded with sweet malts. Fruits at the back trying to get out, detectable. Shit, bland taste, nothing nice, very boring and unexciting. Taste!!! Bland, cardboard, slight fruit at end. Pointless!!! Malty, very malty But not beery. Disappointing, flat in the taste, faint hops barely noticeable, the beer should be given away for free (it’s a bit pricey) Gave me a head the next morning, shitty beer!
Weich herber Beginn. Süßlich hefig, dann wässrig werdend, wenig fruchtig. Weich herber Nachhall. Einfach, süffig, okay. 8/9/8/8/8/8
Ein wirklich sehr gutes Bier... wirklich gelungen... fein und spritzig... Für mich das beste Feldschlösschen... 5.5 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
